description:
Came back this morning on Sunday for breakfast again after a nice night out in the city.  We got the baklava crepe to split and our own savory crepe prior.  I got an off menu special in Philly cheesesteak crepe, it was good, I switched the cheese from Swiss to provolone.  It was heavy on the peppers which I picked a few out, but didn't have onions which I was glad about.

My wife got the eggplant crepe, it had sun dried tomatoes, garlic, & cheddar cheese, I tasted it and it was good.

This place has a line out of the door anytime you come for breakfast on the weekends.  A good sign obviously.  I can't wait to come back during our next overnight visit to the city.

Next time we visit, I'll get Pesto Crepe with a side of sausage (chicken-apple), my wife wants one of the eggs benny.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Very yummy and huge menu. We're visiting from out of town and heard amazing things about this place. 

We got the lox bagel and an Athens omelette and it was so filling and not too expensive. I loved that their side of fruit was kiwi, strawberries, and bananas. Quality fruit that isn't filler fruit like cantaloupe and melon. Yuck!!

Hoping to come back here again before we leave and get a Nutella crepe. Yummmm
author: katelynn a.

description:
Line was out the door busy but moved quickly. The place is small but has lots of seating with tables in every possible space. While in line, you can view the very large menu board posted on the wall. They serve breakfast and lunch items. You place your order and if dining in, sit down and they will bring it out to you. Get a glass of self service water before sitting down. 

I ordered the crab cake Florentine which was delicious. It comes with 2 crab cakes served on top of English muffin halves, topped with spinach, 2 poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. The eggs were perfectly poached. The English muffins could've been a little crispier but it was all very good together. The potatoes were perfectly crisped. Would definitely order it again.
author: Tina F.

description:
Perfect place to stop in for breakfast/brunch!

I had this place on my must hit list while I was in San Fran and it did not disappoint. It was quite busy when I walked in and I was scared I wouldn't get a seat once my food was ready, but I took the chance anyway. I walked up to the counter made my order and luckily someone was getting up as soon as I was looking for a seat.

I ordered the chocolate waffle with fruit, apple chicken sausage, and an orange juice. WOW! It was delicious! Yes you can't really screw up a waffle really, but honestly it may have been one of the best I've had!


It doesn't seem like much when you walk by, but definitely worth checking out!
author: Christie N.

description:
The waiting at this place is intense, yet the line moves fairly fast, we didn't understand why the only have one cashier and she was also a barista and the one going back and forward letting the kitchen know the orders, I mean she was really sweet, I just think that  since this place is so busy, they just have either another cashier or another barista. The menu is extensive which is awesome because it gives you a lot of options to choose from, I got the smoked salmon with a side of bacon and my friend got the New Orland's crepe with a side of avocado and chorizo( the chorizo was delicious). The crepe was only ok since the chicken was over cooked and the crepe was dry, I cannot complain about mine, it was pretty good. Decoration needs to be change, the flowers in the wall are sad 
I will definitely give them a try and get the smoke salmon.
author: Andrea M.

description:
I had Belgium waffles and it was perfect.
Service was quick.
I didn't have to wait in a line as it was a weekday but heard that there are long lines waiting on weekends.
author: Ramya R.

description: This place is exactly like Crepevine, but it's not. The menu design looks like that of Crepevine, and I heard that the same designer/artist created the menu for Honey Honey. I came in on a late afternoon for brunch, and there were a lot of seats available and no line. They have a lot of various items on the menu, but I got the pesto crepe with fruits on the side. Unlike Crepevine, it doesn't come with salad on the side. My friend also got a crepe with chicken, but the chicken was too dry and not flavorful. The atmosphere also seemed more like a fast food diner rather than a nice brunch place. They also had very limited seating outside. The only plus is that they serve brunch items all day.
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description:
This little place is a gem. Why is there a line? Because it's amazing! We came here on a whim. I was on a restricted diet for a thyroid cancer test and I had been having no luck with places helping me cook without butter or salt. When we asked if I could have egg whites not cooked in butter or salt, they said, "No problem!" This is the first place that didn't give me a hard time my whole trip. 

The place was jammed, but the staff hustles like it's no one's business. They move people in and out and a so pleasant even though they are busy. Food came fast.

The portions are great, and my family all had different things- crepes, waffles, eggs, pancakes- all were good. (So were my "special" eggs.) 

I thank this place for giving me the only meal that made me smile on vacation, and for a great experience.
author: Andrea B.

description:
I've only been to Honey Honey once before and it was pretty empty there I so assumed it was like that most days. Wrong. Very very wrong. I failed to notice that the first time I went I went earlier and it wasn't a holiday. But the wait was well worth it. The staff is extremely friendly despite the constant rush. 

(This might be helpful if you have social anxiety) 
When you first enter, you are greeted with a vast and colorful menu. Each seemingly written in chalk with beautiful handwriting and descriptions. When you get closer to the front, the staff will assign you a number and that number will correspond with the table number. The table numbers are easy to see as they are standing straight up. (Although I think this only happens when it's busy. When it's not, they will give you the number and you will pick your own seat) When it's your turn to get order, it's really simple. Just state what you want and that's it. No biggie. The water will be on your right and if you ordered coffee, the stuff for that will be on your left along with straws and such. 

I ordered a (seasonal special) of peanut butter crepe with bananas. It came to $10.75 (not including tax). It was very sweet and very worth it. If you love the goodness of peanut butter in your mouth and like crepes, this is definitely for you. 

(Please tell me if this was helpful or not so I can see if this is worth doing such a long description for those who may be nervous to order).
author: Naomi C.

description:
Bookmarked this place for my birthday trip to San Fran and was not disappointed. I saw on yelp that the line can get pretty long..Thank goodness I didn't have to wait that much. 
I ordered the Chicken Pesto Crepe with hot chocolate and it was AMAZING! Best crepe I've ever had!! 
It's my MUST GO TO restaurant when I visit San Fran now.
author: Jane H.

description: So good! Line is out the door and it's not for no reason. It moves pretty quickly and you honestly need the time anyway just to read the full menu on the wall, so many good options. We had the sunrise burrito and pesto chicken crepe. Nothing short of amazing. Also a fun atmosphere.
author: Lauren E.

description:
Came here for dessert with a friend, and the food was fine but honestly did not blow me away. 

The place is pretty okay in terms of service, decor, and food.
author: Jenée S.

description:
Came on Memorial Day and the line was out the door and stayed that way until we left! Surprisingly, the line went by pretty fast. It a cute little sit-down cafe. This place seemed very well organized. 

I ordered the huevos rancheros and substituted the black beans for potatoes with a mimosa to drink. My fiancé ordered the eggs Benedict with an orange juice to drink and we shared the chocolate waffle. The OJ was freshly squeezed! Love us some freshly squeezed OJ! The food was so good! It was a good portion and we definitely got our money's worth. 

The service was extremely quick and we got our food within 10 mins upon ordering. 

Overall, our first time here was worth it. Definitely would recommend!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Just an okay breakfast place in tourist land of SF. 

Ordered crab Florentine and huevos rancheros. Both were quite bland. 

Potatoes were undercooked on both dishes. 

Salsa isn't store made but rather from a bottle and I believe some other ingredients are sourced straight from Costco. 


For what it is, overpriced and underwhelming.
author: Cyrus H.

description:
Wow, what a great little place.
Recommended by our hotel front desk staff was the perfect place for a nice quick delicious breakfast.

I ordered plain crepes which were dusted with powdered sugar. I added a side of bacon and a hot tea to round out my meal 
My sister ordered the Milano omelette, which was also very good.

The extensive menu something for just about everyone and I'm fairly confident they would have customized anything as well.
They didn't have a true veggie omelette but again with some customization I'm sure that could be attained.
They also have some nice selections for lunch and even a light dinner.

Our only concern is that they don't really have anyone walking around for coffee refills or additional service needs. There was only one gentleman who seemed to be delivering meals out of the kitchen but he was in such a rush to get back to bring out the next person's food that you are extremely challenged to wave him down.

All in all we would definitely return when in the area.
author: Sherri G.

description: Super confusing. Sign says wait to be seated and everyone ignored us. Ordered  a grilled chicken sandwhich and the tomato was thicker then the tiny piece of chicken.  I dont think it's worth the hassle to find parking. Theres little to no seating and people sit there reading or working while people wait for a seat
author: Theresa V.

description: Place was very good. Line to order went by fairly quickly considering it was brunch time and it is tourist season. I ordered eggs Benedict and fresh carrot juice. Both were great. I had no problem finding a seat. But then again, it was just me...
author: Olive R.

description: order at the register, get a number, sit down and your food is sent to you type of restaurant. Service was super quick and the food was even better! The menu was so large that I will have to be back to try more items from their menu !! :-)
author: D L.

description: Come hungry! Servings are huge. Every plate that came out of the kitchen made my mouth water. They have endless options all of their crepes (savory and sweet) and Benedict's looked bomb. I had the Miami Heat crepe with potatoes and an au lait. Just what I needed after a long flight. Long lines but moves quickly so do tables.
author: Stephany C.

description: I heard about Honey Honey before moving to San Francisco, so I was very excited to give it a try when I got to town. I have returned many times and have yet to be disappointed. Everything is delicious, the portions are just right, and the service is good. Definitely a local favorite -- just make sure not to go at peak time or you may be waiting in line for a bit!
author: Peter L.

description:
Cute little cafe with really great food. 

Someone I know recommended this place for when I go to San Francisco. I'm glad I took her advice because the food was great. 

The downfall is the line to order and finding seating. It does get really busy but if you have a little time, it's worth it. the portions were big and the food was delicious
author: Candace S.

description:
Bomb Breakfast spot! 
Had Nutella and banana crepes, waffle and omelette.....Must try if your around the neighborhood! Lunch sandwiches looked yummy too!
author: Roger S.

description:
The food is decent, but the service and vibe are... a lot. I got in about 20 minutes after opening, and the line was already to the door. I waited for about 20 minutes in the line before ordering, and then it took about 20 minutes to get my crepe. It's a bit hard to find a table, especially if you're dining alone and don't have someone to hold a spot (a ton of larger groups we're leaving one or two people to find seats while they waited on line). 
The menu is pretty extensive, so you'll probably be able to find something you like- and stay tuned for the seasonal specials that are posted just before the register. 
The decor is very old fashioned, and about 30 minutes in they started playing weird music- like a dance club meets traditional Greek music.
author: Emily S.

description:
Delicious! Yes, that's the first thing I have to say about this place. What a great last breakfast to have in SF!

There was a line right out the door when we got there, so we knew it must be good (or, you know, touristy). We had to wait, but it went smoothly because they were so well organized. You wait in line to order at the counter, but don't feel rushed because you have plenty of time once inside to look at the menu. The overall amount you have to choose from is overwhelming! I didn't make my final decision until I was at the counter.

I ordered the Pesto crepe and the iced chai tea. The chai was so good and refreshing! My happy place. And the crepe was perfectly cooked, and they DID. NOT. CHINCE on the filling! For any of the crepes! The rest of the group ordered the Half Moon Bay crepe, the Eggplant Crepe, the strawberry nutella, and the lemon. All of them were delicious. Oh and they have this awesome juicer for fresh squeezed orange juice! 

You have endless options here. And to make it harder, when you have made your decision, they surprise you with the Daily Specials menu at the end of the line! I highly recommend Honey Honey for breakfast.
author: Crystal A.

description:
Definitely on my list of best Breakfast spots in Lower Nob Hill. After 2 visits it is time to write an honest review.  Yes the lines can be long, but good things are always worth waiting for... I look for long lines, it's a clue they are doing something right. 

If you are a fan of egg Benedict I would recommend this restaurant. I've had both the Crab Cake Florentine and Salmon benedict. Both had ready good flavor. I would definitely pick the salmon only because I really enjoy salmon. 

The Crab Cake Florentine come with two poached eggs, spinach, crab cake on an English muffin topped with hollandaise sauce and served with potatoes. I opted out of the potatoes with fruit. 

The Salmon benedict comes with two poached eggs, Salmon, tomato, served on an English muffin topped with hollandaise sauce and served with potatoes. I opted out for tomato slices. 

The coffee is good. Make sure you flag down an employee if you want a refill. Staff is really friendly.

I look forward to trying a crape. They look amazing.
author: Brandon L.

description: They have delicious food however, it takes forever to get the food. I had Salmon Egg Benedict and it was really good.
author: Alp O.

description: I found this place on yelp and was sold after I saw pics of baklava crepes. When I arrived the line was out the door. It took about 30-40 minutes to reach the register. It seemed a bit unorganized, since there were many open seats. Someone came and gave me a table number once I got close to the register. I ordered a chai tea (Oregon chai brand), the baklava crepes, then a side of bacon and potatoes. The food came quickly and everything was delicious! The crepes were very sweet. I wanted to come back another day for lunch but unfortunately didn't make it. They have a large variety of lunch and breakfast foods.
author: Ashley A.

description: If I could write 0 stars I would. I am so disappointed that we were told that we were "TOO LOUD". It is currently 3pm and there are 3 other people in here and we were told people complained about our volume, and if we needed to be loud, we should go outside. We asked who complained and the waiter said many people. However we asked other people if we were too loud and they said no. I am just so disappointed that we were having a good time enjoying our breakfast, yet we were asked to leave because we were "too loud". I've always recommended this place to friends, but today definitely change my take on the place. So sad to have experienced this with friend who were coming out of town. Will not be returning even though the food was great.
author: Cecilia L.

description:
Really liked Honey Honey Cafe cause of their crepes! Breakfast was had here and it was decent. Their interior needs remodeling cause it looks a little outdated, but their menu board was awesome. Loved seeing the hand written menu. Lots of choices for breakfast and lunch! If you are going here for breakfast, get here before 830AM cause the line gets crazy long. Also, seats are limited and they tend to fill up. Weird cause when we came here in the afternoon for dessert, it was close to empty. 

Got the: Post Street Omelet [$11.95] came with: cheddar, ham, onion, mushrooms, green pepper--definitely tasted better omelets, but it was good enough. The ratio between the ham & veggies were good. Ordered a side of pancakes [$9.75] 3 fluffy stacks! Thoroughly enjoyed that with a glass of freshly squeezed OJ [$4.50]-- we know it's fresh cause the machine runs right behind the counter & is clearly visible. The star of this restaurant is the crepe we ordered! It was a simple, yet fulfilling dessert! We ordered the banana nutella & walnuts crepe with ice cream on the side [$8.25]! Sooo good! The flavors really mixed well together & they did not skimp out on bananas or nutella...it was just the best darn thing we had that day. Try Honey Honey out, you won't regret it!
author: Rana R.

description:
Great breakfast spot! My suggestion : 

1. Get there early (before 8.30AM) the line gets real long 
2. You pay and then get a seat, seats are limited 
3. They have an insane breakfast spread from eggs, sandwiches to waffles 
4. Their beverage menu is amazing with option of mimosa and sangria too!
author: Chalin S.

description:
I saw that someone on my facebook had been here and it had decent reviews and looked closed to my hotel. (It ended up being a little trek.) The menu looked expansive and I was excited. I got the burrito with chorizo (can't remember the exact name) and it was kind of cold as were the black beans that were on the plate. The cheese in my burrito was even close to melted. I got an iced mocha for a drink and it was ok. When I went to the counter to refill my mom's coffee, I discovered the container of Nesquik the used for the "mocha."

One plus is that even though the restaurant was crowded and the line was long there was seating available by the time we ordered. While we were eating another patron sat down without ordering and a staff member told her that she should order before sitting down, ensuring that everyone that arrived before her would be able to sit down for their meal.
author: Janna J.

description: This place is amazing! Great food very fast and efficient. There was quite a line when we arrived but it moved quickly.  The menu is up on the wall and is huge and very descriptive. Good selection as well. I had the Santa fe scramble while is a seasonal option and it was amazing. If I had to do them on anything it would be that they add too much rosemary to their breakfast potatoes, but that's just me being picky.
author: Kirsten C.

description:
BEST CREPES I HAVE EVER EATEN!! This place had a very trendy vibe to it. They offer savory and sweet crepes on their menu. My wife and I both got a savory crepe and split a Nutella and Strawberry crepe. The Breakfast Crepe was great and I would get it again, but the Nutella and strawberry crepe was to die for. There is no table service, but you order at the counter and they bring you your food. They also have a unique orange juice juicer, which I recommend trying the OJ to see how it works. 

This is a must try in San Fran.
author: Steve P.

description:
This crappy place is a total tourist trap. Our family stayed at the Spero down the block and this was the closest breakfast place. There's always a long line but don't be fooled. Our party of five got a few different types of crepes and they were thick and doughy like pancakes folded up. If you get a savory crepe, you'll get vegetable fillings that came straight out of a can. The crab cake eggs Benedict was the only decent item. 

You'll also be told to leave before you're done with your food to make room for the people waiting in line for their food. We had to leave while still chewing our food.
author: J J.

description:
Pros:
-Delicious breakfast spot in Union Square
-Good value 

Cons:
-If your starving, then this place is not for you; you will wait forever 
-Music is way too loud
-One person at the register! 100 people waiting in line, come on. Hire one more person at the front, your making a killing..
author: Harry H.

description: Once upon a time on Yelp, a person would leave a review that wasn't a book but tell you the basics or key items.  They used to also give a realistic review, now it's 5's or 1's and not much in between .  This place is rated too high.  Nice little place and helpful staff but low quality and non seasoned eggs, soggy bacon that is fatty, pancakes are basic, and an Americano that tastes like water.  The OJ was good, that's it.  I get it, it's your local hangout and near your house but in the end an honest review is much more helpful to the rest of us.
author: Joe D.

description:
First time here. The food is good and delivered fast. It has a diner feel to it. A little hectic but not too much.
You order and pay at counter, sit down with your number and a few minutes later...presto...food
author: Robyn N.

description: Came here for breakfast.  I had the Sunrise breakfast burrito.  Had them add the heuvos sauce on top.  It's was fantastic.  Full of flavor and spice which I love.
author: R R.

description:
This place obviously gets a high volume of customers, especially on the weekends. We ate here early in the morning on a Monday and our wait was roughly 15minutes. 
You order your food at the counter and they then bring it to a table of your choice. I opted for the chorizo scramble. It was very good with a heavy burst of flavor from the chorizo. The potatoes that came with the dish were perfectly crispy and well seasoned. 
My wife git the Acapulco omelette which she enjoyed but didn't rave about. 
The cappuccino/espresso/cafe au lait was a complete disappointment here so if you are a coffee drinker, skip it. Not worth it spending the money. 
Overall they have a vast menu with great combinations of foods. I would't rush to eat here again though. Solid 3.
author: Gina M.

description: This is a good cafe. They serve sandwiches, crepes, coffee and breakfast.  I liked their salad and blue cheese burger. Customer service was fast and efficient. Prices were reasonable. Good place to get food in a quick, causal dinning environment.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: I ordered delivery from the cafe twice while in SF. They actually do a good job with their omelettes. The French toast was okay, but what was really good was the Nutella banana crepe! The second order I made, they had forgotten our orders of sausage and bacon, but the owner was nice enough to run it over to our hotel when I called and told them we did not receive our sides. My omelette the second time around was not made correctly either, but it was too late by the time I realized it and I was too hungry to wait for a different one. If you are staying in union square and need delivery, I would try this place.
author: Anna T.

description:
Will you wait on the weekends...absolutely!

Is it worth the wait? (I didn't order crepes and my omelette was average...so, still up in the air)

The things I appreciated:

-Variety in menu

-Cool fresh squeezed oj machine

-Organization! I mean, this place works like clock work. You order then get seated, but while you're standing in line to order the staff members are picking out a table for you. Brilliant idea! I didn't think it could work as well as it did. 

As for my food, I had the huevos rancheros. Pretty good but felt like the beans could use more flavor. Evidenced by the loads of hot sauce I ended up pouring over it. 

Overall, not a bad place for a not-so-quick brunch.
author: Adelina M.

description: Great breakfast spot! We tried to eat here yesterday but was scared away by the line out the door.  We had more time this morning and was glad we waited! It only took 20-30mins in line and service was fairly quick! We ordered the Crab cake Florentine and the strawberry Nutella crepe and both were great!
author: Lindsay C.

description:
The food is alright but the set up of the restaurant is a disaster. It will take you an hour to be seated because there is only one person at the register. 

I'm guessing the line is so long because this is the closest brunch spot to union square.
author: Lana R.

description:
Honey honey is amazing. 

Great food and generous portions.

We ordered 3 crepes, beer and fresh orange juice. My God was it worth it. 

Service was great, sort out to our boy Meteb and make sure to tip him. 

Good music too.
author: shane w.

description:
I heard about Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery from a friend that was visiting from out of town and happened to stumbled onto this spot for a quick bite. He enjoyed it so much that he ended up visiting it a few more times since his hotel was nearby.

The menu is quite extensive.. lots of options for sandwiches and crepes (both savory & sweet). I tried the Chicken Pesto Crepe with fresh fruits. The crepe was good.. not sure I enjoyed the pesto sauce as much. I was pretty impressed with the side of fresh fruits -- unlike your usual fruit side, there was a lot of variety & all so beautifully sliced. My friend really enjoyed his Apple-Turkey sandwich. We shared the Strawberry Nutella Crepe for dessert and it was delicious -- I mean how can you go wrong with Nutella.

There's a good amount of seating but it's also good for takeout.
author: Ruby C.

description: Went for a quick bite after dinner! Got strawberry Nutella crepe w icecream! It was very good! Enough portion to split between two people! I would recommend checking this place out!
author: Theresa H.

description: The little cafe is quick, freshly made food and hot. Delicious from the first bite to the last.
author: Liz S.

description: Conveniently located! This hipster vibe place was always busy! From the time we walked in, it was a 15 minute wait to order food at the counter. Finding a table was a little worrisome as people were leisurely enjoying their brunch/lunch and not getting up in the normal fashion that these places normally work. We enjoyed the savory eggplant crepe as well as the strawberry Nutella crepe. Both were very good, if you are in the area it's a good quick spot!
author: Taylor S.

description:
I don't get it.  We waited over 20 minutes to order (then 15+ minutes for food).  Was it because there were no open tables? Nope - there were plenty.  There was one cashier/order taker that doubled as the barista and bartender for whatever drink you ordered.  She would touch money and touch your order and never washed her hands.  I am not saying the hair I had in my water cup was hers, but it was no surprise.  

To quote my son, "If the food was good, it would be worth the wait, but it is not."  Another good quote from my son who ordered a $3.95 side order of fruit that came out with 2 sliced strawberries, 4 slices of banana and one slice of kiwi, "did they want me to think i got a whole banana by including 2 ends?"  

Needless to say, the service, food and cleanliness of this place were all poor.  The line out the door exists because Serivce is slow and there are so few breakfast places in the area, not because the food is good.  Ignore the concierge that sends you here.  Sleep late, grab a starbucks and find a good place for lunch!
author: Ken R.

description:
Tasty.  Really enjoyed our breakfast here. Line was long on a holiday weekend, but the food was really good. We had standard breakfast fare plus crepes - all was delicious. Coffee was nothing to get excited about

Restaurant is crowded so don't go if you're in a hurry. But it's as good or better than most of the other breakfast joints around Union Square.
author: Jim O.

description:
When I first arrived at around 10 am on a Sunday morning, I noticed the line went out the door. I was reluctant to wait in line since there were about 10 -15 people waiting in line outside and the weather was a little chilly. There were also a lot of people waiting inside the restaurant. However, I really wanted to eat savory crepes especially since I had a great experience eating 
crepes at Higher Grounds Coffee House in Glen Park. 

I decided to wait in line anyways. It took about 1 hour for me to get to the front counter. The employee assigned everyone a seat while we were waiting in line. When it was time to order, I selected the Mediterranean Crepe ($11.95) and chose salad as my side dish. 

The food arrived pretty quickly despite how full the restaurant was. I want to say that I waited for about 10 minutes after being seated. 

In general, the crepe was good and cheesy. It looked like the employees may have rushed while making the crepes though. Some of the toppings were not sliced very well. For example, I got huge onion and tomato pieces. The onions were very raw. Luckily, I love eating vegetables. In addition, I saw a weird bulge in one part of the crepe. When I cut it open with my knife, I noticed it was a huge chunk of feta cheese about 1.5" to 2" in diameter! I was also given only two  artichoke pieces. 

I was a little disappointed about the salad. The salad looked like the cheap, generic salad mix you can get at Safeway. It was a bit dry and I wished I got the potatoes or fruit side option instead. I tried my friend's potatoes and found it to be delicious! It was super crunchy and had a lot of seasoning on it. I also noticed the fruit side option to look very fresh. I saw tons of thin strawberry slices. 

It was nice seeing that there was free Wifi in this restaurant. I would not come here to study though. It's a bit noisy. 

I may come back here, but I would prefer going to the crepe place in Glen Park instead!
author: Kristina M.

description:
PROS: 
-Close to our hotel.
-Line moves quickly.
-Lots of indoor seating.

CONS:
-Food was meh. Ordered eggs benedict and tasted very bland. Weird. Potatoes were over seasoned with rosemary and salt.
-Confusing 'seat yourself' sign, as you have to order first, then sit and they bring it to you. Read this in a review prior so knew what to do, but saw another table who hadn't and sat for sometime before realizing no one was coming to take their order. 

Would pass next time. Maybe their crepe's are good?
author: Sarah M.

description: Honey honey is a convenient place to get breakfast, especially when we are staying in the city just down the block. We ordered the cheese blintz, which was very good. We also ordered the eggs Benedict and this was disappointing.  The eggs were way too done, as in they didn't have a runny yolk like we like them. The hollandaise sauce had no flavor at all. Some of the other food around us looked really good and maybe we just didn't know what to order.  Bacon was limp, also.  Hopefully the next time we try them, the quality will be better.
author: Mary Anne B.

description:
Good size cafe down the street from our hotel. We were able to walk here from the JW Marriott. The cafe has ample seating. Food is ordered at the counter regardless if you're dining in or taking out. 

I ordered the eggplant crepe. My boyfriend got the chicken burrito, which was a special. This restaurant is known for their crepe, but I found the food ok. There wasn't anything that jumped out at me. The crepe was thick. My meal was more like an eggplant quesdilla versus a crepe. The special was great. 

This place was great due to speed and our ability to get to the airport in a timely manner.
author: Malisa R.

description: Went Honey Honey yesterday at 2pm, no crowd, peaceful and easy. Ordered at the counter, given the number and they sent the food over within 15 mins. If you have sweet tooth, try the Blintz. If you like pasta, get the fettuccine. If you're a sandwich lover, try the apple - turkey, it has avocado! Food overall is good with decent price!
author: Vivian T.

description: I don't even know how to describe it. Food was good, service was easy, and it was pretty cheap. Not disappointed at all, very much a "load the plate up with home cookin'" type of place. Oh, the coffee was kinda weak, like, it tasted kind of watered down, but that could be me.
author: Norman-lee D.

description:
A joy of a restaurant. Worth the wait.

High volume eatery, well run and managed by a terrific staff. Quality food, served hot, with a very wide menu selection. Come hungry. Leave satisfied.

Eggs Benedict was outstanding. Both Crepe dishes were "clean plated". Iced tea was remarkable as per one in our party. Hot black coffee was not as high of quality as hoped, but not undrinkable either as most diners joe can be. 

Would be eating here again had we not been leaving soon.
author: John W.

description:
Upside: Food is a-ok, they specialize in crepes and eggs benedict.

Downsides:
- Only one of the eggs in my eggs benedict was runny, the other one was overcooked
- Long line for brunch, that seemingly doesn't move
- Crepes could use more filling. We got the coconut crepe with chocolate filling, and it had way too much dry coconut and not enough chocolate
- Parking in this area is close to impossible. Uber!
- Inside could be cleaner
author: Vasiliy M.

description: Ok so I walk up and I see a line and I think to myself...... go find another place. Glad I waited yum.com Nutella and walnut.
author: Mike L.

description: If I could transfer one breakfast spot from SF to the Twin Cities, this would be it. First, i was so impressed by the options Honey has to offer. I was a bit overwhelmed but eventually went with a crepe since it is in the name. And wow, that crepe was probably the best I'll have in a while. Great ingredients and flavors worked well together. The breakfast potatoes were crispy and delicious too...the line was so long when I got there during prime breakfast time, but it wasn't as bad since you need a while to look at the giant menus to decide what you wanted anyway. Definitely will be back next time I'm in SF!
author: Emily Z.

description:
Egg Benedict was so BAD 
Salad was the worst
And cashier had a nasty attitude when we said that the coffee is cold and we want it hot 
I'm not going to come back .
author: Nir L.

description: For my first morning in San Francisco we ate here. I highly recommend the Breakfast crepe or the salsa savory crepes. Potatoes were way too overdone. It's a very casual place with the line to order often out the door. The bathroom was immaculate! All the locals seem to love this place. I don't blame them.
author: Terry M.

description: Love this place. I came for crepes and ended up getting the croissant sandwich. Back for the second day in a row. Each time I forgot to substitute fruit for the potatoes and each time, they were super accommodating and just gave me a fruit cup. The staff really knows how to move a crowd. Don't be daunted by the line. The menu is amazing and they give you a table number before you order and pay. They also move the line along quickly by taking certain orders in advance. Hinda in particular is super friendly, remembered our drink order from yesterday and made us feel super welcomed. I highly recommend. They even have mimosas and bloody Mary's for those who need to start their morning with a different type of buzz other than their cappuccino and lattes.
author: Kathy S.

description: Very disappointed. The food was cold, and no flavor. The staff was snotty, and rude. I will not go back.
author: Matthew B.

description: Excellent food.  We had the Nutella  strawberry crepe and a breakfast crepe. Fresh ingredients with nice presentation. They are open for breakfast at 7:30 and the place was hopping. Looked like a local favorite.
author: Sharon H.

description:
Honestly, I expected more from this place. I couldn't decide between sweet and savory so I got their crab cake Benedict and a Nutella crepe. Both were very good, even though the crepe was a bit too hick for my taste. Benedict was good but nothing to write home about, something that you could get anywhere. Their menu has a huge selection so something for everyone. I went on Thursday afternoon so the place wasn't busy at all but I couldn't see how it could get crazy during the weekends.
My only complain would be their tables. I am not the tallest person ever but I was very uncomfortable as the table was SUPER low. I literally had to fold over to be able to eat and my knees couldn't even fit under the table so I had to push it further away. 
Overall, an average breakfast place. I would probably go there if you don't like trying new things but as San Francisco has so many unique places, I probably wouldn't go back to this one.
author: Irina R.

description:
Incredibly long wait on a Sunday. I expected a long wait, but you stand outside in line and then you get inside and wait more when people order. I think we waited about an hour. It was very very slow. Not sure why ordering took so so long. 
The food was decent. I had the salmon Benedict. 
The strawberry blitz crepe was not what I was expecting. A little too thick and the cottage cheese felt out of place texturally.
Most likely would not return.
author: Ann A.

description:
Place gets busy in the early morning, but that's to be expected.  Everything else is closed and people are hungry.  Mostly tourists will flock to this spot and expect a line, but thankfully it actually moves pretty quickly. 

Once you pay and are seated, just sit back and relax until your food is delivered to you.  So how is the food? It's fantastic.  The blintz crepe is a bit on the smaller side, but the savory crepes are actually pretty large.  So that's fantastic! Service is pretty on spot, so you thankfully you have that going for you. 

Overall, a great spot in SF, but then again, there are a ton of great spots in SF.
author: Benny H.

description:
Delicious, good proportions, kind staff. 

They don't just serve food, they talk to their customers. They told me about one guy to whom they often give free food - I assume he's homeless. It shows that they take care of their neighborhood. I don't just like to be fed, I like to know about the people who make the food, so this was important to me.
author: Daphne C.

description:
I ordered the Croissant Breakfast Sandwich and thought it was great! Be prepared for a long line when going on the weekends since there is only one cashier. Once we ordered, we were able to be seated immediately and had hot and fresh food quickly. It was worth the wait.

Also, their orange juice is made from freshly-squeezed oranges, which was awesome.
author: Courtney S.

description:
Place was very good  many things to choose from. Get there early since a line does form. But rest assured it moves along quite nicely. They do assign u a table, so do not try and grab one urself. Staff was helpful and nice. 

Will be returning if I visit SF again
author: Jessica G.

description: Located in a vibrant area of the city, surrounded by so many great cafes and restaraunts. Got a savory and sweet crepe -- very delicious. Great spot to catch some tasty food at any time of the day.  Highly recommend.
author: Michael N.

description: Was close by and wanted brunchy food and this place was perfect. My friend and I got the salmon Benedict and SBK (strawberry banana kiwi) crepe with ice cream. The egg on the Benedict was super yummy. And just beautiful to look at :D. The crepe was also good with the ice cream! I really like that their breakfast dishes are there till 3pm and even after they have so many choices. I want to try the savory crepes next time!
author: Lulu T.

description: Was not super impressed by this place. My food was just ok. From reading the reviews I expected a lot more. Would not waste my time standing in line for this place. Looks like they have many options that were good but for breakfast what my friends and I all got none of us were impressed.
author: Yael G.

description: fast, friendly and inexpensive. I liked the breakfast but was really pleased with the savory selections for lunch and dinner. I picked up my order in minutes and went and sat outside on the patio at my hotel and enjoyed
author: Debbie M.

description: Great restaurant! I would suggest coming at 1 because the rush will have died down and it's honestly worth the wait. It may seem a little pricey but the portions are perfect and they really know how to make their breakfast potatoes. I would recommend getting the banana crepe ( a great combination of sweet and crunchy) and a side of breakfast potatoes for a delicious juxtaposition of sweet and savory.
author: Smrithi M.

description: Food is great, humble workers and a great ambiance. There will be a long line but will be worth it.
author: Roger M.

description: Food was divine! I had Eden (savory crepes) and wow is all I can say. The plate was huge and delicious! My wife had the blintz, she enjoyed them as well. The house coffee wasn't the tastiest but it's coffee... The only negative thing I have to say is the people waiting in are ridiculous, no wonder the line is so long. Everyone stands in line either on their phones or talking to whoever they are with and when they get to the front of the line they have no idea what they want. Get it together San Franciscans!!!
author: Nik J.

description: Either I have no idea how a crepe should be or it wasn't made right. I'm used to much thinner crepes. These were thicker and eggy texture. Maybe I caught them on an off night but not somewhere I'll go again.
author: Wendy C.

description:
You might run into a big crowd and when you try the food you'll see why. Make sure you ask the staff to be seated while you wait in line. 

The French toast is amazing.
author: Abraham M.

description: Great set up. There was a line but it went quickly. I was concerned about getting a table but we were assigned a table while on line. Convenient!!  The breakfast crepe was delicious. The veggies were crisp which we like. Highly enjoyed the warm sweet crepe with banana strawberry and kiwi. Of course whipped cream too. Go early like us. When we were leaving the line was a lot longer. Also many other selections besides crepes. Oh!  Also fresh squeezed oj
author: Regina G.

description:
The food was good, portions are ok too. The wait time was average. You order food they give you a number and they get a table ready for you. 

Customer service is terrible, they rush you to order, rush you to eat. The environment was tense and felt rushed to finish and get out of there. I would not be going back. 


Bad customer service and feeling unwelcomed trumps the quality of the food.
author: Hard Taco I.

description:
This place looked great from the amount of reviews it had so my friends and I gave it a try. There was a short line out the door which we expected. I ordered the egg Benedict and the Dulce de Leche crepe without the pecans. I highly recommend the Egg Benedict over the omelette and crepe selection. After waiting a good amount of time for our food it finally came out, but our order was messed up. We asked our waiter kindly to fix it and she was walking away as we were talking to her and made us feel like we were at fault for not getting what we ordered. 

All in all, the food was tasty here but with the bad service and the long wait time with a messed up order..I don't see myself coming here again.
author: Kubra S.

description: Food was fine but I'm not entirely sure what the hype is all about. Had the eggs Benedict but maybe should have tried some of the crepes. Good service. Just another breakfast spot from what I can tell.
author: Michael C.

description:
Place your order, sit down, and food is brought to you type setup.. line was long but it gives you time to look at their extensive menu on the wall.. the service was great, food came out quickly and was tasty. The young lady behind the register is going a million miles per hour haha!
Great breakfast spot, would recommend.
author: John D.

description: Food was ok. Service was pathetic. Waited in the line forever even though half the tables were empty. And then they forgot to deliver our order with everyone ordering after us getting their food ahead of us. As for the food, ordered the crab cake Benedict. They did a decent enough job but I've had better.
author: Srinayana G.

description:
YUM! 

 Our food was delicious. We ordered two bloody Mary's, oatmeal with fresh fruit, French toast, Crab cake Florentine. 

 My crab cake Florentine was delicious! Crab cake was crispy, still moist in the center with great flavor, I requested that my eggs be poached medium as I don't like them runny- most places disregard my request- they did not and the eggs were perfect, it was served with breakfast potatoes, a little under cooked but had good flavor. The French toast was absolutely AMAZING!! Delicious, flavored and cooked perfect- highly recommend it. My husbands oatmeal was oatmeal, no complaints and it was a huge bowl! The bloody Mary's were spicy and strong! very reasonably priced placed compared to a lot of surrounding restaurants that hike up the prices for the sake of being in a tourist area. 

The restaurant is located on a street corner, be prepared to wait in a relatively long line if you're coming during "prime" hours. We waited around 30 min before ordering our food and being assigned a table. This restaurant reminded me of a crepe vine but way better quality food! If I'm in the area, I would for sure come back- knocked off a star for their long wait and no call ahead option.
author: Holly R.

description: This place was empty and for the price it's okay, the crepe but super good, I got a crepe with spinach cheese and avocado, and me and my friend split a Belgian waffle which was so good with whipped cream, strawberries and bananas! If you ever get the waffle eat it with honey! Won't regret it!
author: Melanie P.

description: This place a perfect city life ambiance. It has great character and the crepes are very savory. New Orleans and  chicken pesto. If you don't wish to explore the crepe savoriness then they have sandwiches, pastas, soups and salads... it's really more breakfast and lunch.  All their food is flavorful. Highly recommended.  However, be ready to wait at least 30 min to order as there are long lines during breakfast and lunch times. Freshly squeezed carrot and orange juice available.
author: Michael F.

description: Line extended to the door, but we got to the from of it in about 30 minutes. Food came out speedy fast, and was the perfect warm hearty breakfast. Fresh OJ is to die for.
author: Jackie B.

description: Crepes were hearty and delicious. Atmosphere was fun and casual, Starbucks kind of feel.
author: Christopher B.

description: Went on a Sunday morning for brunch. The line was out the door but it moved fairly quickly. I probably waited about 20-30 mins before I was able to order. They have a large menu so it gave me time to decide what I wanted. I got the Florentine crepe which was really good. Seating is mostly inside but they do have 2 or 3 tables small tables outside.
author: Kristin M.

description: I'm in San Francisco on business. The restaurants on Geary are too snooty, so I'm back at Honey Honey for another meal. Plainly good food, lots of tables, quick service!
author: Jeff D.

description: The food is delicious. The menu is huge and everything is done to perfection. It's worth every minute of your waiting. The line is long before 11am, but you won't be disappointed.
author: Alice R.

description:
This is one of our go to's. Always love it. She gets the oatmeal, I get the crab cake benny we split a #5 bagel, and 2 cappuccinos. It's always been good here. And lots of folks feel the same, so get here early. Line is always 50% regulars and 50% tourist.
    Yelpers love this place. Delightfully Consistent, packed, and great food. Affordable with decent portions. Walk up, get in line, giant menu on the wall, and order at the register. They will select a table for you based on party size before you order.
   Has gotten substantially better since they started designating tables in their hosting plan.  It used to be a free for all, with assholes in the back of the line sending their significant others to grab open tables 20 min before they got to order. Was a real mele. Now it's well organized. Food has always been great throughout. A Go to!
author: Dan W.

description: This little gem was located around the corner from the hotel we stayed at in SF.  I loved the lemon crepe and the Florentine crepe.  They also make a tasty fruit bowl as well.  My husband had a delicious latte.  I would highly recommend stopping into this place for breakfast if you are in the area. Customer service is friendly and fast and the food is awesome!
author: Melanie B.

description: When we arrived the line was out the door but it was worth the wait. Everything we ordered was delicious. It was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely visit again whenever we are in San Francisco.
author: Shawnda H.

description:
BUSY!!!! 
Good luck finding a place to sit if you come here with a large party! 
The coffee is very mediocre. The food is good but not the most memorable. This is a very average at best breakfast spot in the city.
author: AZadeh A.

description:
Food was excellent, wish the line wasn't as long.
The way they served the food when given looked and smelled amazing. The food tasted better than it looked! We had eggs Benedict with a sweet crepe. The potatoes were nicely seasoned and tasted great! We'll visit again
author: Karyn D.

description:
I came in on a Friday morning and it was packed as usual.  I ordered the chicken pesto crepe, with spinach and avocado.  I waited in line and the waitress skipped giving me a number at first (I was by myself but standing between two parties of 2 or more)

They forgot the avocado (which I paid extra for) and getting silverware to eat took FOREVER.  The server acted like she couldn't hear me, but the table next to me (further away from her) she had no problem hearing or rushing over to help them.

Skip the hype, there are so many other great restaurants in SF.  This place is great if you're a tourist and you want that "I had a great brunch in SF" but getting service here is darn near impossible and the food is average at best.
author: Corderosa A.

description:
I came here with a friend and ordered a strawberry Nutella crepe. The presentation itself was alright, but the crepe had WAY too much Nutella... I ended up digging out the Nutella and eating the strawberries and cream instead.

Aside from that, the service is pretty average, and they have nice music. Honestly if not for how mismatched the music is with the eatery, this place would give off a "mini Olive Garden" vibe because of the decor. 

All that said, I'm sure the other foods here are better than my overly sweet crepe, hence 3 stars instead of 2...
author: Angela Y.

description: Like an episode of Seinfeld.  No changes don't ask take it or leave it.  Food was not great.  Eggs Benedict were hard boiled 3 times it was sent back.  I gave up.  Crepes are ok.
author: Bob A.

description:
Kind of surprised this place is as highly rated as it is. Lattes from an automatic machine and drip coffee is ok. The blintz is pretty and it's good but no wow factor. The crepe Suzette had way too much zest on it. Like a whole orange or maybe two. Really bitter. The crab cake Benedict - eggs over cooked. Potatoes undercooked. Crab was good but again where's the "wow"?

Service is fast and the place was crowded so they get kudos for that. I won't be back though.
author: Tara G.

description:
I would give the place 4 stars based on the seasonal peanut butter Smores crepe but the entrees were not great in comparison. We ordered the crab cake Benedict and the salmon scramble. My fiance liked the crab cake benedict but I found it too "fishy" like the crab wasn't very cooked or something. The salmon scramble was pretty disappointing in both quantity and taste. There were just some pieces of partially cooked smoked salmon tossed with some scrambled eggs. The potatoes were well seasoned though.

The peanut butter Smores crepe with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the side was delicious. There was so much peanut butter and it went well with the melted marshmallow. The vanilla ice cream was so good (I think it had real vanilla bean). I'd probably come back just for crepes.
author: Christine L.

description:
Hahahaha hahahah so good

I got the sbk.... didn't come with a heart... I was a lil disappointed but it tasted so good so no worries.

I also got the juevos rancheros... dude... so good. I ate every bite.

Can be a long wait but totally worth.

I love you honey honey!!
author: Scott H.

description: Amazing service to begin with and the food was great! Good amount of seating and clean overall. Didn't have to wait a long time for food.
author: T G.

description: Tried Honey Honey while on vacation. The place is small, but they are super efficient make the small space work. The menu is huge and the food was tastey. The coffee was lacking in flavor... but the italian soda made up for it!
author: Rosie B.

description:
Do not order eggs benedict. 

My girlfriend and I had breakfast here due to our concierge raving all about this place, and unfortunately were disappointed. She had ordered the Crab Cake Florentine, and I the Salmon Benedict. While both our meals were plated very nicely, and looked delicious, that was not the case. Both of our dishes poached eggs were over cooked, almost to the point being hard boiled eggs. The dishes were cold, and the hollandaise was bland. 

I asked the food runner if I could reorder the eggs on side, cooked properly, in which he actually re-fired  my entire meal. Sadly the re-fire was not much better. The eggs were undercooked, muffin was soggy, and again cold. The best thing about the meal was the crispy potatoes that each dish came with. 

For a $35 breakfast, you'd expect a lot more. Visiting from out of town, so will not be returning, although not sure I would even if I lived here.
author: Ryan C.

description: Given the rating, we had big expectations and we waited 20 Minutes to get in there. Once you're in, you can see the boards with the many and they have a broad offering. We went for the eggs benedict with an orange juice and we were pretty disappointed. Not that the good was bad but it was just average and not worth queuing for.
author: Maëlle W.

description: Went here for a quick "to-go" breakfast on a Thursday morning at around 10am. I ordered the bagel with provolone, pesto, basil, and sundried tomato. Not the best bagel I had, but the toppings were tasty so overall an average rating. Was surprisingly busy - waited about 30min between waiting in line and then actually getting my food. It seems most people dine-in but there isn't waitress service (you order, pay, then get your food delivered to your table number). Waitress was a little short with us, but I think she was just flustered from a rather unreasonable customer just before us haha.m
author: Ciera P.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday morning at 11am and it was pretty crowded. It's an order-at-the-front-and-then-find-a-seat kind of place. Couldn't tell if the people ordering were having difficulty ordering or the one woman taking orders at the register was having a difficult time being efficient, but it took about 20 minutes for 10 people to order ahead of us. I had the breakfast crepe with potatoes and a coffee. Large portions. Good, thin, tasty crepe. Wish there was mixed color bell pepper instead of just green. Great hot sauce selection at each table with jalapeño tabasco, red tabasco and cholula, maybe other options at other tables. 
Wish the coffee was self serve or a waitress could come around for refills, because waiting In line again for 10 minutes wasn't a suitable option for me half way into my meal. 
Still on the lookout for the best breakfast joint in SF!
author: Dane K.

description: Easy. Fast. Low key. The food was really good and the service was great. A great spot if you want something quick and without much hoopla.
author: Trey G.

description: Pretty good. Large portions. I got a tuna salad and I've tried their pasta. Decent price. You're getting what you pay for. Would come back for more.
author: Cecile ..

description:
Did we miss something?

Decided to come here to breakfast one morning after hearing good reviews and seeing a huge queue out the door the day before!! The cashier was happy to replace the maple syrup on the pancakes with Nutella and we were given a table number and went to find out seats. The coffee we ordered came in a chipped mug and after the milk was added we found white specks floating in which we also noticed the people next to us we're having a problem with. When the food came out the pancakes had come with maple syrup not Nutella. We asked the waitress if we could have Nutella instead and she did not look happy and just left the table without comment. About 4 minutes later the waitress came back and literally slammed the pot of Nutella onto the table looking very unhappy and once again said nothing. 

The pancakes were nice and the food was cheaper than other nearby breakfast places but we personally would rather pay a bit more and get much friendlier service. We are wondering if we missed something here or maybe just came in on a bad day?
author: Aimee S.

description:
Very warm and cozy, like a home cafe. The server was also not only friendly toward us, but cafe a passerby homeless man a drink and a pastry as well.

The food was amazing, we ordered the Salmon Benedict and Crab Cake Florentine and enjoyed both! The side if potatoes was quite heavy though so if your appetite isn't he largest I'd recommend you asking to reduce the serving size. 

Overall a wonderful experience, would definitely drop by again!
author: Kaycee P.

description:
Unfriendly staff disappointed since we look forward to eating here when we come to SF then got assigned the most uncomfortable seat facing everyone that is walking in looking at menu 
Sad and disappointed
author: Patti B.

description:
Some quick notes:

- they could really use some signage upon entering instructing diners that you order at the front and are assigned a table while waiting in line. You can't miss the line. 
- extremely touristy spot
- excellent lattes
- expect to wait about 20-30 minutes it's a popular place 
- prices on the website are less than advertised in restaurant
- odd layout and definitely needs signage to instruct customers on how their system works 
- nice big menu to view while waiting in line immediately to the right upon entering
- old school feel to this joint
- no outside seating 
- carb lovers dream - would recommend the crepes or waffles- they looked fantastic but can attest their omelettes are extremely fluffy 
- great variety and interpretations of breakfast- many options. lunch items too 
- fresh squeezed OJ or carrot juice
- they serve beer & wine
author: Stephanie L.

description:
What a way to celebrate the New Year! 1/1/18!

The potatoes were burnt and hard. my chicken pesto crepe was super dry. 

My wife's strawberry Nutella crepe came with a bowl of soupy melted ice cream. We asked to get an exchange because it was watery. The host said..."sorry, that's all that we have today." 

Coming from a business stand point...even if you don't have any other ice cream...you should substitute it with something else rather than providing it to your customer and continuing to do nothing about it.
author: Anson W.

description: We went for sweet crepes and loved them!! The strawberry Nutella was amazing. Crepes were cooked perfectly, filings were very fresh. The whipped cream tasted bland and didn't seem homemade.
author: Karen W.

description:
Not quite sure how this place averages 4 stars.
Service was fine and fast but the food was mediocre at best.
Tried the Post Street Omelette and Blintz with Strawberries.  Neither was good.
author: Yam Yam C.

description: This restaurant has a huge menu and even though the line might get long they have a great system going. As you stand in line someone asks you how many people you are and they find you a table and reserve a table for you while your in line and ordering your food. It worked out perfectly! They have a huge menu and everyone was very friendly and the food was yummy! But I would suggest getting there early in the morning to avoid too long of a wait.
author: Meghedie P.

description:
Food: Ordered the crab cake florentine and my sister ordered 2, 2,and 2 with sausage. The crab cake was a bit bitter. The eggs benedict left my mouth feeling dry for some reason and my stomach feeling queasy. The potatoes were the only decent thing on the plate. Tried the scrambled eggs on my sister's plate and was pretty bland. My sister also did not like her plate and said that Denny's tasted better.

Wait: We started waiting in line just outside the door and it was quite a wait (around half an hour) to get to ordering food.

Service: decent but didn't really do much except bring food to you. Everything else was pretty much self-service.

Price: A bit over priced for the quality. Around $14 for crab cake florentine. The 2,2, and 2 was around $12. It's around $4 for a side of bacon which is only around 2-3 pieces.

Conclusion: Not recommend and will not be coming back
author: Felicia W.

description:
You know a brunch place is good when you're there pretty dang early (8:30ish) on a WEEKDAY and there is still a massive line. Like wth?!

Anyway, we tried some spectacular crepes. I ordered the eggplant savory crepe, and it was heavenly. I'm not a crepe aficionado so I don't have much more to say about that. Just try it!
author: Melanie P.

description: Great food! A lot of options! Breakfast to lunch to dinner! Loved the amount I had to choose from! The crepeswere very sweet, just how I like them. Loved the hustle and bustle of the city nearby. The staff was very friendly! Would definitely go back!
author: Ari D.

description: Incredible menu! Worth the morning line-up. Staff has tables, meal ordering and delivery organized with precision. Highlights are the fresh orange juice, savoury crepes, sunshine burrito, and my favourite, the seasonal dulce de leche with pecans! Mmm mmmm!
author: Carey D.

description:
before leaving san fran , we waited in a long line to order at this place and man was it worth it
definitely get a savory crepe. you won't regret it. also get fresh OJ!

i tried the miami heat- which was avocado, chicken, cheddar cheese, and hot sauce.  oh yes it was perfect. the crepe was also cooked perfectly.  you order from the cashier and then someone will tell you what table to sit at while you're waiting in line.  the food will get delivered to you and water is self serviced.
author: Neha M.

description: This place was right around the corner from our hotel and had good reviews, so we tried it out. So glad we did! YUM!!! The selection is huge, but they do everything so well! I had a special: pancakes with bananas and candied pecans... Soooo good! My husband had the oatmeal and a bagel, which he really enjoyed. He also said that the bloody Mary was one of the best he's ever had! We tried to go back the next day, but the line was out the door and we had to be somewhere. Pretty popular spot, so it's no secret, but it's so good!!!
author: Luna L.

description: Absolutely horrible! Would never return. We waited over 45 minutes for the food. No apology when it arrived. No cutlery either. Instead of getting us cutlery, the man rudely tells us "the cashier is supposed to give it to you." From the sour-faced cashier, to the most horrible service I've encountered in a long time, this is the first 1 star review I've given. I was shocked by how poor the customer service is at this establishment. Do not go. Much better options around the corner. Fix your service and wait times.
author: Laura R.

description:
Honey, Honey is a cute, quaint cafe. They have an excessive menu that you'll find yourself wanting to order at least one item off of each handwritten chalkboard. The only setbacks are: the extremely long lines (practically out the door), one occupancy restroom, & customer service is kinda horrible but sure I accept that for the kinda traffic they get in here. The eggs Benedict was delicious and on point, and the potatoes served with them were even more memorable. They had the perfect crisp & flavor to them. Their pancakes were light & fluffy which were a great pair with the fresh strawberries. No food was wasted here, plates were wiped clean. 

Note: you stand in line to order your food, they give you a number stand and you seat yourself, your food is then brought out to your table. 

If I'm ever back in SF this place will definitely be a breakfast spot I'd love to return to.
author: Chris A.

description:
This place is not to be missed. I had the Eden Crepe with smoked salmon, capers, red onions. Delicious coffee. FRESH squeezed orange juice! Yum!!! 

Service was great, the manager was super nice and stopped by our table to make sure we were happy with everything. Wish we lived in San Francisco so we could come back sooner. I will miss this place. 

They also made a custom crepe for my wife and it was delicious. Get the potatoes. They are sautéed with onions and really good. 

Get there early. When we left at 8:30 there was a line going out the door. They also offer free wifi.
author: Trent T.

description: I was visiting SF and came to this lovely cafe. The crab in the bay crepes was bountiful and delicious! The Mediterranean crepes were delectable. The Nutella and banana with strawberries and ice cream was delightful. I'm so full but I still feel light. What a great way to start the day! :-p
author: Humair K.

description:
Very large menu and solid omelet (I got one with avocado, sour cream, and black beans), but the prices for some of the items was kind of much -- $9 for oatmeal?!

Additionally, the place gets very packed and uncomfortable if you are just trying to enjoy breakfast here.  The food takes quite a while to come out, as well.

Due to the chaotic nature of this place, I didn't get a friendly vibe from the staff.
author: Julie D.

description: There was a long, slow-moving line, but the service was good. The variety of the menu was impressive and offers quite a selection. I ordered the 2 pancakes, 2 eggs & 2 apple chicken sausages. It was very good. I also ordered an iced mocha latte. Also very good.
author: Lili L.

description:
I came here once and it was a stressful experience. I had a big order to place on behalf of many people. When the cashier announced the total, it was significantly lower than what I anticipated and I told her so -- MISTAKE. I said, "I think you undercharged me. I was expecting it to be around this amount." She just looked at me and said, "oh, okay." And then proceeded to charge me an extra $30. She didn't go over the receipt, didn't try to figure out what went wrong. Just straight-up added $30 to my already-incorrect bill. 

There was a HUGE line behind me and she clearly did this just to speed things along. I said "I don't think that's right." And she just looked at me and said nothing, as if somehow it was my fault I was holding up the line. I went ahead and paid and calculated everything later. This place straight-up stole $4 from me.

I'm not going to make a big fuss over $4, but I certainly won't be back here. I paid EXTRA MONEY because I was honest! The food was nothing special at all and it definitely wasn't worth it. 

Go to Stacks for an awesome breakfast in a fun atmosphere. Go to this place if you want mediocre food and cashiers with the problem-solving skills of a peanut.
author: Sarah R.

description: This place it to die for we had the Breakfast crepe with potatoes it was great. Going back for more before we leave.
author: Blanca S.

description:
So when you get your food it will be excellent. The rest of the experience is a bit of a bear. We went at 11:30 on a Saturday.  There was a line out the door.  You wait in the line for a number. Then you give your order, pay, and wait for your meal. If you want something else you can skip the line and runners bring you food.
The problem is they have only one cashier. The line from the door is at least 30 minutes and tables sit empty.  They really need a second cashier. 

Then our food came out here and there over 20 minutes.  A side here, a side there, it was like the kitchen had no idea what table they were feeding.  Also one sandwich was burned and sent back,  but when it came back it was really great! So If they could get more organized I would say this is a 5 star place. Next time I come to San Fran I may try again.
author: Mary R.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place for a while and was excited to finally try it one weekday night. It's great this place is close to union square and also closes at 10pm, which is later than a lot of the places in the area. The place sort of reminds me of crepevine with the menu boards and the type of food offered. You order at the counter and they'll give you a number and bring your food to your table. The lighting in here is weirdly dark, which was something I did not like. I hope during the day it's brighter due to natural lighting. 

We ordered a nutella with banana crepe. It was really delicious with a good amount of nutella and banana inside but it was nothing special really. I love crepes but this crepe for almost $10 was certainly not worth it. Maybe if there was something special about it it would've felt more worth but I probably wouldn't come back for it again. I do kind of wonder why the ratings for this place are so high so maybe their savory crepes are more tasty and delicious and worth the price tag.
author: Catherine S.

description: I was actually annoyed that I didn't notice that Honey Honey Cafe was right next to my hotel until the end of my trip to San Francisco because I definitely would have eaten here more than once. When you walk in there are a huge number of items listed on multiple signs on the wall.  If you want to go the breakfast route there are bagels, savory crepes, dessert crepes, eggs & omelets, fruit bowls, etc. If you're in more of a lunch mood there's sandwiches, burgers, soups, salads, burritos, etc. Once you decide what you want you make your way to the counter and tell them. I went with a waffle with fruit on it and it was delicious. It wasn't a cheap breakfast but I enjoyed it. The only thing I found quite odd was that there was a 'Please wait to be seated' sign when you walk in.  We did that only to have several incoming customers walk past us and go up to the counter to order, which was pretty annoying.  We ended up sitting by the entrance and never saw anyone seating people.
author: Chris W.

description: No service. Food was below average all around. Crab cakes on the crab cake Florentine did not taste good. Not very satisfied.
author: Paco C.

description: Just like any other brunch place in SF there is a wait, but it goes by really fast. The line is long (goes out the door) again the wait goes by fast. I've been here twice and both times I really enjoyed my food. The prices are decent and not too expensive. I really enjoy there lattes!! I've had salam egg Benedict's, and pecan pancake. Both were really delicious. One of the reasons I like this place is there menu! It's huge, so you have tons of options to choose from.
author: Mona A.

description: Honey Honey, is known for their crepes but if like me you're not a crepe lover they have options. Each time I've visited it was for breakfast so I can't give feedback on non breakfast items. I like this spot as they have a great variety of items and everything that I've tried has been good. The pancakes are not too sweet and are cooked just right as well as the omelette...the bacon can use a little more love but that's mostly because I prefer thick crispy bacon and theirs is more on the limp side. Definitely be prepared to wait because there is always a line but if in the area I say it's worth a few minutes wait
author: Noanya S.

description: The best value for money in San Francisco. The food is great and it's cheap relative to San Francisco
author: Moti S.

description:
Food was great! Best coffee I've had in a long time. Great Playlist! 
I had the croissant sandwich with egg whites that came with potatoes and a bagel with cream cheese.  Too much for me to eat but definitely worth it. 
I didn't catch the girls name but she was very pleasant.
author: Valerie O.

description:
~I have been here a few times and I'm happy with the large menu selection of various food items. In addition to crêpes, there are omelettes, sandwiches, salads, burgers, café drinks, juices, etc. 
During certain times of the year they offer a seasonal specials menu. So around the holidays some pecan and pie themed dishes centered around Thanksgiving and Christmas food classics.
 
~The layout is a square room with some booths on the right, while the rest of seating is spread out on small tables. It's a small well-lit café atmosphere, with glass windows on 2 sides. 

$ Also, prices are pretty low/reasonable for the amount of food you get and for the good quality. 
It's a great choice for breakfast, brunch (they have mimosas), or lunch! 

~I ordered a New Orleans crêpe with chicken, mushrooms, Swiss cheese, and sun dried tomatoes. 
You have a choice of sides: fruit, salad, or potatoes. I got potatoes. I did kind of wish I had gotten some greens or fruits instead, just because I started getting full and also it would've been a more balanced meal with veggies or fruits lol. 

~Timing wise 
-Easy 5 to 15 min walking distance from Union Square/hotels (I've walked from the Fairmont) 
-Line wait time is usually around 30 mins 
-Food comes pretty quickly 15 mins

~Only downside, (as in most good places in high traffic cities,) is that the line can get pretty long on the weekends. The 1st  and 2nd time I went it was out the door and along the side of the building. The most recent time was a Saturday during Thanksgiving week and the line was surprisingly shorter. It was from the cash register to the door. 
The good thing is the staff ask you how many in your party and assign tables while you are still in line. 
We were a party of 3 and our food only took about 15 mins to arrive at the table after we ordered. I joined the line at 11:30am and received the food at 12:18 pm. 

To be expected though and as long as you are prepared it's not so frustrating.
author: Cristi L.

description:
We were looking for a nice breakfast place in this last rainy day in San Francisco. After checking on Yelp, we decided to try this place. Right from the moment we entered, we noticed the place was what we were looking for. Nice extensive wall menu, full of amazing options. While we were waiting to order, my wife who's Greek American noticed the great Greek hits that were coming out of the speakers. So another plus to this place!!

We ordered the Eggs Benedict, Eggs Florentine and a turkey sandwich. As a desert we ordered their regular waffles with coffee. Everything was amazing!!

We got the chance to speak with Hinda who was super friendly and told us the reason why she was playing Greek music! Efharisto Poli!!

So, if you are around the union square area, looking for a cool breakfast place to seat and visit, this is the place to go.

Cheers!
author: Hugo d.

description: First of all, the girl employee was smoking right outside the door with her friend. She goes in after I walked inside and asked me what I wanted. I asked for the Strawberry and Nutella crepe . The girl DID NOT WASH HER HANDS. She touched the ketchup bottle, the silverware & MY FOOD. So DISGUSTING AND UNSANITARY. Then when I asked if the icecream was inside, her response was "it should be" and walked out to get back to smoking.
author: Reginne B.

description: The service was very fast, and the guy behind the counter wasn't very rude. The Miami Heat crepe that I got was doughy and undercooked, but the chicken on it was good. Maybe it was an off day because the rest of the food seems like it's better than my crepe was.
author: Brian K.

description: Excellent place for a sit-down breakfast. I had the Two-two-and two, because that's how I roll. Good eggs and pancakes. The chicken apple sausage was interesting. The best part about this place is that it's down the hill from where we are staying.  We will definitely be back.
author: Ricky W.

description: Based on the food: 4.5 stars. Based on the service: 2 stars. So I would average it to 3.5, not 4. Great little shop for brunch. The line is always out the door. There's wifi & Parking is terrible. The place is a bit tight with so many chairs and tables angled at every possible space available.  I would come back again for the food.
author: Daw M.

description: I loved this place! You wait in line to order then you sit down and they bring you your food. The wait was about 30 minutes to order and 5 minutes for the food. I ordered the baklava crepe and my mom ordered the chorizo scramble. I also ordered an iced chai tea. The baklava crepe was really good and tasted just like baklava. I wish that pistachios were used on the inside of the crepe to give a more traditional taste. The chorizo scramble was pretty tasty and came with potatoes and toast. I would recommend getting the regular chai tea instead of the iced. This place is great for breakfast and brunch!
author: Ismael P.

description: Mediocre food, tasteless coffee and one hour wait in line to order food.
author: Anca E.

description:
Came here for breakfast/brunch at around 10:30 on a Sunday morning with the fiancée after browsing on yelp. We waited about an hour to order... and total time until we actually ate from line to food was probably 1.5 hours. MAKE SURE YOU COME EARLY. You are assigned a table when you order so don't expect to have someone in line while you find a table to sit at. 

Honestly, I'm not too crazy about it. Their menu has a lot of options, and I saw one special that caught my eye... peanut butter crepe which included pb, marshmallows, Rice Krispies, and chocolate syrup. I added bananas to it just because I like bananas and pb. Fiancée ordered the 2/2/2 deal, and paid an extra $3 to add a few pieces of sourdough toast.

The crepe that I had kinda annoyed me. It was folded which is expected, but literally one side was all peanut butter and the other was bare with just the marshmallows... there were a few bananas in there only on the peanut butter side. I probably would have enjoyed it more if everything was mixed together then folded. And it was basically only lightly drizzled with Rice Krispies and chocolate syrup, I was expecting the Rice Krispies to be inside the actual crepe.
