The latte I ordered wasn't too bad, and it's nice they have complimentary lemon mint or orange infused ice water available. 

The Fiancée's breakfast was two eggs medium, two bacon, and two pancakes. She liked it, but basically was similar to IHOP in terms of quality and taste.

I think this place probably has really good food... maybe we just chose poorly. I would try this place again and maybe order one of the omelettes or specialty crepes that they have there.
author: Brian J.

description: Went here on my trip to San Francisco and it was really good! Get there early to avoid waiting in line. I ordered the salsa crepe and a hot mocha. Very much satisfied. Staff is very professional and are constantly moving around and checking on guests to make them happy.
author: Eliana A.

description: Ehh. I think this place is more about the look of the food then it is about taste. I got the Waffle and it was hard and a little crispy which I don't like. My mom got a burger and said it was burnt and it looked kind of gross. If you want breakfast that looks as good as it tastes go to 8AM near the wharf. Soooo much better than this place.
author: Victoria P.

description: I was quite excited about trying the food at this place because I was hungry but left underwhelmed. I ordered the Mediterranean crepe, the Strawberry Nutella crepe, two eggs with toast and potatoes, and the veggie sandwich. The bread for the veggie sandwich was too thick and not toasted and the sandwich as a whole lacked flavor. The potatoes which came as a side for everything savory I ordered were not good!! They lacked flavor, were mushy and not crunchy at all...and it's difficult for me to not like potatoes. The Mediterranean crepe was pretty good but nothing so special to come back here for. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this place, especially because there are sooooo many breakfast/brunch options in the city.
author: Taline M.

description:
Came here for brunch on a Sunday morning and my goodness, this place was packed! (Which I think is expected on a Sunday morning, but still). What I really liked about this place is that you don't need to wait to get seated and wait for someone to take your order. You get in line and once your right about next in line, someone will ask how many is in your party and save a table for you! 

I got the chorizo scramble and it was so so so so yummy! It's a good amount of food and it comes with toast. My friends both got their crabcake clementine which I tried and it was amazing. I suggest ordering these items. Definitely worth it.
author: Gielliane D.

description: My wife and I waited in line for 20 minutes on a weekday morning, but from the reviews we thought it would be worth it. My food came but somehow they lost my wife's plain Belgian waffle. The people that sat down after us got their waffle and were finishing eating and she still didn't have her waffle. I got a refund for the waffle and got my tip back. Won't be returning.
author: Richard M.

description: Not sure what all the hype is about. From the time we waited in line to when we received our food, it took about an hour. I don't mind a long wait as long as the food is tasty, but this cafe definitely disappointed. We ordered the savory Mediterranean crepe and Nutella strawberry crepe. My savory dish was just alright. There were too many vegetables and too little cheese to hold it together and it was very bland. Not to mention the crepe was on the thick doughey side. Same issue with the Nutella crepe, as it's dough was also thick. Crepes are supposed to be thin and crispy. This review is for the foodies who rely on yelp to help choose a spot; I don't recommend.
author: Taline S.

description:
Very busy place! Went there around noon and they were packed. I was able to find a seat though. The staff was attentive and polite. Food came out very quickly. I ordered the North Beach crepe with potatoes. The potatoes were not good at all. They were cold and a mix between burnt and/or sitting out for a long time. I hope that was a one off. 

The crepe was very delicious though! An ample amount of filling for the size. I'd definitely go back and try another flavor.
author: Brooke S.

description: A line out the door is a good sign! Our first day in San Fransisco and we decided to try this place out. It was delicious. Great coffee, quick and efficient service, and of course, great crepes! I chose savory (Torino) and hubby chose sweet (Lemon). Both were excellent, although I would have liked a little bit of sauce or cream in mine. It lacked just a touch of something moist. Overall, it was great and would definitely go again.
author: Jennifer H.

description: We tried everything, can't go wrong with anything. Great service! Kids loved it. Seating arrangements are first come first serve , food came out quick !
author: Hernan T.

description:
My experience?  A whole lot of nuttin, Honey.

It has a strange business operation, as other reviewers have mentioned.  The gigantic wall menu is retro-1970s, but it doesn't help this poorly managed restaurant.

Pei Wei is a similar business concept, but at Pei Wei they are usually well-staffed, well-trained, and friendly.  Most importantly, the food at Pei Wei comes out fresh, flavorful and hot.   

Mediocre would be a compliment to describe the food at Honey Honey.
I ordered the New Orleans crepe with a bagel and coffee. Needlessly expensive, bland and boring.  The bagel was flavorless and over-toasted. 
The coffee? It had water and it was brown. 

I've had better bagels and coffee out of a vending machine.

Honey Honey...go away away.  San Francisco deserves much better.
author: Jeremy B.

description: I love Breakfast. Very tasty. Large portions, price is good, service is fast. I'll be back again if I'm in San Francisco!
author: Kristina G.

description:
It's been 2 hours and we haven't even gotten our food yet. The line is made long due to poor service. We wanted a decent breakfast since it's near our hotel. The prices aren't that cheap, the utensils are dirty. 

Update:
Finally got our food: breakfast crepe and a Philly cheesesteak crepe. Lots of cheese. The food is OK. Would have preferred to get McDonald's breakfast. I don't know how this place got 4 stars. I think it's more appropriate at 3 stars. Based on my experience. I will give it 2 stars, 1 star for each hair I found in my food.
author: Alex K.

description: This place is amazing! The crepes are delicious, the orange juice is fresh and it's over a cosy place to eat.
author: Leslie R.

description: Amazing food for breakfast and lunch. I've been here a couple times while on vacation, and mostly everything that me and my family ordered was great. The only problem was that it was always crossed, and we had to wait over half an hour to get in every time we went. Asides from that, the food was great, and I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Alex H.

description: The wifey and me chose this place because it was close to our hotel...looks as if it gets a lot of foot traffic especially since I waited in line for about 20 minutes. I ordered the chorizo scramble and the wifey ordered the dulce de leche crepes. Small portions which is probably best but the prices were a bit high. I would return if all other brunch places were out of the question.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Great find when traveling to SF! The Nutella crepe was amazing as was the cappuccino! Fun music and atmosphere!
author: Veronika L.

description:
Crepes were a little thick and fluffy, more like a pancake than a crepe but still enjoyed the food
Service was very fast, fresh squeezed OJ was great
author: Leslie L.

description:
I was tasked with breakfast this morning, his words surprise me. Ordered Breakfast and Miami Crepes it was good, especially loved the fresh squeezed orange juice. 

My only suggestion, a To-go order line for walk-ins.
author: Julia M.

description:
When it comes to a place that serves crepes... 1- It's hard to find a good spot with multiple options for both sweet and savory. 2- It's hard to find a place that not only serves crepes, but much, much more. 3- It's hard to find a delicious "breakfast/brunch" crepe spot that doesn't close at 2 or 3 in the afternoon. 

This place checked off so many boxes in my book. Open until the evening, the food was absolutely amazing, and they had quick service. We liked it so much we ate here twice in two days. Highly recommended.
author: Ashleigh F.

description:
Went here for a late brunch seeing as how it was incredibly close to where I was staying. The place was barely 2 streets away.

I ordered the crab cake benedict, my mother ordered the chocolate Belgian waffle, and my dad ordered the Miami Heat crepe. The crab cake was good. It was slightly on the "fishy" side of the taste spectrum which personally I enjoyed, but I know others might not. The potatoes were crispy and slightly overdone, which is how I like my potatoes but again, others might dislike this. The Belgian waffle was well done. It was properly portioned and quite aesthetically pleasing. It wasn't outstanding but it's not like I expected it to be some five-star Michelin diner. The Miami heat crepe was a highlight. The dough was so soft and the ingredients inside were fresh and full of flavor. 

The atmosphere was alright. Same old diner type setting. I do have to comment on the sanitation of the place. It's relatively dirty compared to the rest of the places we've visited in the city. The cups for water seemed really old but at least the service was decent. 

3/5. Decent food but nothing outstanding. Basic diner setting. Decent service.
author: Miguel R.

description:
First time having a non-sweet crepe and I'm glad I did it here. I came here twice and had the Chicken Pesto Crepe (4 stars) and then had the Miami Heat Crepe (5stars) next time. 

I recommend the Miami Heat Crepe if you like spicy or chilaquiles. 

Seating can be tough but they try to assign seating as you order so that helps a ton from those people who try and save seats while others stand in line (while you stand ready to eat your food)--Don't be that guy/girl.
author: Eric S.

description:
After a hangry walk around the block trying to find a place for brunch, we decided to stop here because the reviews seemed pretty good! There's a huge menu display when you walk in and you order what you want at the register and they'll bring it to you. I'm indecisive and everything sounded so good, but I settled with the Half Moon Bay savory crepe. The crepe is thick... like thick thick. The crab cake was kinda bland and definitely needed more salt. I really like the concept of crab cakes in a crepe though. It comes with a choice of fresh fruit or potatoes! I got the fresh fruit, and you can see them slice tons of fresh fruit in the back. 

There's an orange squeezer for fresh orange juice and it tastes pretty darn good. Seating can be limited, especially if it's gets busier. The staff is friendly so overall, a great experience!
author: Jenni T.

description: Given the 4 star yelp review thought the food would be great. It was okay. The strawberries were old in the crepe and looked as though they were soaked in preservatives. They had barely any red color. The crepe itself was good. I've had better. Potatoes were the only great food I ate here. We tried a little bit of everything - hamburger, egg dish-all okay.
author: michael b.

description:
Delicious, plenty of ootions on the menu, and the portions are huge. The crab cake florentine is my favorite, and I definitely recommend the fresh squeezed orange juice to go with anything. 

There can be a pretty long wait though. It's been 30-45min of a line wrapped outside the building every time I've been, even mid-week.
author: M M.

description: Crepes here are a must! Super flavorful food and the homemade bloody Mary's are good with solid spice to them. I would stop by if you are in town, but it does get crazy crowded. Also, they assign tables, so don't try and steal one while a friend waits in line
author: Adam C.

description: Wonderful food! My husband and I both had the Milano omelette with mimosas. Good pricing, nice atmosphere, casual, great food.
author: Kristen P.

description: This place is a fire hazard. Stay away. The manager continues to pack them in. There is no room to move.
author: Oui D.

description: My best friend and I decided to grab some brunch and this place was perfect! It was around 12 o'clock pm when we arrived and the line was not too long. It is a semi small place, but after we ordered - we were lucky enough to have gotten a seats near the wall where the huge menu is located! Our food was served around 12:20! I ordered eggs benedict while my best friend ordered a nutella banana crepe with a side of potatoes! The potatoes are definitely what the key to deliciousness is here! My best friend also ordered the orange juice and she loved it!
author: Karla M.

description: Not worth the wait for the quality and price of food.  Sausage overcooked and overloaded with spice on Benedict and Potatoes.  Overall spent $42 without tip for 2 breakfast mains, two plain coffees and one small OJ.  Could have stayed at Ritz for this price with better quality.
author: Mesha C.

description: I don't get the hype. We drove by here about 6 times and figured we'd be blown away based on the constant lines. We decided to give it a shot during off hours to get in on whatever was worth a long wait. We don't get it. The crepes were fine but now worth standing in line for. The crab cake sandwich was pretty good but nothing special. The fries had no taste. The Bloody Mary was too spicy to drink. We left full but not overwhelmed and would never wait in line to eat here.
author: Erin F.

description: The crepes are incredible and my wife said the vanilla latte is the best she has ever had!
author: Kramer L.

description: This place is EXCELLENT. Went here for dinner our first night in town and everything was delicious. So we went back for breakfast. Wonderful customer service and great menu for breakfast, lunch, dinner AND dessert. Highly recommend. Quality food.
author: Nicole O.

description:
We were craving for some eggs benedict breakfast, and Yelp had such good reviews for this place that we just had to swing by. We waited for about 30 minutes in line to finally order and get a table. They did have a good system of making sure you have a table after you order so the two stars are for that. 

However, the food did not get any stars from us. We ordered crab cake Benedict and the chocolate waffle. 

Eggs Benedict-  The poached eggs were really over cooked and are just like hard boiled eggs. It was disappointing to cut your eggs Benedict and not see the eggs running. The crab cakes were ok and a little burnt.

Chocolate waffle- visually, it looked amazing. As we took our first bite, something tasted off. The batter was completely off and tasted more like a bread than a waffle.

Unfortunately, we will not go back to this place. A 30minute wait is not worth for the food we got. Maybe stick to their crepes but we did not get to try those and are not willing to anymore after this experience.
author: Mara G.

description: Service was not good, had lipstick on the cup with my coffee. Wait was long. Food was pricey for the quality. We waited in line 20 minutes before getting to the counter to order
author: Nick H.

description: This cafe is right in the theatre district, and if you're ubering, your driver probably won't drop you off right at the front of the store but at the bottom of the hill. A quick 5 min walk later, entering Honey Honey Cafe is a relief. It is so homey and personal, with a build board of their whole menu visible from the back of the room. I got the Nutella strawberry crepe and a chai latte. Undoubtedly the best meal of the day.
author: Isabelle V.

description: Had a crepe with strawberries and Nutella. Crepe was very good. Service was somewhat slow but they were busy for the hour. Overall the place was welcoming and food was tasty.
author: Maya B.

description: It was worth the wait. We arrived around 11:00 on a Sunday morning & had to wait in line outdoors for about half and hour before we were welcomed in. Once inside, there's an amazing menu of crepes and other offerings to order from before being seated. We didn't wait long for our (delicious) food, and by keeping the line outside, it kept the restaurant from feeling overcrowded. We had 3 varieties of crepes - 2 savory and one desert, and they were all great.
author: Melissa C.

description: Get the nutella crepe and cappacino.  Pancakes and blintz are good but the nutella crepe is why this place is so busy.  Side note, pricey and not much seating available inside so bring warm clothes in case you need to eat at the outside tables.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I was just looking for a quick bite near the hotel... WOW! This place is great!

The Dungeness are in season, so I tried the Crab Cake Benedict, but this is also a crepery, so my companion feasted on a Mediterranean Crepe chocked full of olives, onions, artichoke hearts, cheddar, feta and avocado. Both dishes were accompanied by the best home-style,  fried potatoes I've had in years.

This is a wonderful find in the Theater District near Union Square (and within the shadow of San Francisco's original Trader Vic's on Cosmos which closed in 2004). The sandwiches look great too, but breakfast is served daily until 3 pm.
author: Mark O.

description: Excellent place to eat. Crapes were excellent all ingredients were extremely fresh And create a venue. Little pricey but to be expected for being in San Francisco. Be prepared to wait a bit in line but the wait is well worth it.
author: Daniel A.

description: All the dishes were very tasty. Son had the best looking breakfast burrito, it tasted great too. I had the breakfast crepe with salad. It was perfect.
author: Kim H.

description: This is our second time to eat here for breakfast. Even with a line always out the door the food is worth the wait. I love the eggs Benedict. My hubby always gets some type of crepe and says they are delicious. They make a great cappuccino, but if oranges are t in season steer clear of the OJ, it was almost like water. Very friendly staff and extremely efficient at getting everyone in, fed, and out with a smile on their face!
author: Krystal F.

description: Great place for breakfast, had the French toast with ice coffee and the bagel with avocado cream cheese and sun dried tomato.
author: Manuel G.

description: Came here as a result of my Yelp search. Line was out the door but travels pretty quickly. Had the Acapulco omelette. Delish! Could have been a little bit warmer. I like the fact that they can serve soy and or almond milk with your coffee or tea. Salmon Bagel was just regular. Nothing over the top. Definitely would go again.
author: Maria S.

description:
Honey Honey Cafe is a large and modestly priced quick service restaurant at Post and Taylor.  We were there with a small crowd waiting when the doors opened at 7:30 on a Sunday morning.  Considering that we were the first people coming into the the restaurant, we were blown away by how filthy the restaurant was.  It was like the tables had been "cleaned" with maple syrup.  Yuck-o.

The staff is efficient and hustles.  You order at the counter, and they will bring your food to you.  We ordered a salad and the crab cake benedict.  The Savannah salad was good albeit a bit odd.  The chopped romaine and spinach leaves were tossed in a sundried tomato vinaigrette, which was good.  The sliced apples and generous crumbles of blue cheese went well with it, but the candied pecans were overly sweet and the marinated artichoke hearts were just sort of weird.  It was an odd combination, but it was tasty (if you pulled out the artichokes).  The crab cake benedict was pretty good.  The crab cakes had very finely minced crab and were a little fishy tasting, but the eggs were a perfect soft poach and the hollandaise was excellent.  If I come again, I would stick with the eggs florentine and avoid the crab cakes.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
This is an excellent brunch place but I suggest getting here early! Like before 8am! We arrived at 830 and when we left at 915 the line was out the door and around the corner! It is relatively small for the crowd it draws but the food is so worth it. Nice large portions and delicious!

We did not try any crepes. We had french toast and a chorizo burrito. Both were fantastic and very filling. This is a must try in SF, just get there early am.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: The best crepe I've ever had was Honey Honey's Miami Heat. I didn't know eggs could taste this good. Sat on the sidewalk, which was really fun, although not terribly level.
author: Zach C.

description: This place is a hidden gem! An addition to the vide variety of crepes, they have a lot of other food options. My daughter got a salad with the sprouts, sunflower seeds and homemade dressing-very fresh and absolutely delicious. The portion was very generous. The dessert crapes were amazing-we had caramel with roasted pecans and vanilla ice-cream. They had an option for whipped cream as well. All the staff was very friendly and efficient. They made my day!
author: Maria P.

description: Savory crepes here are amazing.  But I had to leave room for the Blintz dessert.  You have to stop by Honey Honey for an amazing meal or treat.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Yum! First, it was refreshing to walk into an intimate restaurant in SF without tripping over a homeless person. Honey Honey also has clean restrooms and a spacious dining area. 

We tried the fettuccini franchese, the salsa crepe and the club with fries. The Alfredo sauce was so rich and creamy (and the bread rocked too). The club was made on sourdough and my husband called the fries "perfectly cooked". I opted for the salsa crepe and it was AMAZING. Admittedly, it was my first crepe, but if they're all like this...YUM! 

You do order at a counter and have the food brought to you, but they were very polite. 

So far this is one of my faves in SF!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Line was out the door and around the corner, ratings were good so I stopped by. Below average food, on par with Denny's and more expensive. If you want a lovelt breakfast for about $5 more head down the street to Taylor Street Cafe.
author: Rosa H.

description: The menu was so big and I wanted everything on it! My food was delicious I just wish I lived in SF so I could try it all. I got one of the specials.
author: Sarah R.

description: The Eden crepe was really good. If you like salty food because of salmon and capers. Overall great food. The menu is very diverse but simple to understand. The music in the background was popping. And great service, but you have to wait in line for 20-30 min because it gets packed.
author: Mateo M.

description: Great menu selections for vegetarians! There were so many things I wanted to try. Had the salsa crepes and also some desert crepes. The line was it the door but we were able to get in, seated, get food, and get out quickly! Highly recommend.
author: Mia B.

description: We were visiting San Fransicso and we found this restaurant on yelp. I'm glad we did. The food was delicious. The orange juice was fresh, they  freshly squeeze oranges. There was even a line out the door (that's how you know a place is good). I would come back here if we visited again.
author: Kianna S.

description: Long line / coffee has no flavor / food was ok but not incredible . For the price it's definitely not the best place to go
author: Delphine S.

description: Best place for breakfast in San Francisco. The food is really good and the staff it's so nice. They are always smiling and they are really fast. We tried the French toast, the bagel with avocado and tomato, eggs with potatoes and bacon and the honey honey cake (delicious cake with caramel and honey). Everything was absolutely delicious. We order bacon, but it was missing in the comand, so when we ask for it they brought it for free. So nice! We will go back for sure.
author: Cris C.

description: I liked it overall in terms of both food quality and service.  The Belgian waffles, omelet, and potatoes as well as French fries were all excellent.  My only reservation was that the union square burger, which I had cooked to med well, was a bit too hard to chew, i.e. not tender enough.  But then burgers aren't their specialty I suppose.  Other than that, the place had a nice vibe to it.
author: Nevil S.

description:
This place came recommended by the hotel concierge when we came to San Francisco. We stayed three days and ended up coming back all three days. Lines usually go out the door at breakfast time. 
It helps that the menu is right on the wall so you can make your selections while you wait. I had a hard time choosing my dishes because everything looked , or rather sounded so good. I had a chorizo omelette with home fried potatoes, and it was to die for! I also had waffles with strawberries and  cream cheese topping, and eggs Benedict. YUM!
 
The place is very rustic and simply decorated. It reminds me a little bit of Panera but more cluttered. it is on the messy side because of the sheer amount of people that come and go. It is very hard to get a table, so when you do you grab it and hold on to it for dear life. Great food at very affordable prices. It is a must!!
author: Tairyn A.

description:
When I went here, I couldn't decide between having a sweet or a savory crêpe... so obviously, I went for both. The lemon crêpe I had was quite sweet, but I guess that's what I was asking for. Still very good. I also enjoyed the savory Miami Heat crêpe I ordered.

The actual place is pretty cute! Although there was a long line when I went, I think it was worth the wait for my first visit there.
author: Jen A.

description:
Deeeee LISH!

And such a big menu! When I came here on a Monday morning, was shocked to find the line going out the door, ouch. But crepes sounded amazing so we decided to wait it out, plus it gave plenty of time to deliberate between the many, many things on the menu. The board is beautiful and very easy to read (once you get to the inside part of the line). 

We figured there would be no chance to sit down, luckily people move in and out pretty fast and it's a large space. Furthermore, a staff member is constantly cleaning tables and asking how many you have in your group in order to get you seated. 

I ordered the Miami Heat, so good! Generous amounts of avocado and cheddar. And the heat was there! My friend got a strawberry Nutella crepe, I tried a bite and was in heaven. Love how you have the option of fruit or potatoes, definitely went for the fruit and it was so fresh. Prices are also extremely reasonable, especially for the area! 

Worth the wait, and trust me, you'll be waiting!
author: Sasha L.

description:
It was delicious, I would love to go back for lunch. It is pretty crowded and the tables are small so it is a get in get out place. 
I had the chocolate chip waffles with bacon on top. Very good. The service was very friendly. The prices were fair.
author: S M.

description:
The Miami Heat Crepe was the bomb! We ordered that and eggs Benedict and wish we had gotten two of the Miami Heat. The Benedict was good too but the crepe was something else
Service was fast. Food was great and the potatoes were super tasty!
author: Hanna G.

description:
Mediocre crepes for ~$12 with tax. Good place if you have a breakfast craving - they've got egg scrambles, waffles and pancakes amongst their large menu of sandwiches and salads.

If you're looking for crepes, alternative crepes locations: st Germain has buckwheat batter, crossroads cafe is cheaper (~$9)

- MIAMI HEAT CREPE ($11.91): chicken tasted like it belonged in a burrito and crepe batter was forgettable. Ok amount of avocado, mushrooms weren't really cooked
 - STRAWBERRY AND NUTELLA CREPE (~$8): strawberries too mushy and Nutella tasted more like chocolate syrup. Too sweet overall, including the ice cream that came with it

Service relatively slow (to order and receive food). Water cups smelled super heavily of bleach... Had to ask for a disposable cup. 

Outdoor seating available.
author: Kristie C.

description: Good breakfast spot.  I had the Chorizo scramble which was just okay.  Quick service, you order in a line and find a seat. Basic decor.  A few tables located outside.
author: Tarra T.

description: This place was packed on a Monday morning around 9am but the food was just ok. I had the chicken spinach and mushrooms crepe with hollandaise. I added an egg. The hollandaise was bland and almost non existent. The runny yolk from the egg helped. The filling in the crepe was good. Customer service was good. If I were to go back I would order something different.
author: Mel R.

description:
I visited SF before Xmas and a co-worker of mine actually recommended this place for breakfast so I made it appoint to me check it out and see what the food was like... 

I came in on a Friday morning and it wasn't to packed at all. As we stood in line we were checking out the cute big menu along the wall ... SO MANY FOOD OPTIONS!! As we got up to order the lady taking orders was either upset she had to be at work or just didn't care for her customers, she was very short and not welcoming at all. I ordered a simple egg and bacon breakfast (can't ever go wrong with that) and had a coffee ... the food was okay! 

We sat outside because the inside just didn't look clean, I felt like the floors needed to be swept and the tables should have been more on top off. 

I wouldn't highly recommend this place but if your looking for something quick before your bike ride at fisherman's wharf then this isn't to bad.
author: Crystal D.

description:
This place is severely under rated in my opinion.

The wife and I walked here after checking out another place that was higher rated but was too busy.

You do need to order before you sit, so we had about a 10 minute wait before we were able to order. While waiting, a gentlemen came around and let us know which table number we would sit at, so you do not need to fight over seating.

My wife had a sandwich which she thoroughly enjoyed. I had the pesto crepe which was phenomenal. We shared the Blintz Dessert Crepe and that was a visual masterpiece (see our picture). 

The prices are extremely fair for what you get and the food was plentiful. My wife and I will be back next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Jason M.

description:
As good as the reviews. The wait to eat was a little long, but with some very efficient handling of those dining, and those waiting, it is as smooth as babies bottom. 

Food was divine, and a fantastic value.
author: Robby M.

description: The eggs Benedict were a huge disappointment. I stood in a long line and felt cheated. I should have gotten a crepe. The crepes look a lot better. The orange juice was extremely fresh and I did like that.
author: Laura C.

description:
Okay..... was super excited to try this place... and well... I gotta say... service is everything.

We walk in and stand at the counter for about 5 minutes before anyone helped us... and we were the only ones "in line", and the place was pretty slow. 

We orders the Philly Cheese Steak Crepe with breakfast potatoes on the side for my babe and the Half Moon Bay Crepe with avocado and fries instead of the potatoes for me.

Our order arrives and mine has potatoes (which, by the way we're over salted), so I asked her about the fries.. she said the fries will be on the side... I was like okay? I said instead...... but nope.. she put it on the side, and we were charged and NOT TOLD THAT THEY CANT CANT SUBSTITUTE UNTIL THE FOOD ARRIVED!!! 

So... we did into our food and the avocado was in the wrong Crepe (babe is allergic)... 

So we tell them and she said "let me check if they can remake it." What? Check? You served someone the wrong food and you have to check?! 

Whatever, so I asked her to just bring my avocado on the side so they don't have to remake mine... so she did... the tiniest piece of avocado.. sliced.. they charge extra for avocado.. a dollar.. which is usually fine... but usually places give you a good amount.. take Chipotle and their guac for example. 

Last thing.... when you place the order at the counter, you pay right away and there is a tip option... which basically forces you to leave a tip unless you click other and type in 0.00................ 

I'm usually a great tipper... but crap like this makes me not wanna tip....

Even though.... I did leave a tip because I was expecting it to be better and the service was shitty after we paid... great...

Not coming back here again... there's better crepe places with much better service. 

Crepe tastes good though.
author: Deanka S.

description: Crab cake Benedict  was very good! Baklava crepes were good but too sweet for my taste. We waited in line for about an hour on Saturday at 9am.
author: Rachel C.

description: Loved this place. Very cute inside.  Had to wait 30 minutes but that's expected on a Saturday morning.  OJ was outstanding .  Had the 2/2/2 and pancakes. Both were good.  People at the service counter were quick and attentive.
author: Movenda Z.

description: What a broad menu! We enjoyed the eggplant crepe and the pesto crepe. The herbs in the eggplant crepe were spot on. Also the potatoes were amazing! The side salad was good, too. The nutella banana crepe was super tastey and warm. Staff were very friendly, and the wait time was negligible. We'll be back!
author: Emma F.

description:
IF YOU'RE STANDING IN LINE READING THIS...STAY IN LINE ; P
We were in SF for 2 days and had craving for crepes...so of course we yelped =)
So glad we picked this place. 
SERVICE: When we 1st arrived the line was out the door (always a good sign) I went to front of line and asked a gentleman (maybe manager?) How long wait would be for party of 10. He informed me approx 20 min, and that by the time we got to order, he would have table for us. He was extremely courteous and friendly. 
As he promised, by the time we got to cashier to order, he had set up a table for our party. (So far so good)
FOOD: (drool) We tried several crepes: the Baklava, Breakfast, SVP, and the North beach...all delicious. Couple of the teenagers ordered the fettuccine franchese (which i sampled...WOW)
The 2 2 2 was tasty, as was the chorizo scramble (hubbys fav dish) he was quiet satisfied
OVERALL: Go, eat, enjoy!! This is def a do-over next time we're in town =)
author: Judi B.

description: Great breakfast - you order at the counter and they bring the food to you. Food came pretty quick. Coffee was good. It's a little on the pricier end of breakfast but was worth a visit
author: Ron G.

description:
Perfect for a quick bite in a not so fancy place. Cappuccino is Huge and very recommended.

Crepes are tasty, my favorite in savory is the Miami heat. Ask For no cheese if you remember to.
author: Nadia C.

description:
Do not order through yelp
They do not deliver or will have any record of your order when you get there
Always busy and food not that amazing for the prices
3 breakfasts will run you $60 plus
author: Vadim D.

description: Delicious breakfast. Honestly everything was good here, wish my appetite was bigger to order more. Recommend strongly!
author: Lourdes W.

description: Insane wait for standard diner breakfast food, but it's one of the few breakfast places whose sole specialties is *not* toast. There's a decent quantity of seating though and the line moves reasonably. It's a fine option in San Francisco when everything else is overly trendy with an impossible line.
author: Iris H.

description:
A short line-up to get in early on a Sunday morning. You order and pay first before being seated - but the food was brought out pretty quickly, and was made perfectly. 

I had the chicken pesto crepe with potatoes, and it was delicious. They're coffee (I had a latte) was top-notch. The staff were helpful and friendly. Would visit again.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Crab Cake Florentine...yay or nay? I'd actually say I've had better. After wandering to Coit Tower and building up an appetite, my friend and I looked on Yelp for places near Union Square to have brunch at. We found Honey Honey and looked at the Yelp photos and decided the crab cake florentine looked good (and we were starving and tired of walking). 

When we got there, the line was out the door. We'd wait in that line for another 30 minutes before having our order taken. When we finally got inside, there were four menu boards with many items. It was at that point when my friend and I realized we'd been here before and hadn't been impressed. However since we were hungry and because of other positive reviews, we decided to stay. 

We both ordered the crab cake florentine which also included a side of country potatoes. The presentation of the dish was definitely photo worthy and the poached egg was nicely done. However, upon eating the crab cake I was turned off. It was pretty salty and fishy tasting. At one point, I even ate a shell and had to spit it out after hearing it crunch between my teeth. 

So why 2.5-3 stars? The service was excellent. The place is small and so I was concerned about finding a table but they indicate where you can sit when you're about to order. Once we ordered, we only waited maybe 7 minutes for our food to come out. The poached eggs were done well though one was more runny than the other. I did like the seasoning on the country potatoes. 

My friend felt a little sick after we left and we don't know if we can attribute it to her dish. We've decided to pass on this restaurant in the future but it seems like others enjoy it so it may be personal preference in this case.
author: Olivia C.

description: Not sure what all the fuss is about. Long line and wait to order and be seated. Then when you finally get the food it's nothing spectacular. Pretty average food, same as you'd find at a diner. The crepes we had for breakfast weren't very sweet (even with the syrup they tasted salty) and seemed better for making lunchtime crepes. It's okay but not worth all the hype.
author: Cesar L.

description: Love this place! I ordered the eggs & potatoes & my fiancé had the Two Two & Two. Overall it was pretty good, the customer service was nice & the wait was a little over 15 minutes. They have a nice system going on.
author: Evelyn M.

description: Came here on a rainy morning and it did not disappoint. The crepes were yummy. My daughter ordered the strawberry and nutella crepe and loved it. My husband ordered an omelette and the veggies were cooked well. Overall it was a yummy breakfast spot with a cute interior decor. We did happen to get there before it opened and waited in a short line for them to open the door (and then still had some hot shot business men decide they needed to cut in front of our family with 3 small children to order their food first even though we had been waiting there first). The disorganization out front was a little annoying and having to order at the counter and find a seat would be hard as the place fills up. Definitely worth a try if you are in the area.
author: Nina S.

description: Long ass line but food is good. I ended up going there about 3 times after being in San Francisco for about 9 days. I had the Belgium waffles with a side of scrabble eggs and the other two times I had the Nutella and strawberry crepe with an extra side of fruit cup and two eggs. Worth the wait!
author: Kenia G.

description:
This place exceeded my friend and my expectation!!!!  We weren't expecting much from a restaurant located in a bad neighborhood but figured we'll try it anyways since it's 3 blocks away from our hotel and has such good reviews.

We walked in around 9:00 AM on a Friday and there was quite a line already but it moved pretty quickly!  You make your order and they give you a number in which you can place on a table.  When your food is ready - someone comes over and brings you the food according to the number on your table.  If you ordered a drink - you actually get it right away!

We ordered an Iced Chai and Hot Latte - both were really good especially the Iced Chai!!!  The flavor wasn't too underwhelming or overwhelming... it was PERFECT.  We also got the Salmon Benedict and a side order of Bacon.  The egg was perfectly poached and the salmon was really fresh.  Our order came 5 minutes after we placed it - talk about FAST! 

By the time we're done with our food, the line was OUT THE DOOR!  I recommend coming here early if you want to try out this place!!!
author: Racheal D.

description:
Be ready to wait super super long just to order. 
I had the eggs Benedict, my husband had the salmon Benedict and we ordered a nutella banana crêpe. The food was very good, but I had to give it a 3 star because the wait is just way to long. The four seasons in Palo alto has an eggs Benedict that I ordered from room service that taste basically the same as this one. So the wait is just now worth it for me.
author: Elena I.

description: Big location with lots of options. Went here to get crepes as a late night snack. It tasked fine. Normal crepes, but our mistake was getting take out :(! I think it would've tasted better if we stayed in the location and ate the crepes there, but it was pretty packed and hot int he restaurant so we opted to go home and eat. Price wise - they were fair in their price in relation to the portion and the quality of food served.  Thus, recommend checking this place out.
author: Okapi C.

description: This place has the best savory crepes I've ever eaten. And of all the crepe places I went in SF, this was by far the best. I had the chicken pesto crepe with mozzarella instead of Swiss.
author: Hayley L.

description:
The food here is worth 5 stars but I had to give them three stars because our food came out after SIX other tables received their food even after they ordered after us. They have a great selection so everyone will find something they like here. 

I had the 2-2-2 and I substituted chorizo for my
Meat and potatoes for the eggs. It was wonderful. The pancakes were delicious. The potatoes were perfectly seasoned and the chorizo had great flavor. 

My hubby had the oatmeal and didn't like it because it was too soupy. (I hear you asking "why would one order oatmeal at a place known for gray food", all I can say is "that's a great question" as I have never heard anyone say that oatmeal was  great anywhere. lol). He also did not like the apple chicken sausage as the flavor was bland and then long flat patties were unappealing to the eye. 
want so badly to give this place 

I will be back!
author: Tamara A.

description: A strong choice if you are around or on the way to work. Crepes and omlettes are good here. Enjoy variety of taste with your own mood in the morning. If lineup is long, just go somewhere else. This is good, but also many good choices around within 2 blocks
author: Jun O.

description:
My bestie invited a mutual friend and myself here for brunch. We had a "day in the city" planned out and this was our first stop. 

Although the line appeared overwhelmingly long, the wait time was actually pretty short; it was actually perfect timing as our trio decided on what we were each going to order. There's plenty to choose from on the menu! 

I chose the breakfast crepe. It was relatively good, I like a lot of flavor, which the crepe lacked, but it wasn't anything a little bit of Tabasco couldn't fix. 
The potatoes were DELICIOUS! They were well-seasoned and well-prepared! 
I also ordered a mimosa, which tasted good but was kind of on the warm side. It would have been delicious had it been served cold! 

My bestie ordered a waffle, and our other friend ordered the French toast; both were very good! 

Overall, the service was good, the staff was friendly and attentive. I would definitely go back and absolutely recommend it!
author: Jessica G.

description: if you want good crab cake, don't come here. We left all the crab cake . The crab cake is the worst taste i ever had. it's not fresh and tastes very Sour. Other things are okay.
author: Zhihao L.

description: A quaint little spot for breakfast & lunch. Parking garage nearby on Taylor & walking distance to the pop-up Color Factory. Be prepared for a long wait to order. Took us about 30 min on Tuesday around 11am to order but the meals came out within 10 min. We were a group of seven & they were able to get us a table fairly soon after ordering. I ordered the Salsa savory crepe - super good - with fruit, a cappuccino (almost got the OJ) & the SBK sweet crepe - very yummy - with ice cream. I enjoyed the food but not sure I am dying to go back, hence the one star deficit. But definitely a great spot if you're in the area & have some time to spend.
author: Parastou B.

description: Had the tuna sandwich and the iced chai. Very good quality and loved the athmosphere! The iced chai was a bit sweet for my taste but I really liked the sandwich. Fresh products and more than enough for me!
author: Sabine B.

description: Worst coffee ever, what a disgrace for coffee In a big city. And it was over priced.. guy serving the coffee looked like he hated his life
author: Khris T.

description: Amazing food! I tried almost every popular food of them in my 2 days layover in SF! LOL! Ask them about their best offers, they help you best!
author: Shima Z.

description: These guys know service. No sign up board, just get in line and read the huge menu on the wall at which point someone will ask how many in your party then assign you to a number that they put on the table they have assigned to you. You then place or order and have a seat, food will come. Most always a line out the door but quite efficient service and the food was great too!
author: TinaMarie B.

description:
Ordered a PB&J before going to the Commonwealth Club last night because I thought it would be quick. Got a regular butter & J instead and when I went back to ask for PB on it, I was told that if I hadn't been in a hurry they could have checked to make sure it was correct. 

Oh! I see. My fault. 

3 stars because the PB&J, when I finally got it, was good!

UPDATE: I got a reply message from the restaurant claiming that no one was blaming me, but then, in the same message, blaming me again:

"Being in a hurry doesn't give you the right to make me not double check the order before it's being delivered to you..."

The restaurant also made sure I knew that the PB was added "on the house without extra charges," which makes no sense because that's what I ordered and was already charged for. Lowering my number of stars due to this strange and argumentative response - still blaming the customer. Strange way to do business.
author: Morgan C.

description: Horrible experience. Waited 20 minutes in line. Staff slow as can be. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger medium....it came out like a piece of charcoal. The fries were also cold. Didn't bother to take it back as the place was sooooo busy. I ate a few bites because I was starving. McDonald's would be considered a gourmet burger nezt to this thing
author: Jeff V.

description: Where else can you get this much delicious food for such a great price? It would be wrong to take away any credit for the long line we experienced... that's just proof that the food is well worth the wait. Go see for yourself!
author: Tamesha C.

description:
Loved this place! I found it on a short walk from my hotel. I had the Miami Heat crepe, this is more of a spicy crepe but definitely worth it! I also had a cuppaccino and some orange juice! The juice was fresh and the cuppaccino was great as well. 
Went in around 9AM and it was quite busy. They had about a ten minute wait. It was definitely worth it!
author: Lupe S.

description: This cafe was a great brunch spot for my group as it gave us enough energy for an afternoon of shopping! I ordered the pesto crepe with a side of potatoes. The chunks of feta could have been crumbled more to have a more uniform flavor throughout the crepe. I found a couple really large chunks that made those few bites overly salty. After I broke it into smaller pieces, it was much more palatable. The potatoes were very tasty and well prepared. Great texture of potato (not hard, but not mushy) and good flavor as well. Their seating is quite plentiful and they were rather smart in their seating process. While you are standing in line, an employee assigns you a table and you let the cashier know which table you were assigned. The food you ordered is then brought to you. If someone tries to steal your table while you're in line, the employee will kindly ask them to sit elsewhere. Overall, great experience here.
author: Angela M.

description: We decided to walk about to find dinner without a reservation. Dulce de leche crepe was insane. Produce was fantastic! Definitely one of the best casual spots you can find for any type of meal. Will definitely be repeat customers!
author: Doug S.

description: This joint was a block away from our hotel and we were tired of grab and go food, so we decided to give this a try. Like almost every other restaurant in the area, it's an order and pay at the counter situation. At least they had table service. You order, pay, grab your number, and hope you can find a table. Fortunately it was quick turnaround for most so we didn't have to wait for a table. The line to order goes out the door and never appeared to slow so we had high hopes for good food. I ordered the Post St omelet with potatoes and he ordered the chicken something crepe with fresh fruit. Both were large and tasty, came out quickly, and the service we did experience was positive.
author: Brandi K.

description: Overall good crepes! I got the Nutella and chocolate crepe and it was crispy and sweet! My boyfriend got the blitz and it was a bit small. Good crepes but a little pricy for the size!
author: Katty X.

description: Located near our hotel we ate at honey honey four times. 2x for breakfast 2x for dinners. All meals were excellent but we felt breakfast was the real stand out. Family friendly- plenty of high quality choices to suit everyone's tastes. The lemon crepe was the stuff of my dreams (hubs would disagree as he's a Chocolate lover)
author: Aly E.

description: Excellent fresh squeezed orange juice and a delicious and varied menu. The pancakes are sumptuous and the breakfast burrito is sublime.  Honey honey is on my " to do" list whenever I'm in town.
author: Monda W.

description: Was so happy this place was nearby our hotel because the food looked incredible!! Our first day we unfortunately got there at 6 and they said no breakfast foods after 3, which was the meal that drew us to the places. The employee was kind enough to refer us to another cafe which served breakfast all day (I think that was good customer service rather than saying "I don't know"). The next day went back and enjoyed every bite!!
author: Amanda B.

description: Really enjoyed the Salmon Benedict. Will definitely be coming back next time I'm in SF
author: Max S.

description:
I'll start by saying that in order for me to ever come on Yelp and give a restaurant one star the situation truly has to be grim. 

We came here off of a friends recommendation (they hadn't eaten here yet, they saw the reviews on Yelp) and after verifying the 4 star rating on Yelp we figured it'd be ok to try this place out. 

We ordered a cheese and ham croissant with house potatoes and French toast and a tofu egg scramble along with house potatoes. 

The food came out and it looked promising.

As soon as we began eating my husband started picking through his potatoes. For whatever the reason something caught his attention. To our horror he pulled out an insect about half an inch long that resembled a cockroach/cricket. Long legs and definitely some sort of wings.

He pulled it out of his potatoes and we calmly got the attention of a man who seemed to be the manager or head chef (not sure). He came over, looked at the bug on the table which we explained was in the potatoes and without saying a word went and summoned the cashier. (Not even an apology or sign of some sort of shame or remorse that this is the food coming out of his kitchen.) The cashier came over to our table and when we showed her the bug she at-least apologized and offered us a refund. 

Needless to say, we took our money and left. I have never had such an experience. I would truly reconsider coming and eating at this establishment. 

Disgusting to say the least. Clearly, there is an issue with kitchen cleanliness and that's a problem.

I truly regret not taking a photo of the bug as initially I wasn't going to come on here and write this review. But it would b a disservice to anyone coming to eat here and not making them aware of the posible risk.
author: Desiree Z.

description:
My favorite breakfast place in SF, perfectly located near our hotel, of course. 
They have an enormous amount of dishes to choose from. As I am a pancake fanatic, I do not recall if I had other food. Anyway the pancakes are great! 
The coffee is also very good! Sometimes I went just for the coffee. 
If you are very hungry, however, stay away during lunch hours.. Then you'll have a line throughout the door and no place to sit. This might also occur in the morning, I wouldn't know as I was on vacation and my mornings were pretty late.
author: Nina R.

description: Good food, nice service. Came with a group of 3 and they even helped find a table for us (it's self seating). Would come again if I'm around town and want a crepe :)
author: Christina U.

description:
This is a must try spot if you visit San Fran. What else could you ask for beside good food and awesome service?!
Dont be terrified if you see a long line The staff  manage to keep it moving fast. Parking is a little crazy out here You might want to try street parking Or else they have a garage next door for $4.5 per 15 mins.
author: Cuc P.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised by Honey Honey Cafe and Crepery! 

My friend and I walked in after trying to find a place to satisfy our brunch cravings. We ultimately settled on sharing two plates - crab cake florentine and a cheese blintz. The crab cake florentine was excellent. Crab cakes with hollandaise sauce is certainly an experience to have! I also really liked that the crab cakes had an ample amount of fresh crab instead of an overload on the breading. The blintz was also very good. The crepe was light and fluffy and housed a delicious mix of ricotta and strawberry preserves.

The atmosphere is very similar to squat & gobble/crepevine but I was more impressed with the quality here. Entrees weren't too expensive and there were definitely some creative dishes that caught my eye. The scent of constantly fresh squeezed orange juice was also amazing (but $3.95/cup is pretty expensive).
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Without a doubt this place has delicious food and their orange juice is fresh squeezed. 
Beware- of those cups that are piled up for you to grab and serve yourself either a lemon lime or orange water from their dispenser. Just poured myself some water, sat down and saw what looked like chapstick lip remnants on my cup. I wiped it and sure enough I was right. Gross.
Tip- buy a beverage and you'll get a fresh glass. When your done with your drink refill with the water. Hope this helps!
author: Julianna F.

description:
Good variety of crepes and other breakfast items.  

Gets busy right off he bat so I would recommend being there early or be patient for the wait.
author: Brandon G.

description: You walk in and the line is out the door. It might take a little while, but it's worth it. The Crêpe's are fantastic, the scrambles are tasty and the staff is as efficient as they can be while managing the sheer number of diners coming through the door. I had the "SBK" and my boyfriend had the chorizo scramble and a Nutella strawberry Crêpe. Everything was just yummy and filling. I highly recommend that you visit this place!
author: Suzette N.

description:
Crepes are great but don't get the eggs Benedict. 
The muffin is old, the Canadian bacon is tasteless and tough and the egg is cooked hard.  Underwhelmed. Not worth the wait.
author: James T.

description: The system they use here is ridiculous, it slows down everything. After standing in line for 30 min, we were squished at a small table. The food was decent, the home fries are really good, but one of my two eggs in my eggs benedict was hard boiled? The french toast was okay. I think the best thing was their home fries. It basically seemed like a wannabe Crepevine.
author: Madyn G.

description: Even though we had to wait in line for 15 min on Sunday morn, it was worth it. Great breakfast. Love the fresh squeezed OJ and fresh fruit served with crepes. Love how quickly they served us!
author: Bill S.

description: Everything the reviews said and better. Favorite place in SF. The food was fresh and the taste was exceptional. Had the peanut butter crepes with marshmallow and rice crispies plus eggs Benedict. The line was long but moved very fast.  The restaurant ran extremely efficient for the volume of business that they do
author: Kyle F.

description: Just ok. The coffee was horrendously gross for $3. The salmon scrambler was cold by the time I got it and we were the first ones in. In total we paid $30 for mediocre food.
author: Carleen K.

description: I love stoping here when I am in the city. I usually get the strawberry Nutella crepe it's amazing! Most times I stop in and get to go so I can enjoy back at the place I stay as I rest my feet from walking all day. I bet other items on the menu are great but I always go for more of the desert crepe. Highly suggest this place and they have free WiFi.
author: Jessica S.

description: The playing and everything was great but nothing to remember. Service is kinda of a self service type, in the busy streets of SF.
author: Trinity T.

description: Pretty neat hole-in-the-wall place that is phenomenal for brunch. They have sweet and savory crepes, as well as a variety of breakfast and lunch items. The fresh squeezed orange juice is a must!
author: Eric S.

description: The line was out the door when we arrived on a Sunday morning but it moved faster than expected. The tables are assigned while in line so you don't have to worry about finding a place to sit. There are lots of good vegetarian options. The Florentine and Eggplant crepes are both great. Don't miss the fresh squeezed orange juice. The espresso drinks aren't so great. They're made in a hurry by the person working the register. Overall I enjoyed the experience and would be happy to return next time I'm in the area.
author: Alex B.

description:
Lines must be a san francisco thing. We wanted a quick brunch before heading to the airport & found this place near our hotel.
There was line all the way outside. The wait was about 45 minutes to get a table. A guy was assigning table as we got nearer to the counter to order. 
I had the pancakes, and had huge expectations seeing that I waited this long to get a table! It was cleaned in a hurry, still a little sticky. The food came about 20 minutes later. Not too bad I guess. The chai latte was very average. Slightly cold. Pancakes.. they are edible but really average. Hard to justify an over an hour wait for it! 
Service was ok. I mean they were really busy and that is totally understandable.
Overall, we were both really underwhelmed. Not somewhere I would queue up that long for..
author: Jenn H.

description: Great place to grab breakfast. Expect to wait in line, but the service is fast and the crepes are worth it!
author: Leslie B.

description:
Nice place. Bomb mimosa's as they squeeze their own oranges. Dolce leche crepe was awesome.
The service .... not so much. Man and lady appeared to be owners/boss' were less than friendly.
Place fills up fast so get there early if you want to get a seat
author: Steven A.

description: Food was really good but the service was slow and they seemed overwhelmed with the breakfast rush
author: Nicole K.

description: They have such great team work to take care of you! They are really efficient in getting people in and out and they are great at not making you feel rushed all, all at the same time. Food was great. Space is a little tight. I had my baby with me, we left her stroller outside and just put her car seat on one of her booths :) the only thing I would say is that they need to have a separate line for people who have ordered online, someone who ordered online cut in front of me and I had already been waiting about 45 minutes, so it may just be easier for everyone
author: Sonya O.

description: Great breakfast and good prices. Expect to stand in line for a bit, but worth the wait.
author: Kenneth H.

description: The food was excellent. I got the nutella banana crepe with a side of fries & bacon. Although, they kept the door open and it was freezing. The place itself seemed outdated and felt like it needed remodeling. The music didn't exactly fit with the cafe or early afternoon vibe. I waited for probably 30 minutes but the food did come out quickly so overall it was a good experience.
author: Maddie L.

description:
After scouring Yelp for hours looking for a restaurant that was not a chain, was close to my sisters hotel and would have food all of us, including my 9 year old, could eat, we decided on Honey Honey.   We picked my sister up at the airport and navigated our way to this restaurant and almost decided to go somewhere else because the line was out of the door!  But we realized that trying to find a new restaurant by just walking around would be hopeless so we got in line.   The extra long wait at lunchtime on a Sunday is the only reason I docked a star.  

The food was so good and there were options for everyone!  The only thing to know is that they actually seat you when you get close to the front of the line.  They will give you a number and then once you have ordered you find your table.  We didn't understand so we tried to secure a table but were told that was not how it worked.   

Also, fresh squeezed orange juice for my mimosa!  Yes please.
author: Nicole H.

description: The concierge at the JW Marriott recommended this breakfast place, and the line snaking outside on the sidewalk attests to its popularity with locals. The place is dark and filthy though, and the food unremarkable and greasy. We had to go through several water glasses until finding two without visible dirt. The portions are fairly large which may account for some of the perception of "value" but is not what we are after. Will happily skip when we visit SF next time.
author: L V.

description: Get there early because it's a popular spot and you will wait in line, but the crepes are great!
author: Mireya M.

description: Had to be the best breakfast in San Francisco. Line was literally out the door on a Saturday, but it was so worth it. Natural OJ and the iced mocha was great. The huevos ranchero and crepes were out of this world. Great breakfast and reasonably priced.
author: Edilio P.

description:
Had the Chorizo and eggs with Fresh OJ,

HEAVEN!!!

Seriously great grub.

As many have noted they always have a wait, but I would rather wait for quality then get slop fast!
author: West I.

description: Great breakfast spot! Food is excellent! Highly recommend the huevos rancheros, yogurt and fruit, hot chocolate. This place can get pretty crowed and tables take a minute to clean up.
author: Gabriella P.

description:
I can't believe so many people like this place. The fettuccine with pesto was actually a cream soaked pesto. It doesn't say cream on the menu for that item. I sent it back and got Chicken Parm. The chicken was rubbery. 

For breakfast I got eggs and pancakes; the pancakes were tough and chewy. 

The line for breakfast was out the door. Maybe I ordered everything wrong.
author: Jason K.

description: Awesome food, just a wee bit long wait standing in line to order our food.  All well worth it, delicious!  Hubby had the Mediterranean and I had the Pesto crepe!  Great friendly service!  We'll be back for sure!
author: Brenda S.

description: College tour trip with daughter Easter weekend. We both loved the our crepes.
author: James E.

description: This restaurant had one of the most city friendly environments.  I ordered an omelet called the Cable Car which was smoked salmon and capers withbred onions.  It was so delicious!  This is ibe of my new favorite establishments to visit as of now because I really enjoyed the experience.  The staff was super informative when it came to suggestions as well...
author: Emiko S.

description: Nice little spot to have breakfast & start the day but definitely busy. Waited about 35 mins for a table & there's not much of a waiting area. Food was good for the most part. Staff not very friendly, just looking to get you in & out. Restaurant seemed fairly clean but the bathrooms were dirty.
author: Avianna E.

description: Food was good but they took very long to bring it.  I realized they were serving people who came after us first.  I asked them about it and they said big orders take longer.  I don't think that's ok,  they should serve in the order you came.
author: Susana M.

description: We tried to have breakfast at this place a few times while visiting SF and staying at hotels in the area prior to moving here full time. Every time we tried to have breakfast at Honey Honey, the line was out the door. Some how we beat the rush and got in. The line behind us, grew quickly and the place was filled before I knew it. I had a veggie omelet type crepe thing, and my boyfriend had pancakes and eggs. The food was delicious and probably only took about 15 minutes to cook. NOTE: this is not a fancy brunch place. You order your meal at the counter, and then find a seat yourself and the employees will bring out your food to your table. It's a simple place but definitely worth checking out.
author: Tati C.

description: Fairly long wait with no designated waiting area. The line forms from the till, through the restaurant, through the door. That being said, the menu is on the wall so you can decide what you'd like before you reach the till. They assign you a table (with a number) as you get closer to the till. Once we ordered the food did not take long and the coffee was good! I had the Pesto Chicken Crepe and it was excellent! Just the right amount of seasoning, and plenty of chicken! Potatoes were crispy and hot but the fruit plates I saw looked very good as well. If you don't mind the wait, or eating next to a line of people, I say go and check it out!
author: Shyloxmom M.

description: Delicious crepes, we tried both the savory crab Half Moon and Nutella Banana. Mocha wasn't the best, but my son enjoyed his hot chocolate. Line was quite long on a Sunday morning, but we were lhappy.
author: Kyto B.

description:
Meh. 

For the long wait (around an hour and fifteen minutes), it didn't quite live up to our expectations. 

Firstly, the seating situation is really weird - basically you're supposed to be seated after you order your food; however random lazy people in the back of the line will run to empty seats first while people at the front of the line are waiting to be seating. Kinda weird set up overall as the massive line to order extends throughout the restaurant and winds by your table while you're eating. 

The bench seat tables are also very awkward - high benches with low tables, so your thighs are kinda squashed while eating. 

So, I got the breakfast crepe, which was pretty good - not long-wait good, but a hefty amount of eggs. I appreciated that they were able to make substitutions with no extra cost as well. Husband got the croissant sandwich - the side potatoes were the best part (seriously, they were some of the best O'Brien potatoes ever) unfortunately; the sandwich itself was very underwhelming, with runny eggs and a croissant that looked like it had been sitting on a shelf for a few days. 

Overall, wouldn't recommend.
author: Leanna W.

description: I had the crab cake Benedict. A little on the dry side but delicious. But one of the best parts is the orange juice, fresh squeezed and just delicious. I only drink fresh squeezed orange juice and there's is one of the best. I've also had the juevos rancheros, that's pretty good too and a little on the spicy side.
author: P S.

description: It wasn't worth the wait. I was super excited because the reviews were good and there was a big line, but the cappuccino wasn't as good as a Starbucks one and the crepe flavors were great (I got the SBK), but the crepe texture itself just wasn't as good as other crepe places I've been. It's good for brunch as long as there is no line. Not worth the wait.
author: Megan H.

description: The food is pretty good and reliable. I came  in from out of town and the staff said that the cafe is a good staple. I agree. The line did get a little long in the morning for breakfast, so try to go before 9 am. I didn't think that this place was particularly special but reliable and consistent for the couple of times I ate there. It's a good choice.
author: Katherine C.

description: Went here for breakfast on a Friday. When I arrived it was full, but the line moved quickly and once I ordered at the register seats were available. The fresh squeezed orange juice was amazing. The crepe was good too.
author: Brian F.

description: Eggplant crepe with potatoes was excellent. Portions are good. Got here at 0800 by 0815 on Saturday line was almost to door. Great selection of food . The food comes to the table very fast. I can see seating being a problem with the amount of customers.
author: T Z.

description: This place is a great spot for breakfast! There was a bit of a wait to get inside, but the line moved quickly and efficiently! When inside, the menus are large so they are easy to read. The customer service was fantastic. Everyone was so nice and looking to help. The food was excellent and the portions are large. Well worth the wait!
author: T T.

description:
My friend didn't lie when he said he will show me and my guests from Germany the best spots in San Francisco when we come to visit!!
Everything from location, ambiance to service and food was super nice!!!
It was so packed!! And we were so hungry!! So it was such a nice suprise when we got a table right away!!! And our food was there in no time!! That was amazing!!
The waiters were so attentive, quick and such sweethearts!!
And the food... Woah!! Delicious breakfast, I'm telling you! Nicely portioned and tasted as good as it was decorated. Thank you so much for everything Honey Honey, we loved it and will be back!!
author: Damla K.

description: Good food but expensive.  A full breakfast with OJ and coffee costs $20.  I was a tourist needing breakfast in downtown San Francisco, and there seemed to be very few choices within walking distance of Union Square.  I tried Honey Honey and ordered the 2+2+2 platter -- 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 slices of bacon.  The orange juice ($5 extra) was fresh-squeezed on the spot, and was delicious, but it was served at room temperature, not chilled.  I was satisfied with the breakfast, very tasty, but wanted to give a note of caution about the prices.
author: Richard R.

description: I've had their crepes before they are pretty good . Today I tried their grilled chicken sandwich and the chicken was literally raw. I sent it back. They kindly brought out a new one but even the new one was very tough and chewy and could not eat it. I'm not sure how they prepare their chicken or where they buy it but the poultry should not be served the way they do.
author: Yodel P.

description:
3.5 stars

Came here for brunch a couple weeks ago, it's walking distance from the Westin St. Francis. Approached the restaurant around 10:15am and noticed a line of about 10-15 people outside, but there were another 20-25 in the line that continued inside the restaurant. The line moved pretty quickly, I think we were in line for about 30-35 mins during which I was able to study the menu, which is very extensive. I had to go with a crepe since this is a crepery after all. I customized my own crepe, which took the cashier person a few minutes to figure out how to charge me for. I got a crepe with spinach, cheese, and eggs with a side of fruit. I really liked the crepe itself and everything inside, the fruit cup was nice-but nothing special. My BF enjoyed his benedict and the breakfast potatoes that came with it was cooked and seasoned perfectly. I found myself semi regretting not ordering the potatoes. 

Cute restaurant. One of those places where you order in front then sit yourself. We were a little worried about finding a place to sit, but there were plenty of tables after we ordered our food. Pretty quick turn around here with people enjoying their food, then vacating the tables for other customers.
author: Kat M.

description:
To be fair, I didn't have a crepe here. I had a burger that was dry.  It seems that all crêperies have the same menu.  Maybe it is a restaurant in a box that is sold like a franchise, but with a different name each time.  

This restaurant is a little dark and dingy.  Maybe it's more lively in the mornings and lunch hour.
author: Kim Y.

description:
Got lucky and beat the rush. Line went out the door as soon as we walked in. The menu is extensive as they have burgers, pasta, crepes (sweet and savory), sandwiches, breakfast, coffee, tea, beer, wine, etc. Kind of all over the place. 

Didn't need to worry about getting a table as they are assigned when you order. No table saving. 

Ordered the Half Moon Bay crepe with crab cakes, tomatoes, cheese, and mushrooms. For being a crepery, I wasn't impressed. The crepe was too thick and crispy. Also it was just OK tasting.

We also ordered Belgian waffles with strawberry, banana, topped with whipped cream. Nothing to write home about, but it was pretty good. 

Something to note, there was this couple near us that didn't get their food until after three other tables received theirs. When they inquired about it the guy who was seating everyone said "Has it been 15 minutes? You have to wait at least 15 minutes." He then proceeds to look at their ticket and it has been more than 20. No joke he leaves comes back with more food for other tables, then comes with theirs. No apologies, no explanation, nothing. The couple wasn't angry or made a scene either.  Seems they want you in and out as fast as possible. Also, he came by later and asked if we were done and then just took our plates. I was still drinking my water and would have liked to finish the last bite. Whatever though, that's just me. We were basically done. Also he shoved an entire party of 8 in a corner and the couple sitting next to them made room so they could be comfortable and not crammed. The guy who worked there didn't get them new chairs or anything. I'm nitpicking right now for sure.

For breakfast, it's good. Customer service could use some work for sure. I understand that it's the morning on a weekend and there are a lot of people, but this can't be the first or last time for it to be busy. Oh, and the crepes should have been better. That's just me, and I'm not a crepe snob.
author: Andrew P.

description: This is one of the better brunches I've ever had. I ordered the Milano Eggs and a pesto chicken crepe. Both were astonishingly delicious. Perfect blend of cheese, garlic, and pesto basil which left me craving for more. I'm definitely coming back for more!
author: Akshat G.

description: We waited 45 mins in line and then the food was extremely disappointing. Just wanted to let you guys know, the positive reviews were really misleading in my opinion. VERY mediocre tasting food and really slow service
author: Alexys M.

description: A nice, chill place to grab a bite to eat! We had the French Toast and the Miami Heat, both were amazing! Miami Heat was very spicy, but I took the sauce off and it was great. Service and prices are good and loved the pop music from different eras.
author: Elijah And Daisy S.

description: Great place to go for breakfast but it gets crowded. However, they run an efficient way to get people in and out quickly. The food is reasonably price and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu! The staff is friendly but the place is pretty small so you'll be sitting close to your neighbor. But well worth the experience!
author: Jackie O.

description: Had breakfast here, came in right after it opened. There were only 4 people ahead of us in line. It took over 30 minutes for us to get our food. Pretty par for the course, like equivalent to an expensive IHOP. My daughter had a Nutella/strawberry crepe, we have eaten crepes many times, including in Europe, this one was tough, maybe over cooked? So for 2 adults and a child spending $50 on breakfast I'd go eat somewhere else really.
author: Lindsey G.

description: Visiting SF for the first time and this was my first stop for eating. The cappuccino was very good as were the nutella banana crepes. I had to wait about 20 minutes for my crepe tho, which is the only reason I left off a star. The staff was very friendly.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
The Half Moon Bay crêpe (cheddar, tomatoes, mushrooms, and crab cake) was delicious. The outside of the crêpe looked a bit dark, like it was overcooked. But it ended up tasting fine with no burnt flavor at all. And for $11.95, you get a pretty good amount of crab cake. They didn't try to make the crêpe look fuller by using more tomatoes and mushrooms.

You also get a choice of potatoes, salad, or fruit. I opted for the side of fruit, which ended up being a bowl of apples, bananas, strawberries, and 1 slice of kiwi. The kiwi was really sour but otherwise, the quality of the fruit was decent.
author: Cammie W.

description: Delicious! Super cute and very authentically Parisian with great crepes and a fresh squeezed ok machine!
author: Whitney H.

description: Wow! The crepes are out of this world!!!! So good! Awesome service, super kind workers. Very detailed menu so you can always fine what your craving. And there is Wifi! Definitely recommend!
author: Sara M.

description: Great sandwiches and salads, cool staff with good music as well, I be back for brunch soon
author: Victor V.

description: Awful service.Had to wait outside the place in the line, then inside the place in another line, and then for almost an hour for the food. I'm sure they messed up the order and when we raised the issue, they were not even apologetic. And when the food came, it was not even good and was Very very average. Never going there again. Never recommending it to anyone.
author: Anjali T.

description:
This place is worth the long wait and awful service. Just wait for the food!! 

I've been here several times so far. 

1. Hiccup one
After almost 35 mins of waiting in line, we managed to order and have a seat. The bus girl was super weird. She told us to get up from our seat for no reason. She said her boyfriend is coming and likes that seat. Who the hell cares? Why is any server has a right to reserve a seat for someone who is not even in the restaurant? Also, this place is not a restaurant where a server brings you to a seat. You just order and find your own seat kinda place. Okay it bugged me major time and kind of ruined my brunch mood.

2. Hiccup two:
