When the old man who brought our dishes said "hope you can down them all", which was weird. Who says that? How about 'enjoy your food'? Service doesn't even deserve 1 star. So beware. 

BUT....

When you put the meal in your mouth... Oohh aaahhh. Really worth it and you'll forget everything that happened till that moment.

PORTION is big, so you don't really need more than 1 anything. But we wanted to try everything we liked. 

CHOICES: huge array of choices. We had 

1. Miami Heat: crepes with avocado, chicken breast and cheddar, scallion. It was great! I'll eat it everyday of my life 

2. Eggs Benedict: it was yum.

3. Nutella banana: this, I can eat for the rest of my life too. So rich, tastes amazing. All my favorite things in one.. 

4. Belgium waffle: comes with banana and strawberry and ample amount of whipped cream.
This was good. But next to Nutella banana, it wasn't that good. 

5. Coffee: was okay. Not good, not bad. 

6. Orange juice: it was freshly squeezed and really good! 

7. Mediterranean crepes: loved it 

8. Tuna sandwich: was soo goood 

I'm giving this place 4 stars only because of the service. Food is 5 STARS!
author: Bella J.

description: Good and worth the short wait. 30 minutes from start to yum. We had a traditional breakfast and it was great. Once you know their system for serving you will be less anxious about the wait. They are working hard to serve the line. You will get a table number while in line and then order. Sit down at the table and the goodness is soon coming. Really not that bad and the price is reasonable.
author: Dave S.

description:
I'm disappointed that I didn't get a chance to come back here before my visit to SF ended, maybe again someday! 

I had the SBK crepe which is strawberry banana and kiwi, with whipped cream. It was good! Not my favorite crepe ever but one of the better meals I had in the area. I'd never had warm kiwi before and was surprised to find it had a taste similar to baked apple. Overall the crepe wasn't very sweet until I added the whipped cream, was somehow more on the savory spectrum. Kind of good if you don't want something overwhelmingly sweet. Friendly service, nice lunch or snack spot while exploring downtown.
author: Mysti R.

description:
Yelp Challenge: 6/100

My boyfriend and I visited San Francisco during spring break and enjoyed breakfast at Honey Honey Cafe two out of the three days we stayed. The cafe runs on an impeccable seating system. By the time you've ordered, there will be an open seat for you. I ordered the salmon benedict with orange juice the first day and a tuna sandwich the following day. I prefer my orange juice cold and was a bit disappointed that it was lukewarm. My eggs were underpoached and were falling apart into mush before I could enjoy them. The tuna sandwich was great. The micro greens were a great addition for texture. Definitely make sure to have their complimentary infused waters as they are ice cold and refreshing. I'll be back!

*Both days we dined in, I payed with a large bill and they were able to make change. This was an added bonus!
author: Supattra S.

description:
Very average place. There's a huge menu upon entering, but it could use more variety. My friend wanted a savory crepe with chicken apple sausage, and none of them came with it, but it was available as a side. Sounds kind of odd to me.

I ordered the North Beach crepe, which was filled with spinach, chicken breast, onions and Swiss cheese, topped with hollandaise sauce. My order came out only mildly warm. We were the only other party there at the time (~5:30pm on a weekday). The hollandaise sauce was also very bland, which was a major disappointment since it was the thing that intrigued me about the dish. The whole crepe was very mediocre. I tried my friend's eggplant crepe, which tasted a little better but was still nothing special. I ordered fruit as a side, and they tasted like they had been sitting out for a couple of days. 

Would I come back? Maybe, maybe not. I'd prefer crevevine though.
author: Cheryl N.

description: Good hearty breakfast and coffee served quickly and at a reasonable price? Yes, please, especially for the pricey Union Square area.  We tried the Belgian waffle, which was very good, and the Mediterranean crepe, which was tasty and filling.  The coffee is good,too.  They have a big menu, so there's bound to be something for everyone. There is ample seating inside, but the place fills up quickly.
author: Amelia S.

description: There is generally 20 mins waiting but the wait is worth it. I had the Eggs Florentine with roasted potatoes, spinach and english muffin. Also some very fresh orange juice. The breakfast and the staff gave an awesome start to my hectic day.
author: Aman J.

description: Great breakfast spot with lots of choices! Hubby loved the crepes and the Post Street omelette was yummy.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Honey honey is type of brunch place where you pay before you eat and to me, this is more convenient so you don't have to wait for them to place your order. I got the tofu scramble which is basically scrambled eggs with tofu and a side of potatoes.  My friend got a pesto savory crepe also with a side of potatoes. Food came in quick and the portions are huge for the price you pay. I paid $11  for my plate and that's a good price for brunch in San Francisco. The ambiance in here is very home feeling, tables are fairly close to each other but it isn't super close and it's just comforting. The eggs didn't have much flavor but with a little bit of ketchup, it tasted amazing. I recommend this place if you're in downtown looking for cheap brunch places that actually tastes good because this is one of those on the list.
author: Lisa W.

description: I came here after my flight to SFO from New York. Naturally, I was starving and went to the first place with four stars or above. This happened to be Honey Honey. The first time I went, I got the Burrito which pleased my hunger very well! It was super juicy and melted in my mouth. The following day, I got the Mexican Salad which did not disappoint. I totally recommend coming here, especially if you are staying at surrounding hotels!
author: Master C.

description:
Amazing savoury crepes! I had the Mediterranean crepe which was a delightful brunch item stuffed with artichokes, olives and avocado with cheddar and feta cheese. Served with some great crunchy potatoes, it's a great morning dish.

The ambience also impressed me. A very relaxed place with great service. The servers found us a table while we stood in queue waiting to order. Overall, very happy with the place.
author: Pratik R.

description: Not worth the wait.  Pretty mediocre crepes, the salsa crepe was not bad.  I got a side of chorizo which was burnt on top and gross and mushy inside.  The stars are for the servers who were nice, and were doing a good job on a busy Saturday.
author: Danny C.

description:
DELICIOUS FRESH SQUEEZED OJ.  

Great cafe/restaurant offering sandwiches, crepes, omelets, etc.

I had a salmon scramble with taters and english muffin (that arrive not toasted enough).  The eggs and salmon and potatoes were delicious.  I also had a vanilla latte but they don't offer nonfat milk.  If your looking for that, you're SOL.

All in all, a pretty delicious breakfast, but the oj was amazing....5 stars all the way.
author: Lucky S.

description: Visiting from San Diego and found this place. So friggin happy we did! Ate there 2 days in a row and probably would have eaten more if we had found sooner. The food is fantastic, great sandwiches, killer waffles and breakfast all at a reasonable price. Coffee is good too. Only draw back is the line to order every morning. But what do you expect when the food is so good!?! Go there, seriously, just go.
author: Patrick E.

description: Long line even on a Monday morning, mostly full of tourists. I ended up ordering take out and was very satisfied with my crab cake florentine. Portions were so huge I couldnt finish it at all. The potatoes were nicely charred and the hollandaise sauce was thick and creamy. Loved it!
author: Christina N.

description: Definitely not a destination restaurant.  I think most people chose to eat here since its close to a lot of hotels.  We came around 9:30 on a Friday night, in search of a dessert. I ordered a nutella banana crepe with an extra scoop of ice cream.  It took FOREVER for the crepe to arrive.  At least 20 minutes and the restaurant was not very busy.  The extra scoop of ice cream never came.  The crepe was ok, a little on the smaller side.  The server/cashier was not overly friend and happy either.
author: Randi M.

description: Good food, but expensive. Our breakfast was a success. There is a good selection of drinks for every taste. I was satisfied with the breakfast, it was very tasty, but wanted to warn about the prices.
author: Isabella R.

description:
Great crepes every time. Water there is refreshing as it has lemon and mint or strawberries infused. Lots of tables to sit and enjoy, bathrooms are well maintained. Staff is usually pleasant. 

Strawberry Nutella crepe with ice cream is an easy choice.

Watch out for the brownies though, there are raisins in them. Yuck!
author: Derrick D.

description:
Underwhelming in pretty much every way. Ordered the Smoked Salmon Benedict and the Sunrise Burrito; both we're fairly cold when we got them. Salmon didn't seem fresh and the Hollandaise was lemony. Burrito was fine, fairly dry, and had very little chorizo. 

Wait was about 25 minutes on a weekend, which is fine, but there was no order to the wait. Some people waited to get their seats after they ordered, some people grabbed whatever was available, and folks who HAD ordered had to wait for someone else to get up. 

Probably would not go back if I visited SF again.
author: Alex H.

description:
It was a long wait but worth it as an experience.  The food was good but not great.  However the atmosphere was energetic, mostly because it is a well known tourist spot.  The orange juice was quite good, the breakfast crepe was as expected.  It didn't measure up to a crepe  / pancake place in Leiden but that is a high bar.  The chorizo sausage side was spicy and added good flavor with the crepe

This would not be my daily breakfast place but would probably return if visiting SF again with friends
author: Christopher F.

description:
Such a good restaurant was just a good experience!! Definitely gonna go there many more times!
The line was very long but it was worth it!!
The food was just on time and very good!
Happy I met this place!
author: Topaz G.

description: Go here for the Crepes!!!! The Nutella Crepe was amazing. With every bite it had only more chocolate oozing out. Amazing hot chocolate too!
author: Vidhi R.

description: We went here based on the recommendation of the Hyatt concierge. I like sweet crepes but haven't been too enthusiastic about trying savory crepes. They never appealed to me until now. I had the Mediterranean crepe and it was fantastic. My son had the banana and Nutella which is pretty common but was tasty nonetheless. We also tried the dulce de leche (I think) with candied nuts. It was a special and was out of this world! There was a long wait on a late Saturday morning but what good place do you go to in SF without a wait? There's quite an extensive menu with something for everyone...even those of us who aren't wild about the typical breakfast of eggs/omelets.  I would definitely travel to SF just to get that Mediterranean crepe again!
author: Kris F.

description: L. O. L literally!!!!!!!! first of all it needs a new look 10/10 second of all maybe it needs a couple of new employees too- actually nicer ones!! I got a baklava crepe :) it was great til I literally got to the last bite and there was a hair inside sticking out. of course i'm like oh yeah that's great so I went up to dude & told him and he was like just like ok and so I went back down & the supposed chef walked by and lifted his hat? to show he was bald? like okay? go head and be petty I don't blame you i'd be the same if it was slow too. went back up to cashier dude and was basically like so wassup and he was like what you mean like bro and he wanna say if you come in the morning you could speak to the manager like haha ohhhh you're one of those people alright he proceeded to keep telling me his chef was bald and i'm like ok???? there was another dude in the back with a full head of hair like o so we just not gonna bring him up but okie. then he was like it can't be mine i have grey hairs and i'm like yeah i know. couldn't be mine either because my hair was all up in a bun. 10/10 worst customer service I have had in 2017 10/10 never coming back 10/10 way better crepe places in the city oh and they charged my card extra for a tip when I didn't include it :) lmfao they are a MESS
author: Katelyn R.

description: Eggplant crepes and blintz crepes were both great! Came here on a Monday around 12, not super busy.
author: Rubina B.

description: This review comes late, but my experience as gluten intolerant customer was terrible. First, I was told that nothing in the menu was gluten free. When I pointed out that there are salads, they reluctantly said that one of them could be made gluten free. Having no choice, I ordered it. A few minutes later, it came with a large piece of bread on top. When I complained, the server, visibly irritated, removed the bread, and gave me the same dish back, obviously contaminated. I had to insist to get a new plate. The result was a dish of bare lettuce...
author: Diego R.

description:
Another great brunch option you need to get to early!
I came here before my flight back home so I knew I had to eat a hearty meal for the long journey back to the east coast.
They have a great menu with classic breakfast options and some nice sweet treats. I ordered the scrambled eggs crossiant sand which and then had the Nutella banana walnut crepe.
There was a line, a bit of a wait and a wait for the food but it;s to be excepted on a Sunday. The crossiant was warm and flakey which was perfect! It also came with some potatoes so it was very filling. 
I asked for my crepes to go so I could enjoy while waiting for my flight. I was very happily surprised how well it traveled! Not a big mess & they were great about separating the topping in small containers so I could easily rebuild the creation!
The Nutella crepe was amazing, sweet delicious gooey goodness! Well worth the price!
author: Phylicia K.

description: Food was very good. Be prepared to wait and the line goes straight through the dining room. They could invest in a small renovation and solve that problem but it doesn't seem to bother most people should ncr the breakfast choices in the area seem limited.
author: Michael C.

description: Really really good crepes!!! Went for breakfast and the food was amazing!!! Just recommend that you get there early, right when they open. We got there at 11 am and the wait was 45 minuets to order. So definitely order online or give yourself time.
author: Amar P.

description:
I'm not a huge sweet crepe fan, but a tasty crepe, lesgoooo!

There was a long line into this spot but it moved very quickly. They have every type of crepe you'd want here. I went with the Breakfast Crepe since I couldn't see any other which carried bacon or sausage. The GF went with Miami Heat and we were both pleased!

The one downfall I had was the coffee situation. We ordered a latte and Americano. Outside of being boiling hot (seriously solo hot) the Americano didn't come with hot water. So it was an espresso.

Overall I enjoyed this place very much. They also had pecan cookies (see photos) for $1 a piece and they were really tasty!
author: Willard J.

description:
Amazing place, great food great customer service and great ambiance.
The owner was walking around chatting with everyone .
Defiantly this is my favorite place when I visit San Francisco.
author: Haz H.

description: A work employee and myself ate here because we were out of town on a work trip. Their Eggs Benedict was to die for! And for San Fran, it was a lot cheaper than some of the brunch places around union square. We actually ended up eating here twice. The line out the door makes it apparent that their food is delicious. And it really didn't take long to get through the line. We liked it a lot, and the workers were all very friendly. We stayed at the Hilton on Union Square and it was right down the block from us. They are also available for lunch.
author: Amber D.

description:
HH was recommended by our hotel and we gave it a try since it was just a block away. We were warned there would be a long line, but we only waited about 5 mins on a Wed morning (10am). The line did get longer around 10:30. 

I'm not a fan of restaurants where you order first and then find a seat. The brunch food is just your basic breakfast and lunch food, nothing too special, but not too bad. The portions are huge so it's a good idea to share if you're not that hungry.
author: Roll N.

description: Awesome breakfast! Came in with our 3 kids, so 5 of us total. The great menu had something for everyone. Great prices for the amount of food you get. We all loved the fresh squeezed orange juice. Over all this restaurant was very yummy and we would visit again if in the city.
author: Janna G.

description: Probably the best breakfast i have ever had. Had the post street omelette and the Nutella banana crepe! Coffee wasn't the greatest but to be honest I didn't care because the food was incredible
author: Emily W.

description: Yum! I was in SF for work and we went to this place twice for breakfast. There was a bit of a crowd the second time, but it went surprisingly fast because of their order/ number-on-table system. The food is delicious and large portions. We split the eggs Benedict and it was amazing. Will be returning when back in the city!
author: Dida L.

description:
5 star food. Delicious Santa Fe scramble and breakfast sandwich. Huge portions. 
3 stars for wait time. The bottle neck appears to be the ordering. The person behind the counter is taking orders, running cards, and making complicated coffee drinks. If someone helped her the wait time would be so much better. Waited in line 45 min. Food was out in 10 minutes.  We showed up when the place opened.
If you are in line and it stretches outside expect 45 min wait.
author: Liz B.

description: Awesome place for breakfast. Creative savory and sweet crepes, excellent service and everyone was happy. This was my second visit and I would have gone back every day if it had worked out in our schedule! Oh, and a place that also serves mimosas and bloody mary's without being a fancy sit down place made for a fun start to our trip!
author: Jackie B.

description: I only ordered a bagel and not gonna lie, it is unlike any other bagel. It has nice crispy flavor to it and if you add a bit of salt to it on top of the cream cheese, it's amazing.
author: Edmond S.

description:
Have eaten here a few times but was not happy with the food this time.  The employees were friendly and helpful but we waited an hour in line even though there were plenty of tables free.  There was a 20 min. Time period when not one moved in the line.  No reason given for that.
I had the Eggs Benedict and one egg was perfect but the other was way under cooked and watery.  It is very loud and was not a place we wanted to sit and talk.  Maybe that is why they do that.  We are now looking for another nearby place.
author: Judy B.

description:
Whether you are feeling brunch, lunch or dessert, this place will satisfy you. It has a large selection of menu that will almost overwhelm you but no doubt whatever you order, it'll be good. 
My friend and I came in for brunch and ordered Post Street omelette and Nutella strawberries crepe and shared, which was perfect portion for us. The food came out quickly, very fresh and savory. If I ever visit SF again, I would come back to this place. 
The only reason I give a 4-star is because when we sat down our table it wasn't very clean and some gooey stuff on ketchup bottle. But that didn't bother us from enjoying our food!
author: Annie L.

description:
I was very unimpressed by my experience here.  

I ordered the Crab Cake Benedict and flavor-wise, it was decent.  Unfortunately, my eggs were more hard boiled than poached, my potatoes were cold, and the English muffins under the crab wasn't toasted at all.  I also ordered a coffee thinking how could anyone mess up a cup of coffee... Well, the half and half at the coffee counter was spoiled.  To top it all off, there was a pigeon flying around inside the restaurant. 

Prices are decent, food is meh, and the interior needs pest control.  Not sure if it was just a bad day or if this is the normal quality. Based off this one experience, I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Ashley A.

description: Enjoy my vegan tofu scramble.   It was a bit expensive for what I got, so if you're a vegan, I would look elsewhere.  If you are an omni, the food looked great.    I would give the taste of the meal 5 stars, and the value 3 stars.  It was pretty expensive for what we got.
author: Anthony A.

description:
My second visit to SF and I end up here for breakfast yet again. Totally LOVE this place! I've never been there other than for breakfast and there's always a line, but it's so worth the wait. They have an extensive menu of crepes (sweet and other), as well as other yummy breakfast goodies. 
I've tried their eggs Benedict (original and with salmon) - delish, but my favorite one is their blintz - TO DIE FOR! And their freshly squeezed orange juice makes it even better. Perfect start to a beautiful morning. 
If you're in the area, don't hesitate to try it!
author: Iulia G.

description: This was a great breakfast place! The menu is huge--savory crepes, dessert crepes, omelets, pancakes, French toast, Belgian waffles, as well as lunch items. The seating process is a little confusing. The line went out the door & moved slowly. What happens is you wait in line for a table to open up. The huge menu is up on the wall as you wait in line so you can mull over what to order. As you get close to the counter to order, a host will ask how many are in your party & assign you a table with a number. When you order & pay, you tell them your table number. Then you immediately sit down & just wait for your food. The food came relatively quickly & hit the spot. We each had a crepe--the half moon (which was the least favorite) & the breakfast crepe (which was yummy) & we shared the pecan pancakes which were amazing, by far the standout of the meal.
author: Andrea R.

description: Super yummy crepes, savory and sweet!! Nice restaurant with great ambiance. The breakfast eggs are really good too!
author: Meg B.

description: Great food and service!! Their crepes are the business!!!! Tell them what you like and the cook will whip out something delicious even if it's not on the menu. 5 Stars all the way around.
author: Adam Z.

description: This was a very nice brunch place. We waited for probably 25 minutes but the line keeps moving which is nice. The food was delicious; we had crab cake florentine and the French toast and it all was great. Just a tip - if you order a side salad, make sure to specify which dressing you want or it may be dry lettuce! The drinks were great. The mimosa was $4.50 and contained mostly champagne and then some freshly squeezed orange juice (we watched them do it!). The service was also fantastic. The owner/manager was walking around cleaning off tables and checking on each group which was really nice. I would recommend this place to people visiting.
author: MacKenzie D.

description: Great breakfast place. Don't let the long line turn you away; it moves quickly. Worth the wait. Good service!
author: Kim C.

description: Great breakfast, a big variety of choices - we ate the salmon benedict and pancakes with fresh fruit, and loved it. The place is self service.
author: Inbar I.

description: Waited in a 45 min line for brunch on a Saturday.  Boyfriend got the breakfast crepe meal and it looked like his veggies weren't cooked and his breakfast potatoes were still pretty raw and lacked flavor.  My Blintz was good, but very small.  The cappuccinos were average.  But the water...OMG I almost cut my lips on the jagged edges of the plastic cups they were serving water with.  It looked like a dog had chewed on the end of it.  So glad I drank my coffee first to finally wake up and see what I poured water into.  I think this place is over rated and there are plenty of other breakfast spots in SF that would be way better.
author: Marie E.

description: Honey honey offers a good selection of breakfast options including bagels, omelettes, crepes. I had a savory and a sweet crepe. The food is okay although the crepes were too thick and there was too much filling as for me. Drinks I liked. The survive was good but slow. It took them 30 mins to bring my food.
author: Anna K.

description: I tried ordering a strawberry and banana crepe but, the cashier was kinda of giving me a hard time about it. She said I must choose off the ones off the menu and then request to take/add ingredients in. There is a plain crepe entree, I did not think chopping up bananas and strawberries would be a problem but they were busy so I understood. Instead, I ordered the french toast plate. It was pretty good and the service was very fast. I would have gave this place a better review if I didn't go to the restroom before I left and found a roach in the bathroom. I did see a Terminix truck across the street helpfully they are fixing that problem.
author: Nyomie O.

description:
There is no service. You place your order, take a number and your food is brought out to you. It's a busy place, but we didn't have a problem finding a table.

We were very disappointed with the food. I ordered the blintz and the filling had curds and strawberry sauce and no ricotta as described. My husband ordered 2 pancakes, 2 scrambled eggs and 2 slices of chicken sausage. The sausages were too salty to eat.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Based on the crepes alone! Hit it on a weekday afternoon no wait.  Lots of variety in choices. They do not have just your average dessert or sweet crepe, many unique options.
author: Jeremy D.

description:
So we checked in the hotel and this place was within walking distance so we tried it out. After standing in line for 45 minutes we got to order. There are two parts of standing in line that long, one good and one bad. The bad you are hungry and getting mad you have to wait that long also seeing seats disappear sucks. The good you see what others are having and get a good idea what to eat. 

We ended up getting way more food than we should have because we wanted to try so much of it. Their Apple chicken sausage was the best thing I ate. I would get it again. The Post Street was good as is the orange juice that is fresh squeezed. 

If you go give your self ample time as it takes a while in line.
author: Adam C.

description:
One of the best places for breakfast in SF. My wife and i stumbled upon it while we were in town for the weekend. The menu caught our eye so we decided to stop in and try it out. The line was long, but the food and service we received was well worth it. The young lady who took our order forgot to give my wife her drink so when i reminded her she politely apologized and made up for it by giving her a double. It was a kind gesture that was much appreciated. The prices were fare and the food was delicious. Stop by if you're in the area and try for yourself.  

BTW - The eggs benedict was amazing!
author: Kenny R.

description:
Very busy restaurant, so before going there make plans or get there early especially if your doing breakfast. You order, you pay, you go find a seat and wait for the food to come. 

They specialize in somewhat of a healthy type of food, crepes and other options. Not so good with taking special orders, for example I asked for my omelet to be 3 egg whites and 1 whole egg (normally their omelet comes with 2 eggs). The girl at the register nicely said that the kitchen is busy and they may not do it. Oh well, other than that, pretty simple, easy and good food.
author: Berj D.

description:
Great place for lunch. The place has a great variety of options and the salads and sandwiches were both very good. The service is fine for an order at the counter type places. I would def recommend for a casual lunch esp if you want a lunch under an hour. 

Pros:
Central union square location 
Fast service and counter ordering 
Great options for a group of people to select from 

Cons:
Can get crowded for lunch and you may have to wait in line
author: Michael T.

description: I came here on a Wed around 12:30 p.m. seriously no line, so maybe that's the time to go. Anyways food was decent nothing outstanding. Service could of been friendlier all the girls looked so sad. The food came out fairly quickly and the place is well runned, always movin. The bathrooms were pretty much clean, they have free wifi. The place can get really stuffy and warm, they had to keep the door open to get some fresh air so idk what's up with that. I'd recommend, it's simple food but I personally won't be going back.
author: Lesley H.

description: Very disappointing for dinner. Was better for breakfast. The potatoes were dry as if they were made a day ago. The eggplant crepe was super dry. I had to add additional salsa to make it edible. Overall bad choice for dinner.
author: Rohit S.

description: The purposeful slowdown in the line confused me.  I ordered a Torino crepe, and finished half of it before I ever tasted the feta.  Not a favorite.
author: William P.

description: The food was ok, but they had this delectable moist honey cake that I still think about months after having it, the line was out the door when we arrived but it moved fairly quickly, they have a lot of options available on the menu and it appears to be a small space but it's really fine when your seated, the waiters and all the other workers were very kind and fast...  I'll be back for more cake soon
author: Cna M.

description: Food is always good, but service is ok. The cashier is kind of rude to be honest, but love the menu selection. Also be prepared to wait in a very long line!
author: Sabra M.

description: Loved the Banana Nutella crepe. The Miami heat savory crepe was beyond incredible. Definitely recommend having breakfast here.
author: Mohd I.

description:
If you want to immediately order your food, come here around 7:20 prior to opening so that you can quickly get your stuff.

Their portion sizes are definitely big, so have an appetite. I haven't had their dessert crepes, but instead had their breakfast/savory crepe. It was ... good!
author: Kevin L.

description: I would give 0 stars if I could. This place is dirty, service is horrible and food is mediocre. To top it off, I ordered the so called "freshly squeezed Orange juice and felt a little queasy in my stomach right after the first sip. It was also the worst OJ I ever had. Never am I coming back or recommend this to anyone.
author: Jing Jie H.

description: Really like their food, it's very delicious! The owner is always nice & friendly - he always greets us nicely.
author: Brittney M.

description:
Came here on a friday morning and the line was OUT THE DOOR. 

the way this works is you order food at the register; then you are given a number and find your own seat. the food comes to you when its ready. 

I'm not sure if it's because i didnt order the write items, but everything I had was mediocre. Maybe i should've gotten crepes or french toast but i wanted something savory. I had the scramble with onions, mushrooms and peppers, with a side of avocado and a cappuccino. Eggs were dry and splotchy. I was expecting a moist scramble. avocado was brown-ing. and the cappuccino had no espresso taste. the place is overrated!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
It's pretty basic chain food. The good thing is you can get dinner pretty late and when they messed up our order they gave us a second one for free. I ate the wrong order and my friend ate the right one. They serve breakfast late into the night and close at about 10 

The place looks cute and the layout is nice and open, fun music mostly from the 90s. Servers are good.
author: Rits M.

description:
Nice corner location , menu items look good.
My lady had the salmon scramble and she loved it. I ordered the huevos rancheros and it was ok. The huevos rancheros was a sloppy looking plate , with red sauce everywhere and the black beans were cold, not warm but cold. Presentation is a big part of any dish and this menu item was lacking. Coffee was good.
author: Dean P.

description: Best place at San Fran. My favorite place at the financial district area. Friendly and food is great! Thanks for the great service.
author: Evan F.

description: I wish I could give more than one star but we didn't get to eat here because they decided to close 1.5 hour early despite both Yelp and the sign in the restaurant window showing a 10pm close time. Guess that's fake news. :(
author: Lane H.

description: There was a line when we arrived at 11:00 on Friday. We waited about 20 minutes and were able to get a table after ordering. The crab cake Florentine was okay, but the Nutella banana crepe was AMAZING!
author: Allison B.

description:
There was some good and some bad.

Food: My husband had a grilled chicken sandwich and loved it.  I had the pasta with shrimp and it was...meh!  The pasta tasted pasty and the shrimp didn't taste fresh.  My kid had a ham and cheese sandwich and he didn't like it at all.

Location: It's a great spot since it's near some major hotels.  It's pretty centralized.  The restaurant is a little worn but they keep it clean.

Service:  They take your order with a smile and seem very nice.

Overall, just ok.
author: Ana B.

description: Came here for a conference, Lyft driver recommended this place, and it did not disappoint. Come early or be prepared to wait in line. I ordered the 2,2,2 and the pancakes were light and fluffy and delicious! The hubby ordered the Post Street Omelet and also did not disappoint. If I had to choose my favorite thing on the plate it was there well seasoned potato's. Good coffee.
author: Rubi L.

description: This place was amazing! I was disappointed that I couldn't get back there a second time.  It's small and a constant line the whole time I was there, but it was well worth the wait.  You order at the counter, then they bring your food out in this cozy atmosphere.  I ordered the strawberry, banana and kiwi crepe - was delicious and I don't usually do sweet for breakfast.  So filling!!  Would definitely get again!
author: Danielle P.

description: A must go to for a great breakfast. Be prepared to wait in line no worries on saving a seat when you order they tell you what table to sit at. The OJ is a must have as well as there coffee. Trust me it's so worth the wait..
author: Brandon S.

description:
When visiting San Francisco, there were so many restaurants to choose from just within the city! After some decision making, I chose to go to Honey Honey Cafe and Crepery for some brunch.

Walking in, the menu is laid all on chalkboard which is a cute touch. The restaurant itself is very laid back with an older feel to it. You order at the counter and receive a number then sit wherever you'd like.

I got a Nutella and strawberry crepe which was so so good! The crepe itself was crunchy on the edges and softer on the inside. Just the right amount of fruit and sweetness. I also got a cup of their coffee that comes with their own special mugs. If I ever come back to town, I would definitely hit this spot again!
author: Samantha M.

description:
I came here with a group of friends around 5 pm on Thursday, and there was no line. 

I ordered the Mediterranean savory crepe, and I loved it! The crepe was a substantial size, and I was impressed with how well distributed the contents were in the crepe. Overall, great quality and very satisfying. 

However, I ordered potatoes as my side and I found them salty and dry. This won't deter me from coming back in the future, but I will likely order a different side the next time I come. I can't wait to try the rest of their menu!
author: Seyvonne I.

description:
Can I give it a 10 stars? One of the best egg benedicts I've ever had! The line for this place was ridiculous! It's like the line never dies down haha. But everything was worth the wait. My friends and I wanted breakfast after a crazy fun night in SF. I brought up eggs Benedict and found this place by our hotel. 

We waited in line for about 20 minutes. They have a huge menu! Which makes me want to come back and try out other items that they have! I decided to order the crab cake florentine. The crab cake was on point!! Along with the egg Benedicts, they also added spinach to the dish, which makes it a perfect semi-healthy breakfast. The potatoes were well-seasoned and crispy! And there was no grease on the dish, which makes it even better! 

My friend decided to get the Canadian bacon and man.... It was the best bacon I've ever had! It was tender and thick, and barely any grease! I was a happy camper :). Definately will come back to try other foods! Or maybe order another crab cake florentine and other items along with it! Love love this cafe ! High recommended the egg Benedicts dish .
author: Yen H.

description: Love this little cafe for breakfast! Appears to be a local favorite or just well known because of Yelp! A little secret.... wait for it... wait for it... order your food online and avoid the line that goes down the street!! You won't be disappointed!!!
author: GaryandCathy W.

description:
I don't tend to eat out so much anymore for health and financial reasons. That being said I always seem to find exceptions for this place.

Wonderfully flavorful items on the menu from top to bottom.

the crab cakes are killer!

Also the mimosas are what the standard should be for every brunch spot in the city; Large and strong ;)
author: Daniel T.

description: Very kind staff, amazing French toast and even more amazing Dessert Crepes. I tried their Nutella and Strawberry. Its a must try!
author: Eli B.

description:
I stopped in for a quick brunch after walking through Union Square.  Since I went in between lunch and dinner time (~3pm) the place wasn't packed at all, and I easily found a table to sit at.  I can see why this place gets packed during peak breakfast/brunch/lunch times because the restaurant itself is rather small.

After skimming through the menu I knew I wanted something sweet instead of savory, so I ordered the blintz crepe.  I loved the presentation!  My crepe had a cute strawberry cream cheese heart garnished with a sliced strawberry, powdered sugar, and sauce decorating half the plate.  My only complaint was how small my crepe was for the price, but it tasted delicious!
author: Ashley U.

description:
I was referred to this restaurant from my daughters time share @ Wyndham Hotel.  My experience with the person taking my order at the cash register was very unprofessional and was very demeaning as their credit card reader was different than what I am use to.  What she DID not inform me as she watched me struggle to get the machine to work I am required to leave a tip (even before anyone has provided service to me ) to process my transaction.  It just gets worst as we sit down we had to track down cream for my mom coffee they said I order my daughters fruit cup too late so she never got it.  I just asked for the manager to get my money back and OMG the cashier is the manager.  
They appeared with my order told me it was going to go to waste we took and and I was happy to say we gave the meal to someone who really needed it.  #customerservice101 #goodluckuneedit #badservice
author: Nicollette R.

description: Good breakfast. Got a chicken burrito from there seasonal menu. Delicious with the avocado in it!
author: Luis C.

description:
Just okay - they have a pretty expansive menu so that's good for everyone! Crepes, both sweet and savory, eggs and omelettes, bagels etc etc.

We came her on a Monday morning and there was already a line. Took us 30 minutes to place our order, but our food came out in less than 10! I enjoyed the flavors of my crepe, but I felt the crepe itself was too thick. They didn't use fresh strawberries for the sweet crepe we got but the potatoes were nice and crispy, but very much rosemary flavored (which I'm not a fan of) 

There are water dispensers for your pleasure - lemon infused and regular. They seem to be a bit understaffed - the cashier will stop taking orders in order to make espressos/mimosas/bloody marys. Kinda inefficient.

A-OK.
author: Yenny D.

description: First timer, staff not very friendly and the food was delivered like warm. But most of all it just wasn't good. Not sure how they're getting such high reviews. Maybe it's that the standard in this area but for me and my taste, it left much to be desired.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
This isn't a place I would recommend. Though they were nice and had decent food, we were all left disappointed for various reasons. I had ordered an omelette with tomatoes already in it. I asked for sun-dried tomatoes instead. I received both and that's pretty much all my omelette had was tomatoes. I just ate the egg. The oranges for the $5 oj weren't ripe yet and tasted sour. 

I won't be back.
author: Laura T.

description:
Deserves 4 stars if you're looking for crepes but for anything else, this is not worth the wait.
I got there around 8:30am on a Sunday and there were already 30-ish people in line. Not the nicest place to sit either so I kinda feel this place is hyped.
author: Thomas D.

description: Food was good and the service was friendly!  The bathroom was clean and the orange juice was yummy.  The food was moderately priced and my omelet was delicious.  My boyfriend got the cheese and onion crepe and it was quite tasty as well.
author: S F.

description: The breakfast was pretty good but nothing spectacular. I got two pancakes two eggs and bacon. The bacon was delicious but the eggs were kinda cold and the pancakes were average. I got the fresh squeezed orange juice which was almost yellowy because i don't think the oranges were ripe (it was a little sour). the service was okay and I paid 35$ for breakfast for too. Overall okay but won't come back again
author: Emily S.

description: The lady at the cash register is literally the rudest person I've ever encountered, and if I hadn't already waited an hour in line, JUST to order I would have left. Food is way to mediocre for their service to be this rude. She is ruining this place and I will never be back.
author: Kiana R.

description: Yum! Get the Blintz dessert crepe. I got that with two eggs and it was perfect. Coffee was great too
author: Angie H.

description: Worst breakfast in terms of taste, cleanness, and service. All other breakfast and brunch restaurants are way better than this in the region.
author: Tim X.

description:
Ehhhh...we probably wouldn't have come here if it were not for the close proximity to our hotel.  We arrived around 8:30 and the restaurant was packed. Packed restaurants and a line usually add up to something good. However, our experience at Honey Honey was just okay. I ordered the two-egg breakfast with potatoes and splurged for a side of their chicken apple sausage. My wife ordered the salmon scramble.

I did appreciate that Honey Honey offered carrot juice. Not sure if it was pressed that day or the day before, but it still tasted pretty fresh. The meals came out and one thing was abundantly clear when the plates hit the table. The potatoes are doused in parsley. I guess the cooks are a little heavy handed with the parsley. Understandably used as a garnish, but not as a main spice for potatoes. They were completely overpowered. The eggs were eggs and the toast looked like it was suffering from identity crisis. Two-thirds of it was still bread and one-third of it actually progressed to toast. The chicken sausage was a mistake. The sausage tasted okay but was very greasy. 

The meal was relatively cheap and it looked like they had tons of options on the menu. Maybe I just selected wrong. If I am ever back in San Francisco, I would consider coming back to try a crepe, but for breakfast I would recommend going elsewhere.
author: Josh K.

description: Most mediocre brunch I have ever had. Food didn't taste fresh, the music and ambiance wasn't nice either. I honestly don't know how there was a full line of people waiting to order or how it has 4 stars. sorry.
author: Fiorella B.

description:
A spontaneous stop! We got the peanut butter crepe and it was good. We find it over priced for staple ingredients and they went a little skimpy on the chocolate syrup.  Come on! 

Happy Eatings!
author: Doreen C.

description:
The line is long but it's worth the wait !! 

I had issues trying to decide what to order it all sounded so good.. That's a struggle I can bare 

It's Sunday so it's only appropriate to get Huevos Rancheros, side of chicken apple sausage, a large refreshing Greek salad to share .. MM was poifect. 

Good, Friendly, Fast service. Finally.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Two crepes and an omelette for us this morning - all were great.

We arrived just ahead of the crowd and waited about ten minutes to order.

However we waited thirty minutes for the food while parties after us were done eating before our food arrived.

Great food, nice people, something's amiss with the process of getting the food out to you.

I'd go back but they need a change on the thirty minute wait for breakfast.
author: Nick B.

description: Came here for brunch on my last day in the city super hungover and I came back to life! There was a huge line but it's def worth the wait...they have a good variety on their menu so it's not only brunch food but they do specialize in crepes and omelets. I had the breakfast crepe which was delicious and the portions are generous, so you will def leave feeling super full. I will be back next time I'm in town!
author: Anabel R.

description:
I hate to leave less than stellar reviews, but I feel it's appropriate. My only qualm about doing so is I'm not certain I can be completely fair to this restaurant, but you only know what you know. I came in a few Sundays ago after reading great reviews. I live out of town and had just completed a 10K, so I was hangry! I expected to wait since I'd read the reviews. I was standing in line for an hour before I got to the counter to order. Yes, it was a Sunday, and yes, I expected the wait. What I didn't expect was the miserly portions. Ok, so maybe my hanger had something to do with that. I ordered 3 pancakes, scrambled eggs, and a pot of tea. My bill was $19! I know this is San Francisco, but please! I probably wouldn't have minded so much if the 'cakes were those large luscious ones that could be used as a Halloween mask if you poked holes in em. But no. These little airy wisps covered in a sprinkling of powdered sugar were made for a high tea or something along that line. Not for a hangry runner! The eggs were fine & the tea was great, but please. 
  Now I can see some saying I didn't taste enough of the menu to post. I agree the many different crepe options looked stellar. But sometimes a lady just wants a big ol mess of pancakes..and nothing less will do. Sorry Honey, Honey. You meant well.
author: Diane K.

description:
What a sweet find!! We stumbled upon this place since it was just down the street from our hotel. 

We were looking for a breakfast place around 8 am and saw this and decided to get in a line we didn't realize that this was a top rated local favorite. After reading reviews we decided we had to give it a try and thank goodness we did!

Yes, there was a line and the wait was an 1 to 1.5 hr but it was well worth it!!!

We ordered the Crab Cake Florentine Benedict, Peanut Butter Crepe, side order of Apple Chicken Sausage, Iced  Chia Latte, Orange Juice. 

Literally my mouth is drooling just typing out our breakfast. Everything was so good from my iced chai latte that I finished in .5 seconds. If they offered an IV of it I would highly consider it. The orange juice was fresh you see them make it when you order. 

The BEST, outstanding, amazing, delicious Crab Cake Florentine Benedict I have ever had. The portion is huge I couldn't finish my plate but I appreciate the size of everything served. They nailed this dish...to be honest they nailed everything they serve here! 

Will be back and ready or a round two of brunch! Do your self a favor and start your day off right by having breakfast/brunch here!! Worth the wait!
author: Batul A.

description: Great place ! We had breakfast there two days in a row . Wide range of choices for their menu . Eggs were delicious, crepes done perfectly. Friendly owner and staff . Go there early , expect a full house .
author: R Y.

description:
Definatly, need to update my review.

Got take out, amazing! Fresh and outdone. Even though the restaurant was incredibly busy. Really appreciated the costumer service and going the extra mile.

Can't wait to order again. 

Brunch to go for sure mmmmmmmm :)
author: Melissa F.

description:
This place was mediocre. My husband and I are from LA and decided to go to SF for a spontaneous trip. Was looking for a delicious breakfast spot so we decided to try this place out based on it's high ratings. 

My order was a New Orleans savory crepe-- chicken breast was dry. Crepe was dry
My husband ordered their popular Philly cheesesteak crepe--crepe was not as flavorful as we expected. Not much meat. 

Overall, the long line was not worth it for the food quality.
author: Cee E.

description: I love crepes. These guys make good ones, with some lovely varieties. The spicy chicken in the Miami Heat was excellent, and I loved the Baklava, full of nuts and honey.  Great service too.
author: Adrian M.

description: Checked this place out while I was in town for business.  The line was pretty long at 10:30 in the morning, but it moved along fairly quickly.  I ordered the breakfast crepe, which was essentially a Denver omelette wrapped in a thin crepe.  Overall, it was pretty tasty. I'll have to try one of their dessert crepes next time.
author: Dingus M.

description:
Its a good thing to have a dessert place that can accommodate large groups since most of the other cafe in this area have limited seating/space. This way we can be that obnoxious big group, making sure you can't hear anything other than our chit chat and evil laugh.
As for the food, they were quite generous with the nutella portion. Big blob of nutella, banana, strawberry and a puff of powdered sugar. Come get your sweet calories temptation!

On the side note, crepe actually goes pretty well with wine (Yes, they sell wine). Or maybe my tongue was already numb with nutella sensation.
author: Jenny T.

description: Utensils were not clean and tables were sticky. Had the "fresh" crab cake sandwich and the bean chili. The entrees are not very special and the crab cake must to the store frozen. I would have liked a better experience but ended up terribly disappointed.
author: D L.

description: So my cousin and I ordered huevos rancheros and a strawberry Nutella crepe. The food was great but the only thing I will say is the fresh squeezed orange juice was not good at all. It didn't take sweet at all and it tasted like it was watered down. If they can substitute the orange juice with better oranges then I think this place would be better.
author: Dave S.

description: Vegetarian and mimosas options are not that great . Crepe is good option here.   Would recommend baklava crepe . They have good outdoor seating.
author: Maddy S.

description: Horrible. The reason for so many good reviews is lost on me... and I go out of my way to eat at funky local places. The line doesn't bother me - moved quickly, but the blaring techno music for breakfast was so loud we couldn't even talk, the staff was rude - lost our order and literally threw food onto the table before walking away, food was unimpressive - crepe had over-rip fruit, there were flies buzzing all over and trash swept into corners, and I didn't see any wait staff attempting to refresh coffee. The place is in obvious disrepair and the staff doesn't care. I see no indication they are trying to maintain previous good reviews and they definitely didn't earn it.
author: J D.

description: Saw reviews on this location so my family and I thought we'd give it a try. Line was out the door so we we're excited to see what this was all about. The restaurant is small therefore we were looking out for empty tables before we placed our order. You order and pay then you find where to sit. On a good note their juice is delicious. Freshly squeezed. My daughter didn't care for her iced chai. All in all the food was good. Not WOW but good.
author: Gissel G.

description:
Don't let the long line deter you from waiting...legit breakfast food with a European flair. 

Crab cake florentine is amazing...like benedict but with fresh made crab cakes and spinich!  Delightful! This dish needed salt but it's sexey and gouey and sophisticated. Don't miss the mimosas with fresh squeezed orange juice. Get two!!

It's casual with hip music and affordable prices. Order at the counter. Bustlng even on midweek mornings. Come hungry...portions are good sized.
author: Heather B.

description: This place was super tasty. My wife wanted crepes and we found them on yelp. Worth the walk from our hotel. So many different options and lots of vegetarian options as well.
author: Bill J.

description: TOOTH CRACKED ON FOOD!!!!!! There was a shell (or something else) in my crab cake sandwich causing my tooth to crack. Worst part is the guy tried to say that it would never happen and was extremely rude. Meanwhile I am showing him a piece of my tooth in my hand and he's saying " I don;t tknow that's a tooth" as if I am making up this story. The manager wouldn't even refund my money at first until I was more pushy and brought up a lawyer. He tried to deny it was from the food as if it was my fault. He just kept saying "this wouldn't be from the food I served you, I don't know that's a tooth in your hand."
author: Josh P.

description: We had breakfast here during our visit to San Francisco and had a great experience. The line moves pretty quick, the service was great, and so was the food.
author: Tyne S.

description: I waited in line for this place because of the reviews for about 25 minutes. Ordered the Suzette dessert crepe (which was listed as orange juice, orange zest, butter). I was completely disappointed in the dish. Was literally just a folded crepe with orange juice poured over it. Most crepes have a creme filling to give it weight and this had absolutely nothing inside. For $9 I felt like this was a complete ripoff. I left this place hungry. I ordered a dirty chai latte and that was this place's only saving grace.
author: Brittany V.

description: I always think it's a really good sign when you go somewhere for a bite and it's PACKED. That means there's something there worth trying.  Bonus points are the fresh squeezed OJ, like, seriously fresh. They also give you a big boy glass, none of those wimpy little 4 oz tumblers.  The crepes rock. I had the Miami Heat. It was good. Basic, but good. Great hot sauce on top and big flavor on the chicken. My wife had the pesto chicken one, i think. The only problem I have is we waited 20 minutes in line (okay, it's popular) but another HOUR at the table for 2 crepes.  Steff had to leave because it took so long and I took her crepe to go. It was frustrating and I ate by myself. I felt bad for the people in line watching me sit there by myself waiting for the elusive crepes. I'm sure it's not like that all the time but fair warning. You should really WANT this crepe and be prepared to wait, because good things come to those who are patient. Steff ate her crepe a few minutes ago and it was bomb. That is all.
author: Brian S.

description:
When you first approach the restaurant for breakfast you'll notice a line out the door and wonder if it's worth the wait.  Once inside you see an extensive menu with breakfast served til 3:00.  The poached eggs on crab cake were wonderful as was the omlets.   Service was quick once ordered and they clear a table for you just before you order so no worry about saving a table.   

Friendly staff and I would go back again
author: Russ Z.

description: Great food and amazing service! Will definitely be back when visiting the city! Had French toast and breakfast crepe
author: Contessa R.

description: I never cared for crepe until i tried theirs. The crepe was so soft... very fresh. My friend had hot milk chocolate paired with crepe. He said it was a perfect combination.
author: Kristine U.

description: So we are pretty demanding in restaurants when we travel, but I have to say the Honey Honey Cafe meets the hype.  We found it by yelping what was close and for breakfast this place is 5 stars.  Don't miss out on the fresh squeezed OJ!!!   Oh and order a breakfast crepe and then go back for a pesto.  Big note, get there between 7:30 and 8:15.  By 8:30 the line is out the door!
author: Chip L.

description:
I have to say this is the worst place to dessert. I only gave this place a try because there isn't much dessert places around Union Square. 

Strawberry, banana and kiwi 2/5
It's edible but very plain. It's just fruit and the crepe , no spread or whipped cream. There's ice cream but it's on the side. For the price you paying and you only get to choose ice cream or whipped. It's overpriced. 

Tea 1/5
Smell nice but taste like expired tea. Just taste like water. I have to mention the teapots were dirty too. I didn't want to complain because my friend choose this spot. 

They get one star for effort cuz we did come in when they are about to close in 30 mins. But would not come here again. I'm glad I didn't get upset stomach.
author: Miri L.

description: Food was very tasty! We both had a savory crepe meal and enjoyed it. Line was long on a Sunday because ordering was counter service but only had one person taking orders and grabbing your coffee. There were open tables the whole time. A little frustrating, but generally worth it.
author: James H.

description: Great breakfast spot, can get crowded but worth the wait and line gets thru quickly, veggie omelet with bacon added, and herbed potatoes are the best!
author: Farley J.

description: Every time we're in San Francisco, we HAVE to go to Honey Honey. Great selection of awesome breakfast foods, crepes, sandwiches...serving breakfast foods until 3pm. GO!
author: Mark H.

description:
Food is mediocre and enormously popular with people who like mediocre food. Long lines. Dirty mugs. HAIR IN MELTED CHEESE IN CREPE. Kinda knew what I was getting into but still. 

L8R.
author: O. K.

description:
I'm a meat eater, I mean line my coffin with Bacon when I die.  But I also believe in a balance of life, meat and plenty of it for dinner, ice cream for breakfast, in case I don't make it through a whole day desert is out of the way.  so for lunch I usually have a fresh salad of some sort. and more times then not here at Honey Honey, Well today must have been trash day. Usually the salads are fresh the bread roll tho never looks browned or fully cooked so I let that lay. Two stars for this lunch, your only as good as the last meal you served and for no reason other then throwing this in the trash should it have left the kitchen. 
I've seen fresher and less wilted greens on the side of the road in the Mojave. I had more olive pits at the bottom of the dish then I had olives, it looked like a pebbled walkway.  And for the first time the roll had some golden color to it, but as stale and old as, well I'm not going to make this political so I'll leave DC out of it. But I'd have better chance chewing roofing tile. Someone is sleeping on the job and looks as if they are doing so I a bed of lettuce in the kitchen ( see what I did there? Haha). But seriously shame for allowing this to come to a table as a meal. 

11/10/17. Snuck in today because I do like the place. Salad was cool fresh and crisp.  Couldn't have been more pleased.  Good job.  The rolls still need help, but carbs who needs them anyhow.
author: Giacomo G.

description: It's just ok.  Long line to wait in for so so food.  The salmon Benedict was over salted and the eggs over poached.  We also had the waffle.  The fruit was really fresh and the syrup was great.  The waffle was mediocre.
author: Jason R.

description:
There are so many incredible places to eat in San Francisco, but this is not one of them.

I got the Half Moon Bay Crepe (cheddar, tomato, mushroom, crab cake) and an Iced Chai. Upon ordering, I asked if I could substitute the tomato for avocado. The waitress just responded "No.". Okay... at this point what are my options? Can I take off the tomato? Can I pay extra for the avocado? Just give me options...

The iced chai was a-okay. It tasted more like flavored milk than a traditional chai with cinnamon. Whatever. The crepe itself was also really unmemorable. It came with a side of fruit that looked like it was sitting in one of those refrigerators at Safeway for a few days. The crab cake was unflavorful, just overall bleh.

No clue why this place was a tourists hot spot... My advice would be to take an uber to another part of town and get better food.
author: Nicole W.

description: Wow! Very flavorful and delicious. Don't let the line scare you; it's worth the wait!
author: Brian S.

description:
This place is great, and it has pretty much anything you could ever want in a crepe, savory or sweet. The menu was extensive, offering everything from moussaka to a panini. There was also an impressive breakfast menu that I had to comb through a few times. We stumbled upon it in the evening and had sweet crepes, which were very delicious. I had a strawberry and Nutella crepe and my friend had a banana and Nutella crepe. The coffee is also really good.

All in all, this place has a friendly staff, wonderful service, and great food. I will definitely be back if I'm in the San Francisco area.
author: Steve N.

description: I have always enjoyed Crepevine and this place seems similar but is not as good. Portion sizes are much smaller and quality is not the same. Floors need to be swept, feels dingy.
author: K S.

description: I ordered the Pesto Crepe. It's your average brunch place. Nothing spectacular. But will come back again for food.
author: Lna A.

description:
Although crepery is in the name, there are a lot of different options for food. But, I would recommend the crepes. There is plenty of choices so a decision can be difficult. The sweet crepes come with an option of whipped cream or ice cream which will be one of the hardest decisions of the day. For breakfast I had the Mediterranean savory crepe which was an interesting combination but really yummy. 

When we came on a Saturday morning at 10:30 am, the line was out the door. The only downside I would say was that there was hardly any place to sit inside the restaurant. Some of the tables were still a little dirty too, because they try to clear them as soon as possible. They do serve your food very quickly though. 

My friends and I thought it was so good we came back the same night an hour before they closed for dessert. One employee remembered us and gave us some nice small talk. We all ordered SBK crepes (strawberry, banana, kiwi) and it was a combination of foods I would have never thought of. 

This would be the place to try crepes that are out of the ordinary but still good.
author: Amelia L.

description:
For a quick, basic breakfast this place works great. Huge menu with plenty to choose from, speedy service, and tasty food. My mom and I came here after a few days of ultra indulgent meals and I just wanted something basic so I got the two two and two--two eggs, two pieces of bacon, and two pancakes. Plus a fresh squeezed orange juice. Simple but good. Was exactly what I was looking for.

Nice sized space, reasonable prices, a solid no frills dining experience. Would happily return and look forward to trying the crepes next time!
author: Annette J.

description: A little above average. Honestly the lost remarkable thing about the restaurant was the line out the door that kept moving at a reasonable pace for the food. I'd have expected something somewhat remarkable for the wait, but I guess that's just par for San Francisco with all the tourists. Anyway, service was brisk. I ordered the sunrise burrito and was served in 5 minutes. It was decent, though I think I'd try something else next time as it wasn't all that special. Coffee was Ok. If you want to eat here it's a pretty safe bet.
author: J W.

description: I had the blitz crepe and a side of potatoes. They were very flavorful. My almond latte was perfect.
author: Araceli M.

description:
I've only been here for after-dinner desert crepes but liked it. Then again, I don't think there is any other place in the TL serving desert crepe, let alone at post-dinner hours. All their crepes sounded nice but we only got three desert crepes as there weren't enough of us to try more. Must return for the savory versions too.

The place was pretty sparse at 8:30pm as it was about to close (it is the TL). The place is pretty quiet as a result. They still served us because we were there with a regular, nice, yeah. Basically, you order at the counter, then grab any open table.

The owner was pretty friendly and checked on us to see if we needed anything else.
author: Peter L.

description: Was in town for the weekend and stumbled upon this place due to reviews. Not gonna lie, we were skeptical at first once we saw the building and long line, but glad we stayed! Be prepared to wait in line! Took us probably 15 min to order. You order your food at the register and then they bring you your order within 10 minutes. So it's not too bad despite the large crowd. We were originally going to leave but the bus boy talked us into waiting! Wish I got his name, he was very sweet, attentive and helpful! Besides that, seating can be limited which is why I'm giving this place a 4 star. Large crowd but not enough space. Freshly squeezed OJ! Food was good! Will definitely be returning on our next SF trip.
author: Stephany C.

description: I've never had a savory crepe before this place. I got the chicken pesto crepe and it hit the spot. My favorite was their baklava crepe, such an interesting spin on the regular crepe. I was never dealt apart of the Crepe hype but this place definitely got me hopping on the wagon. The baklava crepe is a little too over stuffed for my liking, but it could be cause I don't love the taste of honey. Latte was great too! You can sub for almond milk.
author: Kayla S.

description:
We ordered a banana + strawberry crepe which is quite simple compared to most of their other options on the menu. I never, ever eat crepes but had to give this place a try with all the hype!! I must say the crepe was quite amazing. We came on a Monday night at 9:30pm so it was pretty quiet. We tried coming again for breakfast two days later and there was a line of about 15 people so I'm sad I didn't get a chance to try more of their crepes! 

Would love to come back!
author: Tony T.

description: A year ago, I came here. I ordered and ate a strawberry crepe. I will never forget this crepe! The crepe was delicious and it was perfect after 4 hours of serving the tenderloin community. The decor is simple but the food is so good!! I'm coming back as soon as possible.
author: Judy W.

description: This place was great ! I had the crepes, potatoes and a mimosa, all were awesome. The only downside was the super long line and wait (which can also be seen as an upside because obviously the place is great if the line was so long)
author: Lauren K.

description: Really cute, good coffee and a large menu. I had the pancakes and they were very good. The lattes had great foam and I appreciate that.
author: Ama P.

description:
Tofu scramble with potatoes-mediocre
Oatmeal-standard
French Toast- dry

Large Restaraunt
author: Tina H.

description: Our hotel concierge recommended Honey Honey after a long flight to San Fran and I'm so glad he did. The breakfast was likely one of the best I've ever had. I wish I could remember the names of the items but my husband had the crab eggs benedict and I had the most divine omelet was black beans and avocado. The fresh OJ mimosas made the meal. It was likely one of the best and certainly the most reasonably priced meals of our stay.
author: Kari H.

description:
We were here on Labor Day this year and didn't think to get up early, which was a bit of a mistake. BUT surprisingly the hour long wait outside was with it for the crepes, croissant breakfast sandwich and convenient location just a block from our hotel.

The variety of breakfast options here are the real star. We so wanted to come back and try more but schedule and budget didn't allow. This is a place I would definitely come back for though!
author: Becca C.

description:
Wasn't our first choice for brunch as there were many to choose from in this area. Decided to line up for this after not liking the selection from our first brunch place and we were not disappointed. 

Expect a line, moves along slowly, but it was worth it. Husband got the post omelette, sub for bacon and I opted for salmon Benedict. Being ridiculously hungry I asked for a side of crab cakes and they honored it as they don't have it on their side menu! (Thank you!). Fresh squeezed OJ to top off an awesome brunch. 

* potatoes don't look too stellar, but flavor is really delicious! 
*Benedict yolks were minimal, but yummy. If they can make it a bit more runny it would be perfect. 
*fresh fruit? Yes! Minimal browning and Fresh

All in all a satisfying experience :)
author: Robyn C.

description:
I love this place. It's great for brunch/breakfast, or any meal of the day rather. The menu is HUGE so there's something for everyone, and you won't get sick of it because there's so much to try! I am one of those people that tends to stick to what they like once they find it, but I wanted to try so many of their dishes, so I'd be down to keep exploring their menu. Major OVERLOAD. 

AMBIANCE: stand in line to order food, then find a table and they bring the food out to you by order number. The restaurant is adequately sized, but it could be larger based on the size of the crowd it draws. When it gets really crowded, it might be hard to find a table, but the turnover is quick. The server was really nice and took our tardy party member's order so that he could sit with us instead of making him stand in the long line since we had already ordered and were waiting for the food. 

FOOD: CRAB CAKE FLORENTINE EGGS BENEDICT (10.95). As all the other reviews have said, this dish is bomb. Gooey eggs, creamy hollandaise, crispy (real) crab cakes, spinach!! YUM. The New Orleans crepe (9.75) was good too- sundried tomatoes and chicken breast up in here! They have everything, from pancakes, to scrambles, crepes, to sandwiches and pasta! 

SERVICE: As I mentioned, you typically don't really interact with the servers that much except when they bring out your food, but we had a really good experience with the staff who went out of their way to help us. That's what makes small places like this great! 

Overall, great value, especially in SF. $10.95 for an authentic crab eggs benedict??? What a steal in this day in age, IN SF. We loved this place so much we ate here twice within a 3 day period. I would definitely recommend this place especially because of its central location close to Union Square.
author: Sara S.

description: Awesome place for brunch and the wait time is not bad at all in 15-20min you order and have a table ready, unlike many places I went to during my stay in San Francisco. I ate here twice during my stay. I recommend it 100%
author: Jaylou V.

description:
Come for the crepes, stay for the big band music. 

If you're going savory you have to try the Mediterranean with artichokes, olives, feta, onion and cheddar-delicious! For sides you can select potatoes, fruit or salad. The fruit was ripe.

Beware the time you get here-the line can be put the door by mid-morning. Beat the crowd-or try or for a late lunch.

For dessert the Nutella Banana is the sure favorite. Dusted with walnuts it comes with your choice of ice cream or whipped cream. You know what to do.
author: Petunia T.

description: TWO LIVE COCKROACHES in my crepe. I'm a local and it makes me sad to see all these unknowing tourists eat in this place of filth.
author: Megan P.

description: Delicious fast food style sit down. You order up front and they'll bring your food to you. My crab cranes were delicious
author: Winston L.

description: Best chopped potatoes I've ever had hands down. Great spot for breakfast or brunch, definitely going back.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
Has a huge selection. Salads, crepes, burgers, sandwiches, soups - perfect place to keep in mind when in the city and not sure of where to go or what to eat.
Great service. Order when you walk in!
author: Anisa A.

description: The food was good but the service was horrible. The brought out the food for everyone else but took 50 minutes to bring out my Belgium waffle and when we would ask, they would respond "there's nothing we can do, you have to wait". Once it arrived they brought it with whip cream even though I asked for no whip cream (dairy allergy). And I asked about this and they yelled stating "what do you want me to do?!? I can remake it but you'll have to wait!!"
author: Elizabeth V.

description: When in san francisco YOU HAVE TO STOP HERE. Extremely delicious, everything was incredibly good. I am very picky with customer service and theirs wasn't thats great, but food was amazing.
author: Aimee K.

description: This was withing walking distance to our hotel.  We waited about 25 minutes, but well...the food would have been worth twice the wait!  I had pancakes and an egg sandwich on a flaky croissant.  The breakfast potatoes were well cooked and seasoned.  Price was very reasonable for the quality/amount of food received and the fact that we were in San Francisco.  Delicious!
author: Pdx C.

description: What a great little cafe! The line that extended out the door was the first sign this place would be delicious! The eggs benedict were cooked to perfection. My only complaint was the side of potatoes were a little burnt. Be sure to get the nutella and banana crepe! You won't be disappointed!
author: Lindsay F.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant today as a first time patron. Food was excellent and choices were amazing on the wall mural menu. An employee by the name of Met gave us our table number early while we were waiting in line to order at counter and ensured we had a table. Greeted with handsome smile.
author: Jay A.

description: Very very very slow service... waited one hour for orders...If you don't have time to wait,not recommended at all... food qualityis average
author: Asena K.

description: I love their food. Mexican salad is delicious. Crepes are awesome. Potatoes are soooooo good. Sometimes the music is REALLY loud and I find myself hurrying to eat so I can leave. On the days when the music is a reasonable volume, it love eating here.
author: Stomparella J.

description: Location was in a good area but the cafe itself was really hot. They have an extensive menu with many choices to choose from. Atmosphere was very modern and cafe feel. I ordered a sweet crepe and I assumed the fruits would be cold since many crepes I've had are like that but not this place. The entire crepe is hot so the fruits taste a little different!
author: Steven W.

description:
Great huge menu options all items we got were top notch Cafe style big portions. 

The orange juice was so good and fresh squeezed.
author: Derek G.

description: Passed this place a couple times while visiting SF and the line was out the door so of course we had to check it out.we went there for lunch and ordered the savory crepes. I had the pesto crepe, I'm a sucker for anything with avocado and pesto. The pesto was delicious and full of flavor and all the veggies were so fresh. The crepe was perfectly cooked. Service was excellent, everyone was very friendly. A perfect spot for brunch!
author: Jessica P.

description: Went for breakfast around 10 on a Monday morning and the place was packed. We waited in line for about 45 minutes which kinda sucked but it all worked out when we placed our order and about 10 minutes later the food was hot, delicious and at our table. The line is intimidating but it was some damn good food and the service is friendly and efficient. Lots of great options. The omelettes are good
author: Tyler T.

description: Would give it 3,5 if I could. However, I waited for quite some time when I arrived because of the long line. The 'Eggs Florentine' tastes good except the potatoes. The fresh orange juice is delicious but the coffee unfortunately not. However, they have almond milk. All in all an okay experience but I'm not sure I would return - maybe without getting a coffee.
author: Ninna H.

description: Was worth the wait of 30 mins on a Sunday morning. Tried crab benedict, tofu scramble and salmon lox, and all of them were excellent. Friendly staff and nice ambience was certainly a big bonus. Will try again...
author: Riyaz M.

description: This place is great. Tried few different things and they were all great. Salmon Benedict is the ultimate breakfast. All in all great food.
author: Stefan T.

description:
This venue doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food here is solid. You can't go wrong with anything, whether the burgers, omelets, sandwiches, salads, and other items, but the main action here is with the crepes. Whether savory or sweet, they come with a good amount of fillings for the price. I found the Philly cheesesteak crepe particularly realistic. Just stick with items that are prepared to order and skip those that are already pre-made (i.e. pastries or other baked goods they might have on the counter). 

Not a bad choice if you're staying at an area hotel and want a simple, cheap breakfast, or if you're running early for a meeting in the area and just want to chill for a few minutes.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Decent brunch/crepe spot, but nothing particularly memorable. I'd come back if I were craving crepes and didn't know a better spot to get them, but I don't think I'd frequent here that much.

I had the CHICKEN PESTO CREPE. Good portion size, but kind of pricey at $10. The savory crepes come with a side of potatoes, salad or fruit (sweet crepes come with ice cream or whipped cream).

The cafe isn't very large and doesn't really accommodate for the long lines on the weekends. You're not allowed to sit down or reserve tables until after you've ordered so that people who have actually ordered can sit down and eat.
author: Jessie L.

description: Always hit or miss on service. Today was a miss. Took them 24 mins to get me my to go order making me late back to work. So i cant even eat my food while its hot. Thanks Honey Honey... Not
author: Christopher R.

description:
