Super strange way of running a breakfast place. We arrived today, Sunday morning at 7:55am. The line was extended halfway through the restaurant, we were like the fifth table in line.  Restaurant is half empty. The line didn't move, the cashier probably took one order every 5-10 minutes. I'm so confused why I keep seeing people write that they have a good system. The Runner/Waitress spends more time asking people to not sit down in seats than she does doing the important part.  We spent 40 minutes in line and 10 minutes waiting for food. How can this place make money? Literally took 40 minutes to get drinks and orders for five parties?  The food isn't even that good...at all.  Also you tip before you receive service, and you don't actually get service.  Super weird focus is more on following this strange system than actually feeding people.  Then, they shut the doors and make people wait halfway down the street. When we finally left,the place was half empty with a huge line...
SAN FRANCISCO:Breakfast is not that hard.
author: Christy B.

description:
The line was out the door on a Saturday morning, but the food is so worth the wait! I had the strawberry Nutella crepe and a few months later, I can still taste it in my mouth. The coffee was average but I definitely had myself a second cup with the crepe. 

As far as service, I actually felt bad for the guys because of the volume of people. They were constantly making food and the bussers were nonstop cleaning, in the dining area. The amazing part is that there were actually tables once we ordered. I was worried about that. So, in the end, I categorize this as an organized, flowing chaos that leaves you experiencing crepes so delicious that you will savor them a few months later

I can't wait to get back to SF and breakfast here again
author: Shamila M.

description: Visiting San Fran for the week and have been going to mediocre breakfast places all week, but this one was actually so good! Got the crab cake florentine it was amazing!!
author: Saadiya D.

description: the guy at fron the register didn't remember that I just pay over 145.00 on lunch at the place. I come back to get water the guys really rude asking me to asking him to get water next time give me a poor looking stick eye. I said ok I apologize for it. then let's the store to never come back. you need to be nice to everyone... I will never bring my family back .
author: Mario C.

description: I mean, it's a step up from ihop, but not a big one. If the wait wasn't an hour, I would give it another star. I think the reason the ratings are so high is because it's rated by tourists.
author: Monica F.

description:
In town and wanted to check this place out because of the reviews. Went in at 9:25 (they closed at 10p) and were told the kitchen was closing in ten minutes. We were made to feel like we were intruding and taking their food.  The place had garbage all over it and almost every table needed to be cleaned off. 
If we weren't walking we would have left. 
Ordered and the food was ok but the service continued to be horrendous.
author: Tamra V.

description: Ordered the post omelette. With no cheese. Veggies were raw and not mixed in the egg. It was like dining at Bob Evans. Just a folded egg with raw veggies inside. Also on top of that, they got mad at my wife because she went and found a table while I stood in line. Not only did they get mad at her, they had a snooty attitude with me when handing my number. The line was atrociously slow. 30+ min to order. When walking to the restaurant - saw some guy peeing in the walkway. And while seated saw some guy jacking off at a street sign. The food wasn't that great that I would dismiss the service and street ambiance.
author: Daimeone S.

description: This place was amazing I found it on yelp and I didn't think it was going to be so good but when we arrive and saw the line of people waiting to order we look at each other and said yes it must be good and we stayed to enjoy this great place I had the crab cake with eggs Benedict .
author: Angel H.

description:
I very much enjoyed this place. The menu was extremely extensive and easily viewable while waiting in line, I loved watching the machine that squeezes the oranges, the location was extremely convenient as it's so close to the big hotels, and most importantly, I enjoyed my crab cake florentine. To make this review short, I didn't think my crabcakes with hollandaise were particularly special, but it was a well crafted crab patty without the over-saltiness I get with cheaper places. The home-fries on the side could've been better (lots of burned pieces, seasoning wasn't creative, some intangible stuff), but were still very acceptable.

Pricing is fair (for being San Fran) at about $12 for the Salmon Florentine, the environment was not too crowded or loud, and the food was great, so although it's not the best place I've been to, but I can still give it a strong recommendation.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Tried the Miami Heat savory crepe. Pretty yummy. Wasn't spicy, but it had great flavor. Their potatoes are super scrumptious tho. 
I would def try this place again. So many options to choose from and friendly staff
author: TigerLily F.

description: oh so delicious! I ordered the breakfast crepe w/fruit, cooked perfectly! My daughter really enjoyed the eggs Benedict.  Really busy in the morning, had to wait 20 min to order.  They have a pretty good system in place getting their hungry patrons in and out. t was so delicious we went back the next day for a late lunch, no wait at all! I got the Greek salad with their homemade dressing was amazing!  Nice environment right on the corner.
author: Zanthia H.

description: Line was out the door, but the breakfast was amazing. You order at the counter. We had eggs, bacon, peanut butter crepe, Nutella crepe and pancakes-and we finished every bite. Was about $55 for four of us, so not bad for SF.
author: Emily G.

description: What a great choice! A really big menu and reasonable prices and portions. As good of value as I would hope to find in downtown SF. The handmade Bloody Mary's are a deal for under $6! Food was great... we'd come back here anytime. I highly recommend it.
author: Brett M.

description: Nice place, decent service, and good vibe, but the food doesn't taste as good as it looks. I had the crab cakes Florentine and a Nutella, strawberry, and banana crepe. The crab cakes dish looked amazing but had no taste and the crepe was way over filled with Nutella, so much so that I didn't finish. The potatoes that came with the crab cakes were also slightly under cooked. I will try again, but for now, they're average at best.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Great food for brunch with the family! I enjoyed a hot chocolate and a Florence crepe while my mother had a special of Phillip steak crepe, which she thought was great as well! The place is clean and there are an abundance of menu selections!

My only complaint is that the line was long and the people working the counter were very inefficient. During my order I was interrupted a few times by other employees. In additions, the employee taking orders also made drinks, stalling the whole process. Overall, great San Francisco brunch experience!
author: Zoe B.

description: The crab cakes Florentine look so amazing here. Too bad breakfast foods are only served until 3. I settled for the half moon bay crepe as I wanted to try the crab cakes. I was expecting a long wait based on all the reviews, but it was surprisingly empty.  The crab cakes were yummy, I'll definitely be back to try the crab cake Florentine.
author: Stella S.

description: This place was amazing!  I had the Mediterranean Crepe with fruits (trying to stay healthy LoL) and it was delicious.  Wish we had a place like this back in Hawaii.  A must go place in San Fran :)
author: Louise G.

description: We stopped in here for an early dinner. It was difficult to choose from all the selections on the menu but we settled on the Half moon bay and Florentine crepe. Both were respectable offerings.
author: Raquelle Z.

description:
Can this place get any cuter?

Staying overnight at a nearby hotel, I was craving for eggs benedict.  Thanks to good ol Yelp, I found a great spot for brunch.

This place can get packed on Sundays so be prepared to wait in line.  Also, do not grab a table until you have paid for your meal and have your number.  Even though it's crowded, the table turnover rate is quick so we didn't have too much trouble finding a table for 4.

I ordered the "Fresh" Crab Cake Florentine and a glass of fresh squeezed OJ to cure my hangover.  

The food was amazing!  It comes with potatoes that are to die for.  It's buttery, creamy, and has a nice balance of soft and crunch.  The crab cake florentine was also amazing.  Very flavorful and filling.

They serve a wide variety of goodies so I'm definitely going back to try some of their other items.
author: Erica C.

description: Long line, long wait, but delicious and so many great options it was hard to choose.  We had no idea where to go for breakfast, but were very happy with thr decision.  Sweet crepes, savory crepes, fresh OJ, good coffee drinks, etc.  Seating and recieving your order (via a numbered sign you take with you after ordering) was a bit disjointed, but reasonable considering the crazy line.
author: Russell W.

description: Best breakfast near Union Square. I went at a high demand time and stood in line for 45 minutes. But the food came super quick after I got the chance to order. You order at the front and get a number to go to your table. Maybe they were just under staffed at the front cashier but all in all I am pleased with the experience and will definitely go back any time I'm in the area and it is breakfast time. Great espresso drinks too. The cappuccinos are huge though which is not a great thing in my book but makes you feel like you got your money's worth.
author: Kim P.

description:
This place is just ok....  I would not go out of my way to eat here or even wait in line if the line is out the door.  Overall the line does move... slowly ...but the customers are entertained by the music and the huge and colorful menu on display.

We had a crepe craving on an early Sunday morning.  The day before our family dined at Crepevine in Berkeley....  which is what prompted our craving for more crepes....  sorry Honey, Honey..... I would stand in a long line for Crepevine, but not for you...  we were there 15 minutes after opening and still waited about 20 minutes to order and then an additional 10 minutes to get the food.

The best thing is the bathroom though....  super clean!  A clean bathroom is always a great indication that other parts of the restaurant are also held to the same standard...
author: Anne W.

description: I had the crepe that had eggplant and sun dried tomato in it. So good! It's an order at the counter place with lots of seating inside and out. I'd go back for sure.
author: Jayne I.

description: Couldn't decide on crêpes, so we got more. The one with salmon (Eden) was great, the Mediterranean was awesome, and the Miami heat had well spiced chicken breast slices. Side of bacon, just because. Highly recommend.
author: sean r.

description: I had the Savannah Salad with chicken it was so good huge size I'm still full & it was very fresh I also ordered a fruit bowl it was also really fresh yummy !!!!
author: Disney R.

description:
Had brunch takeout and it wasn't the best, but not bad either. Crab cake benedict was okay, but the crab cakes had quite a few shell pieces in it and the hollandaise sauce didn't have much flavor. At least it was clear the crab was actual crab. 

We also had the breakfast crepe (differs from the ingredients listed on the menu here on Yelp). It had feta cheese, tomato, and spinach. This one was pretty good actually. The fruit that came on the side was good too.
author: Susan G.

description: This cafe was very busy. The crepe we split, the North Beach was pretty good. The potatoes were a little overdone. The outside seating area a little dirty. The experience was just ok.
author: Louise Y.

description: So far my experience is crap. I had my husband stand in line while I grabbed a table and the busboy told me I need to go back into line because he has people waiting for the table. This is an order at the counter and sit where you want restaurant. As far as anyone is concerned you can sit and wait for a table. If the reason that the order taking is so slow - then you need to change your process.
author: Karolyn M.

description: This place has super yummy food. However, the line is super LONG! So, if you're not in a hurry then give it a try.
author: Shannon K.

description: The food wasn't the greatest, definitely not worth the wait.  I purchased 3 different plates,  none are that great.  I may be bold for saying this but Ihop is better.
author: Al M.

description:
One of the best breakfasts I have had. 
Everyone was so friendly and the food came out quick .
The egg plant was to die for and the desert menus is just amazing
author: Norhan A.

description: This is the best and only place for a great breakfast down town. The friendly staff is always working to make sure their guests have a table. Love their selections. The line is long but the wait is worth it!
author: Rich M.

description: Nice brunch place by Union Square that isn't horribly expensive - sweet deal for $4.50 mimosas
author: Veronica C.

description: I like the atmosphere of this place a lot. The music was good, and it's spacious. I sat by myself with some water while I waited for a chicken burrito, which was pretty good. I wanted to get the fettuccine alfredo, but they were "out of pasta."
author: H M.

description: It was a good place. The service was fast. We ordered the pancake and chocolate chip waffles. They were both okay. Maybe we should've tried the savory crepes. Next time.
author: Verona E.

description: I had the most amazing crepe of my life here! I believe the one I had was the chicken pesto. So full of flavor. I wish I lived in SF so I could come more often!
author: Sally N.

description: Amazing food! Ordered chicken pesto crepe delivery on a busy Friday noon. Fresh, crispy and came with a side of fruits! Highly recommend.
author: Priyanka P.

description: Eggs Benedict. Huevos Rancheros. Waffles. All good -- and the food came out quickly. Perhaps we got in just under the wire, as the line starting stretching while we were eating. This was a Saturday morning, about 9 am. The place sits on the western side of Union Square, so probably close to your hotel! It's the City, so do expect to pay a few dollars more than your country diner, but it's not a trap and there's a very large menu and, if you can't find a table of your own, plop down next to the couple occupying a four top and introduce yourself!
author: T. S. J.

description: This place is awesome! So many options that it's hard to choose. Everything we ordered was delcious. The coffee was great and so was the atmosphere. Out of all of the brunch options San Francisco has to offer,  I'm glad we chose this one.
author: Ashley F.

description:
Honey Honey was good not great to me. The concept is good but the vegetables in the crepes weren't sautéed properly and we're basically raw.  

Service was good may need to slow down a bit and make sure the food quality is a bit better.
author: Curtis W.

description: Blant food, super expensive, super loud pop music, nice interior, but everything else is one star, my Milano ommlet supposed to have basil(seems like they have only one leave which they shred it to make looks like some basil), but I did not feel any taste of basil. I had to ask staff to pour hot tea for me, because teapot was broken and hot water pour all over the table, no paper napkins in room given except one together with fork. Staff are trying to be helpful but they are not friendly, understaffing is the obvious problem. Consider that I paid $20,35 for not tasty small size ommlett, burnt to black wheat bread, hot tea and 20 tips, I don't know how it's possible to have 4 stars rating for this place. The only plus is nice looking interior, nice name and nice looking attractive exterior.(((
author: A. B.

description:
I visited this morning, after the first location I wanted to go to was nothing more than a hole in the wall.  I walked here, it was a LONG walk and I was hungry.  When I arrived, the line was long, it was a good half hour wait.  In the time I waited, I got to observe a lot. 

I can say that customer service is not their priority.  Yes, they're busy, so they're crowded, but when a customer complains, or asks for something different because they don't like what you served them,and there is MORE than half their entree on the plate, the answer is not "I'm sorry." And brush it off, you work to correct it.  Instead the young gentleman (I do believe he is the owner's son) simply didn't want to be bothered with the woman's complaint.  In the end, the other gentleman (The guy who seats you) spoke to the matter and they got the situation fixed, but PLEASE, hear your customers out, or you won't have them, No matter HOW good your food is. 

Speaking to the food: We ordered the Breakfast burrito, a Park Omlette & a Strawberry/Nutella omlette.  The Breakfast burrito was -humongus- It was Gigantic, and the flavours were nice. BUT... the black beans it was served on? They were cold.   The omletle was large as well, served with a side of fruit: the eggs on the outside were warm and fluffy, but the filling was barely hot. *Shrug* Still, very tasty and the fruit - especially the strawberry & bananna was SO GOOD.   

And the Nutella/Strawberry Crepe ... This.. This was heaven.  Their crepe was fantastic and I would go back, I would brave the line and the rudeness I saw.   JUST... For... This!

Ps: Please, Please have your wait staff wear deoderant. Body odor when a server delivers food is unpleasant.
author: Dianna B.

description: Yes, you may have to wait in line, but the food is delicious. Lots of options! I had the best waffle and the coffee is delicious. Fresh squeezed OJ, too
author: Lee M.

description: Not entirely sure what the big deal is here. I'm going to give it another shot. The food is perfectly okay, but the line... oh my god the line. The place opens at 7:30, I get there at 8am on a friday and I'm in line for 40 minutes... and the line wasn't out the door. I see people line up here all the time and I'm not getting it yet.
author: Leo I.

description: Was looking for breakfast in San Francisco, and found this in union square. The line was out the door, but it was worth it! Their crepes are to die for, and their freshly squeezed orange juice tops it all off. I'm picky with food, and there were so many options and I was sure to love them all! Definitely recommend for anyone. The staff is very friendly, and the menu is very clear when you walk in. You get in line to order, then get seated and wait around 10 minutes for your food. Overall good experience!
author: Madison S.

description: Such a delightful find in the City of good eats!  I had the grilled chicken with the pesto, lettuce , tomato , and a baguette. Could not have been any fresher and tasty. I could eat here every day with the wide variety of foods on the menu. And if you are in a hurry, no problem the orders come quick.
author: Nyomi B.

description: What an unfriendly cashier lady, never coming here again. Came here for a brunch on a Saturday, the line was long, and the lady was absolutely not friendly to my friend, arguing with her about how she should eat her eggs! that's unheard of.... the food was okay, nothing worth mentioning after that experience.
author: Aziz A.

description:
Honey Honey was not so sweet.
On Sunday at 9, there was a line about 20 deep.

Breakfast places in Union Square can be limited I know,
especially if you are limited on the dough.

They have a menu similar to Squat and Gobble with crepes and omelet dishes
to say they have good bloody mary's would be fictitious.

The women in the place were nice, but the men not so much.
You can't sit before you order, you have to wait for something to open up.

The food was decent and the drinks watered down.
It's not worth the line, there are so many more better places in town.

The location is the appeal, close to hotels for the tourists that don't want to stray
so if you have time to kill and you're cool with everyone's food coming out 
at different times, then this place is just okay.
author: Kristi G.

description: We figured when there was a line out the door on a Sunday morning that this restaurant would be worth the wait, and it definitely did not disappoint. We had the most amazing peanut butter crepe from the specials board. It was absolute perfection! Everything else was good too. Our party had the crab cake eggs Benedict, Mediterranean crepe, and chicken apple sausage. Huge portions and delicious food explain why there was a line around the corner when we finished eating!
author: Aimee M.

description: GREAT FOOD!  The line may look overwhelming. Don't let it scare you off. Get in line and then when you get close to the front someone comes and asks how many people you have and they assign you a table.  I had the crab cake florentine and it was DELICIOUS.
author: Kim C.

description:
A restaurant specializing in crepes! Like Crepevine, but not Crepevine! Okay, so which one's better??

~ O r d e r ~
Crepe I tried was just okay-ish. I ordered the Eggplant Crepe, veganized (no cheddar), and I completely understand that it would've tasted better without the omission. The crepes themselves weren't very different from Crepevine's; texture and taste were roughly the same, but I felt that Crepevine serves larger potions.
Like Crepevine, each crepe entree comes with your choice of potatoes or fresh fruit (for an extra $1.50). I went for the potatoes, which were nothing special; they def could've used some more seasoning.
     
Honey Honey is pretty easy to spot bc it's painted bright yellow, and it's furnished with some... interesting(?) decor. Honestly wasn't sure at all what to make of the design, and the tables were a bit sticky (euch). But our server was friendly!

Menu options are pretty similar to Crepevine's, and service was roughly the same. You stand in line to order, then take a number from the cashier and find a seat. Beverages are also self-serve. But I def prefer dining in a cleaner and more brightly lit restaurant, so I don't think I'll be coming back to Honey Honey!
author: Claire L.

description:
Theres a reason why the line is always out the door for breakfast. It's because it's great food!
If you're around family or friends who you love and care about (also would be willing to let you pick off their plate) you're going to really enjoy your meal.

This is not the place you want to go to if you're in a hurry to eat and go. If you're looking for a place to sit down and enjoy your meal with people you care about then this is the place you should go to!
Sure the line is a little long and it could take 10-20 minutes just to get to the counter and order but it's worth it.

Also for chai tea fans like me, they know how to make chai tea correctly...
Also the orange juice is freshly squeezed no sugar needed to be added at all. 

Oh and pick off each others plates to get a taste of everything if you're indecisive :)
author: Alexis M.

description:
Usually when you see a line out the door it means the food is phenomenal. Not so much. I got eggs Benedict and they overcooked the eggs. Hard yolks. Gross. Hollandaise had zero flavor. Was just wet greasy yellow stuff. 

My wife ordered a strawberry Nutella crepe. They brought her a regular Nutella crepe and when she sent it back, they just shoved a bunch of cold strawberries inside and returned it all mangled. 

The food was blah at best. I'd say it deserves 2 stars but I'm giving it one to help bring down the rating which is way too high for this forgettable food.
author: Gavin F.

description: Amazing!! Food was so tasty! I had the Croissant Sandwich and my oh my it was soo good!! The cheese was melting all over (my preference) and the potatoes were crispy and well seasoned. I received my order very quickly so it made up for the long lines. I also had the iced mocha which I've had better. But good enough. Definitely a place I would recommend and return too! I plan on trying out more items on the menu next time.
author: Ana J.

description:
One star off cause I really wanted to try their breakfast entrees but they stopped serving breakfast by the time we came in. 

Butt, everything else from the food, service and how fast the food came out was great. I think the manager or owner was there and he came to check on us too. The place is a good size and I can see it being busy and packed for breakfast however we came after 3. The actual food is a good portion and was delicious. I got the half moon bay with potatoes and the crab inside the crepe was cooked right. Also got some mimosas which the guy made perfectly - cause how hard is it to make that? You'd be surprised. The place is also really affordable especially for the amount of food you get. I'd love to come back to try their breakfast.
author: Danielle V.

description: Solid breakfast spot. Would definitely return. Bloody Mary was pretty tasty. Salmon Benedict was good. Potato was excellent. Crepes were a little dry but really tasty. Annoying that you have to wait in line rather than put your name on a list. Waited a long time on Sunday morning. But that is to be expected.
author: Jonathan N.

description: Just having arrived from London the night before I went to Honey Honey on a Sunday morning at 8. The line to order was almost all the way from the front door to the counter in the back, took about 15 minutes to get to order. I had salmon eggs benedict and a latte. The latte was done in express tempo by the person taking my order, the opposite of carefully made artisan coffee. The main dish arrived quickly, a generous portion but not very well made. It felt rushed, the eggs were too runny and the potatoes was unevenly salted. If you crave a lot of calories, and want the anti-hipster experience I guess this is a decent option.
author: Noa R.

description:
My friend had told me great things about this place so we had to check it out when in SF. We got the Milano scrambled eggs, the salmon benedict, and of course the strawberry Nutella crepes. 
I'll start with the good: the Milan scrambled was amazing, it had garlic and it gave it a great taste (well if you like garlic). The strawberry Nutella was so good that I literally had to stop talking, and savor the taste. They were not stingy with the Nutella at all unlike a lot of other places.
Ok now to the sad part: the salmon benedict was the worst salmon benedict I have ever had!:( It was cold. The English muffin was soggy and chewy. The eggs were cold as if it was someone else's order but had gotten canceled and they gave it to me! The whole thing was so tasteless I couldn't eat it.
will go back for the Nutella crepe anytime though :)
author: Shadi D.

description: Great place for breakfast. Crowded but it's worth waiting for the crepes. You can forego lunch after this. The homestyle fries are delicious.
author: Nuthan S.

description: I don't give 5 stars very often. This place is a gem. The food is excellent, fresh tasting and not heavily salted. Omelet and crepe that we ordered were perfectly cooked. Prices very reasonable. They give you a number and assign you seating while you're in line. Not the best ambiance, but food makes up for it. Go early.
author: Mary B.

description:
This place has been in my bookmarks for the longest time lol, had to try it at one point.

Came in on a gloomy morning, so the place looked really dim. But nonetheless, it wasn't dead, there was a good amount of patrons inside already. The menu's posted on the right side of the place, and it's HUGE. there's a wide array of food to choose from, ranging from breakfast foods, to lunch and dinner foods as well.

I ordered the blintz dessert crepe, which is basically a strawberry jam, orange marmalade, ricotta cheese, and strawberry crepe. It can be served with ice cream but I decided not to add it cuz the day was cold. I also ordered a Crab Cake Florentine. You pay after you order, so basically you can just leave once youre done eating lol.

The food comes out pretty fast, depending on how busy the place is. We got our food quite quickly. If you're not a super big fan of sweet stuff, I suggest you not get the blintz crepe. Its a beautifully decorated crepe, and it was really sweet. The orange marmalade gave it a citrusy kick. But the ricotta cheese really complemented the sweetness and it came out alright. The crab cake Florentine was pretty good also! The crab cake was nice and fluffy, not burnt. And it tasted great with the eggs on top. 

Pretty nice place, reminds me of Crepevine or Squat and Gobble.
author: Jerianne G.

description: Was looking around for a place to have brunch in SF that was close to my hotel and found this place.  IT WAS AMAZING!!!!  They have the best menu in SF and everything on their menu is delicious. I ordered a Salsa Crepe and was blown away on how much flavor it had!!  Next time I come to SF I'm coming here,  the owner was a really cool guy and came to our table to makes sure we were happy and even gave us a free strawberry crepe!  Thanks for the Experience and everyone should go here!
author: Ahmad O.

description: I would not come back again. I ordered Lox on an everything bagel. They brought me a plain bagel, with no explanation! The lox was in a glob and the center was the gray-brown fat layer between the skin and the flesh. I brought it back and the manager argued with me. Reluctantly she gave me more salmon just again to include the same gray-brown fatty fringes. Meanwhile the bagel became soft and soggy, she scraped that on a new plate and I was left without onions and capers... not accommodating, not nice people! Also, the prices in the restaurant are about $1.50 per item more then posted on their website... And there's no air conditioning, it's hot and muggy...
author: Andy S.

description: Excellent and friendly staff at this close to Union square crépe haven. Both meal and dessert crépes are tasty. Good baristas as well.
author: Fredrik W.

description:
My family and I ordered the strawberry and Nutella crepe, SBK crepe and some eggs + mocha and orange juice, it cost us 40$ 

They have a lot of things to chose from 

And the food was good !
author: Sara A.

description: I had the chicken pesto crepe and it was delicious. Great portion size for brunch to start the day off right. The staff is friendly and once you order the food comes out quickly. The line is long but it's worth the wait. I arrived around 7:45am and had finished eating and left by 8:15am.
author: Bose' A.

description: This is one of the best things about SF!  Even though it was busy, the waitstaff was very attentive, the Crepes were awesome and so was the orange juice.
author: Marion F.

description: Such a great spot!!  We were on our way to a farmers market and saw the looonngg line of people streaming outside this place and just had to stop. The Miami Heat was a wonderful savory breakfast and our kids loved the Nutella and Strawberry crepe as well as the pancakes. Fantastic Bloody Mary, albeit a little spicy. Every morsel of food was consumed!!! Couldn't think of a better way to start our vacation!!!
author: Steven V.

description: Excellent breakfast spot! Got the croissant egg sandwich and very pleased. Good latte.
author: Chloé R.

description: I would like to give a higher rating for this place. Given that the breakfast line was out the door and it was a 30 minute wait to just get to the counter, I'm guessing it's pretty good. Got one more day here so will try to get in before the crack of dawn to check it out.
author: TJ L.

description: This place is amazing! Great food every time I come! They have some of the best potatoes I've had. I've been twice and gotten the eggs Benedict and the second time got the eggplant crepe, both were very good. If you are a tea lover you have to try their vanilla bean tea! The food comes out fast, and the employees are pretty nice a well. The only thing I would recommend is coming in either earlier than 9 or around 11 because between 9-10:30 the line will be out the door.
author: Emily L.

description:
They have a great menu, I had the Chorizo scramble (they did mistake my order at first but fixed it up quick) coffee was top notch. 
I think I'll try them at lunch next time in town.
Came back tried a breakfast crepe and it was awesome. I'm not likely to try a desert crepe but the ones I've seen look crazy good.
author: Dale H.

description: If you're a crepe fanatic this is the place to go- savory or sweet, traditional or very unique, this is the place for a most delicious crepe!
author: Annie W.

description: 3 stars nothing spectacular nothing bad,orange juice was good potatoes are good got the north beach crepes I've had better hollandaise and I've had worse hollandaise sauce, friendly staff nice atmosphere. Nice selection of Hotsauce this is the California version of IHOP but overpriced if your looking for good price go to Texas
author: Brian B.

description: My fav place and close by where I live! Such a convenient place to stop by. Food is really good and fresh orange juice is awesome! Even tho long time but worth it to wait. Service is great and friendly. The restaurant also clean and neat. Must try!! I recommend.
author: Aunggie N.

description: Exactly what I wanted to find on my vacation. A neighborhood spot with an awesome selection. The Crabcake Benedict looked amazing. A peanut butter crepes was on special and was AMAZING. Definitely a must try
author: Amanda H.

description: Great spot.  The staff is great and super accommodating.  We have eaten in and gotten take out.  Accurate take out is hard, and they nailed it!  The potatoes are delicious.  We have had an assortment of menu items and all have been spot on.  Don't overlook this great place!
author: Melissa K.

description: I had the French toast & the fresh orange juice & I was very impressed & satisfied. It can be a bit pricey depending on the person but overall you get quite the bang for your buck.
author: Abdisalam H.

description: Wonderful place!  The owner was especially helpful with my elderly mother.  Food was fast and really good. Great coffee too!
author: Lesly A.

description: I enjoyed an excellent cup of tea and the Belgian waffle. It was the perfect ending to a trip to San Francisco!
author: Hannah S.

description: Everything about this place is great. Expect a long line but it's worth the wait. We will defiantly come again!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Please tell the chef to cook the onions before putting the in the crepe!   Sharp, raw onions in a breakfast crepe??
Very little service.   Be prepared to walk around to pickup everything you need.
author: Debra L.

description: Tables with half eaten plates and dirty dishes everywhere. Both burnt and undercooked crepes. Old bad tasting fruit.
author: Kevin G.

description: Nothing special. Good service, long wait, basic crepes. Big hype but I guess a lot of places in Sa Fran fall under the same category
author: Vladimir F.

description: Long wait in line for weekend brunch and not much by way of ambiance, but there's a ton of seating and food came quickly. The huevos rancheros was good but the salsa definitely needed a little more heat/flavor. Pretty good diner-esque food, but I probably should've gotten the crepes because they looked way better than any of the other food.
author: Rachel K.

description:
Unfortunately our experience at Honey Honey was a No No.

Prices seemed decent until we received our food. Messily plated and not too appetizing. Baklava Crepe was too chewy and overfilled with walnut but no cinnamon or sugar and very little "syrup". Eggs Benny was undercooked, very little flavor in the sauce and potato side was over spiced and dry.

Hopefully it was a one time thing, we might try it again but I feel sorry for the people that feel this is a good place to eat. In a town like San Francisco with as many restaurants as there are you only get one shot to gain a customer
author: Ikaika F.

description: Oh. My. Lamb.  Had the savory Philly cheese-steak crepe and it was so dang good ! The potatoes that come with it are seasoned so good I can't even deal. Ended up getting the SBK desert crepe and once again, on point. They do get busy fast, starting at 8 there's always a line,not always super long, but a little wait. Totally worth it ! Oh! And their freshly squeezed OJ?!
author: Helen S.

description:
Very impolite person (Ahmed) came to our table and asked to leave even we were waiting for order. Nice place but never seen treatment in San Francisco. He kept saying "I don't care"
So we stand up and went back to line to pick up our already ordered crepes.
author: Orhan G.

description: Stopped in for a quick lunch while exploring the city. Had the apple-turkey sandwich and Nutella crepe. Food was fresh and delicious. The Nutella crepe was the I've had outside of Paris.
author: Heather M.

description:
The food here is worth the wait. Tons of good breakfast options from eggs Benedict to Belgian waffles, of course Crepes are their claim to fame. I got a tip the Waffles were amazing from my concierge at the hotel. 

You'll wait about 30 minutes on the weekend for breakfast so be ready to stand. The line moves quicker than you think and luckily the menu is parallel to the line, genius! You order at the counter and get a number placard for your table, yes, you have to find your own table. Once seated sit back and relax because your food will be out in about 8 minutes. (Unscientific hypothesis based solely on observation during my stay) 

I had the breakfast crepe and one pancake. Crepe filled with: eggs, cheese. Onion and bell pepper; it comes with ham but I substituted chorizo. (Must be my AZ roots) The pancake was a 10 out of 10, which those of you who know me says a lot for them. (#pancake snob) The breakfast crepe comes with your choice of potatoes or fruit. I got the potatoes and they were perfect, soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. 

My only negative of the place was once I got halfway through my coffee I noticed my coffee cup was dirty on the inside, a small mistake but gross not withstanding. 

Atmosphere is awesome and it's close to union square. Seems to be a good mixture of locals and tourist. I would highly recommend this establishment to anyone looking for an awesome breakfast experience!
author: Henry R.

description: People in up out the door for the food here.  Perhaps I should not have ordered a savory crepe. It was bland.  The ham is lunch meat. The breakfast crepe lacked flavor. The potatoes are yummy. The OJ is delicious. The tea selection solid. The front counter is inefficient.
author: Christiana H.

description: Long line out the door on a Saturday morning, but it was worth the wait. Food isn't mind blowing, but solid breakfast joint. Had the Salmon Benedict, my friend had the traditional Benedict, and another had an omelette. The hollandaise sauce was good but not great. I heard the omelette was just ok. I'd recommend this spot though and if I lived in that neighborhood would likely frequent this spot.
author: KC C.

description: this place is very San Francisco. Coffee was very good and loved the breafast crepe and waffles. Service was not that excellent but I understood people lined up for ordering and was really busy. Price was reasonable and definitely will come back.
author: Jenna K.

description: The food here was great! It's busy but goes so smoothly and the staff are great. Totally recommend!
author: Nathan B.

description: This place is good. My family and I have eaten here for breakfast a few times when we've stayed in the neighborhood. There's a wide variety of foods and we all enjoyed our meal. I'd get there early though, the lines can be long, but the service is efficient and excellent, so you won't wait too long. It's just popular!
author: Christa F.

description: This place is pretty easy to find. Our hotel was around the corner so it was walking distance. As we arrived, the line was out the door. We probably had a 45 minute wait. No need to save a table as someone will give you a table for your party.  We had a few savory crepes, I had the chicken pesto and my friend had the New Orleans. Both were delicious and would order both again. We also had the SBR (sweet crepe), finished it with no problem. Highly recommended.
author: Co R.

description:
Honey honey is an above average breakfast spot. We waited in line for 20 minutes, which wasn't bad. 

One thing I would suggest they change is how people are seated. A lady told us where to sit. Once we sat down she came back over and told us to move because we were at a 4 person table (not our fault). As we were waiting for our food, I saw different workers going around moving people to different tables (at least 3 other groups) I found that off putting...

Once our food came out it was good but not great.

The waffle/eggs Benedict/crepe was decent, coffee was ok , the orange juice was great and prices were cheap.
author: Andrea H.

description: I came here wanting to get, of course, a crepe for brunch, but I ordered Florentine Benedicts instead cause I just had a decent crepe at the Crepe House nearby a few days back. The food didn't particularly stand out... I mean it was acceptable but I've had far better benedicts before. What's more, the restaurant itself is quite old and not very cozy.. so I don't really get the popularity and the crowd. Perhaps their crepes would give an answer but I guess I'll never find out! :P
author: Molly H.

description: Loved this restaurant. Delicious and varied breakfast choices. Wonderful eggs and apple chicken sausage. There was a line out the door but it moved quickly and service was prompt.
author: Susan A.

description:
Awesome breakfast place with a lot of options. On our last day in San Fran, my girlfriends and I were having a hard time finding a brunch place, but stumbled upon this place while taking a walk. I got the eggs Benedict with potatoes and it was a great portion + very delicious. The potatoes were a good type of spicy, and the eggs Benedict had a great hollandaise sauce. They also have fresh squeezed orange juice! 

I would recommend coming early since around 10AM the line was very long to order.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
The food was really good. Very crowded on a holiday Monday noon, but I was lucky to get a great little table while my friend waited in line to order.

I had the Half Moon Bay crepe & added avocado and my friend had the crab cakes Egg Benedict minus the spinach. He would have preferred the eggs to be a bit softer. I thought the crepe was dry on top & needed a sauce, so used the mild tabasco on the table but would have preferred something like fresh pico de gallo b/c I didn't want to add spice to my crepe.

They make their Bloody Mary drinks with sake; they were very nice. That's how they can get away with Bloody Mary's & only have a wine & beer license.

My iced chai had to be returned though (I had to get up & return it myself.) They didn't put enough chai concentrate and it was mostly iced milk. They remade it better & I added nutmeg & cinnamon from their shakers which helped. For that I would knock down this review to 3.5 stars, but Yelp doesn't have half stars, so I will give the benefit of the doubt this time.
author: N. F.

description: Who doesn't love breakfast/brunch good?! The line is usually out the door. Small space. Not good for big groups. Order first then sit & eat. HUGE menu selection reminded me of crepevine. Reasonably priced. If I remember correctly, I got the crab cake Benedict or florentine. Housemade potatoes are soooo good. I ordered a side of bacon & only got 2 slices.. -___- other than that, my meal was deliciouuuuus! I am definitely coming back here!
author: Vangielynne P.

description:
Order at the counter and they bring it to your table.  Extensive menu with pasta, burgers, soup & salad, sandwiches, desert crepes, savory crepes, eggs & omelettes, pancakes, breakfast specials, and daily specials. 
We ordered crepes, eggs, pancakes, and eggs Benedict. 
On a Monday at about 11:00, with a line of about twenty in front of us we were at the counter in about 15-20 minutes. Our food came in 10 minutes. 
The crepes were fine, like all the others I've eaten. Eggs Benedict were a bit spicy (which is fine if you like spicy), pancakes were overcooked. Overall, it's cute, in a good location, and has average food.
author: Judy H.

description: Horrible place. The server asked me to get up but didn't ask the other person to get up. If the rule is really u can't sit until u finish ordering it should be applied to everyone. The server guy was jus being a whim n is intimated by the other male customer and choose to pick on me instead. Stupid place
author: Trish P.

description: Unfortunately, we had a tough experience at this restaurant. While we were waiting on our food, a homeless person walked in and took a table next to us. They gently asked her a couple of times to leave, but she decided not to. They then threatened to call the cops as she got a little more rowdy, but they didn't. Ten to fifteen minutes went by as this lady stared at us and mumbled "stupidos" in our direction. Still nothing was done. Then, after waiting in line and for our food for like an hour, the food was delivered. The homeless lady's murmurings rose to a crescendo - "STUPIDOS, STUPIDOS" she was yelling now. The waiter that delivered our food fled - to where, who knows? The lady got up, her urine smell had now filled our corner of the restaurant, "GIVE ME THAT!" She exclaimed at us, while approaching our table. My wife got up and fled, and I sat there, hoping to reason with her, hoping someone from the staff of Honey Honey Cafe would help us, their paying customers. "No, that's ours," I meekly replied, knowing my hourlong wait would now be in vain. The lady just grabbed our food off of our table, and with one final "STUPIDO" she went back to her table and ate our food. I was standing back from our table now, desperately looking for someone to help us. Instead, the waitstaff had fled behind the counter. One seemed vaguely sorry for us as he offered to get us more food. We just asked for our money back and left. The girl at the register even seemed kind of annoyed. We had to push past a line of about 25 people, some carrying Chanel purses, as they somehow decided that they still wanted to eat at a restaurant that allowed homeless people to hang out and steal customers' food. Maybe some were excited to grab our now vacant table? Really bummed by this experience and disturbing lack of customer service. Why didn't they call the cops immediately? Why weren't they more forceful in asking her to leave? Why weren't the apologies more sincere? Why weren't we offered some kind of voucher? Hope they can sort this kind of thing out in the future. Maybe a new manager who will actually maintain the safety of the restaurant?
author: Zack Q.

description:
Sundays aren't always siesta days.  Sometimes we're busy city people.  This would be an ideal place for breakfast if you have a bit of time--but not the whole morning to wait for dine-in breakfast.  There were about 3 people in line at 9am when I entered this cute joint.  By the time we left, the line almost reach the door.  It's well-sized, not too crowded.  I like this atmosphere.  It reminds me of college where we'd ordered at the cashier, take our ticket, sit down, and chit chat while we wait to be served our food.  They have a delightful water pitcher and petite decor.  They also sell some bakery/pastry goods (ie. macarons) and a variety of juices and wines.

Today we shared a Salmon benedict and SBK crepe.  (SBK stands for strawberry banana kiwi, with a hint of cinnamon and brown sugar w/ a choice of whipped cream or ice cream).  The fruit inside was warm, so that took a little getting used to.  The smoked salmon reminded me of lox with the tomato beneath it.  I usually don't take notice of hollandaise, but today I did because it tasted good.  I'll be back :) I have yet to try their savory crepes & sandwiches, and it's so closely located to Union Square.  Kudos to the clean bathroom, too.
author: Janet T.

description:
Alright well, this place is pretty dang good. We came here on a Sunday and as expected.. there was a decent line going on here. When I came in seats changed pretty often so it was easy to grab a seat for two of us. If you bring a ton of people on a weekend though, you may be disappointed at the lack of seating.

We both got Milano omelette with bacon. Absolutely amazing! Mmmm! It was done great, decent amount of bacon. It was priced great for being in its location. I'd definitely come back!
author: Clayton B.

description: Pretty long wait to get seated and order (about 45 minutes). Ordered a crab cake sandwich and it was very good. Home fries that came with it were just okay. Ordered a vanilla itallian soda as well and I thought it was pretty gross. Girl behind the cashier seemed like she didn't want to be there. All in all, just okay.
author: Izzat A.

description: I ordered a North Beach Crepe with an over medium egg on top of my potatoes.  45 minutes later, a breakfast Crepe came out with an over medium egg over my potatos. It's was good, however, it wasn't what I ordered.  My friend ordered the huevos Rancheros and it came out with a cold tortilla and everything else such as the avocado, sour cream, and salsa came out after, separately, after we asked for it. My other friend, got her order immediately, however, after being so polite her food ended up being so cold too.  I was seriously looking forward to the North Beach and ordered the egg on top of my potatoes because I really wanted an egg and the North beach didn't come with one...  maybe next time if there is a next time.
author: Leilani L.

description: Food was great!. There was a line down the street but it moves fast. As people eat they leave which allows others to get a seat . Funny I never saw anyone jus hanging around waiting for a seat !!. Now I had the crab cake Benedict
author: Rose A.

description:
Came here on a busy Saturday morning with a group of 5. I believe you have to order before you can take a seat, so no saving tables. 

I was so disappointed with my Crab Cakes Florentine... I was expecting something similar to Bill's Crab Cakes Benedict, but Honey Honey didn't measure up.

My biggest issue with this dish was that everything was so bland!!! The crab cakes, the hollandaise sauce, and the potatoes. Bland, bland, bland! My eggs, however, were poached perfectly. 

The mimosa was a joke - my friends nearly finished theirs in one sip, although most of the mixture was champagne.

Very cute and quirky atmosphere. Love the giant menu on the wall. That's pretty much all I liked about the place. Will probably go with something on the sweeter side if I ever come back - can't mess that up right?
author: Dorothy L.

description:
Known as one of San Fran's breakfast gems, and I can see why. Fresh squeezed oj, good coffee, and tasty breakfast. (And of course all kinds of crepes.) Minus one star because the poached eggs on my crab cake florentine were overcooked, but otherwise a darn good breakfast. 

If I'm staying in nob hill again, I'd love to explore the menu further.
author: Sy N.

description:
HUGE menu with many many options.(menu type reminded me of crepevine) I like how this place is open for the whole day meaning people who happen to get a super late lunch (around 2-3) can find places to go. When I went, there was no line, probably bc of the awkward time.

Interior:
I personally didn't really like the wall decor or the bright yellow sign on the outside of the store. The inside looked a bit low lit and the yellowish lighting of the store made it look worse.

I decided to order:
- Miami Heat Crepe (avocado, chicken, cheese, scallions, hot sauce) with potatoes (~$12)

The potatoes were just okay but the crepe was delicious!! It was very flavorful and all of the ingredients in my crepe tasted good together.
The hot sauce is actually pretty spicy so if you're not a fan of spicy foods maybe order without it.

Overall, great food but okay ambiance. Might come back if I'm in the area and craving some savory crepes.
author: Kelley L.

description:
Worst dining experience! Would NOT RECOMMEND.

A group of 8 of us from out of town decided to stop here for a weekend brunch, which of course is going to take more time, but we decided to wait. They make you stand in line for about 30+ minutes without a list you can put your name on or anywhere to sit. Which sucks, but we could have lived with.

They served our coffee boiling hot, and curdled the soy latte drink that 1 person ordered. When they tried to return it the barista said there's "no way to not curdle soy" and to just drink it anyways. Refused to accept it back. No one would seat us, and since everyone behind us in line took the tables we had to crowd 8 people around 2 small 2-person tables at either end of the restaurant. Of course once we were done eating they sat the group of people behind us and set some tables up for them.

When we got our food they left an INCH-LONG METAL SHAVING sticking out of the potatoes! When we tried to return it the owner of the restaurant laughed in our faces, threw us a $10 bill out of the register (NOT a full refund for the meal) and said they wouldn't do anything about it.

The drinks were boiling hot, the food was half cold, the service was beyond terrible and insulting. I'd recommend finding another brunch spot.
author: Imandra M.

description:
Ideally I would give this place 3.5 stars, but I'll round up for the friendly personnel. The restaurant has an extensive menu offering, so there should be something to satisfy everyone in your group. The salmon scramble with seasoned potatoes is my favorite dish, but the french toast and sweet crepe options are also good.

Be warned that this place is located in Union Square and is highly rated on TripAdvisor, so expect long lines of tourists on the weekends. If you're in a rush, order ahead for takeout and bypass the line when you go to pick up your order.

By the way, the font and design of the wall menu is exactly the same as that of Crepevine! The menu offerings are also similar, but, at least based on my experiences with the Berkeley Crepevine, I'd easily recommend Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery over Crepevine.
author: Rodney G.

description: So many possibilities so I'll need to visit again! I had their signature breakfast crepe with fruit and it didn't disappoint! Even the fruit was appealing instead of canned or unripe fruit! I'm no crepe expert but I really enjoyed this!
author: Barb V.

description: Dined here for brunch with my girlfriends and we liked it so much we came here two days back to back. Great selection on the menu with a number of specials as well. Don't be turned off by the long line or worried about getting a seat because the turn around time is pretty fast.  Would have liked the eggs florentine more if the English muffin was toasted more so I would give that dish 3-stars. Prices are pretty reasonable for the amount of food you get.
author: Elle W.

description:
Saturday morning at 9am, 30 min wait to be seated. Order/pay at the counter,  but food served to table. Food arrived within 10 min of ordering. 

Crab Cakes Florentine (me), Miami Heat savory crepe (hubby),  and Dulche sweet crepe (to share) were ordered. We couldn't finish it all,  generous portion sizes. $36 bill with food and 1 drip coffee. Food was delicious and unique.
author: Kristina R.

description: Dinner crepes were just ok, but the dessert crepes really shined.  Had the SBK (strawberry, banana, kiwi) and the peanut butter with marshmallow, rice crispies and chocolate.
author: Scott C.

description: This place has such an large menu with limited seating, but the food looks amazing and tastes great as well. If you're ever in the area check it out!
author: Eric N.

description:
Really solid/good breakfast option in the heart of the tourist district.  Almost surprisingly so.  

The Eggs Benedict were good and the potatoes on the side were actually outstanding.   Cooked perfectly with the right blend of crisp edges and soft, pillowy insides.   The fresh squeezed orange juice was a welcome thirst quencher and the large house coffee was rich and strong.  

You order at the counter after reading the huge wall menu, they give you a number and the food is delivered relatively quickly.  

Good stuff.  I'll be back on future visits.
author: Paul W.

description: Awesome quick and casual breakfast/brunch spot!  You order what you want and get a number for your table and then someone will bring you your food.  They have mimosas and bloody Mary's.  I ordered the eggs Benedict and my friend ordered the huevos rancheros.  We both had a clean plate they were so good!  I would recommend arriving on the earlier side as the place is fairly small with limited seating, while the line is out the door!
author: Jill C.

description: Great breakfast place. The potatoes are awesome and flavorful. Was worth the hour wait.
author: Amber B.

description: Food was decent but nothing extraordinary.  The line on a Saturday morning was fairly long but moved quick enough. Overall I had higher expectations.
author: Meredith M.

description: Good breakfast place with an extensive menu.  Altho busy, it appeared that tables turn quickly.  Food was good, but coffee was disappointing.
author: John F.

description:
Don't wait in line. That's the best first sentence you could read. Wife and I waited over an hour and 15 minutes for mediocre food. While we enjoyed it partially due to being hungry, we both feel we could have chosen a place with no wait and same quality. My wife ordered a hot chocolate with the Half Moon Bay Crepe, side of fruit and two scrambled eggs. Everything came out as ordered and was pretty tasty. I ordered the Chicken Pesto Crepe with potatoes. I also ordered a poached egg as all of the benedicts coming out of the kitchen looked good. I mean you can't go wrong with an egg, right? This is where it all feel apart. I was asked if I wanted a soft, medium or hard "poached" egg. I asked for soft. I got an egg in a bowl that was clearly microwaved and cooked hard. I sent it back and said I wanted a poached egg. It came back in the same manner: microwaved but soft, really soft. An under cooked egg was flopped into my Crepe. I almost lost it, but I scraped it back into the bowl and ate what I had left. 

If you can get in here without a wait, do it. Don't expect an earth shattering meal. If you have to wait, try not to get annoyed with all the people behind you saving tables for people who don't have food and will order well after you. The place should get a handle on this as well. First up, so everyone can sit as they order. 

Again, don't wait in line. Go someplace else and avoid the frustration.
author: Jason R.

description:
What's amazing at Honey Honey:
The creative menu is a joy to read and explore. 
The fresh juice, YUM!
The hollandaise
The Crab Florentine Benedict (yum)
Try the carrot juice, you might become a fan!
A standout in a crowded field of breakfast places around Union Square.

What needs some work:
It's pretty stuffy in the restaurant, you need to get used to it, but why?
The potatoes, I choose the fruit cup which is awesome

Honey Honey will have you coming back.
author: Frank O.

description: This place has great food and a great atmosphere. Be prepared to wait in line. Both times here the line has been out the door and down the sidewalk. Totally worth it. Have your order ready when you get to the front to help the rest of us  out. Menu is on the wall so it makes it easy.
author: Serena S.

description: The New Orleans crepe was great! Added a one egg scrambled to it and it was really comfort to the stomach and soul. The potatoes side was great! Also ordered the two eggs any style with muffin and chicken mango sausage! Love that the dishes were appropriately flavoured with just enough salt!
author: Cheryl S.

description: Had both a savory and a sweet crepe. Delicious. Always seems to have a line in the morning, but is peaceful in the evening.
author: Lee L.

description: We waited in line for two hours and another hour to get our food. I'm not sure if it was really worth the wait but definitely good food! It seems like all the breakfast/brunch places had an extremely long line. I would definitely try again if I were to ever go back.
author: Destini O.

description:
Across from the JW Marriott on Post. Get there early. First come first served. Even for coffee. I had the New Orleans Crepe with fruit.  Yum. Chicken, cheese, mushroom, and sun dried tomatoes.  Good coffee. 

Or go late after breakfast. Either way, go!
author: Terese O.

description: The hot chocolate was really good, with the whipped cream on the top. House coffee was bland. The New Orleans was good, salsa and Sun dried tomato were a tasty addition. North Beach was average, the Hollandaise was pretty bland. For dessert, the sbk and the nutella banana were both great, tho the nutella  got too sweet very fast. Would recommend to others overall.
author: Yangyang J.

description:
Fantastic spot for an early breakfast. After being warned by the other reviews, I made sure I got to this place early. It was still pretty busy, but at least I did not have to wait in a line. 

There is so much goodness on the menu that it's difficult to decide. In the end, I went for a little bit of everything and had the 2 & 2 & 2. Would definitely recommend it. The pancakes stole the show though. They were fluffy, sweet, and just the right amount of salty. I'm still dreaming of them.
author: Avadhut P.

description: Crepes delicious. I was a solo traveler in need of a comfy quiet place and some good food. Was not disappointed.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I'd give a way better review, but AT COMPLETELY MY OWN FAULT, I wasn't feeling very well that morning, and I should've just ordered chocolate and strawberries and cream, etc... 
No, my dumbass ordered the crab cake crepes. No. . . No. 
It's not that it wasn't good. But I was not in the right place inside for seafood. My girlfriend loved everything she ordered, and the place was great, and had a huge menu, that somehow I managed to simply misnavigate. I'd love to give it another try.
author: Tony F.

description:
Came here on as a Sunday brunch with a few friends.  This was not our first choice but we so happened to decide on coming here.  Pretty empty, we shortly found ourselves a seat and stared at the large menu/wall before deciding what to order.

Brunch, I tend to always get drawn in by the words "crab cakes" so I was deciding between the Crab Cakes Florentine and a crab cake sandwich.  Despite having the meal at 12ish and not being able to order dutch crunch as my bread of choice was a little disappointing but wheat was an okay substitute for my crab cake sandwich.  

When I actually received my sandwich, I was disappointed again at the size/amount of crab in the crab cake made with my sandwich.  I typically expect the size of a maybe a mini donut but it definitely appeared to be the size of a tomato slices' worth.  Fine fine fine, size is not a big deal as I was full at the end of my meal.  I doubt I'll come back here because the food did not stand out.  Don't get me wrong, the food is not bad but I do believe there are better alternatives in the neighborhood.  As there was no explosion of flavor or "MMM!" factor I had only thoughts of "I could probably make this and better from the comfort of my own home" as we left on our way.
author: Samuel Y.

description: Perfect spot for crepes and coffee! Many many options for other things as well. The eden crepe was my favorite, and the breakfast crepe was tasty as well. My only issue was it was a little old, run down looking and we waited an hour+, but the food was REALLY tasty!
author: Megan K.

description: This place is beyond busy! There is constantly a line at this hidden gem,  but it was totally worth the wait. We had a cup of coffee (it was nice and strong), freshly squeezed orange juice, eggs benedict and a ham and cheddar croissant....definitely worth every penny and no bite gone to waste!
author: Anna G.

description: Huevos Rancheros is definitely worth it. Really like the way it was presented with a lot of beans. Will definitely come back.
author: Qasim Z.

description:
Went there with family. We shared various omelette crepes and Benedict. The Athens omelette included feta olive and spinach was great. Caramel walnut crepe amazing. The blintz crepe looked great on the outside but little watery with ricotta cheese was not my style!
There was a long line to order but worth the wait. Service helpful.
author: Abdul E.

description: Wow - the Half Moon Bay crepe was fantastic.  Lots of yummy crab cake wrapped in a super thin crepe. The portion was perfect (Had fruit for my side).  Counter order service was very friendly and efficient.
author: Christina M.

description:
I had breakfast there while in San Francisco. The place is big clean and staff very friendly 
Try their latte they are to die for 
The food is ok nothing fancy but very affordable and a large variety of option but not the best crepe I had
author: Myrisse D.

description:
Dear Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery,

Thank you very much for being within walking distance of SoMa and being open for breakfast on weekend mornings. That is, apparently, a rare find in the neighborhood. More importantly, thank you for offering a tofu scramble on the menu. As a vegan, I appreciate that.

However, as a vegan, I would like to give you some information on what a tofu scramble is. Or, more importantly, what it is not. Notably, a tofu scramble:

1. Does not include eggs. If a person interested in a tofu scramble wanted eggs, they would order scrambled eggs, of which you already have plenty on your menu. Tofu scramble is for people who don't eat eggs!

2. Does not consist of cubes of tofu. Rather, tofu scramble is made by crumbling up tofu and scrambling it around in a frying pan with other spices and vegetables so that it resembles scrambled eggs without being made of, you know, eggs (see point 1).

Furthermore, when I ordered the tofu scramble without eggs, I noticed that the amount of food on my dish was noticeably small without any reduction in the price. This was a bit disappointing as I left hungry and still paid a fair amount for my meal.

Hopefully you can take my suggestions into consideration and improve your menu for future vegan patrons!

Cheers!
author: Alyssa J P.

description:
Breakfast all day! Varieties of crepes and breakfast foods. Portions are pretty large but definitely one plate per hungry  person.

I have been here twice and loved both occasions. Always very busy throughout the day...so make sure to double check your food and order, too.

Chai tea: slightly spicy with the perfect portion and creaminess of froth. I don't think this Chai is homemade but it's great to pair with a crepe.

Salmon benedict: it's all about the home fries, man. Crispy and not burnt. Maybe the best home fries I have had in a while.

Strawberry crepe: the crepe was slightly crispy on the edges but light and buttery. The strawberries were not canned or preserved stuff. Sweet, tart...fresh.

C ozy atmosphere, turn around time is quick. You can taste if hollandaise feels like it's from a can. This stuff tasted fresh ! Had the salmon Benedict and crab cake florentine   . Delicious !
author: Marie M.

description: Horrible service. Came in and ordered with my friend, and they just forgot my order. My food has not arrived while my friend has finished eating. Not worth the 30 mins waiting in line.
author: Trang 1.

description:
Solid 3.5 stars; in a way, I was expecting more for a restaurant that has this many reviews but I can still see the appeal, it's not your typical breakfast joint or diner.   Love the decor, a bit rustic, a bit European...and the circular seating arrangements makes for great eye candy watching, around a center pole but I digress.

Ordered the popular crab cakes florenentine benedict, eggs done just right, and while this was good, I wasn't floored by it.  But for $10.50, and the amount of yummy hash browns which were really spiced well, what a steal.  Look at the pic, the spinach was just overflowing lol.

But the highlight was the freshly squeezed orange juice; whoever thought of putting that machine right behind the cashier is a marketing genius, suckered me for sure, wish I had ordered 2 glasses lol.

all in all, for a dt place, it's not too bad distance-wise from the shopping but hotels all around, I'd be here in a jiffy next time.

free wifi too.

friendly service.

amex, yah!
author: Kenneth N.

description: I reviewed some of the ratings regarding the crab cakeflorentine, I was a little set back due to my dish being room temperature.  As for my wife's dish the breakfast crepe, the crepe was fresh and hot as for the egg however the ham and cheese was room temp.
author: Michael W.

description: Adorable cafe with friendly counter service and a wonderful chalkboard menu. After placing your order you are given a table and a number then your food is delivered to you. Visited Honey Honey for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed!  Looking forward to returning.
author: Susanne H.

description:
A very similar cafe to CrepeVine. The same layout & very similar menu. 

I ordered a crab cake florentine & it was delicious. The portions are huge so don't worry about not being full! Crabs are so good & melt in your mouth with the eggs. And the potatoes that come with it are so good! A bit in the pricier side but I would say it's worth it since you'll probably have leftovers for later anyways! 

Definitely recommend if you're in the area.
author: Vernice T.

description: In line for 45 minutes, at table another 30 before they brought out our food, and then then one plate was missing. When I approached the food runner / bus boy about the fact that he was walking around with a plate in his hand that I knew was mine, he got combative with me and told me to sit down. Not 2 minutes later, a girl, maybe the manager, approached me asking what the problem was, after I told her, miraculously my food appeared and she offered us mimosas for the frustration. Way to diffuse! Food was good, but not worth all the time and frustration. They are understaffed and without an efficient system to keep up with the demand. That 'Help Wanted' sign is an understatement !
author: J H.

description: This cafe was very packed when we arrived but the vibe of the restaurant kept us in line to order. I got the Nutella Banana Crepe which was full of chocolate (not my taste but good for any chocolate lover) and the touch of walnuts was a great addition to the sweet treat. I can't wait to go back and try their savory options as well as more of the dessert crepes!
author: Day H.

description: A large selection of brunch items! I love their crepes and eggs benedict. I came here with a guy who is traditionally very cheap and even he loved the prices! They have a few outdoor tables and plenty of indoor seating for individuals or groups. The staff are friendly and the food was good, nothing a foodie would write home about, but nothing I'd complain about.
author: Nicole H.

description:
We stood  in a line 45 mins to place our order and the entire time we noticed about half the restaurant chairs were empty. This tells me they are too slow taking the orders!! An additional person taking orders would have been a much more efficient system and would greatly increase table turnover and total sells. 
Perhaps even better:  Get Real waiters and waitresses taking orders like a real restaurant!  It seems the kitchen crew gets the job done.  

Once we finally placed the order, their machine spit out a receipt with tip options?  Really??? Why would you tip them when you have to stand in line 45 mins to place your order?   I hit other and typed in zero tip! I am sorry but a long line is not service!   Service is taking my order while I sit in a comfortable chair and sip amazing coffee!  

The Food was prepared fast, but it was not amazing. The breakfast potatoes were fresh and cooked perfectly. The blintz (my first) was a gooey mess.  The prices were fair considering SF prices.  But I will NEVER come back due to their long totally unnecessary line.  Hint: get some staff to take orders and Serve the food like a real restaurant!  Most likely you will have an even longer line and collect way more tips. 
I would have given 4 stars had it not been for the order bottle-neck line problems!
author: Mad Marc H.

description: Long line to get your food but it's worth the wait! Great breakfast and lunch foods. They also have savory crepes as well as dessert ones which are good.
author: Alex C.

description:
Breakfast at Honey Honey was pleasant and quiet since I arrived at 7:30 in the morning.  I ordered a chai tea and the original crepe.  This crepe is simple with cheese and onions. They aren't skimping on the onions here so be aware.  You may need a breath mint before heading into the office.  This thing was packed with onions. 

The creeped were quite good and are such a rare item to find that they score high for me. The potatoes were nothing special and I would not expect the egg dishes to be anything noteworthy. This place is all about the crepes. If you come for another reason you will likely be disappointed. 

Staff is young and reasonably friendly.  Breakfast for $10 isn't a bad deal and for something as special as crepes it is well worth the trip.
author: Jeffrey O.

description:
Food: ordered salmon benedict with coffee. It came with potatoes. It was not overly seasoned, and the eggs were still runny (yummy!) Lots of food and definitely exceeded my expectations for a small little corner restaurant. 

I think it's suppose to be busy, so I must have come during an off hour. Fast, quick, pleasant service. I'd come back again!
author: Stina H.

description: Located in the heart of San Francisco, this little breakfast spot is a great combination of value, food, and selection. We went to Honey Honey multiple times during our stay because it was hard to find a better place. Be prepare, the lines can be long as the place is well know for its great breakfasts. Highly recommended.
author: Alex R.

description:
Hi a friend of mine recommend me this place we went there with my fiance we tried the rosted eggplant sandwich that was killer..
I will be back to try all of there sandwiches
author: Hani H.

description: We ordered some food to go around 7pm. We waited for our food for about 30 minutes. People who came in after us got their food first. The crepes were good but the potatoes were sort of burned. Would come back but hopefully with quicker service.
author: Melanie K.

description: Worth the wait! I had the breakfast crepe with fresh fruit and it was delicious! I'm so glad we tried this place out...also they make sure you get a table before you order no matter how busy it is!
author: Janet M.

description:
Yummy waffles with fruit!

I've been craving for waffles with fruit. So when I saw their Belgian Waffle with Fruit, I knew I HAD to get it. So GET IT I did! Definitely fitting for my healthy SF day. Yummy crispy yet soft waffles in my mouth. Delicious bananas and strawberries to hit my sweet tooth. I'm getting hungry just writing this review. Wait, let's look at it:

http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Iz1kATx2z_EmE4Oc8c_fIw&userid=x2kIaq8x6Q2I6uJxmVg4cA

I know right?! It looks SO good. And did I mention how cheap it was?! $7.25 It normally comes with whip cream, but I kept it simple and opted out. Come on down here for a good breakfast or lunch (they serve sandwiches, salads, and what not ). You just gotta order, pay, sit down, wait, and eat your yummy food.

In the words of Arnold Schwarzenegger, I'll be back!
author: Marthie D.

description: Absolutely amazing Crepe Place , definitely worth coming here for breakfast ! My wife & I both ordered Crepes & were very impressed. Definitely order either the dessert crepes or breakfast crepes & you'll be happy you did. The inside has a very nice cafe feel with a relaxed ambient setting.
author: Chris M.

description:
We took waffles and the huevos rancheros. Waffles seemed very nice but they weren't good, it seemed something packaged. I ate several times freshly made waffles and they don't taste like these!
My boyfriend took the huevos rancheros that they looked terrible, beans seemed just come out of a can but he say the taste was not bad.
But the worst thing was the girl at the counter that under my eyes pretended to throw away the used coffee in the coffee machine and then turn it on again as if nothing had happened! of course the coffee was bad!
author: Lucia A.

description: The food was really really good they have a good variety to select from. The customer service was excellent. Definitely recommend
author: Mayumi H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon before going to visit NASA and we had to eat QUICK. We had an hour but all of the issues only gave us about 10 minutes to eat.

The line was horrendously long and the place was sweltering. We found a table and ordered at the bar, but I guess there was a mix up with my friend's order.

I got a salad, chef's salad, I think, and it was just fine. nothing special. It had all the normal accoutrements. Fiancé got a chicken pesto crepe that had deceivingly little pesto in it.

Two friends got the pesto crepe and they were covered in pesto, so that was a little confusing. But they all came out at different times. And we saw people who had ordered 4 or 5 people behind us, get their food first.

Overall, it was a frustrating visit, with okay food. If all the food had come out at once I would have given another star. I'm not a fan of eating while others are staring hungrily at my plate.
author: Paige W.

description: Great menu selection!!! Super yummy food!!! And although the lines are long the service is speedy and very well organized!! The savory crepes are just as delicious as the desert crepes!!
author: Arous Y.

description: Our favorite cafe in San Fran within a week we came here twice. There sweet crepes are amazing!!! We loved their fresh squeezed OJ. The wait of worth it and there quick to bring the food.
author: Korina K.

description:
I ordered the salmon Benedict which came with potatoes. It would have been better if it was served hot. The temp was as if it had been sitting on a table top for a few minutes. I didn't care much for the tomatoes that came with it. 

We also got the Nutella banana with whipped cream on the side. It was delicious but didn't stand out from the other places i've tried.
author: Genelie B.

description:
Worth paying .. Great breakfast! Enjoyed waffles and coffee.
Keep it up!
author: Natasha W.

description: It was good, but it wasnt great!  I found myself questioning why there was such a huge line out the door.  I mean sure, the service is fast, but they aren't the best at what they do.
author: Maria K.

description:
