This little place is a gem.  I went on a Sunday around 9 and the line was out the door.  I placed my order online using while I was in line. Within 7 minutes my food was ready and I was out the door.  I felt like I had hit the lottery.  
I ordered the eggs Benedict with potatoes. The potatoes were superb and the Eggs Benedict were cooked to perfection.  My hubby orders the 2,2,2, which was 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, and 2 bacon strips. He was satisfied. 

Although the restaurant was packed, the service was great.  I also had a latte, YUUMMM!
author: Jessica W.

description:
We often stay at the Grand Hyatt and love being close to this reliable, tasty, and affordable restaurant.  Over various visits I have ordered the Miami Heat, the beet salad with grilled chicken, latte, and the crepe Suzette.  All were very good.  I also enjoy the fresh squeezed orange juice machine for my mimosa at brunch. My husband has enjoyed the eggs Benedict and the Philly Cheese steak crepe. The only miss so far has been the burger. 
Yes, their is usually a line, but it moves quickly and the food is served to your table in about ten minutes no matter how long the line. Honey Honey is actually a big restaurant by San Francisco standards and they have three or four tables if you want to eat outside. Could be a tad cleaner.
author: Colleen M.

description:
This comes up under the gluten free search. THIS PLACE IS NOT GLUTEN FREE.   No awareness even asking them to double check and disclosing how severe the issue is they served me 3 items on my Salad that had to be sent back when I questioned it after it was delivered to the table. 

Seems a great place if you don't have to be careful BUT should not show up on any gluten free search.
author: Healy M.

description: The Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery was on our list of places to check out while in SF and it did not disappoint. My wife had the New Orleans crepe with potato and it was amazing. I had the Huevos Rancheros, also very good, especially after I added a good amount of Tapatio sauce. My daughter had the Dulce de Leche crepe with apples added in. The richness of the caramel and the freshness of the Apple made it unbelievably delicious. The coffee is good and the vibe is friendly enough. We arrived at 8 on Sunday and were able to find sitting right away. I suggest getting there early because by the time we left the line was through the door and sitting was sparse. This is not a complaint as we had a great experience and will probably go back. The line and wait is well worth it.
author: Chris S.

description:
Long lineup for a busy weekend afternoon brunch rush.
The Blintz was very cute and the coffee wasn't bad! 
Well worth the wait!
author: Jean W.

description:
This was the worst experience I have ever had a breakfast spot. Owner (I assume) who took my order had an attitude first of all. Then sat at our table waiting for OVER AN HOUR and when I asked the owner what happened to our food, she got irritated at me as if I did something wrong, like WTF?! They obviously didn't start making the food until I asked, 10 minutes later I see other tables who arrived 45 min after us getting their food or finishing up. I decided that I just wanted a refund, and of course the food just gets made. You would think, to give the customer a good experience for your mistake that you would just let them eat the food with a refund and not waste the food. (Or avoid a bad review) Not here apparently...they brought out the food then after realizing I got a refund, quickly rushed to grab the food off our table and SHOOED US AWAY!  (Talk about cheap)

Can't say anything about the food so maybe it's as good as the other reviews say, but I'd give 0 stars if I could. Rudest, most disrespectful service I have ever encountered. Period.
author: Jake A.

description: Awesome selection of savoury and sweet crepes. Plus plenty of options for desert waffles. High chairs available for kids as well
author: Pablo M.

description:
Got the blintz.  They didn't draw the heart. So disappointed.  

The chicken pesto was ok. Chicken was a little dry. Ingredients aren't fresh.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I've been here twice... I tried a savory and then a sweet crepe and both were amazing! If you're in San Francisco just give it a try. They have really good food and I don't think it's expensive at all ;)
author: Jordana V.

description: Great service, huge food options, food taste amazing, breakfast is fresh and tasty and coffee is perfect!  People here are really friendly and service is fast!  Pancakes are amazing! Definitely a great breakfast place!
author: Hugo C.

description: Great little place for breakfast, brunch or lunch. Close to hotels near Union Square.
author: Chuck N.

description: By far one of the BEST places to go for breakfast not only in San Francisco but in the world! The best crepes I have ever tasted! The potatoes are to die for.  It's definitely worth the wait.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Super yummy and easy food! Had the chicken pesto savory crepe and loved it. Go for the potatoes, they are delicious! Water is also great because it's infused.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Even if the line doesn't LOOK long, don't be fooled!  You will wait forever just to order.
The crepes are sparingly filled, thrown together quickly, average taste. 

The two stars are for the mimosas with fresh orange juice.
author: Suzie M.

description: Second time in here, second time it's terrible. The blood Mary's are TERRIBLE, though granted it was replaced with a slightly better memosa. Also, my salad had wilted cherry tomatoes. Disappointing to say the least.
author: Irina K.

description: Line out the door but from then until eating about 30 minutes at 9:15am on a Saturday. Why? Because the food is freaking awesome! Eggs Benedict with Salmon and the potatoes are so good. Latte was average but the fresh orange juice made up for it.
author: Daniel H.

description: So good!! The pesto crepe was freakin fantastic! The flavors were amazing together. Their potatoes were delicious! We also ordered the bagel with salmon and capers as well as the nutella banana crepe. Everything was really good! The fresh squeezed orange juice was a great accompaniment. Be prepared to wait in line for a while but it's so worth it!
author: Naureen N.

description: Really great brunch! We ordered the salmon benedict, the north beach crepe and the breakfast crepe. Excellent food and the freshly squeezed OJ was an extra plus. Highly recommend!
author: Natalia P.

description: Had an awesome meal with my two teenage boys, they had the banana Nutella crepes and I had the breakfast crepe with potatoes - well with the 30 minutes in line.  We will be back!
author: Rhonda H.

description: Gave this place a try because it was close to where I was staying.  Food was okay, lots of menu selections.
author: Dan M.

description: Wonderful staff, the crepes were delicious and they have literally freshly squeezed orange juice! I asked for an apple juice mimosa and the cashier was glad to make it for me even though it wasn't a traditional mimosa.
author: Wonju R.

description:
Ordered on yelp. Skipped the long line because I had already ordered and paid. Get the food from the super sweet server, have a lovely short conversation.
Now food- HOLY COW. Everything was amazing! Potatoes, the blintz, the pancakes and even the fruit(seemed extra fresh). On my next trip up here I will sooooooo be back. 
Best food up here so far. Yes yes yessss
author: Anna A.

description: Honey Honey is my new go to breakfast place. Ordered the Chorizo Scramble and it was one of the best I've had in the city. The restaurant itself is great. It has a nice cozy atmosphere with great music playing on the house stereo. Prices are affordable and there is definitely something for everyone. Can't wait to come back to try something else.
author: Eric M.

description: This cafe showed up when searching for vegan.  There is almost nothing that is vegan other than a plain bagel.  Even the oatmeal I ordered was cooked with milk.  When I asked for a new Bowl, I was told it would be a while.  While waiting for our food, we saw the same server pushing back on other customer requests.  Go somewhere else, there isn't anything here that is worth it.
author: Joshua Q.

description: 3 stars for great service, man the people working here are polite, helpful and go out of their way to help you.  Bu the food is just mediocre, good food for tourists I guess but nothing I'd go out of my way to get.
author: Asad b.

description: The food is good.  The pesto crepe was incredible.  My Sunrise Burrito was good, but I have had better breakfast burritos.  The eggplant crepe was very good as was the crab cake and mediterranean crepe.  Our group enjoyed the many things you can get here.  The menu is impressive. The potato side is nothing special.   It is very busy place.  You order at the counter and then hope to find a seat Sunday mornings for sure.  If you have a group, try to grab a table while others order.
author: Joe M.

description: Not sure what's with the negative reviews. We arrived at about 12pm on a Sunday. Good thing they served breakfast until 3 because I wanted a waffle. There was about a 10 minute wait to get to the counter to order. But we had a table secured before we ordered. The place is slightly crowded/awkwardly set up. As you have to side step to make your way through the chairs and tables. The food was great, it came out hot and delicous. My husband and I got the Belgian waffle and my daughter got the chocolate chip waffle. The apple turkey sausage was delicious as well as the freshly squeezed orange juice. Overall I'll give it a 9.5 the order/table system could have been a bit better and the waitstaff could have come over to check on you to see if you needed anything else but they didn't.
author: A M.

description: I decided to venture out from my regular set of SFO dives and diners, and tried this trendy crepe place out. Luckily, I missed the brunch crowd so the line wasn't crazy but a lot of the seating is near the line when there is one. A server brings you your food after you have already ordered and paid so they don't have much incentive to ask how your meal is going. I had half of a bun that was pure burnt (see photo) and it took me awhile to get the server to bring me a replacement. Ketchup took even longer to get, but the food always saves the day right? The crepe has pretty good.
author: John Mark I.

description: The food, service, vibe, EVERYTHING amazing. The food speaks for itself!!!! Worth the wait. And the people are SO nice... Grateful to live around the corner!!! It's obvious it's run by people who genuinely care about customer service. Honey honey: I love you. Thank you for existing!!!!!!!!
author: Kaitlyn V.

description: I had their eggs Benedict, which was not the best ever in my experience, but I would absolutely give 5 stars to this place for their amazing fresh squeezed orange juice and breakfast crepe( which I tried from my friend.) I believe their speciality is in crepes, so they would always be my first choice at this place.
author: Arshdeep D.

description: Amazing dessert crepe ! My favorite is banana Nutella  make sure to come early in the morning as there are a lot of people lining up. If you want to avoid lines, go in the afternoon. Breakfast only served til 3pm
author: Michelle K.

description:
The "order-and-find-a-seat" system doesn't work here ((for me)). I don't understand why someone would want to order and then wait for a table that isn't available. The whole process is just semi-stressful and I'm sure I have a hemorrhoid just from thinking so long and hard about where I will be sitting and how I will now have to carry my food and also find a table.

I was with a party of four so while two from my party were finishing up ordering, my friend and I snagged a table so we wouldn't have a butt full of hemorrhoids from worrying about where to sit. We found a spot, but then one lady who worked here told me to get up because they "don't take reservations." After a few attempts in explaining to her that we were nearly done paying and that we just wanted a spot because it was super busy, around 11 AM on a Sunday, another employee told us that they don't let people reserve tables. Sure, I understand their system, and maybe it's just me it doesn't work for, but regardless it just seems to be more "suburbia-appropriate" vs "city-appropriate".

The food here is good but I mean it's not great. Within the radius of a few blocks this place is probably the best breakfast place. The employees just need to calm down.
author: Topher J.

description: Great breakfast. Economical. The 2-2-2 was good (pancakes, eggs, and bacon). The huevos rancheros was also good. Can't go wrong here.
author: Matt C.

description: Came here for breakfast it was super busy. Took a little time to get our food. I ordered the New Orleans crepe it was filling and flavorful. The waffle was delicious as well. I loved their fresh oh also.
author: Nima F.

description:
Amazing chorizo & pancakes! Truly everything was great. 3 months later & I am still missing this place.

For a great casual breakfast in San Francisco go here. I only wish I lived a few thousand miles closer.
author: Julia T.

description: My friends and I got the sunrise burrito, and it would have been awesome if it had been hot. The cheese was NOT melted and it was clearly re-heating gone wrong, with some places cold and some places mildly warm. Eggs Benedict with Canadian bacon was alright, definitely tried better. Coffee mugs were cool and potatoes on the side were amazing amazing amazing
author: Laura K.

description: Fabulous Crepes and choices! I went there with my daughter and even if you have to wait it is so worth it. Fresh Orange Juice was delish. Want to go back soon.
author: June G.

description: I got the Half Moon Bay crepe and it was very good.  What I did not like about the restaurant was the seating.  You are supposed to order and then find a seat, but many people would hold tables before they ordered.  This left customers, who had already paid, left to stand around and wait for people to leave.  We have a restaurant near us that posts signs warning against this practice, and will ask you to leave your table, to prevent exactly this situation.  If this restaurant did the same, it would make for a much more relaxed dining experience.  I created a yelp account just to say this.
author: Joaquin P.

description: Best breakfast place in the neighborhood! Very friendly staff. Food is good, the vibe is great !
author: Yevgeniya S.

description: Came for breakfast. It was crazy busy. Long line out the door and down the sidewalk. Got longer as the morning wore on. Food was delicious.
author: Al C.

description:
Pretty nice little coffee, the food was good but not awesome. 

We, my gf and I, took the egg benedicts so we couldn't try the other plates.

Pancakes looked good also
author: Kevin K.

description: Wonderful breakfast and brunch place. I will say it's more an in and out place. Long lines to order food and drinks then they bring everything to the table. From order placement to table delivery idle very fast and the food is amazing but you feel like you need to eat and leave to then give the table to the next guest. So if you're looking for a place to chat over drinks and food for an hour, this isn't the place. But if you're looking for great brunch food on limited time wonderful. The service is excellent. The prices are right.
author: Maelinda R.

description:
First off.. The food is massive. As is everything in the USA. They do have vegetarian options. 

Had the tofu scramble. They can do it without the egg. If you want to go that route. Firm tofu. A bit tart. Couldn't finish it. Not the most mind blowing food..but it'll do.

Can get congested here. Haven't tried their crepes. Seems to be popular here. 

Inside decor... Left to be desired. But it's a well established restaurant. Worn / lived in look. 

Service is ok. You order your food at the front and seat yourself. Just be prepared to sit for a bit.
author: Joy L.

description: Very friendly staff, but the food is just OK -- worth it if you can just drop in, but not the 45 minute wait on the weekend. For a breakfast experience that's worth the hype (and a lengthy wait) hit up Tartine Bakery.
author: Alex T.

description: We had an incredibly yummy breakfast here this morning. Mediterranean crepe, Salmon scramble, & the strawberry & Nutella dessert splurge. All SO good! My Mediterranean was full of chunks of tangy feta & avocado, olives, artichokes, onions, & cheddar, on a FRESH crepe--perfect. Fresh fruit on the side was included. Sam's Salmon scramble was excellent & his potatoes, as requested, were perfectly well done. The Nutella-strawberry was divine. Found this on Yelp & the concierge at the Hilton also recommended it.  New for us but we'll go again!
author: Jessica K.

description:
Wish I had more time in SF to go here again. Three of us came for brunch yesterday and were initially put off by the long line- but we decided to wait and it was totally worth it. And the line didn't take as long as we thought it would. 

Only thing was watching the food come out made it hard to choose! Everything looked delicious. Ended up getting the eggs Benedict. Deliciously standard kind. Friends got crepe and omelet - also great. 

The waiter also knocked over a water glass but was super apologetic, moved us to a better table, and gave us a round of free mimosas. So nice!

I like the counter style service, the food, and the price, so basically all around great spot!
author: Eva R.

description: Blintz are SO GOOD!  I ordered a cappuccino as well and that was also on point. The combination of crepes they have are excellent. Can't wait to come back for more!!
author: Veronica H.

description:
During my 3 day trip to San Francisco I ate here TWICE which is saying a lot because I love to try new places.  

Round #1 I had the Lemon Crepe and the #5 bagel (the one with avocado).  My friends had the Strawberry Nutella Crepe, and the Florentine Crepe and bagels #4, I believe.  We all had the fresh squeezed orange juice.  

Round #2 I went for the Banana Nutella Crepe and a mimosa.  My friends had the SBK Crepe, Baklava Crepe, and The Crab Cake Florentine.  We all had the orange juice, again.

We all shared bites of everything and ALL the food was amazing.  I think my lemon crepe was my winner of the weekend because it was unique and so tart! 

Would definitely visit this place again and you must must MUST order the orange juice!
author: Mackenzie B.

description: I came yesterday and my friend got a free desert due to leaving a review on Yelp and so I'm here now Leaving a review and one of the cooks is being an ass. Hopefully I can come back and get my dessert when someone actually knows the rules. I still love this place though, it's so delicious.
author: Alex P.

description: This place was amazing loved the omelette. The iced coffee was really refreshing and the service was great.
author: Elvira V.

description: Delicious food. The place needs a good sprucing up. (Peeling wallpaper and such) but that didn't keep people from piling in.
author: Ell W.

description:
I used to live close to this place, and it's was my habit to go there at least one day a week to get my pancakes, waffle or eggs benedict. I still come as often as I can. There's nothing fancy, it's often crowded, but it's simple and good. 
They are better for breakfast I think, but they also have great sandwiches. 
I really like this place, so don't hesitate to try it :)
author: Carole P.

description:
I just had here an experience that I never had anywhere before. It felt like I'm at the dining room at Fawlty Towers.

I ordered a tofu sandwich. However, the attendant brought me a vegetarian sandwich. I didn't notice the difference and started eating it. Half way through, the guy who actually ordered it started inquiring. When the attendant realized what happened, this is what he did:

He came to my table with the sandwich I originally ordered, and without explaining anything he took away the plate I was eating from (while I was eating) and shoved towards me my original order.
He then turned to the other guy and said "HE was eating your sandwich".

By the way, the half eaten dish he took from me (without asking or explaining anything) was just thrown away.
author: Li L.

description: Super yummy crepes! The line takes a while but it's not too bad. It was just going out the door when I went and I was able to order in 20-30 minutes I think. The food comes fast once you order. I had the Half Moon Bay (the one with crab cake). It was good, but the crab cake was very average, not too exciting. My friend had the pesto and really liked it. We shared a strawberry nutella, which was very tasty. Overall, I would recommend!
author: Lizzy B.

description: The food (eggs florentine and Benedict) and service were great. The food came very fast. The prices were very good for the area. They make excellent espresso drinks. You order at a counter and seat yourself but it has a traditional restaurant feel.
author: Holly F.

description: Great brunch spot! I had the eggs Florentine with potatoes it was Great! A good spot to eat when in SF
author: Patty B.

description: Long line but worth the wait!  Excellent coffee, savory crepes (Mediterranean), and rosemary potatoes - pleasantly browned and seasoned perfectly.  Pancakes are the best I've had, hinted with vanilla, soft and fluffy.
author: Lisa G.

description: The atmosphere is amazing! I love the open air feel with music playing in the background, meanwhile, listening to the hustle and bustle of the San Fransisco streets. The food is amazing, and the menu has many different kinds of food: Sweet and Savory Crepes, breakfast, lunch, and dinner items. An amazing place to get breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner!
author: R T.

description: Was looking for a nice brunch spot walking distance from where I was at and decided from the pictures on Yelp to try this place! The line was out the door when I first got there and I thought, Yay I chose well. When we finally made it inside, a new thought; is this place related to Crepevine? You will notice that it has the same menu board structure that Crepevine has, but who knows. I love Crepevine so I'm glad that I have this option now when I don't want to make the trip all the way to the Sunset to get a good savory crepe. I will say however that at Crepevine you get a side of potatoes/fries and salad whereas here you only have the option of potatoes or salad.
author: Michelle C.

description:
If you're hungry late at night, this cafe on the corner is easy to get a quick bite.  Whether you want sandwiches or crepes, there is a huge selection.  However, the quality of the ingredients is average.  Nothing special here.  The supposedly fresh crab cake is more like fried batter.

Service is decent, but the tables can be somewhat sticky.  There is plenty of free water.  Parking can be tough on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description: really cute bakery and great food. i ordered a peanut butter crepe with a side of eggs and it was a really big serving. it was a long line to get in but the food was worth it.
author: Jaclyn G.

description: My husband and I went to Honey Honey crepery and were so impressed by the service and amazing food! The owner takes pride in experience and quality of food. Plus great music! I highly recommend!
author: Gab C.

description: Perfect place for breakfast and lunch.  Loved the crepes.  Will come back.  Nice environment and good service.  Loved the Baclava Dessert Crepe and my husband loved the Nutella and Banana Dessert Crepes.  Also the burgers were amazing.  Definitely will come back...
author: Maria V.

description:
We had a party of 7, 3 adults 4 kids. Don't come here. Food is great but the service is snotty and non-accommodating. Waited in line for an hour and were told the tables were for people who had ordered. Do you think small starving kids like standing in lineups for an hour? We sat 5 at a 2-seater anyway while we waited and were moved to a larger table later.

Didn't take any pics of the food cuz sure it was brunch fare but service is just as important. We had an ill 5 year old in our party so we ordered the lemon crepe thinking it would be a plain option. When it came soaked in lemon sauce and lemon jam where you couldn't even see the crepe we asked if the floor manager could replace it and he said "that's how we make it, if you don't like it pay for a plain one." Woah. We spent $65 on breakfast, certainly reasonable for our group size, but won't be back and won't reco this place to anyone. Got the plain crepe and couldn't wait to leave.

Personally there are so many places to eat in this day and age why not go somewhere where customers are valued and cared for as family? That's how you keep people coming back for more.
author: Monica M.

description:
Solid breakfast and brunch place. Choose what you want, saunter up and order, grab a number and wait. 

This time had the French toast - which was good - and the huevos ranchero, which was merely ok and took the food down to a 3. 

Nice service, pleasant place to stop whilst in town.
author: Paul C.

description: Best crepes in SF!!!!! Nutella and strawberries on a cold evening hit the spot!!! Food coma!
author: G 2.

description: There was a bit of a line but it moved quickly, the menu has very good variety, and prices are well worth the meal. Came in for breakfast would come for lunch. Staff is friendly, spacious seating area. I Definitely recommend!
author: Rosie S.

description: Went for breakfast and they have their process defined perfect. Stand in line to order and grab a seat. They give the food in less than 10 mins after you have ordered. Eat and get out. Had the Acapulco omlette and it was tasteful. Their potatoes were amazing as well. In line for 15-20 mins, food came 10 mins after and we were out after that in 15 mins. For the crowd we were seeing in SFO for breakfast, this is quite reasonable.
author: Ashok K.

description: Killer menu with a wide array of choices. Friendly staff. Food is healthy and delicious. Some of the best potatoes I've ever had. The apple turkey bacon avocado sandwich is perfect. Highly recommend.
author: Matt S.

description:
Absolutely huge menu (seriously, it's a  4 blackboards that take up an entire wall) and everything looks delicious. Don't let the strange yellow outside decor fool you.

The line moves reasonably fast so despite the crowd we still were able to eat in good time. All the items we ordered were tasty and the dessert crepes even came with ice cream!
author: Alice C.

description: Their sunrise burrito is a must try! Great flavor. Generous serving size. Also had a crepe of the day, even though it was hard to choose from their list of sweet and savory options. The dulce de Leche was definitely delicious! It was even served with a side of vanilla ice cream. Heavenly.
author: A S.

description: This place is super cute and delicious! Came here for brunch on a Monday because all the other brunch places were closed.... So yay for being open on Mondays! Super close to Union Square... I got a blintz crepe which was so very interesting but delicious! It was so cute the way they designed it. My friend got a breakfast crepe which was also super good! The people were friendly and overall a good experience :)
author: Kathlena H.

description:
Been here often-- and the breakfast/brunch food NEVER DISAPPOINTS!!

Get's super crowded, sometimes line out the door. You also can't save seating before you get your food so SOMETIMES its a hit or miss, but it's a general rule once you're done eating you leave since this place is packed and it's a pretty small venue.

Anything w/ eggs: AMAZING
Waffles/Pancakes: AMAZING
Breakfast burritos: GREAT

and can't forget about the Earl grey. I love the earl grey. They also give you a personal teapot!

What more can you want?
author: Sophie P.

description:
I don't like what I ordered at all. It was the Chorizo Scramble. I thought it was just scrambled eggs with pork and cilantro but they added some hot sauce into it. It was like very novice messed up Mexican breakfast. They also paired with it an options of fruits or potatoes. I went with fruits assuming with was what I was expecting - NOT A GOOD COMBINATION!! Not to mention the bananas are all black and squished. The strawberries were sweet though. If this is your first time, do not order what I ordered. (My stomach felt funny after eating half my plate.) Try something more classic like pancakes or crepes. 

My best friend ordered a classic French toast and it was partially burnt and they served it to her. She complained that it was bitter and switched over to the strawberries she was offered with the toast only to find MOLD on her strawberries!!! That is unacceptable!! 

I was going to give 2 stars for presentation but I take it back after the mold incident. My best friend got a new cup of strawberries after complaining but you can hear and see that the staff doesn't really care and just doesn't want to make a scene.
author: Jannet H.

description:
NOT BAD, NOT GREAT...BUT WE'LL RETURN

Arrived afternoon about 4...not busy at all.
I had the sandwich and soup combo...tuna sandwich and vegetarian black bean chili.  The chili was really good...4 stars.  Tuna was average...3 stars and came with a side of potatoes...eh....2 stars.

My wife had a pesto crepe...and she loves crepes.  Her home made crepe recipe is insanely good.  But that creates a problem too.  If you are a restaurant that advertises yourself as a crepery, your crepes better kick ass.  Honey Honey's crepe pesto wasnt very good at all.  The crepe was overcooked and almost burned...so she wasnt impeesed at all. 1 star.

My daughter had a fruit bowl and she murdered it..so I'm guessing 5 stars. 

That works out to three stars...probably gonna try them for breakfast and give them a shot at french toast, pancakes, and waffles.
author: Randy S.

description:
Went here when our normal spot was crazy busy because of SFSketchFest and it was a great alternative. They were surprisingly flexible when the 25 of us walked in and ordered food and drinks! The guy at the counter who seemed to be the manager was joking and having fun which was nice.

The decor is a bit kitschy but who cares when you're enjoying crepes! I had a salad, but others around me seemed to enjoy their food. Only real downer was that 30 minutes to closing they were obviously trying to get people moving. I guess I understand, they aren't actually a bar or a dedicated dinner place, but it was unexpected.

Overall we'll be coming here when our regular place is busy or we want a change of scenery.
author: Victoria G.

description: Just in town visiting the City, I miss the Bay but you can't miss this spot. A must eat for breakfast. I had the Post street omelette and French toast. If I had a bigger stomach I would have order more. It's a small place so be prepared to wait.
author: Kenn M.

description:
Came here for late breakfast, it was walking distance from hotel.  This is an order at the counter place.  They are efficient, line moved quickly, and we did not have to much trouble finding a table.  This is an very relaxed casual place, so it is all about the food.

As the name suggests, the specialty is crepes, we ordered the breakfast crepes and the Eden crepes.  Both exceeded expectations.  If your in Union Square looking for a breakfast or lunch place this is one to check out.
author: Benjamin E.

description:
Came here with two other friends for a Sunday brunch. The line was long, but moved by fast, seated ourselves quickly at the first available table.

After waiting for a little over 30 minutes for our food to arrive, I went to the front to ask what I presume to be the owner where our food was at and told him that it had been about half an hour since we ordered and we were wondering where our order was as everyone else who ordered after us had gotten their meals already. He assured me that there was no way it could have been half an hour already and if it was, our meal was free.
Challenge accepted! He checked on our meal and said that it would be out in a minute so he was still good on his time.

Got back to the table, a couple minutes went by and our food finally came out. We got a comp'd mimosa for our wait, but we were still 95% sure he was late.
He came out to check on our table about 10 minutes after and owned up to his fault and admitted that we waited past the 30 minutes for our food, apologized, and asked us if we wanted a caramel crepe to make up for it.

I appreciate businesses that own up to their faults when it happens and tries to fix their mistake. Although we didn't get our money back, (we didn't ask for it, and we were pretty happy with the dessert he gave us anyway), we appreciated that he came clean with his mistake instead of saying that we were wrong and made it up.

I'll definitely be back because i get a sense that customer service here is TRULY important to them.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
As I searched for a breakfast place near my hotel, I came across this extremely cozy place. As everyone talks about how warm it is inside, they're not kidding. If you walk in bundled up, you'll go in taking each layer off, but be sure to keep your shirt on. :) 

I got to the restaurant at 10 am and waited a good 30 min prior to placing my order. The line goes by fast and you'll occupy your time pondering about what you'll order since the menu includes many options - from savory crepes to eggs florentine with crabs. Yum. I ordered the eggs florentine with lumps of crab embedded on a bed of spinach. I am not too fond of TOO much spinach, but the ease of removing excess lumps of it was manageable.  

Everything was delicious and the price was decent. Be sure to try a flavored coffee as well. It will wake you up instantly!
author: Evegail A.

description: Crepes were  good and so were the pancakes,  but the bacon was burnt and hard.  The 1 star was for complete lack of service. Tried to get someone's attention for new bacon, server just ran off and couldn't catch the attention of cashier.  Service was  non-existent, what there was of it was rude.  We got reprimanded because we didn't know how the seating worked, so we saved our table, but was told rudely to wait to be seated and given a number to put on our table and then stand in line to order.  None of this was clear-usually you get your number after you order.  I asked the cashier about the extensive menu and could tell she was extremely impatient to take my order.  Yes, the place is busy,  but patience,  people!  Also, the music was grating-I love EDM, but this was beyond and loud.  Couldn't wait to finish my meal and get out of there.  Attention to the manager and owner:  HIRE MORE STAFF!!
author: Hm L.

description:
This place had a line all the way to the door on a Saturday morning but it moved fairly quickly, allowing just enough time to absorb the menu and look at some of the dishes coming out of the kitchen by the time you order. The menu is quite extensive, between sweet and savory crepes, waffles, pancakes, sandwiches and salads. They also serve my breakfast staple, oatmeal, albeit instant and not steel cut,  but at least this way I got them made with soy milk instead of cow juice. That said, $6.00 for a bowl of instant oats is pretty hefty, the only thing they add is a little brown sugar on the side, no nuts, no fruit. 

The dessert crepes are another rip off for almost $7.00. Part of what made me come here were the reviews stating the crepes are perfect here but I couldn't disagree more. The batter was too thin and watery, resulting in a dry crepe that was burnt on one side and crumbing apart at the edges. Crepes aren't supposed to be that crispy, so they clearly got the batter wrong. The strawberries were sliced carelessly, leaving the green tops on, they also didn't appear to have been washed. I can make a better crepe at home, seriously.

BF seemed happy with the hash browns and his savory crepe, so maybe savory is the way to go here. His crepe also looked less dry.
author: Ute L.

description:
For those of you from Sac, this place is VERY similar to Crepeville. In fact, their items on the menu and the chalk drawn menus themselves is almost a mirror image to Crepeville. 

They have a large variety of crepes. We had the grilled eggplant and strawberry/nutella crepe. Both were delicious. Will be back.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Came here with a friend for brunch. It looked like a good idea but we ended up regretting it. 

Drinks:

I got an Italian soda and my friend got a latte. The Italian soda was flat and the latte was not even warm. Very disappointing.

Now onto the food: 

I got the Salmon Benedict with potatoes. The Benedict was cold and stale and te potatoes were equally cold and burnt as if they had been pre-cooked and left out for way too long. Nasty. 

My friend got a sweet crepe which was very undercooked and doughy. Also cold. 

Bottom line:

Gross, soggy and cold AF never again.
author: Tracy T.

description: Every single taste of every single thing was super good. From the French toast batter to the syrup and the crabcake Benedict what divine. Most times either the Benedict or the potato is good but here both of them were delicious! Must eats in San Fran
author: Kawai L.

description: Got a hair in my crepe... Told the cashier. They Offered to get me something else but come on, I lost my appetite after that. No I don't want anything else, they did not offer to reimburse me. Bleh. Food is just okay either way.
author: Mayra F.

description: Yummy food!  Love the Chicken Pesto Crepe and my son loved his croissant sandwich.  Definitely would come here again!
author: Rashmi B.

description: I don't get it. We saw the long line, reviews and got a recommendation for this place, but when we finally arrived, it was...meh. The crab cake in the Half Moon Bay and Crab Cake Florentine were under-seasoned and tasteless. The potatoes were also bland and undercooked. No kid options just an overpriced plain $13 burger (the nice bun and large size made it a good burger though). The French fries were crispy and fluffy, so thumbs up on those. The real sin here was the "fresh" orange juice. We were excited to see a euro-style juice press. Navels are in season (or close enough) and grown in the state. But the juice was pale yellow, not rich orange, and tasted watery. At $5 a glass, I'd give it 1 star, maybe. Processed store-bought juice tastes better. No restauranteur worth their salt would sell it. They would have been better served saying the machine was out of order. Bottom line: we were hungry and we ate until full. But for $60 for a party of three, we'll find somewhere else to satisfy our cravings.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Solid breakfast the second time we came.  The Torino crepe with feta, mushrooms and spinach was tasty and came with a generous salad, a huge bowl of granola (seemed store bought) topped with fruit and greek yogurt, and a crispy Belgian waffle with lots of berries and whipped cream (~$6). 

On our first visit, I was disappointed in the 2-2-2 plate, which was quite small in portions, with two tiny pancakes, 2 thin bacon and a small scoop of eggs ($8,95) - wouldn't recommend it.  

Overall, liked the bottomless coffee, unique breakfasts and quality food.
author: Alexis R.

description:
Crepes, pasta, and sandwiches!

Came here to carbo-load before the Nike Women's Marathon. It is a very small and cute cafe that you would find on Haight Street or the Marina area. Surprisingly it is close to downtown San Francisco. Under the recommendation of my brother, we trekked over to the cafe with our bellies grumbling and ready to get our carbs in. I got the rigatoni san luca (sun dried tomatoes, chicken breast, garlic, and basil) and my brother and cousin got crepes. I don't remember what crepes they got but I got to taste theirs and both were very yummy. I loved the rigatoni san luca, very filling and lots of flavor. Best part was that it cane with garlic bread which as crispy on the outside and soft and warm on the inside. We shared the caramel crepe for dessert and it was very delicious. Warm, sweet, and made with much love. 

The service is pretty good. The staff is friendly and attentive. It took awhile for our food to come out but that is because they make the food as you order. You seat yourself. We ate inside because it was cold outdoors. Loved the recommendation my brother gave. I wanted to try the coffee, but I figured cafine was not a good choice due to that I needed sleep before the big race!
author: Joyce D.

description: Everything was perfect. Food, timeliness, cleanliness, service...my new favorite breakfast spot in SF
author: Tiffany L.

description:
What a cool place in the middle of everything in San Francisco.
We stopped here for lunch one day and didn't want to leave it. It has a nice, cool decor, cozy and it was so warm in there... They also had the place decorated for Christmas. Too cute!

Their menu is extensive and you can read it from a few blackboards. You order, pay, get a number, grab a table, they bring the food to you.
If you can't find something to eat here, there's no chance for you. They have great breakfast dishes (omelets, bagels, etc), salads, sandwiches, crepes (savory and sweet), burgers, sliders, pastas for lunch or dinner. They have a great variety of coffees, sodas (Orangina, Italian ones), good, cheap draft beer (Sierra Nevada, Fat Tire) for about $3,50 a glass, wine for about $5 a glass.

We both ordered the Chicken Pesto Savory crepe w. tomato, Swiss cheese, garlic (not very strong), basil, chicken breast, pesto. It comes w. a salad, fruit cup or a side of potatoes. We chose the potatoes, very good and flavorful w. great seasonings on. The crepe was outstanding, one of the best we ever had. Just delicious. 

You can get water from the house (they have containers with squeezed oranges, or limes and cucumbers).

Very nice place, cozy, casual, perfect for whatever meal all day long. Great place to hang out with friends. If I'd live in town, I'd stop by frequently.
author: Jo S.

description: Came here on a Saturday night trying to enjoy a delicious crepe with some friends and ended up waiting 40 minutes before asking the cashier when our one crepe was coming out. He asked what we ordered because they had forgotten about it. Without apologizing, he delivered the crepe 10 minutes later and it honestly taste like strawberry and Nutella inside a fried tortilla. I would definitely NOT recommend this place.
author: Madeline L.

description: Stopped in for breakfast and shared a savory breakfast and SPK dessert crepe. The staff was efficient and very friendly. Orange juice is fresh squeezed and the food is very flavorful. The breakfast potatoes had a hint of rosemary that added something extra to the flavor. This place is definitely a must visit if you are in the area.
author: Jeni P.

description:
Nice little place on the corner of the street

Late start today but they still had a massive line, we waited it out for about 15 minutes before being able to order

Nice fresh pressed Orange Juice behind the counter 

I ordered the burrito, eggs Benedict, dessert crepe and pancakes just try sample what they had for this review ;)

Pancake was small but well made

Eggs Benedict was well made, good taste, comes with potatoes

Crepe was SO good and came with a small scoop of ice cream, BUT there was no filling!??? Just fruit and crepe so maybe add that 

Burrito was more of a Mexican state breakfast burrito, came with black beans and sour cream. Not what I was used to but tasted fine

All portions except the crepe seems a tad small for the prices but it's SF so it is what it is

5 star based off of food and presence, this rating has nothing to do with customer service
author: Corbin B.

description:
Food was AMAZING! Tons to choose from and seriously one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Service was super friendly and polite. Affordable prices, especially for what you get. 
Bonus: my wallet fell out and I realized an hour later and panicked. Called them and they had and all the cash was in it! Top notch!!!
author: Julia H.

description: Went here at noon on a Saturday- line out the door(always a good sign!). Waited less than 30 minutes- waiter found us a table while we waited- removed the stress! Menu is expansive, food came quickly- meals were excellent! Crepes are wonderful. Quick tip; come after the lunch rush- at 1:00 there was no line at all! Easy and cheap parking only 2 blocks away at Union Square- what's not to love?
author: Bob H.

description: LOVED this place! Great food and great service, but make sure you get there with time to spare, there is generally a line. Also try the nutella crepes or the crab cakes!
author: Hal N.

description: Great food, cheap mimosas with fresh squeezed orange juice... what's not to like?! Better get here well before you are hungry though because it tends to get busy early and there can be a line out the door!
author: Aaron H.

description: Disgusting, old smelly lox bagel with thick 1in long black hair in the food. I brought this to their attention and they claimed it was my hair. I dont even have hair that long . Then they claimed it from my wife, blond hair woman and she is not bearded. There was 3 pieces of hair between the lox and under the tomato. I still feel sick thinking of this . DISGUSTING!!!
author: Parham S.

description: The crepes were very good. BUT... my wife's latte was served in a sticky cup. Then we waited well over a half hour for our food to be prepared, well after people way behind us had been served - I suspect that our order fell through the cracks. Then my wife's omelette came out wrong and when they fixed it it wasn't half cooked. Then halfway through my bagel I found a short, curly hair smooshed into the cream cheese. I know none of that was on purpose and I just had some bad luck but still, super disappointing for a place that routinely has a line out the door.
author: David G.

description: We came after reading the numerous accolades of the breakfast items and how it was worth the wait. It's not worth the wait. I had the eggs Benedict that was bland, the side of bacon was barely cooked, but the staff were very friendly. Don't wait more than ten minutes, there are too many restaurants nearby that are fabulous
author: Bill S.

description: Loved it. Food was excellent.  Wait wasn't too bad, food worth the w a it. Great hollindase.
author: Tom R.

description: Maybe don't close 25 minutes before you say you do when someone comes in and asks for takeout at 9:35.
author: Meredith S.

description:
Went here with my cofounder for brunch before our interview.  The wait is long - the line was out the door....  We had 1.25 hours, so we thought let's do it!  

Fresh squeezed orange juice!!
The food was great!

Will definitely want to go back if we're near there again.
author: Arry Y.

description:
Rude? Who cares when you have a captive crowd that has no other place to go. 
Line is sort of long 1/2 hour on a Saturday morning. Just because its crowded, this doesn't mean its good. I would not wait half an hour, not even five minutes to eat here again. 
Take for instance the bloody Mary, no flavor and no veggies. Skimpy at best, not sure it had much alcohol in out either. ALl you have to do to be average is toss in some celery....
I had the Huevos Rancheros. Also way below average. The salsa was bland, the whole dish lacked flavor. Big mistake. 

We had a table of 7, the first 3 or 4 dishes came out and then it took almost ten minutes for the rest. My food was cold by the time our whole table had been served.
That should never happen

The service and the food, below average.
author: Ben M.

description:
Why is this place even still open?

1. Single cashier while upwards of 20 customers wait in line.
2. The menu- vast selection, just not a very attractive one. I stared for a long while and could not decide still.
3. The food. Okay, the Blintz (ricotta cheese, orange marmalade, strawberry preserve) blended together to form an unfortunate vomitous color and oozed out of the cut crepe to form a generally displeasing sight. Don't forget the now individual chunks of ricotta cheese floating in the putrid pond. It both looked and tasted like the invention of an ambitious novice cook. It did not taste good.

The savory Florentine Crepe (spinach, cheddar, cottage cheese, onions) was a better, although not by much. Onions were not caramelized at all and left an unpleasant spiciness in my mouth. The rest was just spinach and sliced cheddar thrown together with some cheese. Underseasoned, undercooked.


Chai latter: I suppose I've been spoiled with actual Chai latte and not the sugar and foam concoction starbucks offers, but I wanted some actual chai flavor in my chai latter, and I got none. Enough said.

Disappointed. Will not come back.
author: Chia L.

description: Great casual breakfast spot! I had the crab cake crepe, my boyfriend had the chorizo egg scramble, and we shared a dessert crepe.  Everything was delicious, and big portions for the price.  I love the variety on the menu, and can't wait to go back to try one of the salads and more of the dessert crepes!  The fruit infused water was also a nice touch, and very refreshing.  The owner was also very nice and helpful.
author: Bella C.

description: I tried out their French toast combination. It was fairly good. Nothing too special really.
author: Mark C.

description:
The space: Excellent, lots tables, open, good atmosphere, free WIFI
The food: Not bad, but had better
The service: It's okay. 

This place is borderline. One shift to right or left and it'd be perfect or kinda bad. If they'd only improve the food, ingredients, gave it a little extra attention. Or the service, the workers do what's expected and nothing more. Sometimes they succeed sometimes they fail. 

Guy brought my plate and the spoon dropped. He asks, what did you drop? I said YOU dropped the spoon. He got me another spoon.
author: Joshua G.

description:
Wow. This little place was BUSY. There was a constant line to the door, and now we know why!

They have an amazing selection of benedicts and crepes. They have seafood, vegetable, different ethnic tastes, and more. Also, you get so much food, it's unbelievable. They have infused water and coffee in a diner like setting.

I had the salmon benedict and shared a blintz with my table. The salmon benedict came with a fruit cup and potatoes, which were delicious. It was the perfect balance of sauce with the potatoes, muffin, and plentiful salmon.

The blintz had marmalade and strawberry sauce and was packed with cottage cheese.

We were brought here by our friends before Pride and we would definitely go here again if we were closer to SF. I highly recommend you check it out.
author: Kira W.

description:
I came here after reviewing Yelp, when I was visiting SanFran. I walked over here from the Moscone Center (about 10-15 minutes). I was not disappointed! 

I was in a rush to be in a conference, so i began walking shortly before they opened. I already knew what I want and called to order it right at 7:30am. When I arrived a line of people were just let in (from waiting outside). They serve so many options, it was difficult to decide. I went with the salmon eggs Benedict. They offer a variety of teas, that are served in a little tea pot so that you can refill 2-3 cups. They also offer fresh fruit infused waters complimentary. 

If I were here longer, I would definitely return to try more.
author: Savannah S.

description: Needed to get breakfast before I left SF. Was right by hotel. This place was packed, but more than worth it. Great service, and amazing food. Best crepes I have ever had with strawberries and kiwi inside. The ice cream on the side was so good with the crepes. Staff was nice and not stuck up. Wonderful breakfast. Next time I'm here I'm coming for breakfast.
author: Alia M.

description: Amazing food.... amazing staff. ....please don't miss out on this place..... With a city full of restaurants this one stands out. We eat here multiple days in a row when we are in town. Love love love this place
author: Travis G.

description: Grabbed dessert and coffee here with a friend after dinner. The place was spacious and clean,  but the menu was a little overwhelming. They offer a variety of crepes and we ended up ordering the strawberry Nutella and two plain crepe, which was basically butter with sugar, a regular coffee and iced mocha. The crepes were delicious! One came with aside of whipped cream and the other with vanilla ice cream. Overall I was satisfied and would come back.  The cashier was also super friendly and talkative, which was nice!
author: Nina A.

description:
Love this little corner shop gem. The menu is enormous! Everything we had was delish. The cable car omelette was huge and you must try the potatoes. Lots of home made goodies and good Bay Area combinations. 

Faves: caffe latte, any omelette
author: Christina L.

description: Delicious! Definitely try the crepes. Breakfast sandwich was ok, nothing special. Long wait line, but the flow of the food service allows everyone adequate time to eat and leave. Not good for big groups.
author: Jonathan D.

description: Underwhelming. Definitely not worth 40 minute wait Sunday morning. Crepes were undercooked, eggs were overcooked, and crab cake would benefited tremendously if it actually had more crab in it.
author: Tetyana B.

description: First I'm very biased against restaurants where I can't sit and order. After 20 min in line (at 8:50am),plus 15 min waiting at the table, I wasn't disappointed (or was I just ravenous?). The pesto crepe was very good but the Nutella, banana, and walnut was great, although is hard to make a bad crepe with those ingredients.
author: Erasmo A.

description: Failed to get an order of three.  We ordered three meals prior to coffee and mimosa order and they failed to get it right.
author: Tammy M.

description:
Fantastic savory crepes. I had the pesto crepe and loved it!

Minus one star for chaotic seating arrangement.
author: Rene B.

description:
I'll probably never return here. Came here for dessert..... ordered a banana Nutella crepe. Was good but nothing to write home about.

Have to say I was really turned off when I saw the big garbage can, that they rolled in from outside, in the kitchen. Gross! It was near closing so hopefully it's not always sitting in there. Just doesn't seem sanitary.
author: Angela D.

description:
We've been coming here for years and have always had a good experience.    That was not the case yesterday.    There was a long line and it took a half hour to place our order.    No problem, as it's a popular place.     Once we placed our order, we waited for 45 minutes and noticed everyone in line after us was already eating and almost done!   I noticed the owner walking by and asked him to look into our ticket as its been 45 mins.   He said sure, and walked away.   15 mins go by and we never hear back from him, so I walked up to the register and told the cashier that we've been waiting for an hour for our food.   She goes in the back and tells us it'll be any minute.  Another 15 minutes later I go back to her and at this point I'm not happy, she gives me a funny look as she's getting annoyed and says any minute now.   Long story short, we get our food 1:20 minutes after we ordered our food.  This couple next to our table was leaving and actually said to us, you don't even have your food yet!?   You were ahead of us, and we're already done and leaving!

Clearly they must have misplaced our order.   My main problem wasn't that they screwed up, but the way they handled it.    The owner never came back to apologize or explain what had happened.    Even when I asked the cashier to get the owner, he still didn't come out.   Bad management practice when you don't care if you've treated customers so poorly.    With Yelp this kind of behavior spreads fast so hopefully they learn how to handle situations like this.    Oh, right about when we were leaving, one of their servers dropped off a Crepe at our table and said this is on the house.   Really?   A $7 Crepe, no explanation or apology?    We didn't touch their Crepe, and left it there.    Watch out for this place, if the owner doesn't care about their customers, that attitude trickles down to the employees.
author: Nasser G.

description:
The only reason why I am not giving this place five stars is because of the incredibly long wait. For two people, waiting in this line was about an hour. I'm being nice by saying an hour because I really felt like I was waiting for a century. 

The menu is extensive which is above the mirror that is IN the place -- so in some way, you have to stick your head in the place to take a look at what you want or you can just stand for an hour, staring at your options. They have freshly squeezed orange juice which is yummy but then for three bucks and no refills? Eh. Their coffee is good and strong but not worth it being that I didn't feel like it was fresh. 

We had the chirizo and eggs .. and I had the eggs benedict. Now let me just say that I asked for my potatoes to be crispy because I like them this way! And the lady made no notation. She just nodded which kind of irritated me. I mean, hello? I've been waiting for an hour and I can't even get the food that I want right? So when we sat down, our food came quickly. We were surprised. My boyfriend loved his food. He said he was worried because of the reviews on yelp of the plate being too eggy? Or not eggy enough but he thought it was perfect. He also commented on how much cilantro it had which was what he wanted. For me, my benedict was perfect. The eggs were easy so they exploded PERFECTLY! The only downer was my damn potatoes because they weren't crispy. 

I have to say that even though there was the long wait and the non crispy potatoes, this was my favorite spot to eat while in SF. 

PS. Tip -- do not sit down to find a spot to claim because according to the bus boy, you need to order first. 

ALSO! I really wish that they had more than one register taking orders. Like com'n now, start a line where someone takes orders and it goes to the kitchen while someone then pays. It just was too long of a wait dammit!
author: Angela R.

description: The line was long it took about 30 min but it was worth it! Once we ordered the food and got sited we got serviced pretty quick,we ordered omelets and creek salads and it was amazing ! They have tons of great options to choose from. What ever me and my friends ordered was really good !
author: Stas S.

description:
First, know that the food here is EXCELLENT. That's why I've given them three stars-it was unfortunately their only saving grace. We started out being a little time-limited, our fault in the first place, but figured we could get in/out in an hour. However...the line to order started to creep over 20 minutes...and I started to have a twinge of doubt. Once we ordered, they attempted to serve me a half full cup of cold coffee-so had to get them to replace it. Then we sat...and sat...I watched the people just behind us get their food. We sat some more. We went to ask if it would be ready soon, were told 10 additional minutes. By now, it's been about 40, so had them change the order to To Go. The folks who got their food who were just behind us finished...and left...I went up one more time to start to ask for a refund and they miraculously brought out the food. Not sure the owner felt it was a big deal. Pretty disappointing! 

The food, though-the breakfast crepe was so, so good. The flavor was so rich, and the portions were hefty. Served with some fresh fruit on the side...we were impressed. The menu is expansive and part of me really wants to try more-if I can stomach the poor service.
author: Amy S.

description: Honey had the Torino and said it's the best thing he has eaten during the entire trip here. I had the Nutella strawberry banana. The only reason for not giving 5s is the bathroom was a mess and no toilet paper. We went at 4 and there was only 2 people in front of us and took 10 minutes until we could order. It place had a line out the door both Saturday and Sunday morning.
author: AM B.

description:
If variety is the spice of life, Honey Honey is a freakin' cornucopia. Greek omelettes, pesto chicken crepes, and a few dozen drinks (some featuring alcohol!) line a menu spanning a whole wall of their fine establishment.

Still, it feels like something's...missing. The portions are a little small, the coffee lacks kick, and the prices are just a little too high. 

How ironic.
author: Casey S.

description:
I stopped here for breakfast and left extremely disappointed. If you're going to have a breakfast burrito on your menu in California, it had better not suck. 

It was a large portion but nothing was good about my meal. Boring beans. Flavorless burrito. 

The fresh squeezed orange juice, however, was fantastic. Staff was friendly.
author: Michael O.

description: Good for diner food type experience.  Counter service and the staff brings you food.  Very fast.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Long line but it moves quickly and definitely worth the wait.

I had their carrot juice --- OMG! so good.  The hubs had the OJ also very delicious.  We had the Half Moon Bay Crepe and the Eggs Benedict.  Both great!  The Crepe had a generous portion of crab cake!
author: Mary N.

description: Average breakfast. We waited in line for about 20 minutes for breakfast on a Tuesday morning. Extensive menu with reasonable prices. I had the Milano omelette that had tomatoes, mozzarella, garlic with basil that was tasty. Sides included cold bland breakfast potatoes and hard boring sourdough toast. My husband had the salmon eggs benedict with was also just OK. Nothing exciting, nothing that stood out but nothing was bad. Probably wouldn't come back just because it wasn't anything memorable.
author: Erin K.

description:
Despite the fact that I was really hungry and was looking forward to a great breakfast of crepes, I will have to give this place only two stars. The primary reason for this is that the food, although ok, was a little chewy and the plates were very unhealthy.  

More specifically, every single piece of crockery that we received was chipped in someway.  The plate was so severely chapped, that it went for approximately an inch and a half on to the plate. When we commented that they were serving crepes on chipped plates, they simply traded the plate and didn't make new food. This is a health hazard. 

The scrambled eggs were excellent. However, the crapes, for what they should be well known for, were a little too chewy, Doughy, and not like other crepes. I have been to many crepe stands and this was probably one of the worst.
author: Steve M.

description:
This place is awful. It's so inefficiently run and the food is less than "ok".

Inefficient:
I didn't go back for a long time because it wasn't good, but I woke up this morning craving a crepe and it's about the only place I know of. I was horrified to see the line out the door but you know how cravings go....we were thee for over an hour before actually getting our food. 

Bad crepes:
The only reason I'm not giving it one star is because I haven't tried anything other than the crepes...trying to be fair.
The strawberry crepe had some sort of artificial flavoring in it...with fresh strawberries but I couldn't taste any cinnamon or brown sugar as advertised so the thing was really bitter. I had to eat some of the canned whipped cream they put on the side just for sweetness! 
My husband's plain butter and sugar crepe only had a sprinkle of powdered sugar on top so it was NOT sweet. Again I went to the canned whip cream for some flavor... In Paris, the butter and sugar crepes have a bunch of sugar inside so it's nice and flavorful. This was awful. The crepe itself isn't even that good, half crispy and half dry.

I would not go here for a crepe and other than that there is absolutely no reason to wait in line here for food you could get at the many other cafés around thee block. I would know, I live a block away.
author: Kat S.

description: I went here on a whim when I was on SF and was I happy I did! The crabcakes are to diiieeeeee for. Half moon bay crepe, crabcake Benedict, the orange juice and the flavored water. It was a loooooong wait but the food made me forget about that. I had a blissful happy moment when I tasted the first bite of the crabcake benedict. I was wish I could go backkkkk!
author: Judy N.

description: Don't be scared away by the line out the door!Hang in there and you will be rewarded with some of the most creative crepes and omelettes in San Francisco. You order at the counter and receive a number to seat yourself. Etiquette reminder- don't save seats unless you've ordered. It's unfair to the other persons standing in line. Be patient, you will get a seat since the turnover is fast!
author: Adrian B.

description: Wow! This place is amazing! The menu is huge and has tons of options! Decided on this place just based on proximity to my apartment and Yelp review. We went on a Saturday around 11:30 and there was a small wait, but the service was quick and the food was great. Almost everything on the menu was under $10 with some items at $11.95 or less. This isn't a full service restaurant so don't expect that, but I would definitely be back!
author: Elaine Tiffany P.

description:
Just had breakfast here this morning. We were in line just before 9 and we were just outside the door and waited for 30 min. There is an eclectic group of people, array of menu items, and several options for drinks. The issue with this place for us wasn't the food, it was the line and lack of service. The only reason they have a long wait is because there is a single register and its counter service only. Then 1-2 people run out food and wipe down tables with the same dirty rag...eek! If they had 3-4 people taking orders then they would turn over much quicker.

Now to the food...I was determined to get the crab hollandaise but seeing a few people picking shells out of their mouth I opted against it. I instead went with the Eden crepe. It was a wonderful combination of sweet,salty and filling. The potatoes had a nice crispy, crunchy crust and just lacked a little on the seasoning. You get your own brewing kettle of tea. My husband said his coffee was "okay." He had the chorizo scramble and the chorizo was 60/40 to the eggs and had a nice spice to it. We also shared a side of the chicken apple sausage which was very flavorful. Overall with tip we spent $35. Very reasonable for SF. I think if this place nailed down the order process, they'd definitely be more efficient and would be worthy of 4.5+ rating. ***Go with a crepe, they do them quite well, everything else seemed inconsistent and not really special from any other breakfast place!
author: Tiffany P.

description: This was my favorite breakfast sit-down place on our entire California trip. Keep in mind the lines WILL be long even on weekdays. So either order take-out, or expect to wait. For us, the line was about halfway to the door and we were in and out (sitting down to eat) within 30 minutes so they do move the line rather quickly. I go the pesto crepe and my wife got an omelette. We highly recommend both.
author: Tom S.

description:
I loved coming here. The food is really tasty, but they failed me big time today. I ordered t a crepe to go and when it came time to eat it, it was the size of my palm. It was tiny. AND they left out my protein--the mushrooms!! There was no way I was going to go back to tell them since I was already at work. 
Not a good experience.
author: Steph M.

description:
Expect a long wait to order your food. This place is pretty small so there is not a lot of seating, especially for groups. A group of 4 or more may have trouble sitting together. The staff is pretty friendly and helpful.

On to the good stuff... this place has a great selection of breakfast items. It was really hard to chose so I had the Milano Omelette with potatoes. I was satisfied, and it tasted like pizza which I love so I was happy with my choice. I did not try the crepes which I now regret but next time for sure. :)

Be cautious of your surroundings if you have to wait outside. A random woman stood so close to me that our shoes were touching and when I would move, she would move closer. She had no intent in eating there since she was a transient and eventually left after walking around the back of the restaurant. I am sure restaurants and stores are used to this type of behavior but just watch your stuff. 

I recommend this place. :)
author: Tricia S.

description: Portion size was way too small. Service was slow. Food was pretty good. Nothing great.
author: Samantha A.

description: Really good but not great.  Yes the line is long, yes the restaurant is small and yes the menu is full.  Have to take a star away not for any of these reasons but because the food didn't live up to the 45 minute wait.  If we had walked in, ordered and ate immediately I may be inclined to be more impressed.  I had the pesto crepe and as an avid pesto nut (get it) I have never said too much pesto... But too much pesto!  The potatoes were good but all the food seemed a little cold like maybe it had been sitting under for a bit before it was brought out.  I think for the wait and the choices I prefer mamas down the street.
author: Jackie R.

description: Food is good but the experience is not great.  This is an order at the counter place and it's painfully slow.  There were 4 people in line and I stood there for 15  minutes just to put in my order.   People are nice but the process is just too inefficient for me.
author: Craig T.

description: a massive rat the size of a ipad mini ran past my foot into the kitchen as i was ordering.  grossest thing ever.
author: Teague E.

description: This place was amazing. The line looks long, but it's really not. It's probably the same wait as if you were seated and a waiter took your order.  Once you order and sit the food comes quick and it's delicious. Miami Heat with the chicken sausage instead of chicken breast. SRK was delicious and the chocolate waffle was great too. Did I mention the potatoes were the best I've ever had. My wife and I were sitting there trying to figure out how they made them so good.
author: Brett N.

description:
Our plates were absolutely wiped clean by the time we got done with this place.  We were here for breakfast and although the line was long, it went by rather quickly.  I ordered the Pesto Crepe which was Cheddar, tomato, spinach, pine nuts, feta cheese, pesto, and avocado.  As a side, I ordered the salad.  This was my first time having a crepe that wasn't a "sweet" crepe so I was excited to dig in.  The flavor of the Pesto mixed in with everything else was so yummy!

There are times when you order food and your plate is so good that you don't even want to try anyone else's plate.  (Or at least that's what I thought.)  When I finished all of mine, I couldn't resist trying the potatoes which were leftover on my friend Alice's plate.  They were delicious by the way.  

Because you can't go to a Crepe place without having a dessert style crepe, we ordered a Strawbery Nutella to top off our meal.  I already have a weakness for anything with Nutella so this was just icing on the cake.  I loved every bite of this and so did everyone else.
author: Lorie N.

description:
I was very disappointed in our visit here. I ordered the cheese blintz and a side of bacon and my boyfriend ordered the huevos. 

It wasn't that busy. We waited a long time for our food and started to think they forgot about our food. When we noticed the three people that were in back of us in line recieve their food we decided to say something. The guy didn't even respond or apologize.... just went in the back ane grabbed our food that had obviously been sitting there a while. My bacon was cold and hard and my blintz were nothing like blintz. When I cut them open, liquid poured out with small chunks of cheese. Not very appetizing. It was more like a crepe filled syrup with a tiny bit of cottage chrese. His food was just OK. Overall the service was awful. Even though the food wasn't great.  

I would have given a better review if the service was better.
author: Alexandria O.

description: My wife and I were fortunate to stumble upon this place just before they opened on a Friday morning and we ended up the third couple in line. Upon entering, we could see that the kitchen was already buzzing with action and ready for the crowd to come. Looking around as the restaurant quickly filled up, we could see a healthy mix of visitors and locals which created a comfortable setting. Their menu included many traditional breakfast items but was also infused with a number of signature items that sets the place apart. Both of our plates were delicious and more than generous in size which left my wife and I completely satisfied and planning to return when in SF next.
author: Matthew K.

description:
You wait a long time to place your order, but it's worth it. We had eggs florentine and two eggs any style. Both were wonderful, as were the potatoes that came with them. The coffee was excellent!

I really appreciated something else. Because there is often a long wait standing in line, many parties have someone sit down to reserve a table. While we were there, an employee made the rounds, politely asking people to wait until they had ordered to sit down. Good for them! It makes it much more likely that everyone will find a place to sit after ordering.
author: Daryl M.

description: Wanted something sweet and quick so decided to order strawberry crepe with Nutella. It was kind of pricey for a crepe with strawberry's and Nutella. The crepe came with vanilla ice cream, but when the plate came, it was only a dinky scoop of ice cream barely enough to go with the crepe. The crepe was just so so. I've had better. I see a lot of breakfast items, but it's all kind of pricey.
author: Samantha W.

description:
This place is fantastic. They have a wide variety of crepes - sweet, savory, dessert, breakfast - you name it! 

The line often winds out the door, so be prepared to wait in line. The wait is worth it!
author: RJ K.

description:
I was staying just down the road at the Hotel Warwick and woke up on my first morning in SF looking for a good breakfast. Maybe a crepe? Perhaps a breakfast sandwich? Hmmm I guess I would need to take the walk (uphill - like everything else in this city) to Honey Honey!

Entering, I wasn't floored by the place, certainly a local spot with a loyal following as the moment I placed my order the line up filled up and out the door behind me. I'd classify this as a dive breakfast spot... but one that certainly pumps out a variety of delicious breakfast/brunch/lunch options. It ain't fancy... its Honey Honey!

For breakfast I ordered the huevos rancheros and a fresh squeezed orange juice. The OJ was divine and I nearly downed the entire cup on first sip, totally refreshing! I wasn't really impressed with the HR, which was haphazardly tossed together on the plate with two eggs resting on soaked tortilla's smothered in black beans, salad, cilantro and more beans. Little care was taken with presentation but the taste was pretty good. I've had better HR but I think that I should have had the crepes seeing as this is what they are famous for...next time....next time!

Positive points for the free wifi, and for those looking to connect the password is simply their phone number!

I'd be back, to try something else off their insane chalkboard menu board!

Eatcrest Out!
author: Kris U.

description:
I don't randomly pop up in restaurants. I usually check reviews and make sure I get my money's worth but it was 7 PM and I was so hungry soooo....

I popped in.

The food was bad. The fetuccine was SO BLAND. THERE WAS NO FLAVOR.

But the server was nice so 2 stars.
author: Leslie M.

description: Got in before the crowd but just barely.  We ordered eggs Benedict and they were really well done.  Had a side order of bacon which was a little on the burnt side but hell its bacon.  Not used to these big city prices.  Recommend for sure.
author: Scott W.

description: I've been visiting San Francisco for 3 days now and I've been trying to hit the best spots to eat according to yelp . This place beats everything I've had by a long shot . The food was FANTASTIC ! I ordered the crab cake Benedict and it was amazingness in my mouth ! Other plates we ordered were the Miami Heat and chicken pesto crepe as well as the banana Nutella crepe and pancakes as well as the blitz. Everything was delicious ! Orange juice is fresh squeezed and really delicious and they actually had high chairs for my baby nephew . I could come back a few more times before leaving . Service was great and the owner made sure to check on us while we were eating .
author: Sima A.

description:
You find yourself in downtown San Francisco.  You find yourself hungry in the morning.  You're craving something sweet but also something savory.  You see a line.  It's not that long of a line.  The weather's okay.  Then you get a whiff of buttery batters and fruity fragrances.  You glance at your watch. You look down the street ... then down the other side of the street.  There's nothing else.  You check your Yelp App for other options but you'll have to walk another one or two blocks further.  The line is long but this many people can't be wrong.  You continue waiting and finally reach the order counter.

You're glad you tried a crepe at Honey Honey. [Original Visit: 2007; Second Visit: May 2013]
author: Jack F.

description: I went here with a couple others looking for a fun place to grab a dessert. Seeing high reviews (and loving crepes) I chose Honey Honey. I was highly dissatisfied. The crepes were highly priced and poor in appearance and flavor. The Blintz crepe was very disappointing. The man working was very rude and messed up the order. To top it off, I felt sick after eating it. I would not recommend.
author: Brendan F.

description:
TOURISTS BE WARNED, Avoid like the plague. I've lived here for 7 years and the place is still terrible.

I left a similar review back in 2009 when this place was called Crepevine, then decided to delete the review and go back. Bad decision, this place still has the same terrible food and service. This time instead of finding har in my tasteless food, my eggs were very undercooked (I ordered them over easy) and the fruit (strawberries and bananas) looked and tasted to be past their prime. 

Do yourself a favor and get better food at a little bit grittier of a place up the street at the likes of Han's Coffee Shop or Golden Coffee on Sutter and leavenworth, like the rest of the locals. The food there is almost half the price and a lot cleaner.
author: Ed D.

description: We were really hungry and just needed a place to eat. This place is ghetto AF. I think it's made for tourist. The line was incredibly slow and the decor is a complete mess. The menu looks identical to squat & gobble and crepevine.
author: Scott T.

description:
