Had read good reviews about this place and since we were going to the Mission District this day, we decided to stop by here on our way to another one since there wasn't a line. I was very confused when we came in. Weren't sure whether we could just seat ourselves or what. It had a sign but nobody came to sit us so we ended up sitting and I went up to the register to order crab cake eggs benedict & earl grey tea for myself and for my hubbs, got him a bagel with butter, OJ, and the two, two and two (2 eggs scrambled, bacon, and pancakes). Very delicious although I got sick of the crab cakes taste after a bit.  

I did notice that my teapot the spout had a crack in it.. might want to replace that, guys.
author: Elaine C.

description: So Delish. Had their Mediterranean crepe and their Half Moon Bay (crab cake) crepe very savory and hearty. Mimosa is on point they must use their freshly squeezed OJ to make them. Fruits are fresh too. Potatoes perfectly seasoned. Order first then get a seat, the flow of the place is nice no trouble getting a seat even on a Sunday at 11am.
author: Mariegold M.

description:
On our way out of San Francisco (WEEP!), we had a few hours to kill before our flight so we ducked into this charming little creperie/breakfast spot located nearby our hotel.  

I stupidly had gobbled up leftover chocolate from Millennium (it was so worth it!) so I wasn't too starved at this point.  Nonetheless, the tofu scramble was something surprisingly good.  It wasn't exactly scrambly, more like tiny seasoned cubes of tofu - but it was delicious.  I'm not to certain as to what the tofu had been stirfried with, but it was slightly salty and herby - not the usual nutritional yeast (which yes, I like as well).  The breakfast potatoes were also a nice touch from the usual hash browns - chopped up slightly pan-fried morsels of crunchy warm soft deliciousness.  The potato and tofu combo was lovely with a splash of Tabasco and ketchup topped off with fresh green onions and cilantro.  The accompany sourdough bread seemed to be the kind mass-produced.  It was airier than usual, but all right.  

I also had a soy latte and it was pretty great, but again, I had stupidly chugged down day ole Starbucks beforehand (I'm rough in the morning, okay?!).  Let's just say this stuff was tastier than day old Starbucks.  

I barely made a dent in my beautiful breakfast so I ended up boxing up the rest and handing it over to a homeless man.  I would like to think he found some joy in it, because had I actually ruined my appetite beforehand with a thousand calorie cake, I would've polished it off.
author: Ellen C.

description: Tried to go here for breakfast one morning but we didn't want to wait an hour. We came back at night and had the best nutella/strawberries crepe that i have ever had! Highly recommend coming here for the crepes!
author: Stefanie U.

description: Stepped in Sunday night a but before 9PM to fairly empty dining room to order a Strawberry Nutella crepe and friends ordering a different crepe. Manager at the register was busy arguing with someone on the phone so o waited a few minutes to finish. Paid and tipped only to wait 20min for it to arrive. I don't know what they're doing back there, but it can't be filling orders. Crepe arrived after said manager bungles around to figure out who ordered what in the dining room. No system at all and several tables haven't been cleaned. Anyways, the crepe was good, since you can't go wrong with Strawberry and Nutella. Service sucks. I'll avoid this place the next time I'm in the area.
author: Bor C.

description:
Brunch Time during a warm weekend.

UsedYelp to find this place and wasnt willing to wait an hour to EAT!. 

The place was ok and could use a new vibe, but always a fan of the chalk board crepery wall menus. 

Ordered eggs benefict,club sandwich, and pesto omellete. The service was top notch, wit quick service and happy servers. The food was ok. The benedict eggs didnt looked poached, and the omellte was great. The club sanwich tasted fine, though te fries were a little cold. My mimosa was decent, and overall te place was ok.
author: Benjamin B.

description: Great food . Would definitely recommend coming here. The wait is a little long , so I advice to come early.(Specially for breakfast)
author: Mario M.

description:
Had a late dinner, the food was very good and large portions. There was a large variety something for everyone. 
My granddaughter said it was the best food we had while visiting San Francisco. If we ever make it back to San Fran we will def go back.
author: Theresa C.

description: Wow, the breakfast here was incredible. My daughter has the Nutella crepe and was in heaven!
author: Jay K.

description: by far the best breakfast I've had in a very long time!! I got there breakfast savory crepe & it was amazing!! It is very busy & the line was about 20 minutes but well worth the wait. I could definitely tell that the owner takes pride in his restaurant :)
author: Emily M.

description: Food is overrated and owner/servers can be rude. Crepes are pretty looking, but are your standard sweet and savory found elsewhere. Expect to pay extra $$$ for a squirt of whipped cream. Sandwiches are decent, but not that different from other breakfast places. Not worth waiting in line for 30-60min.... Unless you want to take good looking pictures of your food and post on social media.
author: Rey H.

description: Line was huge on Saturday morning. But fast track. Cozy place. Great eggs Benedict. Nice value. Fast service. Would go back again. Earlier.
author: Rafael B.

description:
We went there for 2 mornings during our stayed in San Francisco. Food was great but they made a lot of mistake and you have to order your meal first before you can find a table to seat.  First time we went there was on a Thursday morning around 10. When my friend came along around late 10ish, this place was quiet busy. They managed to missed my cousin's order. They waited for great 30 minutes food finally came after my husband spoke to one of the waitress. 2nd time we went there was a Sat. morning. This place were pack and Queue was long. We barely able to find a table to seat after our order. This time, my husband order an Egg Benedict and I ordered crepes with ice-cream. When the ordered arrive, his egg benedict end up one extra soft, one standard. Mine order instead of ice-cream, i got cream!.!.! Not to mention that morning coffee was burn..
My advise, don't go during peak hour..
author: Chiru C.

description: We got there on a Sunday shortly after it opened so the line wasn't terrible, but be aware that it moves slowly. Ambiance is a little weird, but didn't wait long for food and it was yummy. I just had oatmeal and fruit with an egg and toast, but it hit the spot. serving of oatmeal was huge, probably didn't need the extra food!
author: Emily M.

description:
I love this place. The food is the bomb. Savory crepe - Miami Heat - hello! Amazing. They do their potato's right and healthy like. Their salads are large and the coffee is fantastic (free refills). Cucumber and lemon infused water station. The staff are lovely. Inexpensive beer, wine, mimosa's..

What you must know to not get pissed off.
Its near Union Square.. some hotels are obviously telling their guests to go there.
DO NOT GO SATURDAY or SUNDAY before 2pm. You will wait in a long ass line of tourists. It's maybe a safe bet to wait til 2pm any day.

This is my neighborhood spot and my go to when I'm lazy to cook, for breakfast and lunch.
author: Victoria S.

description:
Entirely mediocre.  For some reason I have been here three times, each time it has been only moderately busy.  There aren't a ton of choices for breakfast in this area, so I could understand coming here for that, but any other meal is best spent elsewhere.  

The food is decent at best, some dishes are really disappointing but others are okay.  They always have the weirdest 80's era ambient music in here - it's really bizarre stuff, I've never heard the likes of it anywhere else.  In fact, the whole place looks like it's from the 80s.  There just isn't anything special about it and there is much better food around.
author: Lars T.

description:
Get the OJ...it is fresh-squeezed the minute you order. He said the coffee was surprisingly good, I looooved the chai. After watching other people eat while we waited in line (the line was out the door), we decided to just "go for it" once we got to the counter. 

I'm not sure if there's a long line for ALL weekends or just for this one because it was the weekend of Outside Lands, but we waited in line for about 30-40 minutes. However, once the line is over you're seated immediately and your food follows you in a timely manner. It is near many of the downtown hotels. 

We had a dessert crepe (caramel and nuts, I think) and it was awesome. We didn't linger over it, we just devoured it. 

I had crab cake benedict with potatoes and it was great. I liked the crab cakes, I think there was only one little cartilage piece between the 2 of them and the flavor was good. Some people muck their crab cakes up with all sorts of fillers, these were mostly crab. The spinach was steamed and between the egg yolk and the hollandaise sauce everything came together nicely. They do ask how you want your eggs poached and mine were cooked as requested. The potatoes were perfectly cooked and seasoned just enough. 

The guy bussing the tables is like a wizard. Super efficient and with a smile on his face the whole time. If prices seem high, keep in mind you aren't having a server to tip after the meal.
author: Brittany L.

description: Came here for brunch because of the reviews and location near my hotel. Great food, fast service and staff pleasant and accommodating.  I had a crepe, potatoes and tea for $17.  Would definitely recommend.
author: Donna D.

description:
Had the best birthday brunch when I visited last year. Bookmarked this place so I'd be sure to go back whenever I'm in San Fran!

We all ordered coffee, mimosas and omelets. Best cure for a hangover and for a rainy day. Didn't disappoint!
author: Ashley E.

description: I had the SBK crepe (strawberry, banana and kiwi). Pretty good, not too sweet. Only giving them a 3. They screwed up my husband's order and it took awhile for them to fix it. Very busy so get here early. Kind of disorganized.
author: H. H.

description: soo good!!! Got the sbk and it was delicious. Not a lot of seating, kinda long line but people moved really quickly so wasn't much of a wait. Highly recommend
author: Jackie K.

description:
Stop #12 on vacation 2013 with Sue took us out for another breakfast.  After searching a bit we both agreed that Honey Honey might be a good place for us to go.  Apparently a few other people did the same search as when we arrived on a Monday morning (it was President's Day so keep that in mind) the line was almost out the door.  We waited probably a good 20-25 minutes before we were able to order food.

First off, you wait in line and order at a counter.  This isn't a sit down and order with a server type place.  After you order you find a table and they bring your food out to you.  Not sure that system quite works.  I'm sure there are easier ways to do this as they only had one register open.  Actually I believe they only had one register which is kind of silly especially with a crowd like they had.  I imagine this place is packed like this on weekends too.

I ordered the French Toast ($7.75) which was 2 thick slices of challah bread served with fresh strawberries.  Along with that I had a Hot Chocolate ($2.25).  French toast should always be made on challah bread.  There really isn't another way that I feel is very good.  They hit this one spot on.  I don't normally order French toast, but I was getting a bit tired of eggs and this really hit the spot.  It was a nice portion and quite filling for me.

If you are looking for a place with ambiance, Honey Honey probably won't do it for you.  If you are looking for food at reasonable prices, check this place out.
author: Dan H.

description: A very nice and cozy place, the service was really good. Had the pesto crepe and it was delicious, I recommend it if you're hungry and passing by then you should stop by. They should really change the wifi password.
author: Samer A.

description: The chorizo scramble is yummy. It has just enough heat, no need for hot sauce. :) As for the facility, it is cute and clean with both indoor and outdoor seating. Bathrooms are clean. Only downfall, it can get pretty stuffy indoors on a warm day, luckily I prefer to eat outside.
author: Sally D.

description: Sure, it's touristy. But the breakfast/brunch is very good. Long wait but most brunch places in SF have a long wait. This one is worth it. Great menu selection and once you order the wait isn't that long.
author: Phillip B.

description: Eggs florentine was delicious. A little expensive for an everyday spot but a good treat
author: Jacqui H.

description: Disappointing.  I ordered the Eggs Benedict, which is usually a good option.  The canadian bacon was tough (like it had been leftover from the day before and reheated.)  The hollandaise sauce was in short supply and overpowered by the heavy dose of paprika.  The potatoes were heavily salted.  Finally, the customer service was well below par.  Too bad, I really wanted to like it.
author: Sharon T.

description:
Came here while visiting San Francisco based on yelp reviews, choice is large, we ended up ordering crepes which were ok

However, it's a bit pricy and service takes lot of time.
author: Yuksel D.

description: Had the huevos rancheros.  Very good!   Way too many choices that I wanted to try. Will have to go back on my next trip!
author: Dean F.

description:
One thing that can be said about Honey Honey, is that people really seem to like this place.
The thing about San Fran restaurants is that I can never tell if a place is busy because all the locals are piling in, or if people are just lining up because "they've heard [or read] that it was good."
As I started to write this review, I honestly couldn't remember the food.
I remembered waiting in a long line to order - which gave me time to contemplate the menu, and have a mini panic attack about whether I'd really find a seat or not.  I probably looked like a loon to the diners around me, as I stared at them calculating whether or not they'd be done and out the door by the time I got to the counter, ordered, and received a stick with a number on it.

My group and I did successfully order, and semi-successfully found seating - squished together.  This is not the place for groups of more than 2. 

Now that I've given myself time to think of it, I do remember the food.  I got a mocha, which was served in a glass instead of a mug, which is a big pet peeve and no-no in my opinion.
For food, I ordered the sunrise burrito - chorizo has a special place in my heart.  This burrito was pretty good; too many beans; but overall really tasty, big, stuffed with good stuff, and didn't skimp on the chorizo.  It was spicy - appropriately.  

You know what they do REALLY well here?  Crepes.  My companions had crepes, savory and sweet, and I got to try all of them -- totally masterful, totally delightful.  So, go for the crepes when you come here!
author: Rebecca M.

description: The service was okay. When it was our turn to order the phone began to ring and the cashier took about five minutes to hang up and take our order. The food was way too salty. I ordered the crab cake Benedict's and they had a very salty and weird taste. That is why I am giving it a 3-star.
author: Alejandra M.

description: Decided to update a previous review.   Have tried this restaurant several times recently and the food has been very good.  Have had a breakfast crepe, a chicken crepe, and a dessert crepe and all were excellent.  First time I went here had an issue with their stated closing time.  With that in mind if you plan to visit  near their stated closing time you might want to call ahead to make sure they're still open.
author: Mike B.

description: Honestly I would go back for the amazing fresh orange juice and eggs benedict...but the line was FOREVER and the signature crepe really wasn't the best I've ever had. The flavor was ok but the texture with the runny cottage cheese mixture was a little strange.
author: Mindy B.

description:
This restaurant felt homey and their food tasted very fresh! It's a bit pricey...I paid $16 for an eggs florentine, fresh orange-carrot juice (which I highly recommend), and a side of bacon, but their food portions were big so it made up for it. The potatoes that they served were incredibly delish! As a take on hash browns, these potatoes had caramelized to a crunchy crust and had a very nice herby seasoning. It reminded me of Thanksgiving. 

You have to order at the counter and seat yourself, but although waitering was a little bit non-existent, the lady up front had come up to us when we were in line and before we had even ordered our food asking us what we would like to drink. She was very sweet, so instantly, I felt very welcomed in the restaurant. I know I will be back when I come back to visit San Francisco!
author: Rosario R.

description: Solid food, but def not worth waiting a huge line for. Just a heads up to the line around the block. ;)
author: Ann R.

description:
Tried Honey Honey for the first time this past weekend and was not disappointed. My friend and I got there just after 11 and the line wasn't that bad (Maybe a 15-20 minute wait?) It was fine though because that's about as much time as you need to decide on what to order. We also met a nice family from Connecticut so I have no ill feelings toward the line at all-- it's San Francisco. 

When deciding I changed my mind so many times; from the Strawberry Nutella crepe to the Croissant Sandwich to my final choice of the Crab Cake Florentine. My friend got the French Toast. The food was goooooood! My order was filling and it came out pretty quickly. The ambiance is cool, a little cramped but that's the style and it only adds to its appeal.
author: Sirley C.

description: This place is a must go to. If you go before 12pm be prepared for a very long line, but still very worth the wait. Literally everything here is good, but I would definitely come for the crepes. Other things to try - the potatoes, for sure. The staff is friendly too, despite the chaos they must deal with every morning.
author: Katie B.

description: a big surprise is this little hole in the way eatery.  great food but always jammed with people... but they move you quickly and feed you at a very decent price
author: William T.

description: Breakfast is awesome the crepes are fantastic and the breakfast burrito is delicious!
author: A G.

description:
Reviewing on Easter Sunday, so take with a grain of salt...

We found this place on Yelp and it looked good, so off we went. Got there around 9 am, line was close to out the door. By 9:15 it was. 

The food was very, very good. I had the Eden, which was a savory crepe with Fontina cheese, smoked salmon, onions and capers. Delicious, and a portion size that wasn't too big or too small. Came with a so-so fruit side (banana and strawberries, mostly. A lone slice of kiwi). The coffee was very good, too, though getting a refill was impossible until they came with our food, 30 minutes after we ordered. Again, it's Easter, so I understand, but I asked "can WE have more coffee?" and the waitress only took my mug and ignored my wife's. 

Atmosphere is loud and crowded, service was slow.
author: Paul M.

description:
This turned out to be a good place to go for a very quick, light pre-theatre dinner.  It's just a block and a half above the Curran and the Geary, it wasn't remotely crowded, even at 7 PM on a Saturday evening, and the food was satisfactory, of good ingredient quality, inexpensive, and above all fast.

Honey Honey specializes in what they call crepes, which might better be described as tortilla sandwiches.  The crepe is a flour pancake which is folded over a couple of times with the fillings inside.  They're not really large.  They have more varieties than the website shows, including some on another menu board that's almost unnoticably behind you as you stand and look at the main one.

A variety called the Philly cheesesteak had genuine crumbly steak strips, and one featuring crabcakes had two whole, and very high quality, crabcakes stuffed inside.  Impressive.  Not generally my style of restaurant, but good at what it is.  I'd definitely come back here again under like circumstances, wanting tasty and reliable food in a hurry before a show.
author: David B.

description: Good food. Great selection. I came on a whim based on other yelp reviews and loved the food.
author: Cecil D.

description: Omg all I can say is that I could eat everything on the crepe menu. The crepes both savory and sweet were impeccable. I literally couldn't stop eating. Best place ever!!
author: Ramona B.

description:
Found this place on yelp, and decided to give it a try since it was only a few blocks from my hotel. I was not disappointed! After looking over the menu for a few minutes I decided to get the Mediterranean crepe with a side of fruit, and the fresh squeezed orange juice. I wasn't a huge fan of the orange juice, and solely because it was too sweet for my tastes, but I love how they have cucumber water and lemon water you get yourself- very convenient not having to wait on a waiter to bring it. 

The mediterranean crepe was even better than I was hoping. If you like olives, tomato, avocado, and feta (mmmmm... feta...) then you need to try this crepe. I know a lot of places try to skimp out on the feta, but there was so much in the crepe that I was not left wanting. The side of fruit wasn't the best... It had a faint taste of onion... But I'm not sure it wasn't the onion in my crepe overpowering the fruit flavor. 
I don't live in San Fran, but if I did this would be my regular saturday morning brunch location. 

I saw an order of eggs Benedict come to the table next to me, and they looked amazing. If I ever make it back here, I know what I'm going to try next!
author: Melinda R.

description: Came here for the crepes :) left happy. Ask for fresh fruit inside the crepes, sometimes they will heat it which doesn't taste as good.
author: Rosey L.

description:
Ok, so this place has to be the Crepe Mecca of SF.....or at least it's a strong candidate for that crown.  

Stepping into the restaurant, I honestly was surprised at how small it was....and the line was slowly growing longer by the minute!  Although I found the restaurant to be small, it certainly makes up with their menu literally and physically.  The menu is practically larger than life and covers nearly an entire wall of the restaurant almost floor to ceiling!  They have breakfast, brunch/lunch, and dessert crepes, and with all these choices I found it difficult to make up mind..lol!  I finally decide on the chicken pesto crepe and this comes with either potatoes or a fruit mix.  Trying to be "healthy" on my trip I chose the fruit mix.  And instead of coffee, I chose freshly squeezed orange juice.  

FYI:   The system at this place is that you place your order with the cashier, pay for your food, a numbered placard is given to you and your food is brought to your table.

When my food was dropped off, I admit I thought the serving would be too small for me.  Well it seems my eyes were bigger than my stomach as the portion was just enough for me.  I enjoyed my food very much and ate every list morsel of it.

HMMMM???:  The one thing that was on my mind the entire time I was standing in line besides "what am I going to eat" was why was there only 1 cashier to handle the crowds?

Bottom Line:  I would absolutely love to try other items on their menu.
author: Michael C.

description: Was just okay. Long line and long wait to get food. I got one of the breakfast specials - Santa Fe Scramble I think? Toast was toasted but cold, small scrambled eggs serving and didn't taste like anything spectacular...just eggs and jalapeños, potatoes were okay I guess. Sausage was tasted more of apple than chicken. Probably won't go back. Or maybe I will. It's up in the air.
author: Aaron M.

description:
It was the night before the Nike Women's half marathon and the four of us were ready to head back to our hotel and fuel up for the next morning.  Our day was filled with gallivanting all over San Francisco, chinatown, the shops around union square, macys, H&M, playing tourist and all that jazz.  On our trek back we were hungry and decided on Honey Honey.  My boyfriend's sister and I were new to the crepes and dishes of Honey Honey but we were with some Honey Honey veterans and they assured us it was yummy enough to take back to the hotel.  

The four of us stood in somewhat of a long line staring up at the chalk board menu on the right side wall and carefully chose our dinners.  I almost opted for the Pesto crepe...but that shrimp fettuccine with mushrooms caught my eye.  Each of us ended up ordering this dish, I added some spinach and also went for one of their dessert crepes.  The banana with nutella crepe with whipped cream.  We waited patiently as we rested our feet and finally got our meals.  When we finally reached our hotel all four of us busted out our meals and began eating.  It was so quiet you could hear a pin fall on the floor. 

I really enjoyed my fettuccine with shrimp, mushrooms, and spinach it was still warm when we got back to our hotel and there were actually a lot of shrimp in it too!  The portion size was great as I couldn't even finish the whole thing.  Next up was the dessert crepe, I thoroughly enjoyed each and every bite of this.  The whipped cream was a bit melted but that's to be expected, it was quite large and the banana to nuttella ratio was perfect.  

All in all, the long line was worth it to me.  They could probably do well with another cashier to help out, the guy seemed very busy but handled the crowd well.  Loved the waters they have on the side for you to serve yourself.  Parking would probably be difficult if you have a car but if you find that space and have time to try their food, do so!
author: Ka'ili H.

description: Excellent fresh made to order food! A cute little gem in the city. Friendly and helpful staff with a pleasant atmosphere. Came here last summer and ate breakfast everyday once I found it.  I'm back this year for a week and am enjoying each visit! Now they are serving my dinner too! You gotta start your day at Honey Honey!
author: Cinnamon S.

description:
We ordered a savory Mediterranean Crepe and a Sweet SBK (strawberry, banana kiwi) Crepe and loved it. 
There's a line but it worths it!
author: Lev W.

description:
My most favorite place in San Fran. I really love this place. They breakfast is legendary and this by a reason. I had pancakes, burritos, scrambled eggs, omelette, crepes and so on :)... For me the most recommendable place in San Fran for breakfast. 

One tip. Bring time with you!!! Possible that you have to wait a bit ;)... But it's worth.
author: Rainer S.

description: We stopped in for coffee and stayed for lunch. The service wasn't the greatest, but it was easy to find something gluten free and tasty. The coffee was very good.
author: Camela T.

description: 5 stars is necessary. We waited in like for about 30-45 minutes... Every bite was worth the wait! The crab florentine & moon bay crepes are THE BEST. They give you lots of food, too! If you're looking for a great breakfast/brunch place I suggest this place! First time ever to San Fran and I'm coming back to this place for sure.
author: Marilyn M.

description:
Hurm...this place is a good brunch spot if you're in the area and want to get a quick bite. There's a bit of a line and it was pretty packed, but we didn't have to wait around for a table. Plus!

I got the Post Street Omelet, which was just ok. There was nothing wrong with it, but there wasn't anything amazing about it. My crepe leaked a brownish liquid...I don't think they cooked the inside stuff long enough. Maybe it was the mushroom liquid? But free refills on coffee...not the best coffee, but its got caffeine. =)

The potatoes were AWESOME though. Lots of Rosemary, with a little crisp. Yum. =) 

If I was in the area, I'd come back...but probably wouldn't venture out specifically for it.
author: Lily W.

description:
Came here around 8am on a weekday.  The place wasn't too busy.  By the time we got our meals, the line was out the door.

Anyway, I got the 2&2&2 which comes with 2 pancakes, two eggs, bacon or chicken apple sausage for 8.95.

The meal was good.  Although, it didn't seem like I really got two eggs.  It seemed more like 1 and a half.  Or maybe, they just use really small eggs.

Anyway, it was good.  I really liked their fresh squeezed orange juice.  

Also, the Wi-FI pw for this place I believe is their phone number.
author: Emily S.

description: We came in around 1pm on a Sunday afternoon, and decided to get in line because there were several empty tables. MISTAKE. It took us over a half an hour to place an order. There was one girl working the register and getting drink orders. Another girl sat on her butt on the side making silverware/napkin bundles, while there was a line of customers waiting. Seemed like a really poor allocation of resources when you could have someone making drinks while someone else takes orders at the register. We decided the long wait could be okay if the food was any good. But honestly? Once we got it, it was just...adequate. I got the crepe with the smoked salmon and my boyfriend got the chicken pesto crepe. It wasn't very warm, like it had been sitting around for several minutes before it was brought out to us, and the flavor was just...nothing special. It was just food. Not worth the wait.
author: Carolyn M.

description: Great crepes to say the least. Long line  then sit a minus. Chorizo sausage excellent counterpoint to whipped cream served with crepe.
author: Christopher F.

description: Absolutely delicious & so worth the wait!  Staff are polite & generous - great all around experience
author: C B.

description:
I eat breakfast wherever I travel. It is IMPERATIVE you know what you're doing. Congrats on doing it right, honey :-)

1. Get there EARLY. They open at 7:30am. I was the second customer, the guy in front of me had been there 3 days in a row. Good enough for me to stay in our short little line.

2. They have crepe in their name. I ordered pancakes. You order pancakes.

3. If its on special there is a reason. It's SPECIAL! Banana Pecan Pancakes. Repeat.

4. Order Chicken Apple Sausage.... perfect compliment to the special listed above.

5. Coffee was fantastic! Since I was there when they opened I knew I had a fresh pot and it was so good I don't think I'll have to order a latte.

Going back tomorrow. Gonna try a crepe and the Chorizo Scramble.... until then my friends...
author: Jessica S.

description: We ordered a eggs Florentine and salmon Benedict. Overall good, nothing extraordinary, hollandaise sauce was almost flavourless.
author: Danny N.

description: This place is good but not great. They don't cook their mushrooms for long enough and their vegetables and fruits are not very ripe or in season. They do have great orange juice though.
author: Kirby B.

description:
Being that I've never had crepes before I can't compare it to any other. But It was still early morning when my friend and I arrived, as it wasn't yet 10am.

We shared our crepe. we had the Half Moon Bay. It was delicious mix of cheese, mushroom, tomato crab cakes. It reminded me of a lighter version of CrabCake Bendict's from Bill's cafe. -- minus the drench of hollandaise sauce.

You also get a choice of potatoes, veggies or fruits for your side. we chose fruits and had strawberry, bananas and apples.

We didn't order anything fancy to drink, I only wanted water. OMG ... free flavored water? one was lemon flavored water and the one I had was cucumber ... it was refreshing and not overwhelming. just the right hint of flavor to go with the crepe.

My friend suggests that I try the sweet dessert crepes next time, hopefully I get to try it again this weekend!!

Total was about $10 and change. THe scenery was great, people were walking their dogs, couples holding hands while sight seeing, and taxi cabs being waved down constantly. It definitely didn't feel like SAN JOSE! it was a great experience in SAN FRANCISCO!
author: Dany B.

description:
I stopped here for brunch and ordered half tuna sandwich and a small cup of spinach and rice soup while my bf ordered their cream sauce fettuccine. We took our number and grabbed a seat which was more than plentiful. 

My bf really enjoyed his creamy fettuccine. He couldn't stop gushing about it. My tuna sandwich was nothing spectacular. The spinach and rice soup was also pretty bland. 

We both noticed that after 12, seats were beginning to fill up and a line began to form at the register. Thank god we came early. Maybe next time I'll try their eggs benedict.
author: Kristine P.

description: The crepes are bamb the French toast is bamb the orange juice is super bamb, prices are just right.
author: Paul G.

description: Arrived at 7:40 for breakfast this morning, line was already out the door. Contrary to other reviews, the service is neither fast nor exceptional. I got the crab cake crepe with potatoes at 8:30. The crab cakes were great, but the crepe itself was mediocre and they did not go well together - the crepe actually detracted from the crab cake flavor. The potatoes were the saving grace. They were well-seasoned and had a great crust on them. Had I not had the potatoes I would have given 2 stars.
author: Lauren H.

description: Love it so much, we came 2 days in a row. There was a looong line one day, no line the next. Large menu, great for vegetarians and meat eaters and sweet tooths.
author: Claire C.

description:
I ordered take out from here when I was staying at the Westin and was craving something other than the routine room service. 

The person who took my order with the "Russian?" accent was not too friendly but whatever. The walk from the Westin to the cafe on a brisk Saturday morning was enjoyable.  The place itself is pretty quaint. They have a fresh OJ machine as well. The breakfast crepe with ham, cheese and fruit was pretty good. They also had macarons which were surprisingly really good.
author: Sunil R.

description: Absolutely loved our breakfast today! Had both savory and sweet crepes! Highly recommend!
author: Doug W.

description:
This place is pretty good but not worth the line especially if you are pressed for time on your vacation. 

I had the Chicken Burrito. It was good, not amazing as the line would have you believe. I also had the Lemon Crepe. (Both were specials) it was unique but over done. Far too sweet for me to really enjoy. 

Also all the Cholula bottles were practically empty. 

However, if you are still bent on standing in line, the Orange juice makes up for the rest. Fresh squeezed, a must try!
author: Kimmy M.

description: Stayed at a hotel two doors down & arrived 10 min after restaurant opened. There was already a line of early birds at 7:40 am.  The menu is extensive & there is something for everyone. I had a savory crepe with potatoes, hubby had a croissant sandwich & sweet crepe. They also have omelettes, pancakes & waffles. The coffee is strong & really good. The line was out the door by the time we left at 8:30.  They have lunch items too.
author: Crissy F.

description: Line is very very long.  Prices are super reasonable and portions are HUGE.  Food is just ok though.  I did really enjoy the waffle fries, but that was the only memorable part of our brunch.
author: Priscilla P.

description:
Nice breakfast place within walking distance from the touristy Union Square but yet not many tourists bother to walk here.

Pretty interior with yellow wash painted walls. Order at the cashier, get a number to your table and wait for them to bring your food. 

After calorie-laden cheesecake the night before (long story), we opt for something more healthy, i.e. Torino crepe. This contains basil, feta cheese, tomato, and mushroom. Creamy and rich flavors from the cheese while the basil, tomato adds some freshness. Yes, they use fresh basil and none of that dried stuff. 

Cappuccino is average so don't expect any Blue Bottle Coffee level stuff.

Service was friendly and quick. Great place for breakfast away from all the tourist traps.
author: Norman S.

description: I had the half moon bay crepe with the crabcake inside...its was soooo good and very filling. There was about 30 minutes, but I definitely enjoyed the food.
author: Naomi D.

description: I absolutely love this place. I went again recently and ordered the Salmon Benedict and some carrot juice. My roommate ordered the Belgian Waffles. They've got an option for you, whether you want something simple or something new! While the food and service is wonderful, there isn't much parking in the area (but it's downtown so what do you expect?) and the place is always packed for breakfast! I guess it just shows they're running their business well!
author: Stephanie R.

description:
14/Aug/15 - Me & the wife on holiday were looking for a good breakfast & thought we'd found it here with the long queue outside but we were wrong.

They forgot our fruit cup, coffees & there was some cling film in my bagel.

The search continues.............
author: Alex B.

description:
Day 15/30: 30-day Oct yelp challenge

Random post-race brunch here since it was near the shuttle drop off.  My hubby ended eating here twice this trip since his SF local friend said this place was classic, and I came here once.  Huge brunch selection... Eggs, egg benedicts, sandwiches, and crepes!  Usually don't find those on the menu.  Sweet and savory options too!

You order like a cafeteria, then grab a table where you can.  The food comes pretty quickly but they did mix up our order on hubby's second visit here.  French toast was pretty average according to hubby, and the crepes ranged from average to good.  We ended up trying 3 types due to the order mix up.  We had a salmon version, the Torino version with feta, mushrooms and tomato, and a special of the day that was a Philly cheesesteak.  The crepes are a bit thick but the fillings inside were tasty.   Good portion sizes and I like the choices of fruit and salad in addition to the usual hash browns.

A-OK place for breakfast and brunch in the area.
author: Katie F.

description:
A reasonably solid option for brunch near Union Square.
You order at the counter first, then sit down. This seems like it could be a recipe for not finding a place to sit, but that doesn't seem to be an issue - food comes out super fast, and people don't seem to linger.
The menu is pretty large, with a big list of crepes (both sweet and savory), and some standard brunch type options - omelettes, eggs benedict, etc.
I had the chorizo scramble which had a nice subtle kick and was quite tasty, and not as greasy as chorizo often is. The potatoes were nicely browned and crispy.
We also tried the lemon crepe off the specials board - it was interesting, covered in zested lemony stuff - but the lemon was a bit overpowering for me. I would have preferred a bit less of it.
author: Don H.

description: The crab cake florentine was a different breakfast for us.in general,I would rate it average
author: R M.

description:
What a great Yelp find! Great atmosphere and people!  Great mix of tourist and locals and a lot of regulars. It was pretty warm inside so I was glad to sit by the door to get some of the breeze that would come in.  Service was either lack luster or nonexistent.  The women who took our order was either tired or bored.  She leaned.  Once your order was delivered to your table you never were checked on again. 

Yummy water, self serve choice... with Lemon or Oranges.  I liked Lemon.
Order at the counter then take your number and find a seat.  

They have Savory Crepes, Sweet Crepes, Burgers, Sandwiches, and a lot of Breakfast stuff- eggs, benedict, bagels. Oh and Mimosa's! :)

I ordered the Pesto Crepe.  It was HUGE!  Way bigger than the one I usually get at MELT. This had pesto, feta, pine nuts, tomatoes, avocado and cheddar cheese.  It comes with your choice of fruit or house potatoes.  They were out of house potatoes so they gave me fries!  SCORE!  They were perfectly yummy crispy outside fluffy inside!  

My friend ordered the Strawberry Nutella Crepe and added banana.  It comes with Whipped Cream or ICE CREAM!!!  She chose the cream.  It looked super yummy!  Gooey warm melted Nutella oozing everywhere!  She loved it!  

Would definitely come back here again... even by myself!! Even if service was Eh.
author: Erika G.

description:
Came here on a Sunday morning and decided to give this place a try since it was close to my hotel. 

Waited around 20 min in line and then another 10 for the food. I was hoping I could say something contrary to the other 1-2 star reviews but sadly, this place isn't that great.

I thought the crab cakes florentine would be pretty good since that's all people post pictures of. Nope. The crab cakes were luke-warm at best, not even slightly crispy on the outside, and the hollandaise sauce wasn't very flavorful. The rosemary potatoes were better than the crabcakes. The freshly squeezed OJ was the best part of my meal. My mom had oatmeal and the Belgian waffle, which were both OK. 

Average place. Don't waste your time in line if you have other choices.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Oh mann... My wife n I had breakfast here on Sunday 3/06/16 u kno just finishing our anniversary wkend off n what a way to start a day off on our last day touring the bay... The food here was OFF the HOOK... #BOMB.COM good.. i had the Omelet that came with some bomb potatoes and toast n my wife had the eggs benedict... 5 stars.. even the Complimentary freshly squeezed orange juice Mimosas from the Owner really made our annivesary breakfast a little extra special. And the Team were friendly and welcoming.. Thank Honey Team keep up the great service..will be by there soon to taste the rest of the menu...lol
author: Jay B.

description: Long line but worth in the end. Don't come looking for healthy cuz their potatoes are to die for. The egg Benedict is highly recommended with an endless selection of both breakfast and dessert crepes to choose from.
author: Gail N.

description: Nice non-touristy lunch spit spot. Definitely good sandwich/soup/salad location. I really enjoyed my meal. Fast, and good!
author: SD L.

description: Eaten here twice in the same day now.  Breakfast was a delicious Acapulco omelet.  Loved the black bean filling and the orange juice is something else!  We ate here for dinner to but my burger was overcooked.  Definitely better for breakfast than dinner.  Fantastic!
author: Rena A.

description:
Got the pesto crepe.
Was a little disappointed, over priced for portion size. Came with a small cup of fresh fruit. The crepe itself was ok but it had more cheese in it then pesto! It was as if they had stock in the cheese industry there was so much cheese. I do not recall tasting any pesto. I know there was some there because they had swiped a bunch on top of the crepe but idk if there was any inside the crepe itself. All in all. I have definitely had better. 
Also it was ridiculous levels of hot inside! I was sweating!
author: Kathryn L.

description: Came here only because it was by my hotel and several colleagues were meeting here. Reading the menu, everything looked delish. You order at the counter first and get a number for your table. I ordered a crepe with crab cake. It was just okay... not very flavorful. It was about $13, so I expected more.
author: C W.

description: Excellent service and food with decent prices! I live in the South Bay and this restaurant must be related to Crepevine; however this place has so many selections! We came on a super busy Sunday and I loved how well the staff controlled the crowd and bussed the tables. The gentleman bussing the tables would not let people sit down unless they ordered and he assigned seats. This made everything move flawlessly and made for a very pleasant dining experience. Would definitely come back!
author: Janette L.

description: I had the half moon bay crepe. It was delicious. The crab cake tasted fresh and meaty. This is a great spot for crepes.
author: Liz W.

description: Nice place. Got egg Benedict and the eggs were overlooked :( if they weren't overlooked, they could have been a delicious plate of breakfast.
author: Arianne H.

description: longest line ever, one register and the girl keeps walking away from the register making 40 people stand in line. you cannot sit at a table while you wait for your party to order. rude service
author: Courtney P.

description:
Ordered Cable car omelette and New Orleans crepes.  Took about 10 mins for lunch to arrive.  The potatoes were terrible.. tasted stale and overdose of rosemary.  

Only good about this place is wifi had good strength.
author: Hema K.

description: I stood in line for 30 minutes on a Friday to eat at this joint. Obviously popular with locals and tourists alike. I had a glass of reasonably priced fresh squeezed orange juice (delicious!) and the half moon bay crepe. Cheddar, tomatoes, mushrooms, and a fresh crab cake, served with breakfast-style potatoes. Portion size is plenty. Mushrooms, cheddar, and a crab cake is an odd pairing, but the flavors usually present individually. I would rather a different kind of cheese perhaps. The crepe itself had no sweet flavor, to which I am accustomed, but I occasionally detected a banana flavor. Potatoes were soft, not too salty, but not super flavorful either. Definitely worth trying again. The menu is varied and extensive.  If you don't mind waiting 30 minutes to order, you should try it!
author: Jessica B.

description: The food was incredible - we had the banana Nutella crepe and each had an additional breakfast - portions were huge and the quality and taste were great. Charming seating area (if you can get a seat).  The line was out the door - so try to get there early if you can!
author: Jessica D.

description: Delicious crepe for lunch, staff was friendly! Highly recommend the shortbread cookies!
author: Misty C.

description: Came here for brunch on a Friday afternoon. Not too busy inside and was able to order right away. I ordered the strawberry and nutella crepe ($6.25) and a fruit dish ($2.75) to go along with it. After about 15 minutes, the food was brought to the table. The crepe was on the small side stuffed with minimal strawberries. It was good, but then again, when is a basic nutella/strawberry crepe not good? It came with whipped cream on the side; if you want ice cream on the side, you have to order it separately for $2.95. The fruit side was a bit on the small side as well, it has mainly strawberry slices, 4 banana slices, 4 paper-thin slices of apples that were already turning brown, and a single slice of kiwi on top. You have to get your own water out of 2 dispensers they have, but once I was almost done with my water, I noticed multiple odd black specks floating around the bottom of my cup. Overall my experience here was alright, nothing too special. It's not expensive, but the portions for me seemed a bit small and the customer service was meh.
author: Lisa M.

description: Great place to get breakfast at I had the crab cake florentine which was really creamy i literally came here for a whole week while I was in San Francisco
author: Anthony T.

description: Best breakfast worth the fun waIt in line. Superb service and organization but the food! Crab cake florentine to die for.
author: Marta O.

description:
Honey Honey was pretty good! 

We had coffee and I ordered the special which was pecan pancakes with maple syrup and banana slices.

The coffee was okay. Prices were reasonable. My pancakes were $6.50 for 2 pancakes with the toppings. My cousin had the Greek omelette which was around $9. She enjoyed it. 

They give you a number and bring your food to you when it's ready. They also bring you coffee refills if you want them. It's more of a diner atmosphere than a restaurant I think.

The place was hopping on a Friday morning. I'd return when in the area.
author: Chelsea J.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around 11 and the line was almost out the door. Though the place was jam packed, seating wasn't an issue.

I ordered the eggs florentine, and my friend orderd the salmon eggs benedict. Both were really good and the soft poached eggs were cooked to perfection. The orders come with a side of house potatoes, but I wasn't feeling like having such a heavy breakfast so I opted for a subsitution of a cup of fruit instead.

In my search for the best eggs benedict in the city, and I will have to say this is one of the top places so far!
author: Angela K.

description: A long line, but worth the wait. We had the crab cake florentine and the Nutella chocolate crepe. Both were excellent!
author: David G.

description:
Honey Honey night look a bit trashy from the outside, but it is absolutely far from it. It is delicious in all sorts of ways, they have a huge menu to chose from. They have a variety of drinks, my favorite was the hot chocolate, it's a definitely a must have. 
When I arrived the line was out the door, but despite the huge line, I was at the cashier within 5 minutes.
Over all a great place to eat with great service.
author: Xavier L.

description: When you get to honey honey expect a line out the door! My first visit we waited for about 1/2 hour. We tried the strawberry with whip cream and the breakfast crepe. While waiting my mouth watered with each passing plate. One thing I do not understand is when people go to a specialty restaurant and they get the opposite of what they are known for, like the person next to me eating French toast!  The crepes were well worth the wait!! When they arrived at our table the hot strawberries with cinnamon and sugar melted in your mouth with each bite! We also had the savory breakfast crepe with eggs, ham, cheese, onion and green bell peppers, this was a great savory crepe but I prefer the sweet ones. Even though the line is intimidating it was not a very long wait and we found a table with no problem! Very good crepes!!
author: Tim W.

description:
Came hangry, left satisfied.... During my recent visit,  I read reviews for surrounding establishments. This was one that we picked and I'm very happy with the choice.  

We had a family of 8, staff reserved table for all of us to eat together. It's a bit cramped and the lines are long, but the food made up for it. 

You get what you pay for & we are completely satisfied. From the chorizo scramble to the lemon crepe to the banana and strawberry waffle - you can't go wrong with any choice!
author: Amri P.

description: it's so good here! be careful on what you order the portions are huge (for me) love the prohibition whiskey blueberry crumb cake
author: Gemma A.

description:
Ryan K. & I picked Honey Honey for breakfast this AM based off of Tiffany N.'s review. Our hotel was conveniently located nearby, so it was a pleasant walk over.

Service: 5

Order at the counter and food comes out in less than 5 minutes. Cashier/Server also made sure Ryan K. got the freshest OJ after they had run out of it briefly.

Food: 4

I ordered the Cable Car Omelette with smoked salmon, cream cheese, and a side of pototoes. The omelette was amazing: flaky, smoky mouthfuls of salmon with the melting cream cheese mixed inside the egg envelope (er, omelette). Potatoes were a little overdone, but still edible. 

Ryan K. ordered the Sunrise Burrito: filling, good portion sizes with spicy tangy chorizo. Chorizo was the best part; the rest of the ingredients were a-ok.

Drinks: 5

Freshly squeezed OJ. Need I say more? Coffee was standard fare.

Atmosphere: 3

Appeared to be average tourist-y place with customers coming in with suitcases and such. Pleasant and polite ambience overall.

Overall: 4

I'd definitely come here again.
author: Helene K.

description: The service was really bad, the pancake was dry and didn't taste anything. Can't remember a worst breakfast.....
author: Joakim P.

description:
Service good fast ..

Men's plumbing is in disrepair.

Eggs Benedict was horrible. Worst I've ever had in my entire life.

Do not get.

Umm .. Will not return or recommend ..!!
author: Robert V.

description: Was not pleased with the line, but it was totally worth the wait!! I ordered the Mediterranean crepe. OMG basically melted in my mouth. The combination of cheese to tomato to avocado to olive was perfect. Coffee was delicious and the service was excellent! A must if you are in the area!
author: Terri-Ann V.

description:
Went here twice while on vacation. We were served quickly both times, even though there were a ton of people in line to order so that was a definite plus. 

They give out really big portions for it being so cheap. The breakfast crepe was delicious, as well as the club sandwich. The staff was pleasant and talkative. I would definitely come here again. It's not necessarily a 5 star restaurant but it's pretty darn good.
author: Katherine B.

description: Breakfast amazing food and staff. The Blinz was a hit! Loved the breakfast items. Five stars, great value in SF.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Came here for breakfast on a suggestion from a friend.  He had been here before.  At first sight of the line out the door seriously scared me, especially because we had 12 people in our group.   The worker told me no problem and started to work out the table situation.  By the time we all ordered at the counter, our table was ready!  IT WAS FAST FAST FAST!!!  I first thought we wouldn't get to sit together and second it would take days to just order.  I was WRONG :).  They provide SUPER SERVICE at HHC&C!!!  After getting our drinks and serve yourself water we sat down and the food was out QUICK.  I started to think it many not be as good as my friend said.  I was WRONG again!  The food I tried was amazing and all 12 people at my table were happy campers (especially because most of them were hung over!)...  

The Bloody Mary was spicy and delicious!  I had the Eggs Benedict with potatoes that was also yummy.  I tried my cousin's Chorizo scramble!  That was sooooo good!  My friend had his usual Crab Cake Florentine.  I didn't try his but I tried the Crab Cake Crepe!  OMG OMG OMG....  I would make the trip to SF just for that Crepe!!  I didn't even see it on the menu so I will definitely have to call if I go again.  I am not sure if it was a sprecial of the day but it needs to be a regular item!!!  

I don't visit the City (The Bay) very often but I would definitely put this on my list for my next trip!!!
author: Christine H.

description: We stayed at the hotel across the street and in our 3 day stay we are here twice. Definitely delicious! I recommend getting there early in the morning as the line is out the door - but definitely worth the wait!
author: Jenni B.

description:
We stayed nearby at Hotel Triton and had wanted to have breakfast at the cafe next door, but we had our dog with us and they weren't serving outside at that time of the morning (8:00-ish on a beautiful Sunday morning). I was craving Eggs Benedict, and Husband found Honey Honey by searching on Yelp (thanks Yelp!).  

The place was packed, and there was a long line to place our order. But once the order was placed, it was delivered outside to us quickly. In addition to sharing the Eggs Benedict, we shared a Crepe Suzette. It was all very good, cooked to perfection, and fresh.

The only suggestion I have is that the restaurant level the tables outside on the sidewalk. It was a bit of a balancing act to keep the plates from sliding around!
author: Karen K.

description:
I was pretty irritated by the line, but it was WORTH IT! 

Couldn't decide between probably 8 items they were all so different from breakfast menu choices I've seen before. The food didn't take long to come out, and I was not disappointed... I wish I'd made it back while in town.
author: Amanda A.

description:
This is a wonderful, relaxed, easy going breakfast place. Open early for jet-lagged European travelers!
I had a salmon benedict, loved it, and some really good coffee. 
Even though it was early, it was crowded, which speaks well of its reputation.
Reliable WiFi as well.
Close to everything downtown (Union Square area).
Very much recommended.
author: Alex A.

description: Quaint little restaurant we found it on our seventh day of vacation the best breakfast so far place is packed well managed the people were very nice. The food was delicious and the French toast was awesome they made my omelette my way no question.
author: Hector E.

description: Disappointed. 2 in our party almost finished their order and we still did not get ours and all placed on same ticket. My salmon eggs Benedict was barely warm.
author: Linda S.

description: This is the best breakfast place. It's got soooo many options from crêpes to regular American breakfasts. Will have to come back next time I'm in town. And take an extra fresh squeezed oj to go!
author: Gwen C.

description:
Honey Honey, how you grill them, ah-hah, Honey Honey
Honey Honey, overcook them, ah-hah, Honey Honey
I heard about you before
I wanted to know some more
And now I know what they mean, you're an egg-breaking machine...

Enough ABBA karaoke... and just who is this mysterious chalkboard calligrapher? His rainbow chalk work is present at a lot of Crepevines, a load of Squat & Gobbles, Soma Inn Cafe, and now here at Honey Honey. What's oddly comforting is that all these places with the same-style chalkboards have the same-style food with the same-style quality. Coincidence? I don't know, but maybe there is a how-to-start-a-popular-breakfast-eatery kit. If so, the owners of Honey Honey have followed those instructions to the T.

Honey Honey is massively popular with what I perceive with the Union Square tourist species, the ones that stay in the nearby overpriced hotel and are looking to save the rest of their spending money on more modest meals. There isn't anything overly adventurous to be found on the gigantic chalkboards... the usual suspects - omelets, crepes, burgers. I ordered the $8.95 Salmon Scramble which came with their rosemary potatoes and a slice of sourdough toast.

The wait in line was about ten minutes, not bad for a mid-morning weekday. The tables were seeing enough turnover for me to be able to grab a small table for two. It looks like one of the owners actually brings the plates out. The chunks of salmon were plentiful, though the eggs were a tad rubbery. The potatoes were savory and could have used a dollop of sour cream. All of it was ok, but then there was a group of Bulgarians staring at me waiting for me to finish.

FOOD - 3 stars...passable breakfast dishes for those passing in town or perhaps close to passing out
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...Crepevine for the tourists...guard your table!
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...order at the counter and prepare to pounce on any open space
TOTAL - 3 stars...Honey Honey, how I'm indifferent, ah-hah, Honey Honey
author: Ed U.

description:
Came here for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised to see that there was no wait at 9am. Ordered an eggs Benedict and French toast. They came to our table later to tell us that they ran out of English muffins (oh no :() and asked if they could substitute it with wheat or sourdough. I really like English muffins, so that was a bummer but they were super nice about it.

When the food came out, everything was on point. My only complaint is that my utensils were a little sticky when I got them, but aside from the minor dirtiness, the food and service were great!
author: Mai N.

description: Came here after dance class. Walk up to the counter to order. Took about ten minutes to get our food. They had some lemon and cucumber infused water available which was nice. We had the Miami Heat Crepe and the Apple Crepe. Both were yummy and filling without making me feel grossly full. Definitely will be back.
author: Nina S L.

description: Five people who were behind us in line were served before us. We got here at 11:20, waited in line for 25 minutes, and waited an additional half hour for our food which was just three standard crepes. Solid food quality, but the service was terrible even by California standards and the food was not nearly worth the wait.
author: Samantha W.

description: Had a great breakfast savory crepe today, fresh fruit was beautifully cut.  Potatoes done to perfection.. put this stop on your list.  Block away from The Marker Hotel, very convenient.
author: Diane E.

description: The line was so long so we expected it to be really delicious but it was not anything special. We had the salmon Benedict and sunrise burrito. Neither was outstanding. Also because there were limited space in the cafe, waiters were trying to get people eat fast so new people could sit. We did not enjoy the service.
author: Bian Y.

description:
What a great spot! I was staying close to this place during my first time in San Francisco and walked by it a number of times to and from my hotel. One morning my friend and I decided to grab breakfast before heading out to see some sights. It was pretty empty being late morning on a weekday, but this meant our food was ready quickly which was a relief because we were starving.

I ordered the chorizo scramble which was spicy and delicious. The chorizo was plentiful and the eggs were very fluffy, the whole thing had a nice texture. It also came with toast and some awesome potatoes. The potatoes were seasoned with various herbs and perfectly crispy.

I washed this down with an iced chai and overall had a great breakfast. If I lived in SF I have a feeling this would be a regular spot for me.
author: Brandon F.

description:
Wow! This restaurant has more crepes than one can imagine; salmon, pesto, cheese, avocado, fruit, the list goes on. Try the pesto Craig. They all also serve other options including traditional breakfast food and omelettes.

The line moves quickly, and the service is friendly.  If you enjoy coffee, this will be a great study to your day-it's extremely flavorful.
author: Living T.

description: This is a popular place. Long line and limited seating. However, the food was really good. I had a breakfast burrito and it was killer.
author: Dana P.

description:
Was pretty empty when we went in around 5:30PM, but quickly filled up as it got to around 7? 

Huge menu on the walls to your immediate right when you walk in. Tons of options from coffee, soups/salads, crepes, waffles, bagels. Etc. 

I got a hot chocolate and nutella/strawberry crepe (part of me wanted the Blintz, but I wasn't in a cottage cheese mood). The hot chocolate was great! Super rich and didn't taste like fake hot chocolate from most places so thumbs up. The crepe was good too, not something I would write home about, but had good flavor/crunch. 

My friend wanted the bagel with lox etc, but somehow that got lost in translation because he only got a bagel with cream cheese so...haha #sad 

Overall cute place, had interesting shaped cookies behind the counter, and...was SUPER toasty when we entered...and mirrors, can't forget the mirrors.
author: Connie N.

description:
I was looking for a nice little breakfast place to check out and I came across Honey Honey Cafe.  When you walk in, you notice that it's a really cute little place inside, seats probably 40-50 or so.  One of the walls has the complete menu, in very large print.

I wanted to order so many crepes, but I wanted some protein and substance, so I went with the Huevos Rancheros.  I would give it 3.5 stars.  The tortillas were nice and crispy and eggs and cheese were pretty good.  The black beans were good, but it did lack a bit of flavor.  Some may appreciate it, but I like when black beans have a little meaty, porky flavor, but it did not.

The extra .5 star goes for the cute atmosphere, but also something that you rarely see in a restaurant, but was fantastic, the bathroom door has a vacancy/occupied sign.  It's a single bathroom and you usually have to knock and wait, but they have a convenient vacancy/occupied sign attached to the lock, similar to porta-johns.  It makes perfect sense and I wish more places had it.

Honey Honey also has a very nice little outdoor seating place where you can enjoy the outside, people watch, and eat on the streets of SF.
author: Randy G.

description:
Excellent Belgium waffles! Incredibly light and not at all stodgy with nice strawberries, banana, whipped cream and a side of maple syrup. What more can you ask for?

We had read that the queue for Honey Honey can get very long so we decided to visit before 9am. This turned out to be a good idea as, even though there was a slight queue, we just had enough time to chose from the extensive menu before it was our turn to order. As we were sat eating the queue grew continuously until it was out of the door and on to the street.

As mentioned I had the Belgium Waffle which was very good and my girlfriend had the Lemon Crêpe which she enjoyed but did say that there could have been a slightly larger portion and a bit less lemon curd on top (there was a lot).

We will be returning to sample more of the menu.
author: Dave A.

description: Worth the 15-20 minute wait. Crepes and specials are mmmm good. Fresh squeezed juice was tasty until my son spilled it, what can you do....go get some goodness
author: Brandi A.

description:
Food is ok, not great. Salads are not my favorite. I think crepes are good. Loved the Santa Fe scramble.

The main complaint is how loud the music is. I don't understand why they have to blast the music as if it was a bar or club. I gad to stop going because of this. Even headphones don't help.

I had to laugh with another couple once because they couldn't believe how ridiculously loud it was, and there was only 4 customers eating inside.
author: D M.

description: Great breakfast spot. The line wasn't that bad, we probably waited a good 30 minutes. The wait was definitely worth it. I ordered the New Orleans crepe, and the Peanut Butter crepe. They were both amazing. My girlfriend and I shared everything. I will definitely be coming back for more.
author: Kenyatta C.

description: Awesome Sauce food and charming atmosphere! So many choices on the menu makes it hard to pick! Lines are long but worth the wait!
author: Martha S.

description: Meh. Not the best breakfast in town. The French toast was average at best - maybe a bit below average. Same thing you'd get at Denny's or IHOP. The breakfast burrito was okay, but nothing notable. The eggs were pretty dry and smothering it in black beans didn't do much for me. You can do better than this place.
author: Andrew D.

description: Before heading out to do all the tourist sites, you need a good solid breakfast - which this place gives with nice portions and I think a very fair price for this area.  Near to Union Square, I would get there early (like before 9am) and you can generally get out in a reasonable time.  While you are waiting to get to the counter to order, you keep changing your mind from the great choices posted on the wall - and then there's a small chart of specials that comes up and you have to quickly decide!  I had the pesto crepe one morning and then came back the next day for the crab cake florentine.  The crab cake was really good and so "San Fran" - better than down at the marina area... I will definitely head back the next time!
author: Maureen L.

description:
Loved it.

I ordered the Spicey Crepe, something like Miami, or something but it was AMAZING!!! wasn't sure how spicey it would be but I loved it.

The only reason I did not give a 5 out of 5 is that the mimosas are NOT bottomless. :(
author: Brittini S.

description: This is one of the worst place I have ever been. The reviews are good because Americans never tasted real crepe, they should go overseas to France. Then they will not eat this again. Cheddar should not be used in all dishes, it makes it worse. The other problem is the worst service. The cashier takes money and prepares coffee at the same time. It takes forever. They should hire a second person. Please any europeans do not go there. Even Starbucks is better....
author: Ilkay K.

description:
Look, I'm a local. I have eaten here plenty of times and know it's a decent spot to grab brunch on a Saturday with less of a wait than most sf places. Food is pretty good, no complaints there.

Why 3 stars? The guy at the cash register is extremely rude, kept cutting me off when I was trying to order and when he finally got done with my order he:

1. "Forgot about my mocha," which when I walked up to the register to remind him, he just kept making other people's drinks who were after me. Ok no biggy, got my mocha and I'm happy.

2. They brought me the entirely wrong order. So like maybe you shouldn't interject when I am trying to get my tastey breakfast order on, and listen to what I want so we don't have to waste your chefs time making another one.

TLDR this place is decent but if you see a guy working the register work yourself out of here.
author: Jenny U.

description:
One of my lifelong philosophies has always been to skip the meal and go straight for the desserts regardless of the time of day. Smacked in between Union Square and the Tenderloin District, this crepery does not have the glamorous outlook when compared to all other tourist attractions on the same block. Instead, their spacious venue is filled with vibrant colors to support a family-friendly atmosphere complemented by a large menu, free wifi, and a good numbers of dessert crepes. As a crepe connoisseur and someone who is heavily dependent on public wifi, I can't help but to swing by for a dessert dinner and to find out the quality of their crepes when measured against others. 

My strawberry nutella crepe ($5.95) arrived with a soft exterior outlined by a crispy cone-like texture on the edges. A gush of steam came out as I flipped open the crepe to notice the cooked strawberries with a smear of nutella that was unevenly distributed. The crepe was drizzled with chocolate and powder sugar to match a scoop of vanilla ice cream that came on the side. With a defined vanilla flavor, the ice cream had a sticky texture and interestingly tasted like a thickened whipped cream. Although the strawberries were not the freshest, the high temperature which it came with was effective in preventing the extreme hot-cold contrast that I find common but less than ideal among the many creperies I've visited. 

Overall, I thought it was a decent crepe that didn't wow or disappoint me. Since I paid $11 for a banana crepe at Ti Couz not too long ago, I thought the price this time was rather reasonable for what I got in return. I wish the crepe could have a fluffier and thicker texture while the restaurant could provide ample wall plugs for those who need to utilize their free wifi. Since their large menu has a diverse selection of dishes, I highly recommend this place for families and teenagers looking to make a quick stop for food as opposed to the many expensive sit down places in the area. The noise level however, maybe too loud for studying, but their wifi is still useful for those who may need it for other purposes. Service was brief and friendly under a pay first, self-serve arrangement. With so many creperies around the City, I would only return when I'm in the area.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Found this little place on Yelp. We walked in at around 5:30 pm and placed an order for a Strawberry Nutella Crêpe and a Lemon crêpe. Both were excellent and reasonably priced. The lemon crêpe was exceptionally tart - so be prepared that while tasty it is not overly sweet. 

While the food was good I couldn't help but feel like it was a bit dirty. The floors were beyond filthy and everything just looked dingy and dirty. I ordered a pot of tea and the cream looked like it had been out all day - it was room temperature and in the end I just skipped it. 

Decent food but don't go out of your way to eat here. Nothing to write home about.
author: Erika B.

description: We were with a big party which included kids, but the staff was very accommodating and fast. The waffles and pancakes were delicious. We didnt get to try the crepes, but everything everyone in our party ordered was delicious, hot and delivered quickly. I would highly recommend you stop in here.
author: Neda F.

description: Big hearty breakfast, large menu with many choices including crepes, pancakes, waffles, omelets, etc.
author: Alan H.

description: Food was great! Service was horrible! I had the blintz  and my son had eggs Benedict.
author: Robert Z.

description: It's a very popular place for breakfast so be prepared to queue for 30 min or so. They have a quite extensive menu but I feel that the quality of the food is just average.
author: Teddy M.

description: I'm not too sure about the service because I ordered to-go but the dessert crepe was HEAVEN. I've taste tested the banana Nutella crepe all over Europe and in California because it's my favorite crepe dessert. I can honestly say that besides Brussels, Belgium which had my favorite crepes I've ever tried, this place is my second favorite. The minute I opened the box and the smell wafted under my nose, I knew this was going to be a good experience. The crepe was not too sweet or rich to where I felt sick but still sweet enough to hit the spot. The light texture was lovely. I ate the entire thing in 10 minutes without stopping. Usually I'm not able to finish crepes because they're too sweet but these guys got the balance just right. I wish I was in town longer to try out the breakfast menu but I definitely recommend this place!!!
author: Grace B.

description: Delicious potatoes. Rockin north beach crape. Line was slightly painful. And I feel sorry for the servers when people attempt to claims tables when a sign stating "please wait for for a server to seat you" could have made clear that.... "Beep stop being rude and entitled and just get up and wait like everyone else" that's running through everyone else's minds that are in line waiting to order and sit at a table
author: Tobi X.

description: As I sat practically shoveling in the goodness, I noticed this place is a 2016 Top Rated Eat24 Restaurant.  It deserves that rating.  The food is off-the-chain good, the fresh-squeezed OJ right out of the orange, and the dessert crepes selection is just right.  I recommend the Blintz, as I'm sure you couldn't pack more a more flavorful blend of fruits and cheeses in this light pillow crepe drizzled with strawberry and cream.  The Union Square location is convenient, but worth the trip from further away.  It is a sit-down style restaurant, and the seating becomes available as people finish and the staff cleans things right up.  A good line was formed as we left about 9:30 on a beautiful Saturday morning in SF...
author: Bruce L.

description: The croissant sandwich was delicious! The worker was great as well. When he noticed I did not like the parsley on the potatoes, without being asked, he brought me out a fresh plate with no parsley! Service like that is hard to find. We will be back again before our trip is over!
author: Nicole V.

description: Recommended for breakfast as our hotel was remodeling their restaurant. Great suggestion! Bit of a line but you could scan the detailed menu while waiting to order. Everything going by looked good. My Eggs Benedict were OK with great potatoes. Wife's Santa Fe scramble special was amazing and very spicy. We splurged when we saw another of the daily specials, Crepe Suzette, which was fantastic! Fresh orange juice using this entertaining machine you could watch cutting whole oranges in half and squeezing the juice into a pitcher - really good!
author: Ransom J.

description:
Decent place to get brunch at. Slightly overpriced for the quality and amount of food that you get though. I know brunch and this place is just okay.

Went here with a party of 7 & we managed to get a few tables. Slightly noisy but good waitstaff. We asked for additional plates for a friends birthday cake that we wanted to share and they accommodated us, which was awesome.
author: Juan T. K.

description:
CREPES?!   I'll try 'em!  I was first introduced to crepes in France, so I have a rather high standard of them.  I must say, these people KNOW THEIR CREPES.  The menu is impressive... they have everything under the sun!  I've been there a few times already and I'm frustrated because though I want to try more of their menu, the Chicken Pesto Crepes is just soooo delicious I end up continually ordering that!  Also, they have a large syrup collection for their coffee drinks.  This is nice because I prefer a Half Hazelnut Half Amaretto Latte.  Amaretto is so darn hard to find!  They have it!!!!! :)

I can't say anything bad about the service, but it's not all smiles there.  Still, they aren't rude.  Just into their job and they do it well.  Thanks!  I'll be back!

Oh, just make sure that you know what your options for your sides are.  One time, I wasn't asked and I didn't think to say, and I got something unexpected.  They have a good assortment of sides, but if they don't ask, be sure to tell them so it's not a surprise!
author: Jordan M.

description: Absolutely amazing crepes! Fluffy and fully of flavor! But be aware of a 30min line up! It's worth the wait! Highly recommend the Eden crepe for smoked salmon lovers!!
author: Alice L.

description:
The crepe menu has savory selections with cheeses and meats, and the sweet creeps offer more than just Nutella.  I had a lemon crepe with cream (or optional ice cream) and found it was very tart and delightful.  I also had a good mocha, and the other person with me had an omelette and potatoes which was also good. 

You order at a counter, then find a seat where they bring you your food.  The service  is very prompt and I enjoyed breakfast.
author: Tina I.

description: Every time in I'm in town, this lovely cafe is a must. Tried salad, pasta and crapes - all the amazing!!
author: Agata M.

description:
Short and Sweet:

Plenty of items on the menu to try. Its an order at the register and sit down with a number kind of place. Orange or lemon water available on self serve basis. Location is close to Union Square just a few block from our hotel. 

Crab Cake Florentine was fresh with eggs just as they described. They offer your poached eggs soft, medium or well done.  Strawberry nutella crepe was a nice sweet treat to split after breakfast. 

I'm a big fan of breakfast and I could have had many items here without being disappointed.
author: Kevin C.

description:
The most random place for a slightly hungover Sunday brunch. But surprisingly good!  I had a savory crepe filled with crab cakes and hollandaise sauce, and a cappuccino. It was delicious and gloriously French. 

Only downside was there wasn't much rhyme or reason in the dining room. Bare decor and some weird sponge painted yellow walls if I remembered correctly. Do I seat myself? What do I do with this number? Isn't there a tray for my cappuccino, freshly pressed orange juice and flavored water? Good lord the choices on this chalkboard menu.
author: Joanie S.
