description: Found this place through Yelp cause we're craving for something sweet after the strenuous shopping in downtown (on a Saturday evening). No food service at 9:30pm Saturday although door sign and Yelp indicate business hours up till 10:00pm. A group of patron was finishing up at that time. We walked in and immediately told, "take out only (f*ckers)!" So much service for a banana Nutella crepe which takes less than 10 minutes to make. Nasty rude European female cashier (with tee and long uncurbed hair) who kicked us out (with her death glare) the minute we walked in. There ain't no honey in this joint, just bitterness...
author: Sarah P.

description: Ate here for dinner a couple times on a recent business trips.  The service was quick and efficient and the food was very good (sandwiches, soups, salads etc).
author: Jamie D.

description: Came here for breakfast on a Monday. The line was out the door, despite it being a weekday. We were lucky to get a table, albeit being beside the doors which were a downside because it is very cold outside. We ordered the salmon benedict, the crab florentine, and the milano for the vegetarian in our family. The first two were so good and very fairly priced. The crab cake was perfect, and the salmon was good, but it lacked a good amount of salmon. The milano, on the other hand, was not the greatest. It was basically an omelette filled with a block of coagulated cheese with barely any tomato or spinach, which we were hoping for. Despite this, the environment was nice and the coffee was good.
author: Ginnie T.

description: I absolutely love coming to this cafe whenever I'm in San Francisco! It was recommended to me a few years ago, and I'm so glad it was. My favourite crepe to order is the nutella and banana crepe which I highly recommend if you're looking for something sweet. They're hot chocolate is also delicious. The staff are very kind and helpful, and this is great little cafe to come for a meal.
author: Gabriella H.

description:
This is the best place for Crepes.

No need to wait in line to get your food. All sorts of desert crepes and savory crepes that is enough for a main course. I ordered eggplant crepe with side salads. Love it! 

Will come for hamburgers next time!
author: Carrie Z.

description:
My expectations were higher, but oh, well.   The breakfast is basic.  The crepes are mediocre.   The wait is very long because you actually have to stand in line to order your food.   

I ordered the egg white and salmon scramble. I got fruit with it.  The fruit was actually fresh.   Anyhow, the salmon and egg white scramble was pretty good.  The coffee was OK.  

I ordered The Blintz crepes.   They were not good.   It had waaaaaay too much stuff in it, it was falling apart.  I don't know maybe I ordered the wrong crepes.  

I probably wouldn't come back to this place.  And that wait in line is a killer.
author: Adriana B.

description: Really friendly gentleman who takes orders and brings out the food but the crepes are closer to dry pizza crust than a crepe.  Would like to like this place but their crepes are just not good.
author: DK K.

description: Large selection of both sweet and savory crepes. I had one of each and both were excellent. Price for portion size is comparable to other cafes in the area. I deduct one star because they charged my credit card twice and there was a long wait for the food after ordering.
author: David B B.

description: WOW-WOW-WOW!!! I can't say how much I like this place without getting water in my mouth. The atmosphere is so cosy and the food so delicious Several times have I gone to HoneyHoney by myself for some alone time, great omelet and a warm cup of coffee or a cold glass of homemade orange juice. My all time favorite will always be "Post street" omelet with wheat bread and fruits on the side. I can't understand how a simple and easy meal like that can taste so wonderful!! I highly recommend trying out either their lovely sweet crepes, Apple-turkey-avocado Sandwich (which I assure will surprise you) or my one and only omelet! Go and enjoy this awesome place with the nice staff and cute decorations!!
author: Victoria V.

description: The best place ever. If you are in downtown SF u should definitely stop by. They have great food and service. Plus they have fresh squeezed orange juice.  Highly recommended
author: Kenza A.

description:
Good food, though a little overpriced for what you get. Fast delivery, however..
Girlfriend was charged for items she didn't ask for.
I got avocado, instead of the bacon I asked and was charged for on my crepe. So while it was good... Wasn't a thrilling experience.
author: Sirk Nimrac D.

description:
My cousin and I were the first customers for the day. 
My cousin got the chicken and pesto crepe. I got the Salmon Benedict and we shared the SBK (strawberry, banana, and kiwi) crepe. Our savory dishes was excellent. The SBk was disappointing. The fruits were over cooked and was bland for the heat.  
Service was fast and the food tasted really good. I liked that we can get our own water so we didn't have to stare down the cashier/bus girl/ and food bringer outer.
author: Chris L.

description: It's worth the line!!! it goes really fast too. Make sure to order the crepes & fresh made OJ. Well worth it. They staff here was all really friendly.
author: Laura B.

description: This place is AMAZEBALLS. The wait is pretty long. We got here and the line was out the door around the corner. We stood in line for 45 min but the food was worth every second. My mother got the Mediterranean crepe, my mother in law got the chorizo scramble, and I hot the cable car omelet (smoked salmon, capers, and cream cheese)  we all got a lemon dessert crepe as well.  Everything was perfect. Definitely reccomended this place
author: Rachel M.

description:
This place is great. I was in SF for a conference and had been to the Pinecrest Diner the day before where I had the Joe's Special and that was amazing. Honey Honey's atmosphere is much better. The only annoying thing is that you order at the counter and get a number and then you have to find a table. The first day we went there, finding a table was fine. The second time we went there, it was almost impossible to find a table.

Anyway, the food was so good. I am very picky about seafood and especially picky about crab dishes. In NYC, it's hard to find good crab, believe it or not, so I was skeptical about the crab cakes Florentine benedict at Honey Honey, especially since it's $10.50. I was stunned by the quality of the food and the size of the crab cakes on the benedict. The crab cakes are mostly crab meat and very little filler -- can't complain about that. The potatoes that come with it are also good. The next time I went there, I ordered a single pancake and it was good! I'm a pancake snob, but this pancake was really good. My coworker got a lemon crepe and was very excited about it, but she was disappointed. And the coffee there was great, too. 

The last day we were there, the line was literally out the door. Luckily, a coworker had gone early and locked down a table. While the food was very good, I'm not sure I would've been okay waiting in line for over an hour just to get some breakfast.
author: Kelli J.

description: Super friendly staff. Amazing choices. I loved the Blue Burger and the strawberry Nutella Crepe.
author: Jason P.

description: Honey Honey was a great find while we were on vacation in SF. The menu is big (literally) and everything we had was fantastic. The kids enjoyed pancakes, crepes and fresh OJ while I had a great omelette and cafe latte. The line does get a little long but it moves quickly and is well worth the wait. The kids wanted to go back every morning we were there!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Ok so just like another reviewer stated.. This place is like Crepevine, but in the city. 

I got their two egg's breakfast with bacon and a nutella crepe. Did not like their eggs too much because is was over cooked and their toast was very bland and they only gave you two slices (as opposed to other places that give you 4)

They have a vast variety of crepe options and sandwiches and salads and it's a never ending list of beverages and food. Price was decent and food portions were pretty large. (at least for me) I would def recommend it if you are a big crepe lover. Don't come here is you're looking for some good scrambled eggs, potatoes and toast.
author: Krista S.

description: Stopped here on a Thursday to grab a quick bite.  Counter service cafe.  We ordered the Crab Cake Florentine (crab cake benedict with wilted spinach).  The crab cakes were fresh made and DELISH.  Also had to order a Crepe Suzette (made with oranges and fresh squeezed orange juice).  Option of having it served with either whipped cream or ice cream.  My inner fatty wanted the ice cream, but it was breakfast time.  The crepe was amazing - tart and sweet and oh so citrusy!
author: Alicia R.

description: Large selection of breakfast items: from crepes to egg Benedict. Friendly service, great coffee and pleasant decor. We had salmon Benedict and crab cake florentine - definitely coming back.
author: Dmitry K.

description: Amazing amazing amazing! My husband and I were craving something sweet after dinner and decided to go with the highest yelp reviewed crepery  around union square area. We ordered the banana/strawberry Nutella crepe and the peanut butter crepe. There are no other words to describe how tasty and rich the crepes were. Best crepes we have ever had! Worth the calories
author: Yana M.

description: Food is good. Some items are heavy on the spice but not enough to turn you off from the dish. Mimosas are good. Best dish (so far): Eggs Benedict.
author: Cory S.

description: Several people on here gave a bad review because they had to wait in line. Well, in my opinion the line is worth the wait. This place is awesome! I personally love the crepes but the pancakes and bagel sandwiches look delicious as well. Plus you can get a bloody mary or memosa with your breakfast. I will definitely come back here!
author: Katye W.

description: Ham and cheese croissant was so on point and so was their Nutella banana crepe! I highly suggest getting it with ice cream too since it's warm and crispy. Honestly was able to go the whole day without eating just having half the croissant and crepe for a good brunch.
author: Nikki D.

description: Went here for breakfast and the lines moved fast and the gentleman working the seating was on point and very nice.  Mimosa comes in a very small glass, carrot juice was great, and breakfast lacked of flavor.
author: Erik P.

description: Felt like I should have a croissant while in SF. This was the place to do it. The croissant sandwich was incredible and huge!  My wife had the pecan pancakes. The pancakes were perfectly fluffy, and the candied pecans were delicious. Hardest thing was making a decision on what to order. Great breakfast spot.
author: Stephen S.

description: Lines, lattes, and mediocre wifi (just as anywhere in sf tho) were the least impressive part of this experience.... However, the cozy ambiance and welcoming staff are a great start....only to be followed up by some tasty breakfast dishes and crepes at decent prices (extra star for that)...To be fair the line moves along reasonably and the food delivery/ service is prompt considering the line.
author: A V.

description: This place was less than a block away from our hotel. Loved the food, so yummy. I waited in line for about 30 minutes, but it was worth it. We had tuna sandwich, eggs Benedict and a Nutella strawberry crape, and everything way really tasty. Will go back!!!
author: Laura S.

description: The menu choice has a lot of choices so depending what you're craving, there are a lot of different options. I never was a huge fan of crepes but this place definitely made me change my mind. It can get really busy depending on when you go in. I went in during lunch hour rush with a group of friends and the time between the 1st and 5th person in our group to get our food was an hour difference. But I've gone in when they weren't as busy and I only waited about 5-10 minutes after I ordered my food.
author: Diana P.

description:
My girlfriend had looked up their menu prior to me stopping in, so she texted me what she wanted. As I was reading what she wanted off my phone to the owner/manager taking my order, he started to raise his voice at me as if I was working for Postmates or something. He then went into a diatribe about getting breakfast orders at 3am.

As for the food here, it's rather forgettable. You can do much better by just wandering around the area and taking a chance somewhere else.

The food may have not been poisonous, but the service definitely was. I won't be coming here again.
author: Jordan C.

description: I have mixed feelings about Honey Honey. The ambiance was loud and the line long which can be a good sign, but took 15 minutes to get through. After ordering we waited about 10 minutes for our food which is not too bad. When the food arrived is where I became divided. My Belgian waffle was perfect. Its light and rich waffle with fresh strawberries and bananas became a home run to my taste buds when I poured on the warm rich maple syrup. Now for the bad. My wife got the oatmeal and fruit. The oat meal itself was woefully soupy and combined with the rotten strawberries she got with it made her lose her appetite. So here the verdict be careful what you order and ask a local in line for a recommendation. And if you are gluten intolerant like my wife just find another place for breakfast all together.
author: Jason R.

description:
Found this place on yelp while walking down Post St. It's not in the best location ever but about 3 blocks away from Union Square. 

They have a great breakfast menu on the chalkboard on the wall. Crepes, eggs & omelettes. I had the Post St. Omelette, which came with a choice of potatoes or friuits; as well as my choice of sourdough, wheat, and one other type of bread I can't remember. 

The vibe is very laid back. They give you numbers and bring your food to your table when it's ready. All in all, I'd come back if I was in the area again.
author: Leina K.

description:
Long lines, slow service, and a dark dingy environment...  We visited on a chilly February day and the door was open and the whole place was cold and drafty.

For all of the drawbacks the food better be amazing.  And yet, the crepes are mediocre at best.

Really not good in any way.
author: Jacob J.

description: I would give it 5 stars, but the way the ordering process takes place is awkward, and the dumb customers who line up leave the door wide open while waiting in line, allowing the cold air to blow in on those throughout the restaurant.  Seriously, how can people be so unaware to just stand in the doorway and not think that maybe they should just wait outside the door?  I think mgmt should be telling them otherwise.
author: S. R.

description: Pretty decent crepe with friendly service.  I like how they have such a wide variety of both sweet and savory versions to try out. The biggest draw to this place in my opinion is the price.  If you're in the mood for a crepe and don't want to pay an arm and a leg in a relatively pricey area.  You can't really go wrong with this place.
author: Dan Y.

description: Yummy breakfast spot for a good price! Awesome breakfast potatoes & pancakes. Found from yelp & would definitely recommend!
author: Alayne S.

description: This place never disappoints, food is awesome, their potatoes, pancakes, and lattes are so good! Yes you have to wait in line to order, but once you sit down food comes out right away.
author: Christy C.

description: We had breakfast and the food was amazing. The orange juice was freshly made and croissant sandwich was the best I ever had. Pancakes were to die for.  This is a must stop in San Fran
author: Tom A.

description: We enjoyed our breakfast at Honey Honey.   The crepes were very good,  especially the pesto crepe.   The salmon eggs benedict was good but not special.  The lemon and mint in the water was a nice touch. We were there when they opened on a Saturday morning and waiting only 10 minutes or so to order.   By the time we left the line was pretty long,  I'd guess the wait was 25 minutes to order.   Tables were starting to turn over so I expect everyone in line at 8:15 was going to get a table.
author: Arnie Q.

description:
(See pics)

Writing an update since this is still an excellent spot to have just about any meal of the day or even just a pop by place for gathering, or read a book.

In this past year they had done quite some nice modeling such as moving the chalk board to the side and you can now have more time studying the extensive menu while waiting in the rather fast line before ordering.

Service is as always super friendly and the food continues to be filling and delicious. I like how they present the food such as Belgian waffles with fruits that totally perk your appetite.
author: T L.

description: Awesome euro cafe.  The coffee is delicious. Also try the Mediterranean crepe or omelette.  There are always long lines on weekends so be prepared to wait. It's well worth it.
author: Johnathan M.

description: Tasty, large portions.  Standard, solid breakfast.  Fresh OJ and French Toast are delicious.
author: Megan P.

description: Great food, fast service, very reasonable prices. We had an enjoyable breakfast. The employees were very personable and I would definitely recommend this place for crepes, for sandwiches or other breakfast items.
author: Kirk S.

description: Enjoyed the Strawberry Crepe!!! Service was mediocre but the food was really good and fresh. I would definitely go again when I am back in San Francisco!!!
author: Aaron V.

description:
Went to eat here because another dessert place nearby was packed. I ordered their dessert nutella crepe and a burger. I felt like I could have cooked both dishes better; the dishes tasted like it was cooked by high school students in a cooking class or something... Their food definitely didn't taste restaurant quality, and I will not return.

Two stars rating is me being nice. In comparison to 100s of restaurants out there, this place definitely can be a one star type of rating..
author: Violet G.

description:
We grabbed a quick breakfast at Honey Honey at 8 am on a Monday before a full day of exploring San Francisco. What a great breakfast spot!

Since we were there so early there was no line or wait. The menu here is huge. You can get anything from cereal to eggs to crepes to pancakes. I had the granola and a bagel and cream cheese. The granola was delicious. I had the fruit that came with it on it side and it was fresh strawberries and and cut apples. My boyfriend had eggs, sausage, and pancakes and was extremely happy with all of them. Breakfast wasn't cheap, but definitely comparable to other prices in the area.

The employees here were not super friendly. But then again it was 8 am on a Monday morning. I don't trust people who are super happy and loving life at that time of the week.
author: Audrey P.

description:
I came into SF for a business interview and my boyfriend and I decided we were in the mood for breakfast. He found Honey Honey and since we love some savory crepes, we decided a walk to here would be worth it. 

Maybe not. 

Don't get me wrong, the place is nice enough but on a Saturday morning, it is packed and the hustle and bustle might have contributed to a few issues. The girl at the counter was pleasant but I was charged for an item I didn't order. Plus, my boyfriend was charged for something he didn't get. 

The food was fine enough but for the price? Not really. All in all, it was okay but I'd definitely have preferred Crepevine to this establishment. Still, it's a pleasant enough experience when they're not overly busy. Lots of beverage options, fresh squeezed orange juice and plenty of food options.
author: Krystyna M.

description:
A nice little cafe that can become very crowded; and I can see why.

The extensive menu of different crepes are placed on multiple chalk boards along the ceiling as you wait in line. 

I can't remember what we ordered since it was a while ago. I can remember I really enjoyed it Anschluss it was delicious.

We ordered the fresh squeezes OJ and that too was oh soo good!

We sat outside at a table on the sidewalk. I have nothing but good things to say about this place.

The people were friendly and the service was great :)
author: Ava I.

description: Awesome food! Must try the Blintz and French Toast!!! The staff is friendly and the food is fast!
author: Amanda J.

description:
I was walking around my hotel to look for a place to eat breakfast and I stumbled upon Honey Honey.  There were many people eating there, so I figured they must do a good job.

I ordered the 2&2&2 with 2 pancakes, 2 scrambled eggs and 2 pieces of bacon.

I waited longer than I wanted to for the food, but the pancakes were worth it.

More people started coming in and at 1 point, there were about 20 people in line to order.

It's probably good to get here early.
author: Julie N.

description:
The CREPES are pretty darn good. The service early in the morning is also pretty superb considering they must deal with many people and have what doesn't seem like many people working.

The menu has a wide selection of random goodness. My only gripe would be paying close to 4 bucks for "Freshly Squeezed Orange Juice". I mean I payed it because it was my per diem so I didn't give a flying French man, but it is not worth half of that. Just saying.
author: Luis D.

description: Hands down this place has the best breakfast!! I've always had the crab cakes florentine! Super good!! There is always a line!! But totally worth the wait!!
author: Erica J.

description: Place was pretty packed and if u don't like tight places, maybe it's not for you. But my banana Nutella crepe was delicious! Definitely worth it. And my mimosa was the bomb.com
author: Andrea A.

description: This place has ample selections on the menu!  Mimosa was made with freshly squeezed oranges, their crepes are delicious, and egg scramblers are good too!!  Four stars out of five because I just wish the seating was a little bit more comfortable.  Other than that, I like this place.
author: Grasan K.

description: Best crepes in town! The tables are small, but I didn't care. I ordered as much food as I could eat. Everything was amazing
author: Madeleine S.

description: Everything was beyond amazing . Miami heat crepe Belgium waffle French toast the sunrise burrito ! Everything was amazing and delicious . Very busy but very fast seating . If you are around the area it's a must try ! Loved it
author: Sandra G.

description:
Amazing food. Best breakfast in the Bay Area. Affordable, awesome music and the service model is fantastic. The line is always moving and the employees really enjoy what they're doing. 

If you're in or around Union Square, Do. Not. Miss. This.
author: Ethan A.

description: YYUUUMMM!!! I ordered the eggs Benedict and they were so yummy! I usually don't order eggs Benedict when I go out because the sauce is so hard to make especially in every day restaurants. This place was really good and the presentation made it taste as good as it looks. (If that makes sense lol) it's a great place for kids! My daughter had a bagel with cream cheese and she accidentally dropped it all on the floor--when we told them what happened they happily and quickly gave her another one at no extra charge or hassle. My boyfriend had the chorizo scramble, the only complaint he had was that it was a very small portion-which I do have to agree with. There was not a lot of chorizo and egg. The orange juice was also over priced, more that $3 a glass which isn't ideal.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Meh. 

Other reviews compare to Crepevine, and though I notice the obvious similarities... Crepevine is much better (for example HH mimosas are muuuuuuch smaller and they don't offer gluten free crepes). Wouldn't recommend or go back.
author: Ashley F.

description:
Ambiance: LOVE the cute country Italian decor and ABBA music playing in the background. I think it's great that you line up to order at the cash register and find your own seat. I think most casual dining places should do that. Good for dates and probably good for groups too since they have so many tables and you seat yourself. 

Ordered:
**Prices are decent. You don't get as much as Denny's, but the quality is better. 
1. Fresh Strawberries w/Nutella crepe w/ice cream- Perhaps it was because I let it sit for 10 minutes that the sides of the crepe started to harden, but the rest of the crepe was delicious. 
2. Ham/Cheese/Egg Croissant w/fruit- Solid. 

I would come back here if I ever wanted breakfast/brunch in the Union Square area.
author: Grace C.

description: Great place for breakfast.  Awesome breakfast combinations.  I love the crepes, the pancakes and waffles.  So good!  It can get crowded during the breakfast rush, but tables and chairs will open soon.  A must try!
author: Rhonald N.

description:
Have eaten here everyday for breakfast while here in SF for a conference.  The service is a little slow at times but if you can get there before 8 there is usually no one is there.  Tried something different everyday and everyday I am happy with my choice. 
Favorite so far is the eggs Benedict. 


Great atmosphere and friendly staff
author: Anthony R.

description:
Great spot! Little to no wait on a Saturday morning!

I ordered the Belgian waffle and the salmon Benedict.  Very good, but very little salmon on it.  

Great coffee and they have the large bottles of orangina. 

If you don't feel like waiting in line at Dottie's, walk over here!
author: Joshua K.

description: How have I never come in this place? I must have seen it a hundred times but never ventured inside. With the move of the Commonwealth Club to its new digs on Post Street, this has become my spot on program nights. Also useful pre-ACT - decent food in a comfortable setting. They have an extensive menu that is almost overwhelming, but everything I have ordered has been great.
author: Robert M.

description: Amazing food!  Great service!  The server went out of his way to save us a seat while things were busy and tables limited.
author: Wendy G.

description: Got lucky, walked in 5th in line, but there was a long line waiting before I was served. Early breakfast is hard to find in San Francisco (not that I consider 8a early!) My crepe was tasty and I don't think the wait was unreasonable for a custom, freshly prepared plate.  Recommended, would visit again.
author: Jaime F.

description: Dirty tables and poor customer service. Went in here around 9 on a Thursday. About half the tables were taken and the other half hadn't been bussed since the last patrons left. Luckily I was able to find ONE clean table while my boyfriend ordered. And if he hadn't already walked away when I realized the table situation, we probably wouldn't have eaten here. He said the guy behind the counter was on the phone while taking my boyfriend's order and then even walked away in the middle of it! At least the food was tasty.
author: Jana P.

description: Very quaint.  Like home cooking.  Small place with not too many seat but worth the headache.
author: T I M O L.

description:
Came here twice while vacationing in the city. The first time, I got the baklava crepe, and my wife got the breakfast burrito. Both were good; the burrito was a little heavy. But they have fresh squeezed orange juice, and the chai was good. The second time, I got the belgian waffle, and my wife got the Miami Heat crepe. The waffle was topped with fresh fruit, and the crepe was very good.

My only complaint is that I'm never a fan of the "get in line, and seat yourself" setup. People don't seem to get that you seat yourself after you get a number. Some folks take a table while someone waits in line for them, which really gums up the flow of things. It's not really the restaurants fault, and they DO try to consolidate tables so that there is room for larger groups. 

All qualms with people aside, the food is good, and the line moves quickly.
author: Don M.

description: I was in SF for thanksgiving week. Stayed at the Hilton on union square, so this place was perfect to walk to. It sits right on the corner and is not a very big place, but big enough to not feel like you sitting on top of your neighbor. I ordered the crab cake florentine and my friend had the pancakes and a side of bacon. The crab cakes were delicious and the eggs cooked perfect. The pancakes were light and fluffy. Food came out hot and quick not long after I placed the order and sat down. Good portion sizes to leave you full, but not stuffed. Also, you cant beat a delicious breakfast for 2 people in the city for $23 bucks. I ate here multiple times and every time was the same great service and delicious food.
author: Tesha R.

description: I love this place!! Its busy on the weekends but the line moves fast. In addition to delicious crepes they have great lunch food such as, the veggie burger.
author: Heather I.

description:
Pros:
FOOD - what the heck more can I say? Big portions, yummy pecan pancakes (HOLY F THOSE WERE GOOD!), amazing crepes. I was so full after breakfast.

My boyfriend had the pesto chicken crepe - he finished the whole thing and I didn't get to try any *sad face*
My best friend and her boyfriend got the eggs Benedict, blintz crepe, and the strawberry Nutella crepe. SO. GOOD.
I had the eggs florentine with the potatoes and the pecan pancakes. It's making my mouth water just thinking about it. Super filling. The potatoes were cooked just right.
Freshly squeezed orange juice? LOVE.

Cons: 
NONE. But it's just crowded. Lol
author: Mai C.

description:
Advisory: do not turn around at the sight of the line weaving out the door and possibly around the corner. Yes, this can be discouraging at first, but the end result of your wait will be completely worth the potential frustration incurred by impatience. This place defies logic. You would think that with so many people eating there, you would never get a table. Yet, somehow the stars align perfectly so that right when you order, a table opens up. We began our wait right at the door, and ordered about 25 minutes later. The wait goes by quickly and they have refreshing, citrus-infused water for you to drink in line. 

The menu itself requires the time spent waiting in line just to make up your mind which you will likely change a good five or six times and possibly once more when you finally go to order. Sweet crepes, savory crepes, sandwiches, salads, soups, eggs, waffles and much more comprise a series of blackboards along a wall as you enter. There are somehow more choices on a whiteboard by the register as well, in case the thousands of blackboard options weren't enough for the indecisive patron. 

We ordered the tofu scramble which came with toast and potatoes but I asked for fruit instead of potatoes and they obliged my request, and the crab cake florentine with coffee. The crab was fresh and flavorful and I wish I had asked what they used to season the tofu because it was truly mouthwatering and tofu seldom is.
author: Marisa M.

description:
We waited in line with my husband and parents on a very cold morning for 30+ minutes to eat at Honey Honey for the first time. It definitely did not disappoint. The four of us ordered the belgian waffle, smoked salmon benedict, regualr eggs benedict, and lemon crepe.

All super delicious. Definitely recommend for a really yummy breakfast. Just be prepared for a long line on the weekends.
author: Alexandra P.

description: Walked in to a long line that moved quickly. You place your order, get a number, and wait for your food to be delivered. The menu is extensive, I was overwhelemed by the myriad options but wound up ordering a breakfast crepe. Which one specifically I can't recall but it was delicious, and it came with potatoes. My friend also ordered a breakfast crepe, we both devoured our food and were totally stuffed. I'd return during next trip to SF!
author: Melay D.

description:
Eggs were completely overcooked, fruit
Was brown, and coffee was made with skim Instead of cream. I wouldn't recommended, but the others I dined with enjoyed their food. Maybe it's better for crepes, eggs are definitely not their specialty.
author: Lauren K.

description: Beware. The fresh squeezed orange juice is a delight, but I had the absolute worst eggs florentine here. First they came out overcooked, so I asked them to make them. Then they came out like this. At this point I was so hungry I kind of picked at them anyway, but I kind of wish I hadn't.
author: Natalie K.

description: Go early on a Saturday because this place gets busy!! The menu is very extensive and there are so many yummy options. We had the breakfast crepe and the Nutella banana crepe. Both amazing. You must try their coffee drinks, cafe mocha and cappuccino were amazing. Will definitely go back!
author: Melissa B.

description: Belgian waffle was excellent! Loved the place and the music. Even though it was crowded, we managed to get a table. Will definitely come back.
author: Reem O.

description: Best crepe I've had in years.  Chicken pesto fresh ingredients, perfectly cooked.  Hubby's Greek salad ok , but not outstanding. Saw a strawberry dessert crepe go by. It looked amazing! Darn it... Wish I could eat desserts at every meal!
author: Lindi L.

description:
My review is based on the breakfast menu, of which we had the crab cake benedict, french toast with a side of eggs and a fruit cup. The crab cake benedict was quite dry and the crab cakes weren't particularly tasty. Kudos for the load of spinach but the poached eggs were overcooked. the fried potatoes were decent but again, nothing mind blowing. 

I think the crepes are one's best bet. If you have to wait at least half an hour like we did, I'd suggest avoiding the breakfast foods and stick with the mainstay crepes.
author: Clara L.

description:
I stopped in for a quick salad to go on my way back to my hotel- but the crepes smelled and looked AMAZING! I'll defiantly make it a point to go back and get a crepe there on my next SF trip!

I had the chicken salad for dinner and it was a very healthy portion, the chicken was DELICIOUS and they slipped in two slices of warm sourdough bread with it! It tasted delicious!
author: Kate N.

description:
very stupidly long line,
ordered chorizo scramble, tasted quite good
author: Harry R.

description: Had a delicious Sunday brunch here. Yes, there was a long line out the door. But it moved quickly, the service was excellent, and the food was excellent as well. Crepes, eggs, coffee, Bloody Mary. Loved our brunch and will return the next time in SF.
author: Delilah B.

description: so so so GOOD! If squat and Gobble had a baby with the crepe house !!! That is what Honey Honey is like! I highly recommend it! The line is worth it, your plate comes quickly once u order!
author: Misty R.

description: Excellent!  Eggs Benifits were good and the potatoes were fantastic.  My wife had the Lox Bagel that she thoroughly enjoyed and the Natella Stawberry crep was out of this world.
author: Mark B.

description:
Great food! I really like the Salmon Benedict and hot chocolate but I really want to out the other items on the menu. I come here for my lunch breaks sometimes and it's a really nice place to sit and eat. 

The only reason why I gave 4 stars is because of the wait. I called in for my order and they told me it would be ready in 10 minutes. When I arrived it seemed as if they forgot my order and I ended up getting my food 30 minutes later. FOR A BAGEL AND CREAM CHEESE! ok I understand they were busy with orders but really? 

Other than that it's a really good place for breakfast and lunch spot. I do come back but I try to order when there isn't a rush :)
author: Mariah T.

description:
A good breakfast at a good price. 

Freshly squeezed OJ which is always a good start.

Coffees OK, but in saying that we haven't really had a great coffee in the US yet, not the kick we are use to anyway. Don't know if they do double shots here?

Decor a bit tired, but clean. 

Good choice on the menu front.
author: Richard E.

description:
Nothing mind blowing. Its a run of the mill breakfast crepe place. 

They're fast and nice with taking orders and the food is solid. Good option for breakfast by Union Square that isn't a money suck. They have specials outside of the main menu which can be a bit enticing, too.
author: Jay H.

description:
My second visit at this little place. Service is fast, humble, friendly end efficiently. I had the two two two with a side of Apple Beef Sausage, really good. Food came fast and waitress was friendly. 

Would definitely come back :-)
author: Martin N.

description:
I'm being generous with four stars because I didn't want it to seem as though I disliked Honey Honey. It's another one of those places with a ton of egg and crêpe options beautifully chalked up on an immense chalkboard for you to peruse while you wait in line to order. And if somehow you don't want one of those options, you can custom create your own: For instance, an egg white omelette with spinach and mushrooms, no cheese. Your meal comes with a great deal of food and isn't cheap but doesn't cost a huge amount of money.

The food is fine but no big deal, and the same can basically be said for the restaurant itself. I'd go back if I needed breakfast in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't actively seek it out or rave about it.
author: Ann D.

description:
It's kind of fun getting lost in SF, not when you forgot to look up the directions on where a place is, or what street to go on.

Walking in, and seeing my party, I took a quick glance at the menu and was confused for a moment, wondering "why am I having a random deja vu when I don't even know San Francisco THAT well?" My confused look got translated into "I don't know what to order" and my friend directed my attention at the whiteboard behind me, saying that I can order off that too. Decided on a sweet lemon crepe, despite the fact that I was here for a brunch, not a sweet pitstop.

I find out later from my friend's boyfriend that these crepe places are a massive chain all over NorCal, one being in Berkeley, another being in Palo Alto, and Crepevine, the weird deja-vu feeling I got. He explained that even though they all had different shopfront names and different names for the crepes, it's basically the same stuff, just a few tweaks here and there, to fit the surrounding of the store.

The lemon crepe wasn't a bad choice, a little on the sour side (but what to except from a lemon crepe) with a pol of extra lemon marmalade and a small ramekin of vanilla ice cream. Not bad for a crepe that's pretty simple, but wished there was something else along with the crepe, maybe extra ice cream?

Now, I'm kind of curious to find the other crepe shops and figure out what's the deal with them all.
author: Tom T.

description: Outstanding!  I had the crab cake florentine and it was delicious.  Fresh ingredients cooked to perfection.  Great selection of dishes.  I will be back!
author: Terence H.

description: This restaurant was advertised as a restaurant with vegan options on Yelp.  They had a tofu scramble which included eggs so I figured  they knew how to do a tofu scramble. Apparently not because I asked them to substitute tofu scramble in one of their specials and it came out with large chunks of tofu. This was disappointing.  I think they only 1 vegan menu item plus a fruit cup.  I expected more
author: SD C.

description: A perfect place for breakfast! The line can be long, but it's definitely worth the wait. I had the Pesto Crepe, which has cheddar, feta, spinach, pine nuts, pesto, avocado, and I subbed sundried tomatoes for the regular tomatoes. It was supposed to have pine nuts, but they were no where to be found...maybe in the pesto? Regardless, it was completely delicious. Big chunks of avocado, lots of flavor from the feta and the pesto. I woud definitely recommend the sundried in place of regular tomatoes--gave it even more flavor. The savory crepes come with the choice of  salad, fruit, or potatoes on the side. I opted for potatoes, and it was totally the right choice. They were some of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had--cooked to perfection, with lots of browned crispy bits, and perfectly seasoned, heavy on the rosemary. With a glass of freshly squeezed carrot/orange juice, I was in breakfast heaven!
author: Dara M.

description:
Wasted potential.....

Great broad menu with a number of very interesting items.  However, it sort of felt that the crepe and plate were thrown together with little passion or interest from whoever was cooking this AM.  I had the Half Moon Bay and the cheese was not evenly spread throughout and the presentation of the fruit was sad (just thrown in a side cup).  Add to that the fact that there were a bunch of unbussed tables and number stands all around.
This place could be FABULOUS instead of very average with a little tweaking.
author: Matt G.

description:
Great crepes, great service! Would highly recommend, especially the pesto. 

We ordered and forgot part of our order... got in the back of the line to finish it. One of the staff  saw this happening, and walked over to take our order so we didn't have to wait. Great service!
author: Evan S.

description: Coffee still not up to standard. Ordering small cappuccino gives you a milky pint! Food still good for area
author: Robert F.

description: The food was bomb but I waited an access of 30 minutes just to order! My waiter was cool but they should have someone just taking orders not making coffee and doin other stuff. All in all the food was great I had a sweet sbk crepe that was skimp on the syrup and a half moon bay crepe that was the tits
author: Dolla T.

description: Best crab cake Benedict I've ever had and I have went to a lot of places. Potato is seasoned good also. They also have fresh squeezed oranges juice. Highly suggested as a go to place.
author: Patrick C.

description: If I could give 0 stars, I would. One of the worst dining experiences of my entire life. I ordered an omelette, two sunny side up eggs (which was given scrambled) and a caprice bagel. First off, our potatoes were actually cold. Not even a bit. Almost like it was last nights leftovers left outside all night. Our bagel was disgusting, I am being serious. I could not pass one bite. So then we decided to move onto the omelette because we were starving and just spent 35 dollars l. About two bites into my tasteless omelette, I noticed a price of hair. I moved it and then I noticed two more pieces of hair by the food. So then after I was utterly disgusted... I decided to inspecter gadget my food.. not only did I find more hair... but my friend eating the sunny side up (scrambled) eggs ALSO found 2-3 pieces of hair. Cold potatoes, hair, tasteless bagel. Utterly outraged. I never return food but this was just insane.... I took the food back and quietly told the lady about the hair given it was a packed house I didn't want to embarrass her. She then proceeds to give me attitude... which I didn't understand why when if you open the box you can clearly see the hair. She handed me 20 dollars from the 35 dollar meal as a refund didn't even say sorry or anything for that matter. I didn't want to argue or get into it so I did not complain about the 15 dollars. This experience was a horrible way to start my day. I suggest you think twice before eating here and if you do, check ur food for hair.
author: Tadeh P.

description:
Very good breakfast at a decent price. Not too trendy. Order at the counter, food is served to the table.

Good crepes, savory and sweet.

One thing I might suggest is to either dial back the music a bit, or add some sound dampening surfaces to the room so people can have a conversation during their meal.
author: Stiv A.

description:
Always my breakfast place in San Francisco. The wait in line is worth it. Great food and service. House coffee is great and the specialty coffees are better. 

Always something special and made with fresh ingredients. Free wifi.
author: Jim U.

description: Went here to grab a late breakfast. Got the chorizo scramble (too spicy!) and a pancake. When I ordered they don't allow for any substitutions, so that wasn't great. The lady who took my order wasn't very friendly. My guess is she forgot about my pancake because it wasn't delivered with my scramble. The guy who ran my food ordered me one, and it was worth the wait!! Best part of my meal. Delicious soft pancake with syrup. If was the size of a dinner plate. The coffee was just ok. The atmosphere is kind of dirty and old looking. I think the menu could be sized down considerably, the place cleaned up, and it could be a hit.
author: Jskilicious S.

description:
Union Square has lots of tourists. This means two things for restaurants: high prices, and few repeat customers. When restaurants don't expect repeat business, there is little incentive to provide good food. Luckily, Honey Honey bucks the trend with tasty crepes prepared fresh. They have lots of sweet and savory crepes, along with egg dishes, soups, salads, sandwiches, burgers, etc. Nothing too adventurous, but it'll fill you up without busting your wallet.

When it comes to cheap, fast, easy food near Union Square, Honey Honey is a fine option. They're open early til late, and have a good menu of choices for hungry tourists and locals alike.
author: Aaron M.

description: We are staying in a hotel close by on vacation from England and have been to the place a few times. Always good food and service and would recommend
author: Steven R.

description:
Thanks to Yelpers, I stumbled here one afternoon after checking out of my hotel in the hopes of finding a good crepe.  I walked in and it was not at all what I thought it would be.  Expecting a cute, quaint spot for brunch, the ambiance caught me by surprise.  First, I could barely tell where it was (granted, I was a tourist); it wasn't labeled all too well.  The interior was interesting.  The walls were handpainted, almost in a Mediterranean style, but from the early 90s.  Instead of wait service, you must find your way to the cash register (if you can make it past the expansive menu...I probably stared at it for 5 minutes) to order.  No problem, I'll take it.  I'm here for the food after all.

I ordered the SBK crepe, a crepe filled with strawberries, bananas, kiwi, cinnamon, and brown sugar served with a side of whipped cream and a side of potatoes (I can never resist).  I also ordered a chai latte.  Bad news first.  The chai was not chai enough.  Too much milk, but not terrible.

Now, the good news.  The SBK crepe was as delicious as the description sounds.  It was aromatic, incredibly fresh, and somehow, not too sweet.  The cinnamon and brown sugar were not at all overpowering; instead, it allowed the sugar and the flavors of the fruit to shine.  The crepe was light, but still fulfilling.  The potatoes were homefries, but very good homefries.  While I did have to add a little salt, the herbs accompanying the potatoes were delicious.  The parts of the potato skin that were a little burnt, were just burnt enough.  Mm.  I love me some good potatoes.

All in all, despite the confusion at the onset of my trip, this was a lowkey place for brunch that I would definitely visit again.  As opposed to the fancy brunch places, one wouldn't feel embarrassed to sit at a table by themselves with a book.  In fact, it was rather comforting.  

Also, did I mention they had free wi-fi?  Check the phone number on the receipt.  That's the key code.
author: Nikki Y.

description: We decided to check this place out due to its great rating. It was everything I thought it was going to be. Great and unique food, cozy atmosphere, fast service and clean bathrooms. I had Torino crepe which was light and more of the healthy option. It was delish and satisfying for breakfast. Can't wait to go back and try something else. Great tea and coffee selections as well.
author: Tammy N.

description: Great breakfast spot. I think I just had the best pancakes of my life. The music is relaxing, and we got here early before any crowds. A little pricey-almost thirty bucks for two pancake, egg and bacon breakfast, but it was incredibly delicious!
author: Samantha M.

description: Had the 2, 2, and 2. Pancakes were slightly burnt and generic tasting. Eggs were nothing to write home about, and when I asked for bacon well done, it came out rubbery. Not sure what the fuss is over this place.
author: Joe S.

description:
I went there on a gloomy Sunday morning with one of my friends for a nice breakfast. The place was packed and top 40 music was playing in the background. By the time we sat down the music got increasingly louder and it seemed that someone most have changed the playlist to house music, my worst nightmare. I think  that there is a time and a place for that type of music and early in the morning at a breakfast establishment isn't one of them. I felt as if I was in a nightclub. Had I been hungover the music would have made me feel ill. Unfortunately, since the music was so annoying I wasn't able to really enjoy my meal and it made me want to leave ASAP. 

The food was decent. I ordered an omelette, which I felt was adequate but not memorable. I won't be returning there to eat, but I wouldn't strongly discourage people from going there -- as long as they plan to get their order to go. 

I wanted to mention that there was only one employee bringing  everyone their meals and cleaning up tables. He had a smile on his face the entire time while he was working. I was really impressed by that. However, they should definitely hire another person to help him out.
author: Abena O.

description: My husband and I love crepes but there aren't many places to get them in New Orleans. After looking on Yelp for a good breakfast spot we had to try Honey Honey.  OMG!!!! The crepes are delicious. My husband ordered the crepe Suzanne and I had the half moon bay. They were both amazing. The crab cake was one of the best I've eaten and I'm from New Orleans-where we know a thing or two about crab cakes. The service was excellent. Be prepared for about a 35 minute wait but it was really worth it. Will definitely be eating here again!
author: Keisa A.

description: This place was absolutely fantastic. We stayed up here in San Francisio for New Years, and it was one of the few places open on New Years Day. I was a little wary when we walked in due to the line streaming out the door, but suprisingly, the place was quick and efficiient, and just as someone was sitting down, another was getting up, leaving room for the next person to sit down and enjoy their breakfast. i got the caprese omelette with bacon added (which unfortunaely was an additonal $3), but the flavor was great. It came with a side of homefries, which in my opinion, were to die for. The atmosphere was excellent and very quaint. The staff were also up to par, making sure tables were cleared off and everything was ready for the next person. With the amount of business this place has, efficiency is a must, and I would have to say the staff have that one down.
author: Natasha F.

description:
My boyfriend and I were visiting out of town and the title of this place (and prior yelp reviews) made us want to try it. What better way then to spend a Saturday night with a sweet tooth. We walk in and immediately there's like 2 tables that are clean and not dirty with plates or trash. They were busy which, to me, made me want to try it even more. (I'd be worried if no one was there) we are greeted by the lady working the cash register telling us they are "ONLY ACCEPTING TO GO ORDERS BECAUSE THERES ONLY 1 COOK" wait why? It's 9:30 you guys close at 10. As we sit down to wait for our crepe we see three guys in the back (2 of them which are just kinda talking not working) when the lady brings us our crepe in a Togo bag she set it down on the table without saying a word to us. We are our crepe that ended up being super burnt and over done with cinnamon...... NO BROWN SUGAR. The only good part about the crepe was the ice cream it came with. We were out by 9:50.... yea we are our crepe there. I'm a manager at a restaurant and it's super unacceptable in my opinion (and completely unprofessional) to close your store before posted hours.. and turn away customers while your technically still open. I'm hoping someone just called off at the last minute and one person wasn't responsible for the whole front because let's be honest that wasn't fair to her. I give this two stars because aside from the lack of customer service from the girl, she was busting her ass to clean the lobby. The manager or owner should schedule at least three ppl since you're located in union square and I'm sure a ton of tourists like us.


EDIT: I just received a message from "Veronika K." The waitress that was there. She said "I was fired for our review. I wish you very worst in life". That's terrible. If this is true, that's horrible bc it wasn't her fault the scheduling was terrible. Whatever lol.
author: Brooke J.

description: Quick n' tasty should be the motto of this busy breakfast and lunch cafe. Nice people and nice service serving eggs, sandwiches, crepes, and more.  The only thing missing is more turkey in the turkey sandwich
author: Jeff G.

description: Based on Yelp reviews, we decided to try this place out, as I am a huge breakfast and crepe fan. Its a 5 minute walk from Union Square. We got there around 8am to beat the weekend rush. We irdered within 10 minutes. The other reviews were consistent in saying it takes awhile to get the food. Only about half the seats were full and it took 15 minutes for the food to arrive. Worth the wait though. We both had the Breakfast Crepe with bacon and potatoes. Perfectly cooked and flavored. The fresh-squeezed orange juice was delicious.
author: Danielle S.

description: Food was delicious and hot! Would definitely go there again. Only down side, they need to keep up with wiping down the tables. It gets a little messy, since they are super busy.
author: Pia V.

description: I like this place but I think I had the wrong item because this menu is huge! I think the creeps are probably a better choice. I had the smoked salmon Benedict which was average nothing special. It's a large portion and I picked at it. The chai is delicious I was surprised! Good location near union square.
author: Priya S.

description: Good place for breakfast/brunch. I was visiting San Fran and found this place on yelp. Loved the North beach crepe. Coffee was good too. Lot of options to choose from the menu. Overall - Good place and great food!!
author: Gurinder S.

description: A nice cozy breakfast spot close to Union Square. It does get a bit crowded in the morning, but tables are rotating quit frequently. I ordered the Salmon Benedict and that bad boy hit the spot. The smokey charred flavor salmon with the creamy hollandaise topped eggs and a side of fresh squeezed OJ, you can't go wrong.
author: Imran A.

description:
Great brunch place with a very different menu! Everything looks unique and appetizing which made it super hard to decide. 

We finally decided on their specials: dulce de leche crepe and Santa Fe eggs with side of potatoes. The crepe was DELISH! Definitely a dish you need to eat with something savory because it is super sweet. The roasted walnuts on top were a great addition to the dish. The Santa Fe eggs had onions, jalapeños, salsa and cheese over fried tortilla strips! The potatoes were smokey and one of my favorite things on the menu!

I highly recommend this place for vegetarians! Many items to choose from!
author: Vrati D.

description:
I was recently in San Fran staying near Union Square when my BF discovered Honey Honey on yelp. We decided that since there wasn't any better reasonably priced options around the neighborhood, we would give Honey Honey a try. 

The line for this place was practically out the door. That line is super deceptive though. You think that you will never get a table when you place your order, but in actuality you most certainly will. I believe that they are slow to take orders so that they can allow time for people to finish their food and open up tables for those who may have just ordered. I'm sticking to my theory because it makes good sense. Also, the long line makes people interested to come in and check out the place, which is what we did.

I have had both their buttermilk pancakes and their Belgian waffle with fruit. Both menu items were good. If I had to choose one over the other, I'd probably go with the pancakes, only because the waffles were a bit too soft and not crunchy enough. However, the strawberries and banana slices on the waffle were great. I also ordered a side of breakfast potatoes the first time I came here, as I almost always do when eating out for breakfast. I must say those potatoes had a little kick to them that made them delicious. 

I wasn't really a fan of their water options. They add some fruits to their water to make it taste more unique, but it's not my thing. I prefer ice cold regular water. Is that too much to ask for? 

Overall, I recommend coming here for breakfast/brunch. The prices are reasonable and they are super close to many of the hotels in Union Square.
author: Mona H.

description:
This place was ok. I ordered the Crabs benedict. It wasn't horrible, but I wasn't falling over in awe either. The set up is cute. The place was busy, but the service was relatively quick. The prices were to be expected. The menu is like squat and gobble.....actually they are almost exact, down to the writing style of the menu. 

I was surprised at how good the coffee was though. And this morning I really did need a good cup of coffee to keep me going through the day. I'm sure if I had one of the crepes they would be good and my rating might be a bit higher, but based off what I had for breakfast, this is what I have to give.

I'd say I'll be back but this place is amongst so many other little places that I'm dying to try. I guess time will just have to tell.
author: Krystal T.

description:
Can't rate the food. There was a roach (or similar) in my coffee so I didn't stick around long enough to try it.

I'd find somewhere else to eat...
author: Russell P.

description: I was in San Francisco for a wedding and wanted to go to breakfast. My niece who lives in California went to her Yelp app and found this place. The reviews were very good so we decided to go. When we arrive the line was outside the door, we looked at each other and said "this is a good sign". We waited and ordered I had the scramble chorizo and pancakes, my niece had the crepe egg omelette cheese and ham. It was fantastic. It was worth the wait!
author: Wanda D.

description: This place resembled Crepevine and Whispers, if you liked either you'll love Honey Honey.  First timers on a rainy day and I was satisfied with the service as well as the food.  It was quite busy when we arrived but one of the employees assured us he would find us a table and that he did! I ordered the waffles with mixed berries and it hit the spot especially on this rainy day, warm and sweet. Within walking distance of where we were and the type of food we were craving!
author: Crystal A.

description:
Great service and great food! The portions are just perfect and they have a large variety of food to choose from! They have vegetarian options as well, which is awesome. I got the spaghetti and was very pleased! 

Would totally come back again :)
author: Debbie W.

description:
Great breakfast/brunch/lunch place if you're in the Union Square area and want something a little less touristy. I had a breakfast crepe with a side of fruit, while my friend ordered their salsa crepe with potatoes. Their potatoes are wonderfully seasoned, really tasty! My crepe was great as well, I was pretty full at the end.

They has LOTS of options written on their chalkboard, so if you are indecisive like me, make sure to look at the menu beforehand! Also, behind the cashier counter is this really old fashioned but cool looking orange juicer. Must try next time!

Cons: The buy at the cashier was not very pleasant...bad day maybe?
author: Bonnie S.

description:
What I most appreciate about Honey Honey is that whenever I've come here, I've never had to wait too long. That's not to say that this place isn't popular! It's just large enough to be able to host a good number of patrons at once. As with all brunch places in sf, they do not take reservations. 

Their menu is very broad. A savory crape will cost you about $10- so it's not too expensive. They serve great cappuccinos and fresh squeezes orange juice. It's not gourmet, but the food is definitely delicious. I think the only downside is that they don't offer hashbrowns as a side .
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
First it's super hot in here. I'm not a very hot person normally so it's not great news to be sweating while eating breakfast. This place has a good bathroom which was important to me this morning. Long line to order but lots to chose from off the board. 

Food was just ok. My kid got the two eggs. She's 17 and said it was "just eggs and potatoes and toast". Nothing special. I had the 2-2-2. Two eggs, two pancakes, and one sausage patty that maybe was supposed to be two sausages. It was very average. Tomorrow we will try for something better. 

It looks like Crepeville locations in Sac. Wonder if the same folks own all these locations or of they copy off each other.
author: Steven H.

description:
I walk in and they must have just gotten through a rush because there are a bunch of tables with food and plates still on them.  I proceed to ask the bus boy where to sit and if I seat myself, he said no...you order up front. 

I am the only person in line waiting for the woman at the register to take my order...she was chatting with another worker. I figured not a big deal, they are chatting because this is the first chance they got (assuming they were busy earlier). She takes my order hands me a number and a cup of coffee, I asked for cream and sugar and she just points over to a counter where you're supposed to help yourself. Why couldn't she have just told me?

The bus boy brings out my food, chorizo scramble and it's delicious!! The chorizo is spicy and the potatoes are fresh and homemade, not store bought. The only complaint I do have about the food is my English muffin was cold when they brought it out. I asked for water and he proceeds to tell me "you grab it yourself"

I'm sorry, but what is the purpose of us tipping if they do nothing, but bring the food? I rather would have grabbed the food myself since I had to do everything else!  This would have been a 1-star review if not for the amazing food. THE COOKS DERSERVE ALL THE TIPS AND MOST LIKELY A RAISE! No one would put up with such poor service if the food wasn't impeccable!
author: Sean R.

description: The food here is so goooooood! I got the veggie burger, and it's really hard to find a really good vegetarian burger. My boyfriend got the grilled chicken sandwich and he loved it more than he loves me. I also has hot chocolate and it was a little too rich for my taste but still so delicious that i finished it. The environment is cute and the service was great! I will definitely be coming back again :)
author: Lucy A.

description: I had the chicken and pesto crepe and it was delicious! A ton of options beyond crepes as well. Definitely recommend for a quick, casual bite to eat.
author: Colby O.

description: My wife and I went during Labor Day weekend and waited for about 45 minutes to order our food. We ordered the post-street omelette and the Banana-Nutella crepe. The food was somewhat expensive and in my opinion it was not worth the price. Although the portions are decently sized, the quality and flavor of the food was not up to par. I wish they would have put more ham in the omelette and have seasoned it better. I had to douse salt and ketchup on it just to taste it.
author: Brian N.

description: My boyfriend and I went to San Francisco for the weekend. The door man at the WarWick Hotel recommended Honey Honey. The line was really long but it moved fairly fast. We ordered the breakfast crepe and the strawberry kiwi crepe. They were great!!! They brought out the food in a reasonable time considering how busy they were. We would definitely be going there again!!!
author: Marissa G.

description: My first time to Honey Honey, but will NOT be my last. SBK (strawberry, banana, kiwi) crepe was perfect. Fresh squeezed OK, from a bad ass splitter and juicing machine, comes in a generous serving. Service, great. Sit outside of there's an open seat!
author: Doug W.

description:
My daughter and I finished our tour of Alcatraz and was looking for a place to eat near our hotel. Our lyft driver suggested Honey Honey after we explained what we were looking for. It was EXACTLY what we wanted! I ordered the "Union Square" burger medium well...it was done to perfection, which is rare (catch the pun?). I also asked that the onions be sauteed, rather than raw...no problemo! The curly fries that came with, were nice and crunchy, just the way I like them.
My daughter ordered the chicken pesto crepe...muy delicioso! Every bite complimented the next, including the fresh salad that came with it.
I ordered a latte to go. It was a very happy two block walk back to our hotel...hot, yummy latte in hand!
author: Lisa V.

description: This is the place to be for an early Sunday morning for breakfast. A simple scramble eggs, toast, homefries, and juice. People are friendly and the price is right.
author: Victor J.

description: Pleasant tourist surprise!  Seemed local, looked busy, very diverse and exciting menu.  Reasonable prices and VERY good portions - you will not be disappointed!  But be willing to share a savory crepe to save room for a dessert version.  We were stuffed but loved it!  A must do!
author: Naji S.

description: Really good place! Amazing pancakes and salmon Benedict was awesome. If coming on a Saturday be sure to arrive early. Mimosas are bomb too.  Great service, great food. 5 star here.
author: Terri E.

description: I had brunch at Honey Honey on a Sunday and arrived at about 10:45am.  We waited in line for 10-15 minutes which was good because we needed the time to decide on our order. I went for the Salsa Crepe and the Apple Cinnamon Crepe.  We were worried about finding seating because the line was so long but didn't have a problem. The savory crepe tasted OK but the apples in the sweet crepe were still a bit crunchy...not what I was expecting. Overall, the experience was decent but I've had better brunch in SF. The best part might have been the fresh squeezed OJ.
author: Hannah C. R.

description: 12:30 pm on Pride parade day and the line was to the door.  But we were hungry for some good food and stayed.  20 min in line, but after sitting down and expecting another 20-30 min for the food - BOOM! Food out in about 5 min.  EXCELLENT - we had huevos rancheros and Crab cake florentine (Eggs benedict with crab cake instead of ham, and with spinach).  Baklava crepe a little heavy on the walnuts and not enough of the sauce.  But very tasty.  And the price?  For Union Square?  $35 before tip - for 2 huge entrees, 1 large dessert crepe and iced tea. Wow.  My friend was stuffed but I saved half my dish and half the dessert for a little later (yes, I do that).  Definitely coming back.
author: C.M. C.

description:
5 stars for the crepes, YUM!

Had french toast and it was just okay, maybe that is because I took a few bites of the delicious crepe first though-haha.

This place is a MUST if you're in San Fran and a crepe lover.

Strawberry, nutella, cinnamon, and brown sugar is the greatest combo.
author: Megan E.

description:
I love the extensive menu at this place, and everything I've tried thus far has been tasty. I've tried the sweet and savory dishes, and both are great; my favorites have been the bagel sandwiches as well as the crepes. Their specials menu is also pretty fun, and there's usually always a great sweet pancake dish on that menu that I crave. 

The restaurant is pretty noisy and it gets really packed (you usually have to wait in a line to order, and then wait a bit to find a seat) but it does move. Would probably be back because it's so conveniently located near Union Square and does have some tasty dishes!
author: Roopa S.

description: This is a cute little corner cafe. I went because I used to work in the building when it was a car rental shop back in the '90s. I had the North Beach crepe; chicken, spinach, swiss cheese with holindase (sp?). Crepes come with a choice of salad, fries or fruit, and maybe something else; I forget. The portion was just right and everything was delicious.
author: Melissa P.

description: This restaurant has rave reviews...very cute place.   A place you can sit down comfortably and eat.  Now the food on the other hand was good but not so great.  I ordered the crab cakes florentine, and my husband mention they were very smelly and I should not eat them. He ordered the eggs Benedict and they just were not done well.  But we also ordered their Belgium waffles with fresh strawberries and bananas. They were delicious!  My husband ordered the chocolate waffle and he loved it!!  So overall this place earned 3 stars.
author: Yesenia L.

description: My boyfriend and I were staying at Kensington Park Hotel, I yelped a nearby breakfast spot and found this amazing place. There was a line but it didn't take too long. The only thing I didn't like was that there was a mildew smell when you walked in but once we walked all the way in it seemed to not be present. The food was amazing. Can't wait to come back
author: Sylvia J.

description:
This place doesn't look like much on the outside and I would even go so far as to say a lot of tourists from other countries come here.  Probably because their diverse menu appeals to a lot of different people.  This is a great place to stop in for any meal.  Breakfast, lunch, dinner and even a quick snack.  They have free wi-fi so grab some coffee and stay a while.

Their dishes are more than gourmet and offer huge portions.  I especially love their salads.  Really large portions, served with fresh bread.  Their club salad comes with a whole breast of seasoned chicken, avocado and at least 2 strips of bacon.  On a cheat day, I love to get their breakfast potatoes, extra crispy.  So delicious.  This is a great place to come for breakfast.  They offer waffles, pancakes, omelets.  Everything.  They have a wide selection of coffee, teas and baked goods.  I'm telling you, this place has EVERYTHING so it's a good place to bring a group so that everyone gets what they want.

Their crepes are even more delicious.  A decent sized crepe with lots of strawberries and nutella.  Mmmmmm!

Love going here for lunch.  It's a nice treat right in the middle of my day.  I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.
author: Victoria C.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

It was pretty filthy on a Sunday afternoon but the crepes were good and plentiful. Maybe no cleaning staff on weekends? Also, not the fastest of food.
author: Bob R.

description: Amazing food. Yeah, the wait was long but everyone was so helpful with getting us drinks while we waited and once we ordered the food came quickly. I wanted to try everything on the menu, it all looked so amazing!
author: Gabrielle L.

description: Great place for food and really nice atmosphere !!  There were 5 of us there on a quick family vacation.  It looked busy so we went in.  Line was long but did tno take too long to get through,  We found a table inside.  Food came quick and was very good.  Good value for money in San Fran .... which is sometimes considered a rare treat.
author: Hilton B.

description: Great spot. A bit noisy but thats how it is in the city. I got their french toast and sausages. It was pretty good! The staff are really friendly. Would definitely recommend the crepes!
author: Christian M.

description: Okay okay, so I really wanted to make this place a regular lunch joint since they have a pretty big menu. Nope. "Fresh Squeezed OJ and Carrot juice" *smile* Go up to the register to order and pay, dude gives me carrot juice from under the counter. Dude, use that barely touched machine behind you and grind me some real stuff. I'm paying for quality not some mystery carrot juice from Rumplestiltskin's batch. GOODBAH.
author: Lucy F.

description:
Great bang for the buck! Plenty of room to sit down. There is also room available outside. Order at the register and they bring you the grub, which makes it convenient if you are on-the-go! 

Had the strawberry and Nutella crepe! Delish!

The glasses they gave us appeared to be dirty or worn. Couldn't tell because they were covered in a mist - straight out of the refrigerator. We ended-up drinking the water straight out of the bottle.
author: Jason M.

description:
Beware. 

We just left this place very unsatisfied. 

We ordered a sunrise burrito for one meal and scrambled eggs with salmon for the next along with a coffee and water.

Everything, I mean everything we ordered was pure unsatisfactory.

To start off my scrambled eggs had green spots all over them, we brought it to the girl at the cashiers attention and stated it was the cilantro, excuse me cilantro does not grow on rotten eggs, MOLD does!!!! 

The burrito we ordered was served in a pool of beans, and that was just the worst un-eatable piece of I don't know want you could ever imagine. I have no idea how they could serve this to anyone, or even the bum dogs outside would refuse this. 

They scored a 92 on sanitary but truly believe it is time for another evaluation and inspection.

Even the coffee cup I was given was old and spotted all over.

The lady tried to say if we wanted to change food we had to pay extra... Once we showed how un happy we were and pointing at the mold on the eggs she offered anything we wanted. We simply refused to get poisoned by anything else and walked out. 

Beware beware beware.
author: Steve A.

description: DELICIOUS crepes and lots of options, yummy yummy potatoes!!! However, the service is deplorable. Everyone there seems to hate their job and everyone who enters. Also they make a really shitty cup of coffee. I was given the side eye a lot, and I am a super nice customer. Like, I know everyone says that but I am a gem
author: Stefanie G.

description:
The good: 
- variety of crepes on the board and when I finally decided what I wanted, I had to rethink my options because I saw ANOTHER board with daily specials. 
- big portions (we ended up taking about half of our meal home 
- cold ice water (I am a stickler for places that have lukewarm water in their pitchers. Nobody likes that, especially on a nice day outside) 
-even though it looked busy, we were able to find a seat easily when it was time to sit down. 

The bad: 
- the crab cake crepe I ordered was missing some crunch or crispiness that I usually find in my crab cakes from my favorite breakfast place. I am used to better crab cakes so I was disappointed. 
- poorly distributed cheese in the crepe: I eat my crepes from the point and make my way out so I ended up eating all the cheese in a couple bites, leaving the rest of my dish a little on the dry side. 
-Chicken pesto crepe was not memorable... so much so that I'm not even sure if that's what we had...

this or that:
-the line was to the door when we came in but it took about 10 minutes to get to the front of the line. Just enough time to sift through all the different crepe options and finally decide what I want. 
- the walls and decor could use a little refreshing. 

would I come back? 
-sure. but probably only to try their sweet crepes.
author: Elaine L.

description:
Excellent breakfast, great service by Mo and everyone else! We had the Miami Heat crepe, chicken burrito special and 2,2,2.

The crepe was filled with chicken breast, cheese and green onions then topped with hot sauce. The potatoes it came with were perfectly seasoned and cooked. It was a fantastic dish!

The chicken burrito had black beans, rice, huge chunks of chicken breast and avocado. Served with amazing tortilla chips and salsa.

The 2,2,2 was perfectly cooked scrambled eggs, fluffy pancakes and bacon. The perfect breakfast!

Can't beat this place!
author: Terri C.

description: It was my first time eating here, but won't be the last. I went there wanting breakfast food, but the menu had so many options, i couldn't resist and ended up with a fresh crab cake sandwich! The food was delicious, Affordable and huge variety! Will be back!
author: Mayra R.

description: Loved the atmosphere! Felt so refreshing! Large variety from breakfast to lunch to dessert! Music was awesome! Food came very quickly and the food tasted amazing!!
author: Luna S.

description:
This place was awsome quick service 
I tried the Belgian waffle the strawberry crepe and Milano omelet it was all delicious great place for brunch
author: Adrian M.

description: I live in Napa...and will take mass transit or drive..just for Honey Honey...YES! It is amazing....I get a savory crepe..SALSA love love love...and husband and I split the Dolce sweet crepe...so delicious. ..The staff are spot on and never had a bad experience here! Very consistent and wonderful
author: Rhonda U.

description:
Wanted to carb the eff out after a late night the previous night, so the only placed that sounded appetizing was this place.

I love that it's nestled on a corner of a busy street and provided for outside dining so you can enjoy the great 'Sco weather and people watch. I also love that there's an array of disshes to choose from on this cool chalkboard. 

When we arrived, the line was out the door and the resto was buzzin w/ patrons because that tells me one thing- FOODS GREEATTT! Well, during this day, the food was half great. I ordered their Crab Cake Florentine (even though Im allergic to shellfish, but I just love crabcakes!) and my risk for an allergic reaction was SO not worth it, and trust me there are a lot of restos in the Embarcadero that serve scrumptious crabcakes that I would gladly experience an allergic reaction for. It was dry, almost burnt, and seasoned to the point I had to drink several glasses of water to avoid the risk for hypertension.A couple of my friends ordered random dishes on the menu that were okay, not to go gaga over.

For dessert I had their Nutella Banana Crepe, but when you put Nutella and banana together, you really cant mess that up, so I have no gripes about it.

I dont certainly oppose coming back here, but I dont think it's worth the wait time.

But then again, it's just my opinion..
author: Christine M.

description: We literally stumbled into this place as I was trying to transfer hotels during my SF stay this past weekend.  What a great find!  I had their Pear Caramel tea which was delicious while my friends had their iced chai lattes and a few other yummy beverages.  My other friends ordered their strawberry crepe which was ridiculously scrumptuous.  They have indoor and outdoor seating which makes for great people watching.  Plus the staff was super friendly and attentive.
author: Jessica C.
