description: Ate breakfast here.  Maybe it was the items we ordered -  one of the crepes and an omelette... Both were very bland.  Not a lot of flavor.  Very flat.  Not a place where I would return.
author: Master P.

description: The line was relatively short and the food came quickly. I had the blintz, which was beautiful and delicious. Others in our group had strawberry Nutella crepes, breakfast crepes, French toast, and the 2-2-2 breakfast. Everything was delicious and fresh. It satisfied our whole family from kids to adults. Definitely recommend!
author: Kristine M.

description: Would actually prefer to give the 3.5 stars for being a selfie serve establishment. Very good breakfast. Potatoes are great. Croissant sandwich great. Fresh squeezed OJ great.
author: Natalie B.

description:
Was here with a my bro awhile back.  It was near our hotel.  The food itself was decent, standard breakfast food/dinner.  The situation was a little odd.  We walked in and I saw a crowd so I copped squat at one of the tables (that wasn't cleaned off or anything), but I think technically you're supposed to wait around for seating.

It was a Sunday morning, so it turned out to be a good thing that I didn't know the rules.  No sooner than we sat down than a ton of people showed up and the line was outside the door.

If I were in the area in the hotel again, I'd go back.  But, not sure I'd go out of my way to come back.    

If you go, you won't get food poisoning or feel ripped off, but you might be annoyed by the line and the wait.
author: Shaunita J.

description:
Amongst the many gems in San Francisco is this flawed rock. It is very loud and the waiters/ servers are not attentive at all. The food tastes like it was prepared by a 10 year old. 

Eggs- flat and heavy not fluffy
Toast- burned 
Potatoes- soggy 
Sausage- burned and salty 

There are so many great diners around union square, don't eat here.
author: Dario T.

description:
Plain chicken peso crepes and salad. Good freshly squeezed Orange Juice.  Also had the chorizo scramble which was pretty good,  right amount of favor and not too spicy.   
Oh and found a small hair in the chicken crepe.
author: Wai H.

description: Love this place. Phenomenal food, tons of choices, fantastic value. Will make a point to visit next time I'm in town. Ownership and servers know this is a hot spot, so don't expect anyone to bend over backwards for you.
author: Reggie G.

description: This eatery was right by my hotel, tried it and it was great! The line was ridiculously long, but it went along fairly quickly. I ordered ok the Eat24 app and by the time I got to the register, my food was ready! It was great! They have freshly squeezed orange juice! And the food was pretty awesome. We had a total of 6 people with us and had no complaints! If I ever come back to this city, I will definitely come back!
author: Addi V.

description: Excellent, speedy service and a friendly face at the counter. The crepes are amazing, I had the savory original with fruit and juice... Well done, folks. I'll be back!
author: Miss R.

description:
If you miss euro snobbery,  then please come here. The aloof service is so obvious it's funny. But this may be the expectation due to its location between hostels and hotels. 

The espresso is not bad. In addition, I ordered a savory crepe, that, as of writing this review, has yet to come...oh, here it is. Admittedly,  the crepe is good,  but I could do without the attitude. Save the time and effort and go to Squat and Gobble, or anywhere else in SF
author: Kelly S.

description: Absolutely the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Called in an order and asked specifically for no egg in the crepe. I get it home and there's egg in the crepe. I call and let the HORRIBLE manager (Ahmed) know that they screwed up the order and he said he would make another. I went back the restaurant with the recipes and he told me he didn't believe me and wanted to see the food. I went all the way home to get the meal and was told he would not refund me for the meal and wanted to keep what I had ordered! Seriously horrible customer service, have never been to a restaurant where they made a mistake and wouldn't make it right. will NEVER go there again.
author: Katie K.

description:
LOVE! So many choices! I ended up getting a crepe with ice cream ( yum!) AND a side of 2 eggs and English muffin! Best Breakfast ever?? 
It's possible....Definitely top 10.

Crepe was better than the last crepe I enjoyed on the French side of St. Martin! And that means it was good, in case you were wondering!

Love the variety-come hungry and leave happy!
author: Heather G.

description: The food was pretty good and there are tons of options for sweet and savory crêpes, sandwiches, omelettes etc, but the management is poor. I remember being here one morning, waiting in the typical long line for a while, then trying to find a table to seat and get served. There were 3 vacant tables, all of them dirty from previous patrons. There was only one girl serving and she was running like a mad woman. My food came before anyone came to collect the dishes and wipe the table. Please don't be cheap and increase the amount of servers during crazy mornings.
author: Eleana M.

description:
My friend and I each had a savory crepe, the Eden crepe and the Pesto crepe. The crepes come with a choice of a side. You get to choose between a salad, fruit cup, or homefries. The homefries were good, but a little dry. The fruit cup was fresh and nicely arranged. The crepes are more filling than they look. The fontina in my eden crepe melted nicely as did the gorgonzola in the pesto crepe. The apple cider was good too, with a nice big stick of cinnamon and remnants of powdered cinnamon spice at the bottom. It was just I needed on a rainy morning.

For a pretty big place and unlimited seating, this place feels crowded because of the tables are arranged closely. Still, I like the feel of this place because it's low-key and unpretentious. They make creative use of some of the support columns as seating too. Prices are fair.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
New Year's Day, slightly delicate after a really late night up of drinking and bringing in the new year from the night before, we hit up Honey Honey for breakfast at 9 am. The servers behind the counter were a bit slow, possibly due to a smaller staff, maybe they were nursing their own hangovers, maybe because the group of people in front of us placed each of their orders separately despite being there all together. Either way, we eventually got our order placed and grabbed a seat. 

There's a really wide range of breakfast dishes, from crepes to eggs to fresh fruit. In a way, I was glad for the extra time it took for us to get to the counter since I couldn't make up my mind what I wanted (I'll attribute part of the indecision to my really slow thinking brain: 4 hours of sleep was really catching up to me). 

Actual serving of the order didn't take long we both had more than enough food to satisfy our post-celebration appetites.

Overall it's a decent breakfast place to stop by if you're looking for something quick and filling. There's a good range of choices, a few specials that seem to change regularly, and decent seating. It's not quite near my place so I'm not sure how often I'd get to it, but if I'm in the area for breakfast again, I wouldn't say no to eating there again.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
We were staying at the Clift and decided to walk down to this joint for some hangover brunch.  This place is far from fancy, but it has a system figured out and it works well. You order your meal from a series of boards - things like breakfast, sandwiches, burgers, salads and so on - then go to the register to pay. They give you a number and deliver the food to your table when it's ready. We went in around 11 or so to a handful of people in line and maybe a dozen at tables, but our food came out quickly.

I ordered the Huevos Rancheros (which came with beans), topped with a salsa/sauce and drizzled with sour cream. The corn tortillas were simply heated before topped with eggs et al, but the meal met my expectations and was inoffensive. When my friend ordered the benedict she was acted if she would like her eggs soft or medium, which surprised me for such a casual joint. Her benedict was good, although the rosemary potatoes threw her a little bit and seemed out of place.

All in all we had a decent meal at a reasonable price within walking distance to our hotel. I won't be dreaming of this place, but I would definitely go back. A solid experience.
author: Erica P.

description: Great breakfast! You order at the counter and they bring it out to you. They have a lot to choose from. I had the croissant sandwich and my husband had 2-2-2. The potatoes are the best! They were busy but after ordering it didn't take long for the food come. The longest part is standing in line to order.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Honey Honey is a great example of what happens when you just let life happen.

My friend and I were in SF for NYE, stayed at a hotel a couple of blocks away.  Early in the morn (like, 10 am), my phone rang and it was my friend.  She woke up early and wanted coffee. She walked down to the Starbucks inside our hotel but the line was long. She decided to Yelp some places nearby and found Honey Honey.

I really didn't have any idea what she said when she called but I heard the words "crepe."  I hustled and threw a few layers one and bolted out the door. 

The line at Honey Honey was out the door.  HOWEVER, it moved quickly.  Here is how to proceed:

1. Get in line.
2. While in line, check out the huge menu on the left wall.
3. Order.
4. They will give you a number.
5. Sit and wait for deliciousness.

I listed it in hope that you would not be one of the few annoying people who try to grab a table before ordering.  I hope that you would be one of the many polite ones who are there to enjoy good food along with good company.  

The food was absolutely worth the wait.  I ordered the banana crepe with nutella, Orangina, and tea.  My friend ordered banana crepe with nutella, chorizo with a side of potatoes, coffee, and apple cider. We were really hungry. But the food was soooo good.  We ate ev-e-ry-thing.  I wish I ordered my own chorizo and side of potatoes.  Seriously, the food was worth the wait.  And again, the line moves fairly quickly. At the very least, they are efficient.

Lastly, the staff was super nice-- from the person who took the order to the busser.  Given that they were located in a very touristy area and some people were not very patient (especially those who clearly should have had a shot of caffeine before they left their hotel room), the staff handled the situatin with grace.

We LOVED Honey Honey!  So glad that my friend decided not to get Starbucks.
author: Pilar D.

description:
Seriously, I love this place. I'm upset I didn't find it sooner than I did. I wanted breakfast on my last full day in San Francisco. This place popped up on my Yelp app and off I went in search of this magical place. I walked in and was a little overwhelmed by the menu but I got over that and ordered the eggs benedict, orange juice and pot of ginger twist tea. The benedict was scrumptious (the potatoes were ok) and the tea was heavenly. I love hot tea. I left full and satisfied and went off in search of something to do with the rest of my day. 

I went back again the next morning. I was heading to the airport for my long flight home and wanted to have a filling breakfast before the journey. I ordered the same tea and a Belgium waffle. OMG! Hands down one of the best waffles I have ever had. It was topped with strawberries, bananas and whipped cream. I could've eaten two! 

The restaurant is a nice size and there weren't too many people there. Try it out.  I think you'll like. I can't wait until my next trip back to San Francisco. This will be my first stop.
author: Robin F.

description: Great food. Great people. Definitely worth a small wait in line for Sunday breakfast. The potatoes are to die for. Crispy and cooked all the way through (pet peeve!) Great smiles from the owner!! Really enjoyed our experience!
author: Roni Z.

description:
The outside and decor look a little suspect but the food makes up for it. Fast and with many options, it's a fresh choice got lunch.

I had the New Orleans savory crepe which was filled well with chicken and veggies and was rather light/healthy tasting. Side salad was a nice touch.

I'd go back, especially with the lack of good to go food options in the area,
author: Kelley F.

description: Really yummy breakfast ... Both the sweet and savory crepes are excellent.  Coffee drinks are good.  The value is unexpected for the neighborhood!  Definitely a good place to go if you are staying near Union Square.
author: Debby C.

description:
What a random place. Naturally, I checked Yelp while I was walking around San Francisco for a place to eat breakfast and had free wi-fi. Honey Honey fit the bill. The manager at the front was super nice and the crepes...Well they are crepes after all. I had a mushroom, spinach, cheese crepe... delicious!

I had coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice. It is a nice-sized cafe, but not the most conducive for getting work done. There are too many people walking through it. I think there are a lot of tourists that come here, but why not? Great food, nice portions and good prices.

yum!
author: Ronjini M.

description: Worth the 45 minute wait. Large fresh breakfast and crepe menu. I got the banana/strawberry/Nutella Crepe with the crab cake eggs Benedict. So good and a must.  Only negative is there were not enough seats and there were those who would save seats for the 45 min wait while those with food couldn't sit and eat. There were tables that sat dirty for a long period of time. Maybe they were short handed that day??? This is the only reason why I didn't give 5 stars.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Horrible customer service and unclean food preparation!!!  We stopped in here for a quick dinner after running around the city. The food was good, so good we were saying how we definitely had to get back here before we left to try the breakfast. Then my friend took a bite of her burger and a long, thin, curly black hair came with it. As we are both brunette and straight it certainly wasn't ours. She quietly took the cashier aside and told her but instead of apologizing (even if they didn't cover her meal- she was towards the end of the burger), the girl asked to see her hair and then accused her of planting it because "no one there has hair like that". When my friend got mad (and to be fair, a little loud with a sprinkle of curses) she told her to leave.  Not a way to treat customers!!
author: Kristie H.

description: The wait in line was a little daunting but worth it on a Sunday morning. I had the tofu scramble and hot chocolate. The food was great and the breakfast menu extensive. It felt like the heat was on full blast and would have been uncomfortable but we sat by the open door which helped. This is my second visit and I will visit again, perhaps on my next visit to SF.
author: Madelyn K.

description: Hands down everything from the mocha to the crepes were delicious. I recommend the breakfast crepe without ham add bacon!!
author: Ashley J.

description:
It was a great sunny day, during the summer, and my morning was made accompanied with one of my besties. Was looking forward for a brunch.

PROS: 

- Great service!
We were greeted by one of the workers outside who was very welcoming and energetic in seeing us. My waiter was friendly and wiped our tables often.

- The sweet crepes are worth a try! 


CONS:

- Savory crepes ARE TO STAY AWAY FROM.
The crepe I got was a savory crepe. I think it was the mediterenean chicken. Unfortunately, I was pretty disappointed. I've tasted better savory crepes.

- Although something that bothered me -probably considered small for most people, was that there were a few flies flying all over my food! Though I don't think this could happen during the colder seasons.

I'd advise only coming here for a mid-afternoon snack! Stay away from the savory crepes, and only order the sweet crepes. Brunch is better off somewhere else.
author: Angela L.

description: Great cafe! I wasn't too wowed by their tofu omelet, but their strawberry waffles were amazing! And their small shot of espresso was delicious and strong! It was pretty warm inside, but considering is was around 50 degrees outside, it felt nice. The people were nice and we got our food pretty quickly. Definitely would recommend trying out any of their waffles!!!
author: Jamie S.

description:
DELICIOUS and CHEAP! They have so many crepes to choose from, sweet and savory ones. They also have breakfast plates, sandwiches, and salads. I got the salmon eggs benedict after seeing pics from Yelp and boy was it yummy. A glass of mimosa was $4 (not sure if that's cheap or not) and was just perfect for a Saturday brunch with my cousin. It's small and if you go during the busy hours, you might not find a table. I suggest having someone in line order while you scout out for a table. Most of the items on the menu were $10 or less. Okay, that's not THAT cheap, but you get a lot of food. And it's cheap compared to the other popular brunch places in downtown SF. 

If you haven't been yet, go go go.
author: Panina H.

description: Soooooo good and delicious you have to eat here the wait is worth it the waitstaff is so helpful and they work fast the food is tasty and the coffee latte and chai lattes are so yummy!!! The eggs Benedict was so good and the potatoes had flavor!!
author: L T.

description:
Ok I like this place but it needs major improvement with the person who takes the orders!!!! It is very annoying and inefficient that they do not get your orders correct the first time and then have your server bring back the food when it arrives back to the kitchen. 

I think the kitchen actually does a pretty decent job, I love their Crepes Suzette and Eggs Benedict and Fresh OJ :P
author: Lyn X.

description: Average. Not sure what everyone is raving about. Small portion. Long wait in line and then long wait for the food, despite there not being a long line. Fair. I've had MUCH better for a better price.
author: David B.

description: Don't let the line out the door scare you. It moves quickly.  I ordered the Blitz Crepe (because I came for the crepes) and a side of extra crispy bacon. The bacon was not extra crispy but the service was great and my crepe was off the charts delish.  I'm definitely going back.
author: Macy C.

description: Fresh squeezed orange juice was good. Also try the banana and Nutella crepes. Short line to order food but well worth the wait.
author: David F.

description: Came for Lunch had a chicken pesto crepe with a salad. You can't beat the price for the portions. Very friendly staff. This is a must try
author: Casey P.

description: If I was given the same eggs Benedict in Melbourne, I'd be disappointed. Did the job though. Nice OJ.
author: Leith R.

description: I ordered a Strawberry Nutella and they gave me JUST Strawberry. It took a lot of time for me and my friend to wait for it, but we had to wait more even without a single sorry. We were a lot pissed off in the morning and were half an hour more angry. Why in the hell wouldn't they be sorry? I hate to give a star. That's too much regarding their service.
author: Chaerim M.

description:
I got dragged here by a friend because this is one of her favorite spots.. For me, I'm as picky as you can get when it comes to food. 

However this place isn't too bad.. The food is really good but the service is pretty slow. 

Anyways.. Let's just say I wouldn't mind returning back to this place again.
author: Lena S.

description: We found this spot on the run. It was fantastic! We got a table very quickly, and The menu is adorable, plastered onto large, colorful chalkboards. It was on a corner, and easy to get in & out of. Very cute cafe, you order at the front and sit, they bring it out to you. Their bloody mary had savory spices, but light on the liquor. The Blintze {photo posted} was decadent & perfectly sized. My date had banana pancakes, they were ok. We arrived just in time as a long line started behind us, We were glad to be ahead of the line!! Timing is everything with this little gem!
author: Joy E.

description:
Not bad but not great either. I go in during the week so their is no line and service is super quick! After I sit down food is usually out within 10mins. But the food itself, meh. I've had a couple dishes here now (chorizo scramble, chorizo burrito, and the 222) and none of them are really anything amazing. 
Customer service is also a "meh" the order takers don't have any real zest for life.
author: Carter H.

description: One of my favorite breakfast spots. The crab cake Benedict is amazing. Definitely worth the wait in line.
author: Robert B.

description: Well worth the Saturday morning wait. Crab cake crepe and potatoes were outstanding. Food came out quickly after ordering and service was friendly.
author: Kate G.

description:
I really liked their Belgian Waffle with fresh fruit and whipped cream which I got to go.  Quite delicious! 

Eating in was a different experience. I got the granola with fruit and yogurt which was equally yummy but the service lacking unfortunately.  The line was super slow moving due to the lone cashier. This I could easily handle, but when the server dropped my friends blintz into his hollandaise sauce and acted like it was his fault, I thought that was a little unnecessary. Everyone makes mistakes, just own up to them. 

Good breakfast food but with so many restaurants in SF, I can find that elsewhere in addition to better service and a cause I'd like to support.
author: Ali B.

description:
The place is the same as it was when it was the Crepe House. Down to the menu and specials. 

1. I appreciate the fact that they're open longer hours.
2. They have three kinds of flavored water for consumption. (Oranges, lemons, and oooh, a kiwi-strawberry variety.)
3. They still have the same awesome thick crepes.

But but but...the seating is still uncomfortable and the lines are hella long 'cause the girl behind the counter is slow! But I still love this place for Sunday breakfast, reading the paper in the sun.
author: Jessica K.

description:
Honey Honey Café is a pretty cool spot to grab a casual breakfast or lunch. You just look at the wall covered in a menu, decide what you want, order at the counter, take your number, take a seat and await your food.

I went with an Acapulco omelet for breakfast, which is made with avocado, cheddar, black bean chili, and salsa as well as a jasmine green tea. I would definitely order both again on a return trip. The omelets are hearty, read large, so if you don't have a huge appetite you may want to go with something else. And they have an amazing array of crepes, which I would probably try next time around.
author: Tiffany N.

description: High hopes for this place based on reviews but the crepes were really just meh. The crepe itself is pretty tasteless although the fillings are good. They serve the crepes crispy and I like them soft so this may have added to my disappointment. My wife liked her sandwich but the potatoes were also tasteless. The coffee is good at least.
author: Marlin T.

description: I went because almost everything that I read says this is a breakfast place. They stop serving breakfast at 3 or 4, now. :/ I was disappointed because I have food allergies and I could have gone somewhere else to eat meals I know my body can handle. Still, the salads are pretty good and the salmon is great. They should definitely go back to serving breakfast at all hours because their breakfast menu looked amazing.
author: Nicole Z.

description: Excellent place to eat breakfast. Our family had the breakfast crepe, Nutella and strawberry crepe, as well as the Santa Fe scramble- all delicious! Great vibe and quick service! If we weren't living on the East Coast and just visiting, we'd make this a weekly stop!
author: Liz B.

description: Great food and location. Long line when I was there (Friday morning before Labor Day weekend).
author: Steve A.

description: Down the street from the JW Marriot and The Prescott Hotel, Honey Honey saved us after a wild night out on NYE by serving us hot and delicious food in the morning.  This place was PACKED with a line for the ordering counter out the door.  The menu was huge and you can see it from virtually anywhere inside the restaurant (a huge help when you're waiting in that line trying to order).  Seating is first come, first serve, so we sent half our party to find a table and the rest of us decided to wait in line and order everything.  There is literally an option for every member of your picky food eating party member.  Husband and I decided to split savory and sweet for breakfast that morning ordering the Sunrise Burrito (with delicious chorizo inside) and the Strawberry and Nutella crepe.  He had the house coffee black while I had their Iced Chai.  The Chai was more milky than I prefer but still satisfying.  The food took a considerably long time (hence the 4 star review) and the tables are really crowded and most tables are small.  The burrito was huge and really flavorful.  The sauce that it's smothered in was delectable!!  Tons of chorizo and eggs inside with sides of rice and beans, it's definitely filling.  The strawberry and nutella crepe was standard but provided a sweetness to the spicy burrito.  Overall, really good food (would love to try the fresh juices!) and probably would come back if I'm even around in the city for breakfast/brunch again!
author: Reena P.

description: I came to honey honey on my first of five days in San Francisco and loved it so much! I tried all the other good breakfast places in this area, and came back here on my last day. Hands down, this is the best.
author: Nadia B.

description:
Wow, the employees here really hate their jobs! From the surly cashier to the clearly annoyed waitress/food runner, it was not a pleasant and welcoming environment. 

We walked in with no line, and it seemed to irritate the cashier that we did not immediately know what we wanted off their massive menu (which we we're seeing for the very first time, btw). We both ordered dessert crepes, which we immediately regretted. It seems the savory crepes or breakfast dishes were a better choice, especially for two hungry travelers. 

The wait time to receive our food was pretty long. During this time, we saw a huge line form, so it certainly seems to be a popular place. 

The crepes arrived and were a big disappointment. Unlike the savory crepes, dessert crepes are about half the size. We got one strawberry crepe and one Nutella, banana-strawberry crepe. The strawberries seemed canned and overcooked. Some strawberries weren't even red or pink, like the color had been boiled out of them. Yum? 

We left disappointed and hungry! We would have split a savory crepe after, but the line was so long it wasn't worth it. We picked up a bagel at a bakery down the street.
author: M I.

description: We found this restaurant on Yelp as we only wanted a little bite to eat. The crepes are lovely and the hot chocolate is very yummy. Good prices and a cool hangout. Great for a quick bite and the other food looked good too!
author: Daisy F.

description: Would like to update that food is still good, but rudeness of staff has gotten worse.  Bummer
author: Lori H.

description: Easy to find in a central location. We visited on a weekday morning around 8.30 and it was busy but a few spare tables. Menu was amazing, great choice. Recommend the fresh orange juice, tasty doesn't cover it. We ordered pancakes with strawberries and bananas and eggs benedict. The eggs came out lukewarm but that's the only negative. Prices were very reasonable and the pancakes amazing. We would go back just for pancakes and OJ.
author: Sarah R.

description: A nice casual place for anytime of the day. Food is great and a wide variety. The service is good but make sure to ask your friend to save a table while you order, especially if you have a big group.
author: Nazly R.

description:
I did not enjoy my meal there, the coffee was more like tea.
I will recommend the Ferry terminal instead, great food, organic, great.
author: J-L D.

description:
I randomly decided to play hookie from work and was looking for a "brunch" place near Uniqlo, where my overenthusiastic out-of-town friend insist she spend hundreds of dollars to shop at.

So I wanted a place that had something sweet and served alcohol at 9am nearby and this was something that popped up on my yelp search.  "Why the heck not?" right?

So its a line up seat yourself place with very unique crepe... peanut butter nutella crepe...yes I do like sweets for breakfast, who cares about being filled?  It did taste like a giant reese's pb cup.  Unfortunately the crepe itself was not so good....

Location is border of TL/"Lower Nob Hill"/Union Square on a corner, so on your walk here be ready for random crack head or bum asking for money, and if you drove here, find a parking garage or good luck trying to find street parking.
author: Omar L.

description: with the line that stretched from out the door and around the street corner, I thought it was super good.. alas, it was good. I had this great expectation of the flavor. It wasn't bad, it was just ok. my friend had the belgian waffle which was very creamy and crisp. I had the philly cheese steak crepe. I should have just tried their eggs benedict which they were known for. the best thing that I had there would probably be the dark chocolate brownie at the counter and the freshly squeezed orange juice.the chai tea had too much milk. But the service was A++ maybe i'll give this place another try in the near future..
author: Chary E.

description:
Very similar to Squat & Gobble but with much lower quality. 

I originally wanted to order a belgian waffle but was told that they were out of waffles. I certainly hope that doesn't mean they stock frozen ones. I went for the french toast instead which was ok, but nothing spectacular. 

I ordered the apple and cinnamon crepe for desert and it was terrible. It was very dry and plain tasting. The apples were cut into large chunks, so they immediately fell out of the crepe. 

There are far better places to grab breakfast in SF. I wouldn't bother returning to this restaurant.
author: Adriana N.

description: Very popular and busy place. Had a line out the door quite early Saturday morning. The pancakes were good, maybe a bit on the expensive side. Worth a visit if you're in the area!
author: Helene K.

description: They opened about 15 minutes late, and there was already a line of about 20 people.  There's no table service, so once inside you have to run to claim a table and then get back in line to wait to order your food.  Line was very slow.  I was there alone and couldn't deal with the wait for pretty unoriginal standard breakfast fare. Try Jaspers down the street!
author: David M.

description: Really great food and good selection - would give 4-5 stars for the food alone. But the wait times were outrageous - (45 minutes after we ordered) and they got our order wrong in multiple different ways. The owner said they had a problem in the kitchen that day.  I'll say.
author: Melissa P.

description:
Honey Honey Cafe is a nice place to go for breakfast, but the food was just standard.
I ordered the Breakfast crepe, my dad ordered the Torino crepe, and my mom ordered the Athens omelette with potatoes. The crepes were good, but again nothing special. Same for the omelette. But the restaurant had a nice atmosphere overall.
author: Megan S.

description: Wonderful atmosphere, the menu is beyond belief. It is so cozy and the service is stellar.
author: Carolyn R.

description: The crepes were good, but didn't blow us away. Very long lines and great reviews set our expectations pretty high. Perfectly acceptable experience, but not sure you want to wait 1/2 hour to order....we had the breakfast crepe and the baklava crepe.
author: Cindy A.

description: Great spot for breakfast or lunch. It has a very extensive menu, if you're familiar with LA it reminds me a lot of Crave Cafe in Studio City. I had the Miami heat crepe with a side of fresh fruit, and it was fabulous.
author: Suzanne R.

description: Line moves a little slow but the food was pretty good nothing to rave about but also nothing to complain about.. They have a very clean restaurant with vibrant colors.. I enjoyed sitting here for a while drinking my coffee
author: Bud W.

description: I had the baklava crepe and my wife had the peanut butter crepe, both very tasty. They take fresh orange juice to the extreme, its squeezed directly from an orange in a very unique machine. Great breakfast!
author: Jeremy L.

description: really?!...  I looked at more than 1k people giving feedback and feel like I 'got fooled' with this less than ordinary place.  Not sure what people are smoking but I can't even give 1 star go this place. Service sucked.  Our food was nothing special and the wait...  OMG, the wait was ridiculous.  I still can't understand why so many people choose this place.  I'm not coming back again!..
author: Tot D.

description:
Was out with my family visiting from Orange County and tried 5 other places for breakfast on a Saturday morning. All had a minimum of 1 hour wait or more. We called honey honey and we were told that there was only a 5 minute wait. We were a little skeptical, but to our surprise food was delicious, wait staff and management were terrific! l highly recommend this place. If your looking for delicious food, quick service, clean atmosphere, and a terrific place to bring you family, Honey Honey is the place to be! 

We will definitely stop by again our next trip out to San Francisco!!!
author: Romy K.

description:
I ordered the 'New Orleans Savory Crepe', slightly overcooked with burnt areas but the contents were tasty and the salsa was thankfully placed on top. Comes with a choice of salad, potatoes or fruit for a side dish  

Cons: Cappuccino was extremely weak and poorly made.  

Crepe + coffee = around $15

Better breakfast eateries in the area and on the street.
author: Greg R.

description: Great Eggs Benedict.  All the right flavoring and the hollandaise was not super heavy.  The woman at the counter was so friendly and helpfull.  Everything was overall pretty great!  Parking was easy to by the way.
author: Kavon M.

description: Drip coffee was good. We got the banana strawberry crepes which were great. Also got the eggs Benedict and I would not recommend getting that. The sauce lacked flavor, Canadian bacon had strange flavor and English muffin didn't hold up under the sauce/yolk.
author: Kyle T.

description:
I ate here several times on my recent trip to SF.  Loved the vibe - reminded me of a coffee house in Vienna - open space, small tables, classical music at night. They offer comfort food presented beautifully and at totally reasonable prices.  Winners - strawberry/Nutella crepe and the lemon crepe - the lemon crepe had fresh lemon - I could taste the pulp and the zest and with fresh whip creme it was a score!  Consider coming here just to get dessert.
For breakfast I really enjoyed the banana pecan pancakes with bacon (crispy) and a big glass of fresh oj.  The coffees here are so much cheaper than at Starbucks - I didn't get a latte but it looked amazing.
They have a huge selection of Mighty Leaf teas.  Another score!
For dinner, the capellini de Angelo was perfect - fresh tomato sauce with garlic, white wine, oregano and shrimp.  A glass of wine less than $5.  Another score!
You have got to check this place out if you are staying in the Union Square awesome.
author: Noa N.

description: I had the Acapulco omelette and it was delicious. Breakfast is reasonably priced although I was waiting 15mins to order. The coffee was good and the place itself was busy with many people enjoying the food. Would go back if I was in SF again.
author: Ryan B.

description:
This place is A-OK! I have seen a lot of better crepe places in the city, but the food and ambience here are not bad. Its extremely conveniently located, so I will probably be coming here pretty regularly.
They have got a pretty large place, but most tables are small 2-person ones. Both the service and the free wifi are pretty fast!
Order my standard Crepe order across all the creperies in the city - The Salsa Crepe. Theirs felt slightly smaller than that of other places, but taste pretty good. The potatoes felt a little overcooked. All in all, pretty good, but definitely not a 5 star.
author: Aditya M.

description: Well worth the wait. Had the chorizo scramble and added jalapeños. The potatoes were excellent, crispy and lots of cilantro which added an earthy taste. Chorizo was very well seasoned and reminded me of the Chorizo you get in Mexico.
author: Adrian D.

description:
After a night of drinking where one thing lead to another and all of a sudden you're in you halloween costume and its 9am and you're hangry and hungover and its raining, what's a vegan girl to do? 

Get a damn TOFU SCRAMBLE. and hashbrowns. Stat. 

Well, I yelped, Honey answered. 

I ordered said scramble. Things looked good. This Honey- she's alright with me. Then Honey put cheese on my tofu. Why do you parmesan crust tofu, Honey? Why? I ate it because I'd never ask for a remake for something so minor (parmesan never hurt anyone in small amounts) but Honey I asked for no butter, no eggs, obviously you know whats up. I did not see the words "parmesan crusted tofu" on your menu. Why? Honey, it ain't there. 

I did like your waters. Your potato's were moist and bless you for having green hot sauce. I know of some other crepe places that don't have said green hot sauce or moist potatoes. ( I don't want to name names.) (But I'm looking at you "Crepe things-that-grapes-grow-on") But considering the cheese fiasco, I'd still pick that other crepe place. Cus Honey, that's what's up.
author: Emily D.

description:
My honey and I were walking around looking for places that were open for breakfast. Almost every place was full. We were pretty much throwing bills around in hopes that a restaurant would see us lost and stranded. That's when we found Honey Honey, and better yet it had the word "crepery" in its title. I was hooked!

The menu took up an entire wall. There was so much to order and so much I wanted to eat! I love a place where I have to choose which crepe selection I want. Many places are so limited with the types of crepes made. It's so easy to make a crepe; you damn well should add as many juicy good stuff you got in 'em! 

***It was so packed when I went in, but the kind waiter found us a table before we ordered at the register. The place was busy but the employees were very friendly. I even personally handed the waiter a $5 tip. He was so nice that he placed it into the tip jar. A humble worker indeed!

Also I'm reading other's reviews and maybe next time can we set up some kind of walk-a-thon that sends us on a hike to all breakfast joints that are in need of customers? Or maybe I'll post up on the block selling tacos, crepes, you-name-it on the side of the street to all you hungry walkers!
author: Vee V.

description: Breakfast is great! The lunch was not as good. It's very packed on Sunday morning so get there early or its harder to find a table.
author: Charlie W.

description: Lovely meal! But line was long, it's worth the wait as long as you get the right stuff. Some of the meals are mediocre but the honey specials are good! We got banana pecan pancakes which were GREAT. We also got the baklava crepe little too sweet but delicious with ice cream :) chai tea had too much milk too little chai.. but will come back!!
author: Esther J.

description: Delicious banana nutella crepe, crab cake florentine, diverse menu. Every plate I saw looked amazing! Fresh squeezed juice and the breakfast potatoes were crispy with herbs and irresistible. There was a line out the door.
author: J L.

description:
Summary: Nice casual atmosphere. Great food. Reasonably priced.

I came here on a Sunday morning during a trip to San Francisco because I, like many, am a fan of crepes. Naturally for Sunday breakfast/brunch you would expect the place to be packed, and it was - but not so much that it was annoying. The place has a great buzzing vibe, emphasizing its popularity that I assume it has among SF natives. If my experience is telling, there will most certainly be a long line, but it moves pretty quickly so don't be discouraged too quickly. I got the breakfast crepe: which had onions, ham, and cheddar. I really liked it. The orange juice was smooth and fresh, squeezed right there in front of you (I'm from New England so this is unusual). The side of potatoes was great too. Portions are medium sized. Not too small such that I wanted more, but definitely not Daddy bear sized either. And, being from Boston and unaccustomed to the high prices in San Fran, I was comforted by the reasonable prices for good food.

Later that day my family wanted something sweet after dinner, and decided to give Honey  Honey's another test. The line was much shorter and the restaurant notably quieter. Still the same humble feel, just less of a busy-bee Sunday morning vibe and a more relaxed evening one. I had the strawberry and nutella crepe. I would eat my own shoes if they had nutella on them, so I may be a biased source for this, but that crepe was also delicious. Overall, great place to go. Not a five-star restaurant (it doesn't try to be), but I'm definitely recommending it as a casual family or date place. Or, if you're like me, just a traveler looking to spend less without getting less.
author: Pablo R.

description: My favorite place to start a day in San Francisco. I usually take one of the solid vegetarian meals. But my wife enjoyed the pancakes a lot.
author: Maximilian C.

description: Just ate lunch here. Great breakfast & lunch place with lots of variety. Had the turkey/apple/avocado sandwich with a salad. Very fresh & tasty. Friendly staff. Lots of seating & had clean restrooms. Not too pricey. Had a bit of a wait but worth it. Will most definitely be back!
author: Liz T.

description: At first when arriving in sf I thought I'd have to subsist on granola bars all week. Not so thanks to honey honey. Every place surrounding my hotel was ridiculously overpriced but here a bagel is about 2 bucks and pasta ranges around 9-10 and was delicious.
author: Megan C.

description: Came here on Sunday morning.  Very busy.  Had the 2-2-2.  Delicious.  Staff helpful In getting a seat.
author: Theo S.

description:
Honey honey is fantastic- and I feel confident in giving it a 5 star review. Perhaps I lucked out on the food ordered and the service, but my 5 star sentiment stands.

1-Fresh pressed carrot and orange juice! I'll admit, this place earned an extra star for me because I could actually get this combination of juice, which happens to be my favorite in the world, and extremely difficult to come by in the US. You can get fresh orange juice, fresh carrot juice, or take my advice and get it half and half. Delicious. And just $3.50, deal.

2-This is a crepe place. I mean I'm sure the rest of the food is fine, but the specialty here is crepes, so I suggest, you know, ordering a crepe. In the same way that the chicken fingers probably aren't the best items on a menu at an Italian restaurant I feel like anything other than crepes is probably not the best this place can offer. (Though the other food I saw come out looked fantastic as well.) I was especially excited about the savory crepes, which are far more difficult to come by than dessert crepes. I started my morning off with the Florentine crepe, a delicious combination of cheddar, spinach, cottage cheese and onions. 

3-Fresh fruit. The savory crepes all come with a side of salad, potatoes, or fresh fruit. I opted for the fruit and it was absolutely fresh. Like, I wouldn't be the least bit surprised if it was sliced up just seconds before going on my plate. The banana, strawberry and apples were fantastic. Also, as these are ingredients used in their dessert crepe recipes, I'm betting they cycle through fruit here quite quickly, so things are likely to be quite fresh.

Overall, great experience, and a delicious breakfast. My food was delivered to my table within about 5 minutes of when I placed my order at the counter, and was warm and melty. The coffee was good, and I even got it refilled for free. Prices are totally reasonable, and the staff was all very friendly. If you're in the area and looking for a bite to eat, this is a great place to stop.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I wasn't totally impressed... But wasn't appalled either. It seems like a small mom and pop joint that natives or shopaholics will enjoy. It has a nice homey feel inside, but the food wasn't spectacular. I like to stay away from extra sweet "desserts" people call breakfast so I was a little out of luck. But I will give them EXCELLENT reviews for a cup of joe. The coffee here is excellent. :)) ill be coming back... Maybe just for coffee!
author: Demsina B.

description:
Honey Honey makes me wish I lived in San Francisco. But then again, if I did, I'd probably go everyday and gain 200 lbs.

  My boyfriend and I went here twice during our weeklong stay in San Francisco. The first time was for brunch when I had the Crab Cake Florentine. I don't know how else to describe it aside from YUMMY! One of the cheaper brunches I've had and so filling too! I couldn't even finish the whole thing....

  I love that you just go up to order and sit wherever you want. The line was pretty long when we went that first time, but that wasn't really a problem because we were taking forever in deciding what we wanted. And even though the line was enormous, there was plenty of space to sit since most people were getting things to go.

  The second time was the night after when we were looking for places for dessert. This was around 8 or 9, so a lot of places were closed or about to -_- But Honey Honey was closed at 10, so we went back for crepes. I got the Strawberry Nutella and once again YUMMY! There were a lot less people this time so the wait was nothing.

  Servers are very nice, the bathroom is HUGE and mostly clean, you can get freshly squeezed orange juice and you can choose between lemon infused or orange infused water (for free!!). My one tiny little complaint would be that the chocolate macaron I ordered was pretty dry. Seemed like it had been there for a while. But otherwise, perfect brunch spot! Or dessert! Or....whatever!!
author: Noelle B.

description: Went there twice on a 3 day stay recently. Long line if you do not get there before 8 am. Worth it though! Highly recommend!!
author: Mark W.

description: I really wanted to love this place, but I just like it. The food was okay. It wasn't WOW but it wasn't terrible. Wait was over 30 minutes in line. I wouldn't wait in line again.
author: Jade F.

description: OMG this food is amazing! Redefines breakfast! Long line went fast and worth every minute of wait!  Had croissant sandwich with yummy potatoes and a strawberry Nutella crepe for dessert! Stuffed!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Decent place for breakfast but nothing outstanding or memorable. 

The menu and set-up remind me of Crepevine. I'd choose Crepevine over this place in a heartbeat, to be honest. 

Customer service isn't friendly. They're rather rushed and pushy... I don't expect my a$$ to be kissed when I eat out, nor do I expect rude and sassy servers. Naw'm sayin'? 

This also seems to be a popular touristy spot, not that it's a bad thing. 

Tables are sticky. Condiments are sticky. Utensils are sticky. The only thing that isn't sticky are the napkins. 

Food comes out fast and is decent, but again, nothing outstanding.
author: Rebecca N.

description: Hands down my favorite place I have ever eaten breakfast/brunch. I went here every morning when I was in San Francisco. The salmon Benedict and the crepes are amazing. They also have fresh squeezed OJ. Don't go if you are in a rush though bc you will probably encounter a decent line. This place is no secret, but it is a real gem.
author: Dani C.

description: Not especially great but good enough. My eggs benedict had some sort of Indian food spice to it that I wasn't crazy about. The staff at the order counter spoke in Chinese for several minuets apparently about the customer before me before greeting me for my order. Oddly halfway through breakfast  the restaurant broke out in loud hip hop music which I didn't think fit the scene...but maybe its just me.
author: Sam B.

description: Great food. Very fast service. Was here on vacation and went to this restaurant more than once.
author: Lydia I.

description:
You want to try an amazing crepe or breakfast burrito?  Come to Honey Honey.  No line.  Large menu on the wall.  Order and pay before you sit.  Food came out in about 10 minutes.  We ordered the Miami Heat crepe and the Sunrise burrito.  Both were outstanding.  The Miami Heat crepe has chicken and avocado which my husband loves and a few other ingredients which I forgot.  The Sunrise burrito had chorizo, cheese, sour cream, salsa and black beans with cilantro.  Goodness all around!
So if your looking for a place that serves you fast and their food is full of deliciousness, check this place out.
author: Leslie S.

description:
A sit down, take your time, you're in no rush environment. But most off all the food is spectacular. They have fresh ingredients; freshly squeezed juice and a happy smiley service that comes along with it. 

I was first introduce to Honey Honey by my good friend Tony A. I work just a few blocks from this awesome restaurant. Since then this has become a part of my weekly work regiment.  

My favorite's:

The SAVANNAH
*Red leaf, spinach, tomato, radish, artichoke crumbled blue cheese, 
apple and pecans.  Oh so good.  Did I also mention my first born daughter is named Savannah.  She too is perfect just like this dish.

FLORENTINE
*Cheddar, spinach, cottage cheese, onion topped with holinday sauce. Wow, wow , wee, wah!

And there's always lemon water and cucumber water to wash it all down.
Come and see for yourself.
author: Rhodora E.

description:
After visiting SF in November, Honey Honey is the only restaurant whose name I can remember--mostly because of its name and definitely because of the yummy crepes I devoured!

I had the nutella crepe with strawberries and it was delicious! I wish I could remember what my bf ordered, but this was a couple of months ago and unfortunately, I've waited too long to write a review. But I know a couple of people who have also stopped by Honey for brunch and equally loved it.

The place is a bit small and gets packed because it's in a touristy location. My bf and I luckily got there right before the line went out the door. It's a cute little cafe and the menu is written on a wall to your right as you enter. You order at the counter and the food is brought out to you.

I would definitely go back next time I visit SF.
author: Jill R.

description: This is a must for breakfast. Wait in line, enjoy the menu, try to decide hat to get, place order, sit down, food will be brought to you. Don't get turned off by the line, it's worth the wait. Eggs Benedict was outstanding. Maybe the best home fries I've ever had.
author: R. S.

description:
Well, this place is a more than welcome diversion for breakfast from all the overpriced hotels breakfasts in the area. I'm certainly glad we ventured to this spot, thank you fellow yelpers.
This is a good spot for lunch or breakfast with an array of choices: burgers, salads, sweet and savory crepes and other breakfast items.
You come in, look at the huge board with all the choices, place your order at the counter, take a seat and your food is delivered to your table.
If you like spicy, give a try to the Miami heat crepe, that thing was awesome and absolutely had a kick.
The food was fresh and priced right. A perfect spot for breakfast.
author: Isabelle L.

description: Seriously, in the short 1 week period I was up in San Francisco for Mother's Day weekend, I came here 3x times for brunch. This place is always filled with crepe enthusiasts of all ages ranging from the twenty something crowd and up.  You walk up to the counter and to order than they bring you your food to your table. The tables are small but provides enough space you need to enjoy their delicious crepes. They serve a range from the savory to the sweet and everything in between. I can't wait to go back!
author: Jennifer C. L.

description: Family friendly and a wide variety of breakfast items. Fast service and even with a picky order - they got it right! Fresh orange juice and great crepes.
author: Candace G.

description:
Got the north beach crepe, it was awesome!
Little bit of a line, but that is San Fran.
author: Andrew W.

description: I don't know what the big deal is about this place.  Long line out the door, service was ridiculously slow and no good vibe in the place.  We waited in line for 30+ minutes and it took 20+ after for the food to come out.  People clearing the tables were like in slo motion.  Food was average.  Nothing to go back for.
author: Ted S.

description: Streamlined, fast, delicious, good seating, nice staff, good prices. This will be my breakfast place while visiting San Francisco. Huevos rancheros very good!
author: Kerrie S.

description: This place is amazing!! Two of my favorite items are the chicken pesto crepe and the Mexican salad.
author: Emily N.

description:
Hit this place our first day in SF--it was right near our hotel and the concierge recommended it for a quick but good breakfast.

Overall, a solid experience but nothing I would write home about.  Huge selection of crepes, omelettes, etc so that was nice.  You pay at the counter and then have a seat and wait for your food so this is certainly a casual choice and good if you just want some good food without tipping or dealing with a waiter.  Coffee was good and hot and the food came out pretty fast.

Would say go here if you were looking for the same thing we were--a quick meal to get you through a morning of site-seeing.
author: Valerie M.

description: Nothing too special. Average food, that you can find at many of the lesser brunch restaurants in SF. Convenient if you are in the area. On weekends it can have a decent wait time.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Slowest service ever for a local breakfast joint. I'm sorry but they're not Sarabeth's and cannot keep customers waiting 30 minutes for an Egg Benedict without checking in with customers about the preparation pace. Also they bring out all orders at once for each table so if you stupidly ordered sth too advanced for the kitchen like, yes, egg benedict, prepare to wait. 

However, the food was at least decent. This place is only OK if you don't have a busy schedule and are willing to spend 2 hours for breakfast which most of us are NOT.
author: Heidi N.

description:
I liked this place so much, I visited twice in three days. It is a casual spot, with friendly service and formatted much like a cafeteria. You place your order at the desk, receive a little number and they will deliver your food to your table. It is self seating, so if you have a problem with that style of dining- this isn't the place for you.

First visit order: Half Moon Bay crepe ($9.50)
*I replaced the tomato with spinach, at no extra cost
*Rosemary potatoes pushed this portion size into 2 meal adventure, saved half for an afternoon snack.

-food service is fast and efficient
-counter staff are friendly and all smiles
-the crab cakes were delicious, and I like that my substitution was free of charge
-crepe was buttery and soft
*you may want to ask for sour cream or salsa, as the dish can be a bit dry in texture between the crab cakes flaky texture and the doughy-ness of the crepe

Second visit order: Hot Miami Heat ($9.25)
*added mushrooms, at no extra cost
*side salad, was a great match with the "spicy sauce" and off set the heaviness of the crepe, chicken and cheddar combination

-comes with spicy salsa integrated into the chicken and a small scoop on top of the crepe to finish  (more of a medium spice if you can handle it)
-great cross-breed between a chicken fajita and a crepe
-would go great with a side of sour cream

Things to note:
-there is a tip jar by the cash, leave a good tip- just because you have to order your food from the counter, doesn't mean they don't serve it with a smile
-there is complimentary water with lemon and mint, so if you're dining in, skip the bottled stuff
-order a small coffee if you're dining in, refills are free
author: Amanda H.

description:
Satisfying. I love their menu and how diverse it is. My boyfriend had the pancakes and I had the eggs florentine. They have plenty of Vegetarian and Vegan options which is a plus. 

The hollandaise was a little bland for me. The whole dish was slightly under seasoned. The eggs however were poached to perfection so that earned it an extra star. 

I had a bit of my other halves pancakes and the were light and fluffy and yummy! 

Freesh Squeezed Oranges Juice is a definite WHOOHOO for me. As well as the free flavored waters. ('Cucumber Lemon Mint' and 'Orange')
author: Lacey C.

description:
-First time trying this place. A few of my friends came to town for a visit and I said let's come here to try. This place looks interesting to me.
-I ordered the Belgian Waffle. It was pretty good. I liked how it wasn't too sweet. It's funny how they only have one slice of kiwi.
-My friend ordered a blintz...but she said it wasn't that good.
-My other friend ordered some pasta, it looked really good.
-Another friend ordered the turkeyapplecinnamon sandwich...she said it was only okay.
-I would come back here to try other things though. Because the price seems reasonable and I liked the atmosphere.
author: Annie H.

description:
Sauntered over with my party of 12 when Olea and MyMy a few blocks away were sporting outrageous lines.

There was no wait so we hurriedly pushed some tables together and went on to gawking at the expansive menu of crepes, omelettes, pancakes, and much, much more! I went with a salmon scramble and found the meal satisfying enough (the scramble was too salty) but just after one bite, my friend began to express her obsession with her stack of pancakes...and never stopped talking about them. Even after we had left.

So next time, I'm definitely adding pancakes (soft, fluffy but dense and filling) to my order. 

I also liked the setup of placing your order first and getting a number to place by your seat. It really hurries along the process and we got our meals in no-time!
author: Furai X.

description:
I went here three different times while in town for two breakfasts and one lunch.

Their breakfast crepes were fantastic and they cook eggs well, definitely lots of flavor!

The fruit side was very fresh and it was nice to not be charged extra for it. 

Beware it's very busy and they usually have just one cash register open. I didn't give them 5 stars because the line is long and a bit slow. If you're not in a hurry its good food!
author: Jenn B.

description: My wife and I wanted to go sweet AND savory so we got a salmon sandwich, Chicken Pesto crepe and a Nutella Banana crepe.  The sweet totally wins.  Long line but worth the wait.
author: Shereef Y.

description:
Honey Honey was a great place to visit with a small group of friends. We went for a brunch time meal and was able to find a table. However, pretty soon after that it was packed. Good thing this place also had a to-go option! 

We ordered the waffles, croissant sandwich, and the french toast. Everything was pretty tasty and decent-sized portions for the price range. Would definitely give this place thumbs up. 

Yet, I wouldn't bother coming to SF just for this, if you are traveling from outside of the immediate neighborhood. Maybe coupled with a shopping trip to Union Square, the parking hassle and fees would be justified.
author: Linda L.

description:
It was just food, nothing special.

The wait was 15 minutes. When we finally got to the counter to order, the waitress took 2 phone orders...nail tap, nail tap...and tada!!! It was bland!

Plus, the waitress was extremely rude to one of us, in a party of 3. My friend wasn't feeling good and so she sat down while we ordered, one party was in front of us and there were many, many tables open. She made my friend get up from the table because she didn't have a number....meanwhile, we are actually ordering at that same time. My friend kept telling the waitress/busser that we were almost there but she didn't care. She moved us to a table that was filthy!!! She proceeded to remove the dishes but left the table top dirty. When I politely asked her to come back and wipe again, I received a dirty look and a wipe that removed maybe 2 crumbs but was still sticky. I called out to her again but this time she completely ignored me!

Breakfast = 1 out of 10
Orange juice = 10 out of 10
Strawberry Nutella Crepe = 5 out of 10 (the strawberries were not fresh, they were mushy.)
author: Cheryl T.

description:
Crepes...oh how I love you. 

Honey Honey is tasty tasty.  

Smoked salmon with cheese, capers and I swear there was some additional addictive substance. I offer 12 stars.  My first twelve star review and fully not sanctioned by the Yelp Police, SFU (Special Food Unit). Ask me if me and my taste buds care.

Pesto Crepe? A serious celebration of how cheese, pesto and a thin egg pancake can join together to make strong men cry and little children rejoice. I suspect this may soon be declared an illegal tasty event.

I was with other people (AKA, my family) and I understand they ordered a hamburger and various other edible comestibles. I am not sure of the details.  They all seemed very happy and just a little misty eyed. As soon as I got close to my plate the eyelids retracted shark style and the details were hazy.

Here is where it gets serious.  We were in SF for 4 days.  A food mecca by any ones standards.   We went to Honey Honey Twice Twice.
author: Paula D.

description: I'm salivating just thinking about this brunch again. I hadn't been here in a few years, but recently took a trip to SF from LA for my girlfriend's birthday and it was just as amazing as I had remembered. Maybe even better. We came around 10am for a birthday brunch and there was a line but it gave us time to look over the extensive menu. The large menu was conveniently placed along the waiting line, so you can decide what you want to eat while waiting in line to order!  We ordered, found a table and the food was quickly served! We got a chocolate chip waffle, chorizo burrito, and a Nutella and strawberry crepe with a side of ice cream. Even though it was three plates for two people, we demolished it all. It was all so delicious! The ambience was cool, with a mix of young and older people crowding the place and we cannot wait to go back.
author: Adam Z.

description: This place is okay. We got the crab cakes benedict because it was recommended by other reviewers. It wasn't really hollandaise as I know it. It was sort of a cheese sauce. We also got a latte each which were also not great compared to other places near by. We waited an hour in a queue to get into this place and it was just okay. Pretty disappointed.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Waited in line a LONG time. Too long to even recount. Probably in the 40 minute range. Once we got through to order, the cashier was shockingly nice given the ridiculous line. Prices are decent for the quality of the food, but nothing really stood out as excellent. Seems like one of those places that stays busy based on its proximity to Market St and hotels in the area. We had two of the benedicts, both of which came out luke warm and otherwise uneventful. The potatoes on the side were decent though. All-in-all, I'd rather find a different spot in SF to spend my time and money.
author: Joe A.

description: This place is the bomb dot com! Lived right across the street at Dakota Hotel for a semester and found myself there all the time eating or just hanging out to study with a delish cup of coffee. The creeps are insane! I highly recommend the chicken pesto crepe or the philly steak crepe! The service is probably a 3/5 stars on it's own but the food always makes up for it!
author: Alyssa P.

description:
The reviews seem to suggest Honey Honey as a decent brunch place but from my experience, the quality of the food must surely deteriorate as the day goes on. 

I was starving and needed a quick bite and so I stopped into Honey Honey. The place was pretty much empty on a weekday evening which was good since I wanted my food fast... which it was so kudos there. 

I had a crabcake sandwich which was as good as a non-homemade crabcake could be. I'm sure they're store-bought frozen patties but I wasn't expecting real crabcakes for $10 anyway. The side of potatoes however was the real shocker. 

They looked like they had been on the grill all day - dark and lethargic looking. Maybe they had gathered all the scraps from the day to make up my portion but boy did they taste that way too. Something about old oil really just breaks it. Some parts were burnt, other parts mushy. They really shouldn't have bothered. 

It settled my hunger, but I definitely didn't leave satisfied. Perhaps the trick is to only visit Honey Honey before the clock strikes noon.
author: Jon L.

description:
Chicken pesto crepe good.  Peanut butter crepe with ice cream was yummy.  Guy behind the counter was a bit impatient but tipped him anyway.  Must have been a long day.
Place was a bit gloomy but food was good.  Like that they had orange or lemon slices in the water.
author: E. L.

description: I know it's a crepery, but order the Huevos Rancheros....they are outstanding!  Wish I had room for a sweet crepe! :) Reasonable prices, generous portions...YUM!
author: Terri S.

description: Simple description of this place in one word "amazing" . We both loved the torino , chicken and pesto crepes. In torino the mushrooms and basil were fresh(not canned ) the environment was nice good staff . And dont forget to try banana , nutella and hazelnut crepe loved it .
author: Zubi G.

description:
This four-star review is for lunch on weekdays. My office is nearby and I eat lunch here regularly.

I'm addicted to the Eden crepe. The potatoes are okay as a side, but the fruit cup is great: apple, banana, and strawberry. Exactly what I want!

Service is reasonable for this style of SF brunchy place. Good amount of seating (for weekday lunches).

To be honest, I don't vary much in my order. I'll get around to the sandwiches soon.
author: Steve J.

description:
Poor service. Bad coffee. OK food. 

I had the misfortune of getting a crab cake (lacking crab) covered in cheddar cheese, folded in a crepe. Bleh.
author: Jamie Y.

description: Great breakfast! We came here twice during our visit...long line yesterday but this morning we came earlier and there was no line. Husband loved the breakfast crepe and I got eggs, bacon, pancakes. Delicious breakfast...highly recommended.
author: Angela S.

description:
wandered in here with my best friend who was randomly craving crepes instead of burgers for lunch (shock!). turns out later that she actually ate a burger for breakfast -_-.. but i digress 

Got the north beach savory crepe 
$9.25
Swiss cheese, onion, spinach, chicken breast, mushroom and hollandaise sauce

Hollandaise sauce is not really incorporated with the crepe as much as just drizzled on top

Two water tanks/pictures/containers??, one infused with oranges and the other with lemon, cucumber and mint. the oranges were a nice touch but cucumber and mint were not as appealing in taste as initially thought. 

Potatoes were dry and overdone and there were more crispy bits in there than anywhere else but the flavor was good

Jams were excellent
There was a caddy of three different kinds of jams so of course I had to try it. Strawberry, orange marmalade and I think a clementine jam. Orange marmalade is one of the best, would definitely want to order something with toast so I can use the jam!

Bathroom door is heavy and closes very suddenly so it banged on my arm and hurt a LOT! 

Fresh squeezed orange juice was all sold out when I got there, so sad

Stranger recommended the north beach and miami heat. since i liked the north beach i will definitely try the other one next time. 

4-14-2012
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Remember to order up at the counter! (or you'll just sit there like a fool).
Service is excellent and friendly.
My savory crepe was not amazing. It was rather bland actually.
author: Varun V.

description: I was pleasantly surprised when I visited this restaurant. The food was good and reasonably priced. There was also plenty of small group seating available. I did stand in line for awhile to order food, but once I ordered, the food came quickly. This is one of the few restaurants in the tenderloin area I would visit again!
author: Fred W.

description:
With a complete dearth of good breakfast options in the Tendernob, I'm rather appreciative of Honey Honey.  

The good:
-large portions of pretty tasty food, including good house potatoes, nice omelettes and decent crepes
-sunny atmosphere
-once order is placed, the food arrives quickly

The not so good:
-on weekends, this place is slammed, and it takes at lest 15 minutes waiting in line to place your order
-staff are a little bit sultry (though I did catch one staffmember rescuing a bird that had made a refuge in the restaurant and releasing it outside.  He got a standing ovation


Final word: the breakfasts here aren't spectacular, but compared to everything else in the vicinity, it's a pretty good choice.
author: Sabrina B.

description:
Fantastic atmosphere with plenty of places to sit. The menu is simple but delicious and the prices are about as good as you can expect in San Francisco. No waiters/waitresses but they do come around to check if you need a refill on your coffee. 

I highly suggest the crab cakes egg florentine. Was the perfect breakfast before a long flight home.
author: Dana S.

description: I come here when I have longer than a half hour lunch break and when I'm craving eggs Benedict. Service is always pretty quick. The restaurant is clean and pretty spacious. Customer service is professional and the food is good.
author: M E.

description: Wonderful food! Great to just stop at and so close to a good part of town! Definitely coming back
author: Erin M.

description:
Delicious!! 
We came here for brunch and the food did not disappoint. 
Thank you, Yelp, for leading us in the right direction!

My friends and I all ordered different breakfast dishes, and we were all raving about the food once we got them.  For a group of ladies who love to chat and catch up, there were definitely moments when the entire group was silent because we were savoring the food. 

Seriously, how could you go wrong with a place named Honey Honey?
author: Nellie T.

description:
Reasons why Honey Honey is a win:
- they asked me how I wanted my eggs poached and then cooked them correctly
- their fruit plate is not melon and grapes; it's strawberries, bananas, apples, and kiwi
- the menu is wicked cheap
author: Kimberley S.

description:
Incredible selection of items--I had a salsa omelette with avocado and it was delicious!!
The server was thoughtful and attentive despite it being a busy Saturday morning for them. The fruit was fresh and the coffee was made just right. My boyfriend was enamored with the selection of beer on the menu and dove right in!!
author: Ritu M.

description: Sun late morning, line out the door & half way down the block. With 25+ people ahead of us in line, the manager approached our party (adults & children) & ushered us to a table while one adult from our party stayed in line to order. Really?! This kind of service is unheard of, but wow! So very thoughtful! We ordered three entrees to share & not a crumb survived. Best way to start the day...a delicious homestyle breakfast in our belly. Delightful neighborhood joint...great vibe with a mix of dates, friends, families.
author: Candace V.

description: We came in well before their closing time and they told us we could only order to go. Ok, fair, I work in a restaurant I understand it sucks to work late. But not only was he personally rude to me while taking my order, he was also condescending and rolled his eyes whenever I added something to my order. Customer service is not fun but if you want to keep your job it's in your best interest to at least be polite to customers. Doubt I will come back.
author: Jessica I.

description: Can you say YUMMY breakfast food?!?! Found this place on yelp since i was staying at the JW half a block down. Belgian waffle with fruit was dead on the spot of to die for! LOL. Seriously! My step daughter got the huevos racheros, which looked amazing and she said tasted splendid. Hot chocolate was great, served in a tall glass and the fresh squeezed OJ was good too. Will be back if i am staying at the JW or in union square.
author: Amanda J.

description: Just not that good. :( slow service, cold food, wrong order first time around. Don't be in a rush when you get here.
author: Will H.

description:
Found this place on yelp while walking down Post St. It's not in the best location ever but about 3 blocks away from Union Square. 

They have a great breakfast menu on the chalkboard on the wall. Crepes, eggs & omelettes. I had the Post St. Omelette, which came with a choice of potatoes or friuits; as well as my choice of sourdough, wheat, and one other type of bread I can't remember. 

The vibe is very laid back. They give you numbers and bring your food to your table when it's ready. All in all, I'd come back if I was in the area again.
author: Leina K.

description:
Grubby and uncared for with bland food -  the best way to describe this place. 

Had a late lunch here at the suggestion of my hotel concierge. Ordered a veggie Mexican salad - very dull, boring and bland with more white tasteless dressing on the edge of the dish than on the salad itself. 

They do some good specialty leaf teas - had the ginger one it was good. Dropped my napkin on the floor, bent to pick it up, but decided to leave it there as floor was very dirty. The table could have done with a proper wipe down. Very, very pleasant smell of molasses soaked shisha tobacco coming from the place next door  a hookah lounge, unless the businesses are related.  

Ok so it is cheap and cheerful-ish but if the front of house needs a good clean, I dread to think what the kitchens are like. I just got the feeling that no-one gives a damn. Maybe I went in on an off-day, or maybe not. I would not return even if it is the closest place to my hotel. When asked by the concierge "how was that for you"? I gave her very honest feedback almost verbatim of what I have written above. I'm not all that picky, so for me to say this it must be down at heel. Oh and to just clear tables and leave the dishes the other side of a divider in the restaurant does tend to encourage flies, as I soon found out being seated close by to this.
author: Barry H.

description: First time eating here, I work across the street and usually go to Joy's but wanted to give Honey Honey a try. I ordered a California sandwich on wheat and when I took the first bite at work the bread was very dry and stale, the condiments and the meat was only applied in the center and leaving the edges dry and tasteless. It was clear the sandwich was not made with any love or care. I could only stomach half of it and brought the other half back after work, after explaining it to the girl at the register I was refused a refund and forced to get another sandwich-at 9:30 at night right before they were about to close. Needless to say the second sandwich was as tasteless as the first(worse than subway sandwiches)I'm very disappointed and this will be my first and last time eating there.
author: Ladywolf M.

description:
Went to this place because it was one of the first, closest breakfast places google maps showed next to our hotel. Boy did we luck out. 

Me and my mom had dessert crepes, strawberry - with and without nutella and other fruit. SO GOOD. Granted crepes are usually amazing in themselves. But some places have managed to screw them up. Not here. We also ordered a croissant sandwich, which was breakfast HEAVEN, and came with potatoes (the real, good stuff) Wish I could go back to San Francisco so we could sample more. Their menu is so full and varied. Sandwiches, soups, breakfast stuff, crepes both savory and dessert.

Only downfall was that the line is crazy long - with the quality of the food I'm not surprised. But the atmosphere of the cafe is really nice - indoor and outdoor seating. They even give you water and freshly squeezed orange juice (you can watch the machine do it) so your wait isn't so bad. :) Definitely a must go if you're in the Union Square Area of San Francisco!
author: Mariya P.

description: We have dreams about Honey Honey.  This is the golden standard for crepes as far as my children are concerned.   If we didn't live 3,000 miles away we would eat here several times a week.  Whenever we are in the bay area we pilgrimage to Honey Honey. Yes the line is sometimes long and it can be a little daunting trying to snag a table.  However, the food is excellent and the portions are generous.  Eggs Benedict, a sandwich on Tiger bread, and of course, crepes savory or sweet.  Get an Orangina to wash it down with, and it's even better!
author: Maria H.

description:
Really enjoyed this place, we stayed on union square last weekend and ate here every morning of our stay( way better than any 4 star hotel offerings)

      Morning 1: huevos rancheros = eggs cooked perfectly however not much to dish.. Beans were watery.
-Latte was very nice and great oj

     Morning 2: breakfast crepe (no onions & substituted chicken sausage for ham)
This was good, I've had better,I would not order it again. Drip coffee ok( latte better)

    Morning 3: stage coach omelette(?)
Capers cream cheese & smoked salmon= YUM! Hands down my favorite omelette ever!  Next time we eat there I will know what to order ! 
      Also the fruit cup is awesome ( fresh fruit cut to order! None of that 3 day old slimy melon most diners offer
 
So this place was crazy busy however the food came out super fast and they were very accommodating considering,they were swamped and we had a toddler !
author: I D.

description:
Lots of vegetarian options. Simple, basic butter and sugar creep, must try.

Multiple  eggs Benedict  varieties - crab cakes are a must have.  

Fresh cucumber and mint water

Very nice service.
author: Mike M.

description: I came here with a purpose. I've had a craving for a Nutella crepe and this was the only place open past 3pm. Most creperies close after lunch. As for the crepe, it was ok. Nothing mind blowing. My 3 year old liked the ice cream more than the crepe and I liked the bananas more than the Nutella. You could say I was disappointed but my craving is gone so I guess it wasn't a complete waste of walking up ridiculously steep hills 4 months pregnant pushing a stroller.
