I had the croissant sandwich (egg, ham, cheese and a side of potatoes) and a soy latte; all good. I have to give them 3 stars because my husband's eggs benedict was overcooked - the yolk was completely solid and not runny at all.
author: Heather D.

description: We've been in line to take an order for ore than 15 minutes and still no movement.  They have waitress and cooks standing around but cannot take orders and money in any efficient way.   One person that must be incompetent doing it as only 2 folks orders have been taken in the 15 minutes.   RUN....
author: Linda K.

description: Meh. My family and I came for breakfast. The decor and ambiance were great, but all of our food was overcooked. Burnt pancakes, overcooked eggs Benedict, and soggy waffles. I probably will not return to Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery.
author: Ryan N.

description:
Pros
1- Florentine poached eggs with spinach was Delicious!
2- Coffee was fresh

Cons
1- I personally dont like styles where I have to stand in line to order my food then fight for a table. 
2- My dish came with 'potatoes' once i received I realized it was Rosemary potatoes. I don't like Rosemary as it is a very potent herb. Better description is in order

I'd recommend and totally come back.
author: Guio L.

description: The potatoes are way too salty! This place is such a tourist trap.  The food is not good and overpriced for the amount you get. I won't be returning here again.
author: Alisha R.

description: We went here Sunday morning after a night out on Saturday. So, what we needed. Sometimes you just need a good breakfast/brunch to get over a night of drinking. My husband ordered the chorizo and eggs and I had the Breakfast Crepe. Both were tasty. We both got potatoes with our meals and both agreed that whatever seasoning they put on the potatoes ruins them. If you don't like a lot of seasoning, stay away from those. Everything else was cool, though.
author: Carina R.

description: This was close to our hotel , Hotel Rex. Get there early if you want indoor seating. You stand in  line, place your order, sit and they bring it to you. This gives you plenty of time to change your mind at least three times. Good selection of food. I thought I couldn't go wrong with the strawberry crepes since the word crepe is in the restaurant name, wrong! my husband and I both ordered the crepes me the strawberry and him the mix fruit one. I looked around and saw that the french toast seemed to be popular but still ordered the crepes. I'm accustomed to IHop crepes. The crepe was dry! The only thing that saved the plate was the side of fresh whip cream and the bacon. A teaspoon of fruit and less than that of any sauce. Not worth the price and I believe it was one medium size crepe. I would not order this plate again. I would go back and try one more item, the french toast. Service was quick, clean place and large menu are the plus here.
author: Bonita R.

description:
Ended up coming here for brunch and I enjoyed it. I ordered the Miami Heat crepe which is basically chicken, melted cheddar cheese, and topped off with their hot sauce/ salsa. The service was quick and the prices were quite decent. 

I would like to try their mimosas or even their Bloody Mary! Definitely coming back!
author: Andrew A.

description: I went here twice while on holiday a few weeks ago. My and my girlfriends experience was nothing but positive. The first time I had a burger and fries take away. The burger was big juicy and delicious, the fries curly crispy on the outside and yummy. It was well priced also. The second time I went there was to meet a friend. I had a couple of pints of there Ale, the price was good! And used there free wifi.
author: Joshua M.

description:
After another late start leading to another first meal of the day after the noon hour, I was psyched to find this sandwich shop/crepery with free wi-fi a couple of blocks from my hotel.  Excuse me, but I just  don't feel like paying $12.95 for the Internet back at the Hilton, especially because I changed hotels from another Hilton that had free wi-fi, but I digress.  Plus being out among the San Franciscans (and numerous other tourists) sure beats being holed up in my room with the TV anyway.

First impressions here though were slightly misleading.  Checking in I yelped, "Start me off right with with FRESH SQEEZED OJ!"  This place had nowhere to go but down from 5 stars with a start like that.  Coffee was good and strong and refills can be had just by bringing your cup back up to the counter where orders are placed.  I was in the mood for pancakes or French toast and when I saw the special was granola pancakes with apples I was intrigued enough to go off the regular menu's pancake offering of pancakes with fresh fruit.  Bad move on my part!  The apple slices were cooked and then suspended in some overly corn starched almost glue like rubbery concoction, which was plopped on top of my pancakes.  I was honestly tempted to send it back because it was just so unappetizing, something I almost never do.  Still, I was famished and it certainly tasted OK.

I've noticed from using Yelp out here in the Bay Area that folks seem quite pleased with places rated 3 stars.  Truly A-OK.  Makes me realize once again that I generally grade on a curve and want to give places good ratings and I'm a generous grader (though in line with most of my Yelp friends back home).  So absorbing the SF ethos, this place is just fine.  I'll admit I ordered the wrong thing, but I'm also happy with the experience overall, especially as I've been sitting here about 3 plus hours enjoying the wi-fi, coffee refills, and the overall vibe of this relaxed, friendly place.
author: Sean M.

description:
Been here twice on two separate trips up to SF.  Like the food enough to keep going back.  HUGE menu.  Yummy flavored water.  
Line gets a little long sometime, but I've never been in a rush during a visit. 
Very yummy salmon crepe (a little over salty) but it is smoked salmon.
author: Adria C.

description: My second time there.  Very good place for breakfast.  Crepes are really good.  Bacon looks terrible, but actually tastes amazing.  Refills on coffee.  Service is average, neither great nor bad.  Got there early so it wasn't too crowded, but it was getting busy by the time I left.
author: Jake K.

description: Our hotel recommended Honey, Honey and even though we had to wait in line for 20+ minutes it was worth the wait. I had the Florentine Benedict and my husband Eggs Benedict with fresh squeezed orange juice. Very good!
author: Joanne R.

description: Our Hotel recommended this place and we are glad they did. Amazing food! Couldn't decide between The Original, Miami Heat or the cheesesteak; they all sounded delicious. I went with the heat and it was gooood!  Highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the Union Square area.
author: Jason D.

description: This place honestly doesn't even deserve one star. First of all: the staff is so rude. I get it- You're busy but being an asshole to your customers often leads to a review something like this. Second: my Bloody Mary was vodka and tomato juice. Thirdly: they didn't have enough pint glasses clean and it took 20 minutes to get our beer after we sat down. Lastly: there was a shard of glass the size of a dime in my meal. They remade it, incorrectly I might add, and didn't offer to refund us or at least buy us a drink or desert of any kind. It was dirty, the tables sat with plates of food on them for long after the customers left, they were too busy and understaffed. I've worked in restaurants for 6 years, it's just really not that hard.
author: Kassi M.

description: Had a very enjoyable breakfast! Eggs Florentine were delicious! And the coffee was great! Cute place for a casual meal. Fresh juice, fruit infused water. I'd definitely go there again!
author: Bek S.

description:
This neighborhood place is divine! The food is fresh and delicious. The portions are perfect. I have tried the Post Street omlette, the crab cakes florentine, the sunset buritto, and the salmon eggs. All are perfectly cooked and the ingredients are excellent quality. The fruit is fresh and perfectly ripened, however I get the potatoes instead - they are perfection! The bloody mary's are excellent - ask for a little extra spice. The orange juice made by the machine is sooooo good.
Don't be intimidated by the line. If it's at the door, you will wait about 15 minutes but it's worth it. There are a couple tables outside - if it's a sunny day, sit there and people watch. You are near Union Square so there is great traffic.
author: Dusty S.

description:
Great selection of crepes, omelettes, sandwiches, salads.  I was very excited when looking at the plentiful, colorful chalkboard menu.  Central location if you're looking for something near Union Square.

However they only get 3 stars due to: 1) Both savory crepes we ordered were way too cheesy.  2) Tea pot tip was cracked so leakage happening with tea.  3) cappuccino was more like a latte and tepid temperature.

Perhaps other menu choices would have been better.  Tough to say since we've only been here once.

Also get here before 10:00am on a weekend.  After that the line gets long.
author: N V.

description:
Gimme a crepe, gimme a crepe.. *insert kit kat bar theme here*

The banana nutella crepe was okay except 1) the bananas were cooked, which was a little weird and 2) they skimped on the nutella.  I could barely taste it.

I give this place three stars because presentation was good, the crepe was fine (but not super), the service was good, and their huge selection makes me want to come back and try something else.
author: Jeanie C.

description: Try the Belgian waffle.  Comes w a lot of fruit!
author: Alex B.

description:
Yummy, busy, reasonable prices, neat menu. Maybe a little bit cramped.

You pay at the counter, get a number, and find a table (if you're lucky). We went on a Sunday morning and it was so busy I was worried we wouldn't find one, but we did, and everyone else seemed to also. However, the (constant) line forms amidst the tables, so I can imagine if had been seated among the butts that might have been annoying. 

My Mediterranean Crepe with fruit was delicious. The barrista totally jacked up my latte (full of grounds) but they made it again without too much fuss. The food came out fast, even on a busy weekend. My 4 table-mates all enjoyed their food. The Eggs Benedict and Tofu Scramble that they got looked particularly good.

I really liked the breakfast options on the menu and I had a hard time deciding - there were a lot of things I wanted to try. Also, for those who prefer a vegetarian breakfast there were more fun options than you might find at other places.

We were tourists staying in Union Square, and as far as a convenient, yummy, nearby breakfast, this was the best spot we found. I hear Dottie's is also amazing but it was too busy. We also tried Golden Coffee, but per my other review it was yummy but super grubby.

I will definitely go back to Honey Honey next time I'm in the area.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I popped in here with the boyfriend after visiting John Pence gallery on 750 Post. Read good things on yelp.

Tried the crepes Suzette, delicious! I believe we had a burger as well. Everything was low key with a little bit of themed charm. The (free) water with lemon and mint was fun! Everything was cooked to order. Yummy!
author: Lana P.

description: Food is ok,  lines are long, limited seating and today forced a disabled vet out of a table.  So not recommend if you want prompt, courteous service.
author: Rick B.

description: I would give solid 4 stars for the quality of crepes and 1 star for the interior. Dark place which makes you feel really uncomfortable ..
author: Jas A.

description: This review is a bit overdue :) ... Very busy when we went, which is always a good sign. They have a pretty expansive menu. Waited in line and ended up ordering a Chicken crepe. It was difficult to find a table but we eventually did. Expect to wait when it is busy. Overall, experience was fine. Nothing good to say and nothing bad.
author: Christi K.

description:
Excellent Philly cheesesteak sandwich to-go. It was reasonably quick, included seasoned fries, and was not messy at all. (Perfect, since I had to eat it while walking back to the office.) The restaurant has a nice, Mediterranean atmosphere and plenty of seating. If I'm in the area again for lunch, it'll definitely be on my short-list.

TRIVIA: While honey is an obvious source of carbohydrate (sugar)-based energy, it also has great benefits for skin and hair. It's a natural humectant (attracts and retains moisture) and has antimicrobial properties. Consider mixing some in with your shampoo or body wash!
author: Bill B.

description:
Hmmm... maybe I need to try the savory crepes but the SBK (strawberry banana and kiwi) crepe did not do it for me.

Breakfast, on the other hand, was pretty good. The crab cake flourtine was nicely cooked with delicious seasoned potatoes. Hollandaise sauce wasn't overpowering. Fresh squeezed OJ was much needed after the previous day's pub crawl.

The line here is just crazy. We made it just before the rush and that line was out the door for over an hour. Grabbing a table can be a battle. Have part of your group in line to order and the other half scoping out tables to pounce on! The staff does a good job asking people at the front of the line if they were able to grab a table too.
author: Ken N.

description:
Long wait to order, but deeeeelicious.  Just be sure to grab a table as soon as one opens up.  I had the North Beach crepe, and it was great...although very Swiss cheesy (which is nothing but fine with me).  The house coffee was surprisingly good.  
Free wifi, but there's such a crowd that I felt too guilty to get my computer out and work like I'd planned.
author: Shannon H.

description:
First time in The City, where my whole trip wasn't dictated!  So, my girl and I spun our Urbanspoon app and this came up.  Thankfully it did, because this place was EXCELLENT!  We had the crab cake eggs benedict and a refreshing "Orangina".  Just the drink alone, would've made the trip to this place worth it.  Orangina?!  Sounds like an STD.  "Dude, how was Cali?"  "It was good the first couple of days, till I hooked up with this chick and caught Orangina."
All in all, if you're in the city and want to try something new, come here!
author: Monica T.

description: Yelpers helped up pick this place while we were vacationing in SF. It has a Mediterranean feel & theme, the menu had a nice variety but wasn't overwhelming (ie Cheesecake Factory). Solid 4 stars so if it's a toss up between here and another so-so reviewed spot, this ones a go!
author: Scott A.

description:
I had a big craving for crepes and was definitely satisfied by coming here. It's a cute lil restaurant on the corner of Post and Taylor. It was a convenient walk from Union Square where my friend and I were doing some shopping. The menu had a great variety of choices. Sweet and savory crepes, brunch items, burgers, and pastas. 

I ordered the New Orleans crepe which had chicken, mushrooms, sun-dried tomoatoes and jack cheese. It also came with a choice of potatoes, salad, or fruit. My friend had a sweet crepe, the SBK (strawberry, banana, and kiwi) which also came with a scoop of ice cream. They had complimentary cucumber/lemon or strawberry/orange infused water. 

This place is clean, cute, and convenient. Two filling and delicious crepes for $16.00. I'd definitely come back.
author: Lynn V.

description: This place was right next to my hotel and I was craving breakfast midday. Not sure how there are any negative reviews because this place is awesome! Great food and friendly service!
author: Victor G.

description: Ate here two days in a row because we liked it so much. Especially loved the fresh squeezed juice!
author: Aj M.

description: Yummy Yummy Yummy. Huge breakfast menu. Come on an empty stomach. Portions are huge so be prepared.
author: Renaud F.

description: The food could be good, however, watch out for the sandwiches. A turkey sandwich comes with one slice of turkey, pertaining to the employees that is how much comes on a sandwich; ONE SLICE?! If I wanted to eat toast that's what I would of ordered, it would of been much cheaper. Don't do it!!!
author: Allison W.

description: Came here for Sunday brunch and couldn't decide from the many items -- so I got both a sweet and savory option. I ended up getting the crab cake Florentine and the banana crepe with an iced chai. The food was excellent. I was especially impressed with the crab cake Florentine. Eggs were cooked perfectly. For some reason they give you the choice between soft and not soft, but if you like eggs benedict, get the SOFT option for sure. It came with home fries that were well seasoned and great with hot sauce. The banana crepe was also very good. You can have it with whipped cream or ice cream, but I got it plain. The iced chai was so good I almost went back for another. Atmosphere: the place has plenty of seating though I hear it can get crowded. It IS lively (aka a bit loud for those of you looking for a quiet spot). Just call in advance like I did and ask what the wait is like. It is perfectly acceptable for a single person to get a table here. Order at the counter and they will give you your beverage and a number, then grab a seat. I would definitely return here as there are many other offerings than just breakfast food and crepes. The sandwiches looked great as I ogled from my table. Delicious.
author: Presh C.

description: We enjoyed breakfast two times here while visiting San Francisco. It was fantastic with quick service.
author: Erik Birch A.

description: We go to honey honey anytime we are in S.F. It small and busy but the food is great and the staff is super nice! Great place for breakfast!
author: Katy S.

description: Walked 2 miles with small kids to get to this place.  Arrived to a long long line.  The kids were tired and needed to sit but the server who I'm pretty sure was the owner's son wouldn't let my kids sit.  He said we have to order before we can sit.  If we don't agree with their "system" we can find another place to eat.  What great customer service.  We ate there anyways because we didn't know where else to go.  After all that of course they got our orders wrong.  Ambiance ugly and food nothing special.  I would have probably enjoyed more eating at IHOP.
author: Naghmeh G.

description:
A couple blocks from the Hyatt, Honey Honey is a solid SF Breakfast establishment.  You wait in line to order, find a table, and the food is brought to you.  The line was pretty long this morning, so it took us 15 minutes just to order.  Fortunately, we were able to quickly find a table and sit while we waited for the order.

The first food to arrive at the table was the coffee and chocolate milk.  I didn't like the coffee at all (however Rabia did and she was the one who ordered it), but the chocolate milk was better then average.

When are food arrived, I was reminded of what an awesome meal breakfast can be. Especially when you are eating as a family and sharing food.  We shared chocolate pancakes, beef burrito, potatoes (highly recommended) and the 2 & 2 (pancakes, eggs etc..).  Yummy!  It was the perfect way to start the day, and by the time it was done we were stuffed and smiling!
author: Iftikhar K.

description:
Honey Honey is a cute little spot to stop for any meal of the day. I do recommend going there for breakfast/brunch, however, their lunch and dinner is excellent as well. The line can be long during the breakfast hour, but it's worth the wait, and super well priced for being so close to Union Square. 

It is a very casual, order and take a number style place, that has the menu written huge on the wall. Perfect place to just stop into when you don't feel like taking super long to eat and be served. 

My favorites include, but are not limited to the following:
-Salmon Benedict
-Eden Crepe
-#7 Bagel
-Chicken and Pesto Crepe

Hangover cure: Try an Italian Soda!
author: Ashley M.

description: Food was delicious, but ordering and standing in line for half and hour was why this place didn't get the 5.
author: Elma M.

description: Decent breakfast stop with pretty much your average diner options. The cafe itself is pretty cute. It is located a bit down a side street nestled between a handful of hostels making it a pretty popular breakfast spot. Although the food was decent, there are so many other more delicious options to try around the city that I wouldn't go back.
author: Jill Z.

description:
After two times here, the conclusion is:

Better for breakfast than lunch.

Eggs, omelettes, pancakes and fresh squeezed orange juice are all worth coming back for.

But the sandwiches and burgers and salads were average at best.

The Chicken Parmesan was odd tasting - why mess with a great dish like that?  First time I have ever seen a Chicken Parmesan with chopped up bell peppers in it.  My daughter didn't even finish it, which pretty much says it all.

The Turkey-Apple-Avocado sandwich is a good idea.  But for nearly $9 bucks JUST for the sandwich, there should be enough avocado or even apple to actually taste.

Even the overpriced Ferry Building has a place in there that makes a way better sandwich for less money (sorry can't remember the name).

But at least the Honey Honey is in a handy location and has plenty of inside seating if you're looking for a breakfast alternative to Sear's Fine Food or Lori's Diner.
author: Lewis C.

description:
Mhmm crepes!!

My residence is very close to this restaurant and I ate there several times. Every morning when I go to school I see a lot of people in line for breakfast, but I never tried this.

I tried several crepes and one time one burger too. You can choose between different kind of crêpes, sandwich, saladas or burger. Everything is delicious and the owner (I think the the man in the counter it's the owner) he's very nice.

Finally, it's very good place, for dinner or for eat something sweet after dinner and it's very cheap :-)
author: Valeria R.

description:
Cute space, it seems a bit small for the amount of people that are there every time we stop by for brunch, but we always manage to end up getting seats.

A-OK is definitely how I'd describe it. Not the best brunch I've ever had, but I keep going back. A-OK waffles (the waffle aficionado of our group was not impressed, but still ate all of it), A-OK french toast (the french toast aficionado, aka me, thought it was too dry for her taste, and there was a lot of it), A-OK huevos rancheros, A-OK sandwich, A-OK $3.50 glass of freshly squeezed OJ, all around A-OKness!

And whoever had our table before us left their newspaper - reading up on world affairs (or photo apps and the new google offers) while waiting for my food is always a plus!
author: Kim B.

description: Food is crazy good and the prices even better. Also big portions. Had the Acapulco scramble which was delicious.
author: Martha C.

description: Worth every penny!!! So delicious with wonderful options! We just got the egg and ham on a croissant but it was amazing! Like an omelette on a croissant! The crepes looked amazing as well. I'm tempted to break my rule of only going to eat at a restaurant once when visiting a new city. Usually I like to experience as many places as possible, but as I wait in this interminable line at Mamas, I'm regretting not going back to this place. Review on Mamas will be forthcoming.....
author: Katie P.

description: Visited this place this past weekend for breakfast with a big group and it was great. The place was packed when we got there, which I hear is pretty much the norm. Ordering took a while as they only have one cashier/register and there was a line out the door. However, she was super friendly and really organized. I myself ordered the salmon benedict on whole wheat toast, while others in my group ordered the salmon scramble, strawberries and nutella crepe, bagels and cream cheese, eggs over easy,  and another salmon and eggs dish. Despite the crowd we received the food pretty quickly.  Our order was spot on and delicious.  Service was wonderfully friendly and efficient and coffee was great too. Would definitely recommend if you're in the Union Square area.
author: Seher K.

description:
I can't really comment on the service, because this place, like Crepevine, is an order-at-the counter and have the food served to you kind of place.
The savory crepes come in large portions, so it's definitely a good value for the price.  The crepes are pretty decent, but it seems the focus is more on the filling and less on the crepe itself.  They have a pretty large menu, so it's hard to go wrong if you are dining with any picky eaters.
EXCELLENT fresh-squeezed OJ (they have a juicer machine which creates a very flavorful glass.  The coffee is just ok...nothing to write home about.  One plus is that this place is pretty large as breakfast places go, so there's never too long of a line, and I've never had a problem getting seated.
author: Nina B.

description: Seemed a bit overpriced for what they were serving (e.g. the sugar and butter crepe being just over $5...) and I didn't feel fully satisfied with how it tasted in the end. Options looked interesting, but I didn't feel the taste was worthy of the price. Then again, I did only order one small crepe.
author: Varsha S.

description: Very good, I had the baklava crepe with ice cream and it did not disappoint. Took about 5 minutes to receive order, cash only no credit
author: Toby T.

description: This place is cute and convenient for a quick lunch or brunch . Would definitely recommend their daily specials. Its cheap, quick and good food what more can you ask for?
author: Claudine V.

description:
We found this place on Yelp because it was within walking distance of our hotel. The line wasn't too bad and we found out you don't need to worry about a table until you give your order. 

I ordered the Strawberry crepe with fresh orange juice and it was all extremely delicious. Everyone else in my group loved their breakfast choices and I loved all the options on the menu. I would definitely come back to this place if I'm ever in San Fran again!
author: A K.

description: California Cuisine at it's best. Expansive menu- I could eat here for a month straight and leave satisfied every day. Especially love their crepes and the black bean soup.  Extra points for any restaurant that throws fruit in their free water!
author: Kat T.

description: Amazing!  Anything, but typical breakfast fare. The salmon benedict, strawberry Nutella crepes, coffee and fresh-squeezed orange juice were beyond my expectations.
author: Adam H.

description: Peanut butter and chocolate crepe was good, but it took 20 minutes. There was apparently a mistake on the order that caused the delay; got two brownies on the house
author: Thomas L.

description: Food Good, Service Bad. My MIL, SIL & I were in the city for a girls shopping trip & decided to stop by for brunch. My Chicken Pesto Crepe, SIL's Eggs Benedict & MIL's Lemon Crepe were all very good. Unfortunately, the girls at the register were rude. They behaved as if customers were bothering them. I ordered a Mocha, which didn't make it to our table, so I approached the counter to see if it was forgotten. The server simply re-steamed a some leftover Mocha & poured it in a glass. Yuck.
author: Samantha J.

description:
I love the Nutella & strawberry crepe, the end.

Seriously though, majorly awesome crepes here. I love the selection and atmosphere. You order in line then find a seat, we were lucky enough to find a seat on a Sunday morning.

My friend ordered the eggplant savory crepe and I had the Nutella & strawberry crepe and an iced Chai tea, which was absolutely delicious and I lived with no such guilt after eating such things. Yum, in a word.

There might be a slight wait but it's worth it.
author: Nicole S.

description: Had a wonderful brunch with the family here...the food was great, we were able to get a table for 6 quickly and the staff checked on our table frequently....we all enjoyed this cafe!!
author: Marilyn G.

description:
San Francisco may have better to offer, but in this part of the city, Honey Honey is a solid choice for families and tourists. On my visit, service was speedy, the place was clean and comfortable. 

My savoy crepe was nothing spectacular, but just fine. The sweet crepe I had was definitely that -- sweet. Any hint of strawberry and cheese flavor was knocked out with bland syrupy sweetness. I would have liked to find more fresh fruit in the crepe, instead of just sugar overload. Two bites and I was bouncing of the walls!
author: Ryan L.

description: Had the Crab Cake Florentine and a Mimosa. Spectacular!  Great service and extensive menu. This is a "must visit" for anyone coming to San Francisco.
author: Mike P.

description:
Yeah, I'm not from around these parts, so a homey cafe with a chalkboard menu and gads of soups, salads, sandwiches, large tea selection and brunch items kinda blows my mind! We don't have too many of these places in Vegas, so I may get a little over-excited when I encounter such an establishment.

You can definitely find something for everyone here. They even have a tofu sandwich! I went with a vegetarian chili and Greek salad combo. I must admit I was a little jealous of the items that came out with home fries, but I still enjoyed my selection. The vegetarian chili could have had a bit more kick, but I finished every last bite. And, I especially enjoyed the super crusty French bread. I sipped on a flavored, fresh brewed iced tea served with an orange slice. First class hydration. My dining companion was not thrilled with his pasta, so it might be best to stick to the more standard soup, salad and breakfast items. 

All of the food came out quickly, so no complaints regarding service. All in all a perfect little spot to jump into for a quick brunchy bite!
author: Misti Y.

description:
Visited Honey Honey on two occasions during a recent trip to San Fran.  The first was a quick stop to grab a latte one afternoon (pretty decent latte!).  While grabbing the coffee, we were impressed with their extensive menu and had noted that morning that there was a line out the door (obvy a popular spot) so we decided to return the next morning for brunch.

The menu at Honey squared is extensive - they have a full range of standard breakfast items (omelettes, eggs benny, pancakes, etc), of course crepes (both sweet and savoury) as well as a bunch of other non-breakfast fair (sandwiches, pastas). 

I was seriously craving some sweet breakfast, so I opted for the strawberry nutella crepe, while my dining partner had the croissant breakfast sandwich. 

I noticed they had both banana nutella crepes and strawberry nutella crepes on the menu for the same price, so I asked if I could get bananas and strawberries in my crepe. They could do it, but for an extra fee (I didn't pay attention to how much but no more than a dollar or two) - which I obliged to given I wanted that straw-nana goodness.  The fee was a little annoying, but I guess when you crank out as many breakfasts as they do and have such an extensive menu, you need some way to deter people for customizations.

NOTE:  the way this place works is you line up, order and pay, they give you a number, you find a table and then they deliver your meal to you once it is ready. Therefore, if you are feeling real lazy or want to be waited on hand and foot, this is probably not your spot.  But, if you want a decent breakfast without all the fuss, this is your spot.

There was a bit of a line - but that is to be expected for any good breakfast spot on Sundays during brunch hour.

My crepe was pretty good - although they probably could have been heavier handed with the fruit. Overall, it was not huge but definitely filled me up for breaky.  My companion enjoyed his croissant, indicating the egg/ham/cheese filling was great but the croissant itself could have been flakier (he knows his croissants).

I tried some of his hash brown potatoes and they were delish - love that they put rosemary in there.

I would definitely return to Honey Honey when back in SF for both my sweet and savory breakfast needs.
author: Katherine K.

description: We went to this place twice. Once for breakfast. The Crab Cake Florentine was really good. Went back for dessert crepes that night. Our son wants to eat here for every meal. Good luck finding a seat, but it's worth it.
author: Brendan S.

description: Loved this breakfast stop! You order at the front, take a number, and they bring the food to you. It isn't like typical breakfast places where someone waits on you. Also, be prepared for a line, sometimes out the door. But it's well-worth the wait! Omelettes, waffles, crepes, pretty much any way you can imagine. We had a banana nut crepe and a southwest style omelette. Highly recommend!
author: Holly E.

description: Perfect for a weekday breakfast.  Visiting San Francisco for a few days. This place was convenient to our hotel and the line and the wait weren't too bad. Less than 10 minutes from walking in to ordering and another 5-10 for our food to be delivered. My partner had the eggplant crepe and I had the chorizo scramble. Both were delicious and amply portioned. Will definitely keep this place in mind for future trips to the Bay area.
author: Edward N.

description: Just ate there!! Got the cancan burger and some crepes. Burger was good and crepes were amazing!! Menu was a bit vast but I liked it. Would definitely recommend for all that visit!!
author: Victor C.

description: Excellent menu, excellent food, excellent bloody mary. Gets crowded by 9 am, but large enough to.find seats for a breakfast crowd. Fine option to choose for you!
author: Anthony C.

description:
I must confess I've never had any of their dessert crepes. I've only had the ones stuffed with meat. It's an okay place for breakfast or brunch, catching up with family or friends. Or if you just happened to be in the area. It's not the best place to have meetings or work with a laptop, despite offering WiFi.

I love the variety of choices in food and I love how everything is named after a place in San Francisco. I love the water dispenser with cucumber, lemon or orange soaked in the water. 

The place is quite big and I've never had problems with finding a table.
author: Jaclyn A.

description:
Oh Honey, your crepes are divine. The Breakfast Crepe that I ordered was definitely savory as your chalk board menu suggests. And your potatoes were the perfect side dish. The fresh squeezed OJ could have been a little sweeter but other than that my meal was great.

My only beef with you, Honey, is that you made my friends wait an inordinate amount of time for their food. We had finished our entire meal before they even caught a glimpse of theirs which made all of us a tad on the irritable side. 

You're pretty close to my residence so there's no doubt that I'll be making another appearance but I'd appreciate it if you got your act together before my return. 

P.S. I saw you throw out that nice man's meal before he was done. Tisk, tisk...
author: Julia N.

description:
I found this place because apparently this is where the majority of the staff from Hotel Adagio goes to lunch on occasion.  I was so thankful for this suggestion.

They have a great selection of breakfast foods and sandwiches mainly.  I actually ended up coming here twice and had two different sandwiches which were both delicious.  You also have the choice of a side of fruit, salad or maybe chips.  There is Wifi that you can use so I can see people stopping here to accomplish some work or homework or just want to read a book.

I was fortunate not to experience a line, but have a feeling this place could be quite popular.  There is the option of take out or to dine-in.

Definitely if you're looking for somewhere to satiate your hunger with something simple, this would be a good place to check out!
author: Anna Z.

description:
Every time I crave a crêpe, I immediately head over to Honey Honey. It's a cute, low key spot with a wide selection of delicious dishes, including breakfast specials, dessert crêpes, savory crêpes, salads, sandwiches, pastas and burgers. I

I brought a a friend who was visiting San Francisco to Honey Honey and she fell in love with the breakfast specials. I personally love the crêpes, both dessert and savory! I haven't tried them all yet, but the ones I have tried have always been satisfying. I shall definitely return!
author: Michelle L.

description: Great selection, great food; fast and delicious. The cappuccino was great too. Easy to find a seat. The union square area is great too! Holy crepe, I'm coming back.
author: Michael A.

description: The food was good but that is where it stops. The staff are unpleasant and poorly managed. After waiting in line for over 20 minutes to order I received no apology but actually a very cold unwelcoming attitude. I won't be coming back due to this whole experience. Many other negative things occurred but I don't have the space to write about all of them. My recommendation is find another place to eat.
author: Garrett S.

description: If you're an egg person, that's your place, despite the name of the place. So, three fried eggs, sunny side up with ham and pepperjack cheese on the side like I asked, and a coffee for under $9... I guess that settles it for me - if I'm in the area in the morning, I'm having breakfast here.
author: Vadim T.

description: Favorite spot for breakfast in SF when my GF visit for the weekend. Conveniently located near Union Square. Consistently great food and service!
author: James B.

description: Took my best friend here from Chicago to grab some breakfast for the long day of exploring the city of SF. I had been here before and was satisfied so decided to take him here also for breakfast. We both got the eggs benedict which was very tasty and filling. Fresh Orange Juice!
author: Kyle R.

description:
Yummy eggs benedict but wasn't feeling the OJ. It tasted gritty and watery and for almost $4 w/ no refill?! I'll pass.
The salad was your typical American diner salad. 

Just came here on a whim after I got back from a job interview and I was craving breakfast food. But the food was expensive.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Got the 2-2-2 pancake, eggs and bacon it was the bomb will come back for me breakfast again nice Service and great food
author: Daniel B.

description: I have been passing by this place for a few years now. Just never had time to go here you know. Me and my homie went here and we both got the breakfast special crepes. Pretty good. Only for $8 a piece you can't beat that. I really loved how fast we received our food too. And we went yesterday which was Saturday and not to mention fellaz a lot of beautiful women with shorts shorts eat here. (In my quagmires voice giggity giggity alright)
author: Tareau B.

description: Pretty good crepes! Not the best I've ever had, but for ten bucks it's pretty dang good! I got the half Moon bay crepe that has a crab cake inside, who ever heard of a crab cake inside of a crepe! It's just about as unhealthy and delicious as it sounds. I would come back.
author: anna s.

description: Decent, but it's pretty hard to mess up breakfast. The Bloody Mary was awful, it tasted like tomato juice and Tabasco with cheap vodka.  Salmon Benedict was tasty, but oddly it was barely warm.  Maybe it is possible to mess up breakfast.  Latte was average.
author: Brandon K.

description:
Very good food, great prices, not too long a wait. What more can you ask for? The Nutella Banana walnut crepe comes with ICE CREAM. And it's $6.75. Lots of delicious and affordable options including a yummy salmon cream cheese omelet plate for $10. 

My only complaint is that the seating is pretty uncomfortable, but I guess that's how they keep the tables moving!
author: Kelly R.

description:
Stumbled upon this place looking for a good, but not too pricey brunch.  Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery totally delivered! They have a really extensive menu - whether you are in the mood for breakfast, lunch or a crepe they have you covered. 

Me and my friend each got breakfast meals and they were great - especially the sausage! We also ordered the nutella and banana crepe for desert - it was amazing.  

They also have pretty decent mimosas for a good price.  I would definitely check out this place again if I was in the area.
author: Corinne N.

description: Had the salmon scramble and she had the salmon Benedict. As for my grub, perfectly cooked salmon with light and fluffy eggs topped with chives accompanied by potatoes and THE best sourdough slices I've ever had! 5 bottles of champagne and freshly squeezed orange juice to boot equals a wonderful brunch on a crisp and cold Sunday morning in San Francisco.
author: Ricky B.

description: I just stopped by this place to get some breakfast food. At the time it was not busy at all - nobody in front of my in line and most of the workers relaxing. I placed an order for a two and two and two and the guy at the register said no need to pay now for it now have a seat and we'll serve you once the food is ready. I waited about half an hour for them to serve me my food. Then I finally asked the man at the counter and the cashier had gone on break without telling anybody about my order. Getting breakfast food is my pride and joy on saturdays and wasting half an hour of my life due to a lazy cashier was upsetting so I walked out.
author: Nivay A.

description: don't get anything togo, they skimp out on YOUR portion. I always get the post street omelet, got it togo this time. It looks like half the usual size. SHADY!!
author: Tuan B.

description: Without a doubt this was the worst breakfast experience I have ever had in San Francisco. After ordering my family and I waited for over an hour for food. When the food finally arrived it came out staggered. My mom received her waffle and it was luke warm and chewy. My aunt ordered bacon and eggs, simple enough. Although she did want them at the same time. She received her eggs first and 15 minutes later received her bacon.. Meanwhile my father and I still hadn't received our orders and when we asked on them he said their was a problem in the kitchen. However, tables all around us who sat down after our table were served and finished eating before our food ever arrived. It wasn't worth the hour wait. I wouldn't wait 5 minutes for this poorly cooked sad excuse for a crepe in my life. Mostly I'm sad I wasted the time, money and calories on honey honey. I understand a busy kitchen, I do work in a restaurant but this was beyond unacceptable.
author: Sarah M.

description: Such a delicious little find! I had the SBK (strawberry, banana, kiwi) crepe and it was excellent! Hubby had the half moon bay crepe and said it was excellent. I ate most of his breakfast potatoes, which were AMAZING! We'll likely be back tomorrow for breakfast.
author: Sarah D.

description:
Looking for some seriously good and seriously satisfying food?!

Come to Honey Honey Cafe.

They have quite possibly the most expansive menu I have seen.  Everything from crepes, to omelets, to hot and cold cereal and even dinner (spaghetti, etc)!  

This would be a great place to recover from a hangover...hehe

The service is quick and the food is lightning fast!

I had the most amazing vegetarian friendly omelet and opted to get fruit instead of potatoes on the side.  So refreshing.  My boyfriend had a benedict and he practically licked the freakin plate.

They have two kinds of fruit-flavored waters (orange and lemon), which were so super refreshing, and free!

This place is a great escape from the ridiculous tourist-y priced places in the neighborhood and it won't be the last time that we come here!

As we were leaving, I saw a poster on the window for $9 beer buckets (I think- 5 bottles to a bucket or something)...not too bad for happy hour!

SIDE NOTE:  The only down side to this place is it gets pretty hot in here...be prepared to peel off some of those layers...
author: Jillian K.

description: First timers, but once you get passed shock of fast paced frenzy. It's really good, had chorizo scramble. Kinda light, full enough to leave on own powers.Somehow even though amount of people in line and amount of tables don't seem to match. It does work out, some cheat and half party grab table while rest orders(LAME).
author: Desi P.

description: The BEST French Toast I have ever had!! Delicious!!
author: Felicia G.

description: What the crepes lacked in size (our fav place is Chicago is double the size for the same price) they made up for in flavor. I had the banana-cinnamon crepe and my fiancé had strawberry-banana-kiwi. We also ordered a side of potatoes and bacon.. All of it hit the spot. They also offer lemon and orange water which was refreshing. They have a large menu, too bad were leaving town today, otherwise of be back!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Pretty good food and a quiet and cozy atmosphere. 

I headed here for breakfast one morning on vacation. There was zero line and a few other people eating/reading the newspaper at the tables. I had read their crepes were good, so my husband and I each ordered a crepe (one sweet and one savory) and switched halfway through. 

I ordered the SBK - strawberry, banana, kiwi, and it was great. Very light, summery, and refreshing. It came with either whipped cream or ice cream. Being it was breakfast, I went with whipped cream, but later regretted it. The crepe would have been even more delicious with ice cream. 

I also had the North Beach, which had chicken, cheese, spinach, onion, and was topped off with hollandaise sauce. After eating my light, super sweet crepe, this was definitely much heavier and more flavorful. I thought there was a bit too much sauce on it, so I scraped it off and added some hot sauce for some heat. The potatoes that came with it were really good too. 

The only reason I knocked off a star was that I thought the portions were a bit small for what you're paying. A couple hours later, both of us were hungry again.
author: Christina G.

description: They have a lot of unique options for crepes. The breakfast crepe is a wonderful deal an will start your day off right. Bloody Mary is wonderful as well! Will definitely return to honey honey in the future!
author: Brooke H.

description: I really enjoyed it here! It's not a fancy restaurant, but it's a great mom and pop with delicious food. I went there for brunch and had one of the crepes (of course, lol). I loved that there was refreshing lemon/lime water that diners could drink. I had a mimosa as well. Mimosa and food proportions were huge! I thoroughly enjoyed my brunch here!
author: Alisha J.

description: Went for breakfast on a Saturday morning. It was really busy, but by the time we ordered food a table opened up.  We had the breakfast burrito and the eggs florentine.  Cofffee was good and only $1.50.  The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was because it wasn't *amazing* I'd definitely go back though!
author: Natalie S.

description:
During the work week I dream of the breakfast crepe with a fresh squeezed/poured double mimosa. I rarely do the breakfast potatoes because I'm obsessed with their house salad dressing. Thats right. Salad for breakfast. Its a family recipe and its to die for.  

There are a lot of "creperies" out there with a similar black board menu, but let me tell you now this is not your everyday Squat and Gobble. Honey Honey is family owned and we are always greeted with smiles and special treatment. They can get busy on the weekends, so if there's a line out the door we pull the local card and sit down to order. 

You can find me here every Saturday and Sunday enjoying the same savory breakfast with the usual suspects. After all, I am the Duchess of Honey Honey.
author: Leah B.

description: Cheddar cheese is overwhelming & dessert crepes are just alright
author: Blake N.

description:
Easy and simple breakfast spot for us, tons of scrambled egg and savory crepe options on the morning we ate.  

We arrived after a late night of going out in the city and I was feeling awful, at a friend's suggestion we headed over here for crepes.  The fiancee had the chorizo scramble and I had the chicken pesto crepe, our friend had some sort of sweet crepe.  All were completely satisfied.  

I really like how they put out the flavored waters the morning we were there, a nice start to our meal.  The only problem I had was that my bloody mary just wasn't that good.  Now everyone makes them differently and this version was a little on the sweet side, blood red in color.  I usually like more of a horseradish flavor to mine.  I still managed to muscle it down for the precious rejuvenating alchohol inside but it wasn't the best I've ever had.  

The confusing thing about this place is that when we stayed at the Ritz on our last visit to San Fracisco the concierge said there were no crepe places in the neighborhood and we'd have to go to the Castro, yet here this place was all along.   

I would hit this place up again for breakfast on a future visit, only one warning, this place gets slammed.  I think we got there around 11 and found a great table, we were maybe 5th in line to order.  By the time we finished the line was out the door onto the street.
author: Christopher T.

description: Line wasn't bad, but very noisy. no coffee refills and eggs benedict was good, but wouldn't go out of my way to try it. What's all the fuss about the potatoes? They were just basic country potatoes? Cute restaurant, though.
author: Michelle L.

description:
The first time we went here it was busy and I think they where short staffed.  My eggs where under cooked but I still recommend it. 

We ended up eating here 3 separate times while visiting SF on our vacation & enjoyed each visit.  Breakfast, crepes and sandwiches where all excellent.  The fruit look fresh (and hopefully local)

Good coffee, strong bold flavor.

Good location
author: Jeff K.

description: It was average, service wasn't the best....but for a budget it was ok.
author: Nicolle S.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place (2.5 if I could). Sometimes I go and it's great; other times, my potatoes are rock hard, and all I can taste in the crab cakes florentine are breadcrumbs and bitter-as-all-fuck spinach. And I'm one of those weirdos who likes a lot of filler in her crab cakes, so this is hella bready.

Maybe I should stick with crepes.
author: Dani A. C.

description: Came here for breakfast and got eggs, pancakes and bacon. The bacon was not even a full two pieces...it was ripped up and soggy. Bread was so dry I couldn't even use it to eat my over-easy eggs with. Pancakes had some mystery meat particle in it and the butter had a few mystery black specs of something in it too. I wish I'd just gotten a bagel from anywhere else for breakfast.
author: Katie M.

description: Enjoyed the Banana crepe with whipped cream.  Decadent!  It was that or the pecan pan cakes.  I've tried many of the breakfast restaurants in this area and the definitely has one of the best menus.  Service was OK in terms of how they engage the client but it kind of goes with the place.  Good ambiance, interesting people and my friend Karen said "it's the full package for a tourist".
author: Elizabeth G.

description: So yummy & quite an extensive menu! It was hard to choose but our omelette & crepes were Delicious!!!
author: Marie E.

description: If I lived in San Francisco, I would be a regular here. Great food, fresh squeezed oj in their mimosas, and friendly staff make this place very popular. If there is one flaw at honey honey, it's their Bloody Mary... I wouldn't recommend that one, but I highly recommend the restaurant and give them all 5 stars because they deserve it.
author: M K.

description:
12:45pm on a Saturday. The line wasn't bad, and it was easy to find a place to sit, but it felt a little cramped. I got a Milano and my boyf ordered a Chicken Pesto Savory Crepe. Total: $19.20, not bad.

I got the Milano with potatoes and wheat toast. The potatoes looked and tasted pretty charred, and the wheat bread was... Sweet? I only ate half a piece because I was full by the time I decided to eat it! 

The omelette was good, though! Loved the mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil; it was a delicious mix of ingredients, however a little plain.

Price and taste is average, portions are above. I also like how they have their water with a hint of orange/lime at the side freely for your taking ^__^. Super convenient!
author: Winnie B.

description: Really Really good food if you can stand the line out the door. Super good fresh OJ and carrot juice. The crepes are to die for!!!!
author: Rockey D.

description:
They have one hell of an intimidating selection of menu items, it took me a couple minutes to take it all in and finally decide what I wanted to eat.

I ended up getting the club sandwich, and it was bigger than I expected. Aside from the sandwiches, it came with chopped potatoes that made a wonderful compliment to the club sandwich I had.

Other than the area was in a pretty busy intersection and the location isn't exactly car friendly, Honey Honey Cafe is great location to grab breakfast/brunch/lunch whenever you're in the area.
author: Allan G.

description: I stopped by here on Sunday for a late brunch since it was near my hotel. The food was good but nothing super memorable. I think it's a good place to pop in for a solo bite if you're traveling.
author: Alicia M.

description:
On my first day of arrival in San Francisco (first time in CA ever), I was famished!  In my mind it was 2 pm and I hadn't eaten more than a yogurt and an english muffin.  Dave and I were planning to walk down to the tourist trap that is the Fisherman's Wharf, but I couldn't do that without sustenance!  We walk from Hotel Serrano in the direction we believe we have to go, and what do we see?  Honey honey of course.  And with it's trusty People Love Us On Yelp sticker, I was confident I would find something satisfying.

The decor was bright and colorful, the demographic young, hip, foreign, welcoming, and the menu: endless with breakfast, brunch, and lunch offerings.  As I fix, I order the mozz, tomato, and basil on a garlic bagel.  Dave orders the one with cream cheese, avocado, and onion.  Ordering is easy and the staff were friendly.  We grab our table number sign thingy and take a seat while first grabbing some complimentary fruit-infused still water (cold and tastastic).

In a flash our order arrives; piping hot, melted cheeses, and fresh toppings.  Deliciousness in snack form for under $4.  Did I die and go to heaven?  Nope, just Honey Honey.  Did I return the next day for breakfast in lieu of an overpriced meal at my hotel?  Of course!  In fact, I would return daily if I could.  Thanks, Honey Honey, for providing me with my first memory of SF that will leave a good taste in my mouth, literally.
author: Shaina P.

description: This was our first time to eat here and it will not be our last! Delicious crepes served with many choices to satisfy everyone's appetites. We will return!
author: Marisa K.

description: Waited and waited...Crepe was hard, apples warm and hard, not right.  When we finish these mimosas they gave us in return, will add a star.
author: Paul D.

description: Very busy breakfast restaurant with a lot of options. Had a chicken *pesto* crepe which was quite tasty but unfortunately didn't contain any pesto or basil as was advertised. I would have returned the item, but since they do not really have table service, I didn't bother. Wife ordered two, two, and two (two pancakes, two pieces of bacon, and two scrambled eggs). She claimed that were breakfast tasted fine. I would have liked to have rated this restaurant higher but was disappointed that my crepe missed the signature ingredient.
author: Robert G.

description:
I'm convinced that this place is owned now by all the Squat and Gobbles in San Francisco, except they offer free Wi-Fi. Alluring thought for later on down the road when I actually own a laptop. 

Always a good Eggs Benedict (as it is at the Squat and Gobble...totally in disguise!) with a wonderfully fresh squeezed mimosa to go along. 

I have a feeling I will be having a lot of breakfast here in the next few months, being down the street from new flavor!
author: Alita M.

description: Went for breakfast this am.  Arrived around 8 and there wasn't a wait. The place is very quaint. I had the salsa crepe with potatoes and it was really good. My hubby had the sunrise burrito and liked it except that they cover the plate in black beans it made the burrito soggy.  It was still good though.  Also, they fresh squeeze their oj and its so good!! Definitely recommend.
author: Christina A.

description: I loved this place. My friend and I stumbled in here after being directed by our hotel concierge for a place we could find good affordable food fast. The desert crepes are awesome! We went for breakfast, lunch and desert during our stay in San Francisco. They have a wide variety of crepes and other breakfast/lunch/brunch options. To order food you wait in line, grab your number then a table. It's a smaller place so sometimes you worry if you'll get a table but we didn't need to really wait for the table because people get in and get out. Overall this place was great! I highly recommend it!
author: Brooke B.

description:
Honey Honey is close to where my daughter lives in San Francisco, so we go there at least once every time I visit.  I am a Honey Honey fan.  I like the atmosphere.  The place is unpretentious, the customers are cool, and the food is solid.

I've been there for breakfast, lunch, and afternoon snacks.  By far, my favorite is the breakfast burrito.  It rocks!  And, it gigantic.  I can have a breakfast burrito in the morning and not eat again until dinner.  Everything is good, but I recommend the breakfast burrito.
author: Brad F.

description:
This place is great for breakfast.

Great menu, great food, great fresh OJ.

Would get five stars if they had a second cashier, (slow line), and were in a better location. I almost got mugged in that part of town.
author: Joshua G.

description:
Delice! Great fresh breakfast that's able to satisfy morning appetites. 

Orders are taken at the register and you get a number that you'll sit at your table with. Not exactly a high-class service place, but the food makes up for it in spades.

There's a wide enough variety here that will satisfy the pickiest of breakfast eaters from the vegan lightweight to the steak and eggs crowd. Veggies and herbs are plenty available here on the menu and everything comes out tasting oh so fresh. 

Top it all off with fruit or cucumber infused ice water freely available, this place is a great place to enjoy your morning.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Went to breakfast at Honey Honey on our first morning in San Francisco. We were actually trying to go to Dotties Cafe, but they were on an unexpected vacation conveniently during the days of our visit. A nice couple told us about Honey Honey, which is just around the corner.

The Cafe has a Carribean feel, and pretty good food. I ordered their special Pecan Banana pancakes and my husband got the Huevos Rancheros. The pancakes were tasty, with whole, cinnamon roasted pecans inside the cakes and on top. My only gripe is they seemed a little tough. The Huevos were also tasty, with a nice, smokey chipotle chili salsa. 

When I was ordering, I was having a hard time deciding between the pancakes and the blintz. The cashier suggested the pancakes, so I decided to go with her suggestion. Later she came over and offered us a FREE blintz so I could try it. How awesome is that?? The blintz was tasty. I had never tried one before and it was filled with ricotta and cottage cheese and some tasty orange marmalade. The presentation was beautiful. 

Great service, I would definitely go back.
author: Kim R.

description: Cool little cafe with great breakfasts. I recommend the eggs Benedict, crab cake Florentine, or the fluffy pancakes .. all very tasty. They also serve lunch and dinner, and have tap beers and free wifi.
author: James N.

description: Found this place on yelp and decided to try it. The line was long but they have Great service and amazing food. definitely coming back here when I visit San Francisco again.
author: Quinton J.

description: Was looking forward to a delicious crepe when I opened the box, but instead I got a thin crepe filled with just bananas and strawberries absolutely no Nutella as I had ordered. Very disappointed.
author: Phoebe G.

description: Great food, not super crowded even on a sunday. Could be a little cleaner, but hey it's city dining!
author: Lee S.

description: Good creepes, average lox, self serve with good prices.  The apples in the fruit salad were brown.
author: bryan h.

description:
I want to like this place. I really do. But it's a diner that is pretending to be a fancy breakfast place without delivering. Let me get something straight: I love diners. I love the slightly grimy tabletops and the mediocre coffee and the scrambled eggs that came off the griddle that hasn't been cleaned in 25 years. I love that stuff. But this place serves diner level food at SF-level prices. The music is terribly loud (and in general, terrible), the eggs and Bloody Mary's are pretty bland. But the worst thing was the bacon. Bacon can only be ordered as a side. For $3. What we got back was, at best, cardboard on a plate. It was awful and inedible.

More offensive was the price. Two orders of mediocre eggs and potatoes with a side of (dry) bacon, a cafe au lait, a glass of orange juice, and a Bloody Mary was $35. If you want good diner food, go to Lucky Penny's on Geary or Just For You and it will be half the price and worth the wait.
author: Danielle L.

description: I had the new Orleans crepe and my fiance had the half moon bay both were outstanding. also we got there pretty early and there was no wait but after getting our food and sitting the line got nice and long. definitely worth the wait.
author: krystal b.

description: Your standard crep place. Nothing to write home about. Although their freshly squeezed orange juice is delicious. The long line does move quickly.
author: Darin C.

description:
Love to stay in the Union Square area when I am in the City, so wanted to find something different for breakfast.

Yelp'd my way to Honey Honey.  

It was breakfast time, so the line was pretty long, but moved along a pretty good pace.

You order at the counter and they bring the food out to you.  The ordering process and getting food out to you was fairly quick, and the food arrived hot and as ordered.


Lots of very cool and different breakfast sandwiches and crepes.  The types of omelettes and crepes are very diverse, so you should find something to your liking.

Don't let the line stop you, it is worth the wait.
author: Felipe M.

description: Don't be alarmed by long line and lack of tables! Staff is so helpful and made sure to find us a seat. Food is outstanding -- try the Milano omelette and the strawberry & Nutella crepe. Even a standard cup of coffee black was a tasty addition to succulent flavors. This joint delivers the goodness!
author: Troy A.

description: It was my second time in San Fran and my last day here so we wanted to try some where new and i came across this place on yelp. The reason i chose honey honey was because of the great reviews it was given but that was not my experience at all. I ordered the eggs Benedict and my girlfriend ordered the apple crepes..both were tasteless and horrible!!! The only reason i gave it 2 stars was for the iced mocha coffee and the home fries other then that i wouldn't waste my time or money in this place.. Such a disappointment!!
author: Jen C.

description:
This place is cute, on the corner, huge menu up on the wall.  There are so many things that look fantastic on the menu that it is really hard to choose one!  I had the breakfast crepe  - onion, cheddar cheese, ham, bell peppers - that comes with FRESH fruit.  It was absolutely delicious.  The fruit was so great.

Pretty chill place, order at the counter, they bring the food out to you though.  It is definitely worth checking out!
author: Sam G.

description:
Really fast service, decent food and if you pick the right time on Sunday or Saturday (11am or 1pm) you'll find plenty of seating. I'm a regular here and will continue to go back. 

-1 star: the woman at the counter is kind of a jerk
-1 star: while the food is decent, i hope it would be better and moreso consistent. sometimes it is really good and sometimes it is blah.
author: Dilip R.

description: This place is delicious!!!! We are here for our honeymoon and need a place for breakfast!  We found this place and I'm really happy we did the food is amazing, and the lattes are too!! I work for Starbucks so I'm spoiled with good coffee, this place is totally comparable to sbuxs!!
author: Letty N.

description: The two two and two breakfast comes with 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, and your choice of either 2 bacon strips or chicken apple sausage. I went for the sausage and it was surprisingly good. The down side is having to wait in line because it is a tourist hot spot (myself included)
author: Jen J.

description: Had the breakfast crepe and latte. The latte was the best part. The crepe tasted ok. Not terribly friendly service.
author: Grace T.

description: Not so bad, I had the chicken pesto crepe. My girlfriends and I came here around 2 and there was a long line. The wait wasn't too bad, but why was it so crowded?! Place is decent, and the staff were really nice. Their menu is pretty large so it's difficult to choose! My other girlfriends had the salmon benedict and a mediterranean crepe. They both said it was pretty good. We all also ordered mimosas! That is always a plus.
author: Christine T.

description: After reading the reviews I expected more. Eggs Benedict below average.. Potatoes very over seasoned. On the plus side my husband had a coffee and it was good! (Being Aussies is near impossible to find a decent coffee in the US!)
author: Jade T.

description: Honey boo boo cafe was my go to for breakfast each day! Great omelette and the potatoes were the best. This place would get 4 stars if the line wasn't always so long and the house coffee tasted like good coffee
author: Shane P.

description: Great fresh OJ. Really good, hearty portion of French toast. Eggs, pancakes and bacon were ok.
author: Ryan S.

description: This is a really good find. Some delicious menu choices and you are sure to find something you want. Not necessarily one for those looking to stay trim. The portions are a beast but you cal always walk it off later.
author: Oliver N.

description:
Oddly enough this place is tagged as a brunch spot. On a completely different level the food here is SPECTACULAR. They have a lot of normal "diner" type foods, but all a bit fusion and a lot gourmet-ish. A bit like the Squat & Gobble if you've been. 

I have to say HANDS DOWN that the cheeseburger is SERIOUS BUSINESS. It's weird because it would seem like such a regular item - but the execution is RADTACULAR.

Stumble here. You won't be let down.
author: Pamela R.

description: I was in line for about 7 hours in front of this restaurant one Saturday, so I was in here twice.  The first time I ordered an iced tea and a bagel to go.  The person who waited on me was extremely rude.  Filled the iced tea cup about 3/4 full and sort of threw it at me.  No, "the lids are over against the wall," or any comment.  It was sweetened which I don't like, but I was thirsty.  the bagel had a ridiculous amount of cream cheese but was otherwise good.  Came back in a few hours later and ate in.  Ordered a Chicken Burrito which wasn't awful.  Not to be rude or anything but not sure there's any other way to say it, it was totally a white person burrito if that makes sense.  The salsa wasn't spicy at all and didn't have much flavor.  It came with a side of homemade chips which were very good.  The second waiter was a lot nicer.  I saw him give a police officer that had been standing outside all day controlling the chaos, a free cookie.  Even though the officer kept trying to pay.  I thought that was nice.
author: Brandi G.

description: I came here for lunch when I saw farm:table was closed Monday (why does everything here have to be closed on Monday!?). I ordered a salmon benedict and an iced chai. I was in kind of a hurry so I was happy everything came out very quickly, even though there was many other people there. The salmon benedict was delicious, and I think next time I will try the crab florentine! I love having seafood for breakfast! The iced chai however, was a little too milky for me. It really just tasted like sweetened milk. I don't know if they're skimping on the chai or just have never had authentic chai tea but I hope they fix this! Overall a cute place for breakfast and lunch.
author: Montana O.

description: I'd rather go to Squat & Gobble ANY DAY!!! The plain crepes were really dry. I got the apple crepe as well and it didn't have any sort of sauce or anything! Just diced apples, sprinkled with cinnamon, on a dry crepe. Left MUCH to be desired. The menu may LOOK like Squat & Gobble or the Crepevine...but the food was certainly not up to par with the other crepery places I've fallen in love with in the city :(
author: Melanie M.

description:
The first time I came here, I ordered one thing--and ever since then I only come back for one thing:  the banana-nutella crepes.  I realize this may not be such a fascinating or unique morsel of culinary delight, but it just hits the spot when I have a sweet tooth.  It hits it real good.

It doesn't hurt that you can get either whipped cream or ice cream with no extra charge.  On more than one occasion I've gotten this as my breakfast--ice cream for breakfast?  Hell yes.  If only I could visit SF more often, but I suppose that's a good thing.
author: Andrew T.

description:
After some walking to find a brunch place that didn't involve an hour long wait, we stepped into Honey Honey. I am somewhat surprised by the negative reviews, mostly because my experience was fairly different from theirs.

There was an abundance of open, clean tables. The lass working the cashier was cheerful. Both of our savory crepes were fluffy and tasty, although I would not recommend getting fruit as a side as you get literally the saddest, smallest bowl I have ever seen. The kiwi was unripe - I'm not sure if there was just a lack of good produce that day since the same firm and bland kiwis were in our dessert crepe.

A good place to stop by if you're in the area and hungry, but definitely not worth making a trip for.
author: Justin B.

description:
Honey Honey Cafe and Crepery is one of my regular joints. I usually eat here about once a week or so. I haven't been very adventurous when ordering but I have tried a few different items.

The food is great. I love a few different sandwiches and crepes. But where Honey Honey falls down is on its sides. The salad comes with a terrible dressing, definitely one of the worst I've ever tasted. The potatoes are overly seasoned with a not so appetizing seasoning of some sort. Not even ketchup can save those suckers. And the bowl of fruit is meh. Too much melon and not enough strawberry, pineapple, and banana if you ask me. I'd take a bowl of soup over the 3 options above.

However, if you ignore the lackluster sides, the food here is wonderful. I could eat here all week and never get tired. Plus there's a good amount of seating most of the time. If Honey Honey improves their sides, they'd definitely get a full 5 stars from me.
author: Charles M.

description: Great breakfast place.  Be sure to get there before 9:00 to avoid lines out the door, especially on the weekend.
author: Mark M.

description: Good food and fare, nothing special or memorable. Would love to have them put a bit more effort on the presentation,  it's San Francisco after all.
author: Ana Maria V.

description: The SBK is amazing, highly recommended. It was very warm inside, so we sat out on the noisy street. My iced mocha was not well mixed, only bad comment.
author: Alejandra O.

description: I am not sure what people like so much. I waited in a long line. To eat subpar food. In an atmosphere that reminded me of a 90's airport food court. And, the food was so-so. Including the orange juice. Orange you glad that I stopped you from wasting your breakfast here?
author: Andrew K.

description: Delicious! And I got to eat at one of the sidewalk tables. I had the chorizo scramble. Yum!
author: Dawn F.

description: I decided to come here for breakfast because it was the closest place to my hotel. When I walked in at 7:30am there was already a lot of groups of what seemed like parents and kids eating there. Needless to say, it was very loud because of the large amount of kids, most of which I saw coughing all over the place. So I decided to order to-go because of this and ate in my hotel room. I wasn't looking for anything for anything too hearty, sweet, or loaded with cheese so I ordered two scrambled eggs which came with potatoes and toast. The eggs were fine although they could have used more salt. The potatoes were crispy and perfectly seasoned with rosemary, but they could have used more salt too. It took a while to get my food, considering it was a simple order. In the mean time I took in the decor, which is very nice and would have been perfect to sit and have breakfast had it not been for the noise. But it's San Francisco, so it's pretty noisy everywhere. I would recommend this place if you don't mind the noise in the morning and dine in. If you're ordering to-go, I would try to find someplace else.
author: Syl A.

description:
So many great options at a relatively decent price! The line was consistently long while I was there and it takes a little while to go through, but the food came pretty fast. Just make sure to get there early enough to get seating because it went pretty fast. I wish their drinks weren't so expensive but they have a lot of cafe options, more than usual diners. Also there were a lot of tables for only two people. We grabbed one table that accommodated four people but I wouldn't bring large groups here. 

Breakfast crepe - good. Less egg than I'd like and more cheese than I'd like, but it was a good. The crepe itself was a lot thicker and less flavorful than the crepes I had before, so it tasted much more like a weirdly folded breakfast burrito. 

Compared to a lot of the other breakfast options in San Fran, this is not a competition for being the best, but It's cute and decently priced.
author: Jane H.

description:
Honey Honey is a very solid brunch/sandwich/salad place. It's pretty cheap, and there's lots of great options. The menu is a bit overwhelming, but I've had the smoked salmon scramble and the Half Moon Bay crepe (crab cakes). Both were delicious and under $10. 

I dig that they make it super easy to get water, and at that, water with fresh oranges or with fresh lemons. The service is fast, and there's almost always an open table available to sit once you order your food. 

Their hours are great, and their salads are good too.
author: Evan G.

description: quick service, fresh squeezed OJ, reasonable prices and decent food. A winner!
author: Formicas F.

description:
Honey Honey continues to be my favorite downtown spot for breakfast and lunch. And even easier to decide what to get now that they've been keeping us updated with their on-going specials on their Yelp page. 

For breakfast there is nothing better than the Sunrise Burrito, and for lunch the Mexican Salad is pretty darned good. 

And for those munchy breaks they always have some sweet and delicious pastries.
author: Mickey A.

description:
I'm not really a breakfast person because I usually feel overly stuffed too early in the morning and just plain heavy all day long. It could also be because a lot of places use shit-tons of oil to make their eggs, bacon, and sausages. 

Honey Honey has turned me into a believer. I know believe in waking up as early as 10am on a Saturday/Sunday morning and rolling into my yoga pants to venture 2 blocks down to this little gem. It's very reminiscent of an Alice in Wonderland kinda-feel, which I fancy. 

This place usually has a line when I stumble in at around 10:30-11ish, but it gives you time to look over their expansive menu. I have had their Belgian Waffles, Eggs Benedict, Crab Cake Florentine, and Banana Nutella Crepe. I am absolutely in love with each of these dishes. Their hot cocoa is also bomb(dot)com. 

As for the service, I have never really had a problem with it because they've been quite efficient at their turnaround. Maybe I have just gotten lucky and whenever a table opens up and I swoop in, the bus boys are pretty quick about cleaning up the tables. I also like the owner/manager of this restaurant cause he was a little humorous with us even on a busy Saturday morning. Now he could have just been a douche and thrown our food on our table and moved along, so his humor was much appreciated. 

Anyhow, if you're a breakfast fan and are in the area, I suggest you stop by!
author: Lisa T.

description: Short walk from our hotel Sir Francis Drake and the breakfast crepes and fresh OJ was wonderful.   I'd definitely go back. There are a few outdoor seats but not much of a view as it is a little "off" the main attraction.  We did sit outside.
author: Angela M.

description:
We've been going to breakfast here for every day of our trip. It's decently priced, and the quality, ambiance is up there. 

You can have traditional breakfast combinations or sweet/savory crepes, deliciously prepared. Small touches here and there make this place very desirable:

- tea is full leaf mighty leaf tea
- plain water is available in two variations - lemon cucumber or orange
- tea coffee counter has multiple types of sweeteners, white, brown sugar, honey. 
- they serve fresh orange juice

Love it!
author: Haris H.

description:
mimosa for five dollars was disappointing with its size. 

pesto crepe was delicious. this place seemed a little pricey for breakfast but ill still be back
author: Adriana L.

description: We finally had a chance to stop by here for a quick early dinner with good friends who were visiting town.  My bf and I shared a Pesto crepe with fresh fruit, plus a coffee.  The crepe was quite good (cheddar, tomato, spinach, pine nuts, feta cheese, pesto, avocado) and filling, and the fresh fruit was a nice finish to our meal.  Their coffee was pretty tasty too!  I'm curious to try breakfast there next!
author: Maile N.

description:
While it's true that San Francisco has many fine creperies, this one stands out for a few reasons, the first being the location. This part of town is right where local-ville meets tourist-ville and Honey Honey is the most affordable, friendly, reliable, consistent and easy-to-get a place seat around. That's not to say it doesn't get  busy--but they keep things moving and you never have to wait long after sitting down for your dishes.

The second reason it's so exceptional--the main one that grants it this 5 star review--is the staff.
