Honey Honey has pretty decent food but I took off a star because I thought it was a bit pricey for what you got. I ordered the Miami Heat crepe which was OK, but barely had any chicken and I didn't taste the spicy sauce at all. My boyfriend ordered the banana, nutella and walnut crepe which was delicious. I would absolutely recommend it. 

I also planned on ordering a mimosa, but it was $4.50 and the glass was tiny. Defintiely avoid buying it unless you want to be way overcharged. 

Another reason I took off a star was because of the guy who helped us. He forgot to give me my coffee and questioned my boyfriend when he went up and asked for it because he said he already gave it to us. Then when we asked for directions he was not helpful at all. We asked where a certain bus stopped and all he did was pull out his phone to look up directions. He couldn't find any so he just told us to take some other bus which was way out of the way. 

Depsite relatively good food, I doubt if I'd go here again on my next San Fran visit.
author: Kathi W.

description:
Food was outstanding... We got there for a late breakfast as we were starting our tourist day, and it was filling, reasonably priced considering the quality, and fast. 

I got the Miami Heat crepes (excellent, chicken was well cooked, hot salsa on top was the quality of an expensive restaurant... nice mix of flavors) and my wife got the Acapaulco omelet (very good, refreshing, though not as interesting).

Would certainly go there again.
author: Andre C.

description: So many options!!! I had a really tough time choosing. You really can't go wrong with any type of crepe... just order whatever looks good to you :)
author: Meagan T.

description:
Amazing is all I have to say about this place!!!!

Just visited San Francisco and discovered Honey Honey.  Amazing pasta dishes and the crepes are unreal.  Great prices and people are real friendly.  A must have when in San Fran downtown area.
author: Sameer K.

description:
What a treat! Love the name for sentimental reasons, and you can't help but smile when you walk through the door. When friends were visiting SF, we decided to go out for brunch. So, I turned to Yelp for a brunch place in the Union Square/SOMA area and ended up at Honey Honey based on the reviews. I think we made a great choice!

It's a cute, order-your-food-at-the-counter, pay, get a number, seat yourself type of place, and that was perfect for our group. We had no problem getting a table at 12:30 on Sunday.

After studying the large hand-drawn menus hanging over the counter, my S.O. and I decided to split two dishes: the Athens omelet, which contained spinach and feta and came with crispy home fries, and a strawberry/Nutella crepe with whipped cream. Mmmmm. We're both glad we didn't each just order a sweet crepe, as it would have been too much sugar in one sitting, but half was just enough to satisfy the sweet tooth. The omelet was yummy -- savory, which balanced out the crepe nicely. The potatoes were tasty, too -- it's not often that I get homefries with some crisp, and these were great. We also got coffee, which was only $1.25 for unlimited refills -- and our server was always on top of those refills.

[Edited 6/5/2009 to add that I completely forgot that we also shared a side order of bacon. Unfortunately, the bacon was forgettable -- not crispy, a little on the fattier side.]

Honey Honey was a great environment for catching up with friends: relaxed, unpretentious, bright, with good service and delicious food. Next time I'm in SF for brunch, I'll certainly consider returning.

Tip: If driving, save yourself some time to find parking. If you can't find street parking, there's a garage right around the corner with a flat rate of $10.
author: Wendy K.

description:
They have crepes, burgers, sandwiches, omelets, & other breakfast foods. They also serve beer and wine, plus Wi-Fi is free. 

I had the Cancun Burger, cooked medium. The burger was delicious. The patty was huge and sooo juicy. The burger comes with a side of garlic or curly fries, I chose curly.      

The service is a little slow, but I would definitely come here again... esp to try a crepe.
author: Sandy K.

description:
Next time I'm in the Bay Area for work or pleasure, probably work because I never have time for leisurely travel, I am going back here. I have yet to find a good crepe in LA and this by far is the best one I've had in this state. I haven't been to France yet but I'm sure it is oh so heavenly, authentic and devine but the Honey Honey Cafe serves up a really good crepe and to me the food is what it's all about. 

I love savory crepes and since it was bordering on brunch time, I had to go with the breakfast crepe with a side order of potatoes.  Order at the counter and pay at the same time. Grab your seat and minutes later your food comes to you. SImple concept. Decent little spot, doesnt give me the vibe of a place you'd linger or want to lounge at, but it does the trick for a better than fast food, sit down establishment. 

Reasonable prices, tasty crepes, what else more could you ask for?
author: ruth n.

description:
Definately would recommend.  Was unpretentious and friendly.
Unfortunately we turned up right before a football game and the place was filled with college students, trying to get all the tables (BTW - they won't let you "hold" tables unless you have your order number).

My husband took me here for my birthday and was expecting someplace fancier - but the food was generous and tasty.  It's a casual feel, a teeny, tiny bit on the 'grotty' side, but generally clean - and the varied menu more that makes up for a bit of a wait and a slightly dirty floor.
author: Beekay M.

description:
Decent crepes, not the best ever, but certainly not bad. Tried the Pesto, The North Beach, Miami Heat, Mediterranean & the Turkey Sando...all were decent except the North Beach was super bland compared to the Miami Heat.
They serve fresh lemon & lime water complimentary.  Patio dining.
Prices were $7.95-14.95 -- which I think if pricey for a crepe but not a crepe in SF.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Cute place within slogging distance from the Clift after a night of celebrating with very very thirsty game developer friends. Honey Honey has a hi-tech fresh-squeezed OJ machine, circa 1985. It might have come from Doc Brown's house. Would not be surprised if it had a flux capacitor. Ergo, I ordered the orange juice, and hoped for a stammered invitation to the Enchantment Under the Sea dance.

Being a visitor to SFO, I decided to go for crepes; ordered the Torino crepe with breakfast potatoes. How one makes a mediocre crepe is beyond me, but said mediocre crepe turned out to be a too-dry, pancake-like mess, with a mere teaspoonful of lukewarm tomatoes, feta and mushrooms inside. It would be appropriate to call the fillings a "garnish."

The potatoes were very good overall - seasoned really well and not greasy at all, though one or two were a bit, shall we say, CRUNCHILY RAW for my taste.

FYI: somehow my small OJ and coffee cost about as much as my mediocre crepe.
author: Tam G.

description:
Honey Honey played an important role in my life when, due to some moving issues, I was without internet for a few days.  This place provided me with a comfortable place to check my email and handle work issues while I overdosed on green tea.  

Now that my internet issues are resolved, Honey Honey has become a lovely place to relax outside of my (sometimes hectic) apartment and still get things accomplished.  Everyone there is happy to set me up with delicious green tea and I usually eat a meal while I'm there too.  The menu is full of fantastic options, the prices are fair, and the service is quick.  

There could be more outlets, but as long as I'm able to claim my usual spot it isn't a problem.

I'm a fan!
author: Krystal K.

description: Both orders were done perfectly. You order up front and then they bring to your table. Omelet was delicious and breakfast burrito also got rave reviews. Food delivered hot and fresh and waitress very attentive and kept water and coffee full. Love the old fashioned machine that squeezes the fresh orange juice in front of you.
author: Steve M.

description:
This is a cute little shop....however, I would try something else on their menu next time. I had the standard 2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 pancakes meal. It was okay.

They do serve crepes, sandwiches, and all sorts of other breakfast food all day. Plus the WIFI is free. They don't have many outlets though so make sure that your battery is nearly full.

Also, the staff is kind and attentive. I ate here when I was staying at Hotel Serrano just 2 blocks down the road.
author: Regine N.

description:
Yea nothing fancy about this place but they have good options and decent crepes, wifi, not many outlets for your laptop, good location for out of towners and decent lattes. Also it is open late.

I ordered the banana-nutella crepe and it was good. It comes w/ either ice-cream or whipped cream options.  
It is a good quick fix for your food craving, crepes, breakfast food, salads, sandwiches..etc.
author: C A.

description: Ordered a savory crepe called Half Moon Bay - it had tomato, mushroom, cheddar and crab cake.  It comes with salad, fruit or potatoes.  Very delish!  Price was very reasonable - $8.95.  Definitely a good place for brunch/ breakfast food!
author: Rosanne P.

description:
What a find! We went there nearly every day, during our stay in San Francisco. The menu had lots of choices, at a very good price..and the Crepes were fantastic!!  The staff were very friendly. 
We will certainly go back to Honey Honey when we next visit San Francisco.
Jeanette & Jo from Australia
author: Jeanette L.

description:
As others have mentioned, this place seems to be a slightly scaled back Crepevine as they have the same menu design and a very similar dishes. 

If you're in the area and jonesing for a crepe it's a decent option, but I probably wouldn't make a special trip for it.  The kiwi, banana, strawberry crepe with a side of vanilla ice cream was a nice treat though!
author: Krystle S.

description:
I really liked this place. While it gets very busy when the brunch people wake up the line moves quite quickly. Very efficient.

Choose any of the 50 options and you won't be disappointed. Prices are very good as well.
author: X O.

description:
Finally settled on Honey Honey after a long debate on what we wanted for breakfast. 

I ordered:
crab cake florentine- the eggs were nice and runny, just how I like them to be in a dish like this. the crab cake was light and fresh. Not too much bread crumb. The hollandaise was a little blah for me. Not bad, just not great. The potatoes were sublime! A nice hint of rosemary flavor, and perfectly cooked. some bits were nice and crunchy and some bit were soft. LOVE

hubby ordered the two two and two:
scrambled eggs, two pancakes, and two chicken apple sausage... The apple sausage was soooooo YUMM-O... 

Honey honey loses a star only because inside the restaurant was boiler room hot! I know it's a lot chillier in SF than most other parts of Cali, but it was REALLY hot in there... We had to sit outside, it was so hot in there.
author: Cecille O.

description: Mediocre food, clean bathroom, but had egg shells in my scramble. We had both breakfast and lunch items. Creeps were tough.
author: Brett D.

description: Yummy! The granola apple pancakes were delish. Don't recommend the turkey sausage. Great place for breakfast.
author: Fae L.

description:
This place has wonderful service and great food. Staff is so friendly too! 

I ordered the Spaghetti and a banana crepe. When they brought out my spaghetti, I thought "holy cow, I'll never be able to finish that!" And of course I only Ate about half because there was just SO MUCH. But it was excellent and totally worth the 9 buck price. The banana crepe was delicious...best I've ever had!! 

The decor was cute too...with a chalkboard for the menu. They also have free WiFi if you are lucky enough to have a laptop. :)
author: Michelle M.

description: Great little breakfast place. The food is great, especially the crepe's. The place does need a makeover & needs to modernized. And what's with the graffiti all over the bathrooms?
author: Paul K.

description:
I've had both a crepe and the eggs florentine here.  Cheers for breakfast at dinnertime.  :)

Great service (yay free wi-fi) and while waiting i've had my soda refilled....

I live in the 'hood so i'll definitely be back soon.
author: Pete D.

description: Had breakfast here on a Saturday morning. Line was a little long, but that's good cause it gave me time to decide what to order. They have a menu with a lot of great options. Ordered Huevos Rancheros with a side of potatoes and a latte. This was the first latte I've had on SF that was actually hot.  The potatoes were good. They had some kind of basil or cilantro in them. Which gave them good flavor. Yummy black beans. The actual eggs, cheese, tortillas and salsa was the best part. The salsa has a nice kick to it. Give this place a try.
author: Stacey B.

description:
Pros: THE FOOD IS AMAZING. The Crepes are wonderful and the omelets are perfect. 

Cons: The place is ALWAYS packed but I guess that goes to show that I am not the only person that will rave about the food at Honey Honey.
author: Arti D.

description:
Honey, let me just say that my iPhone truly comes in handy sometimes. I had just finished managing a One Brick group of volunteers at Glide that morning and I was looking for a local place that  was: 1)Open on a Sun. 2) In walking distance 3) Relatively inexpensive 4) Served beer (a key plus in post-volunteering outings). The Yelp app led me to a few local choices, but Honey Honey won out for fitting all of the above criteria.

The place is seated righted on the corner like a drop of honey in a not-so-sweet area of town. The inside is spacious and light. It's one of those places with a chalkboard menu and a ton of choices, spanning breakfast, lunch, and dinner, plus beer & wine among other beverage selections. Lots of choices to please a crowd. I liked that they had printed menus as well, for the near-sighted among us, plus a pile of Sudoku puzzles for the hyperactive among us to fill out as we waited.  I also had the owner take an interest in One Brick and gave her more info. about volunteering. Nothing like a little networking with noshing.

My sandwich was delicious and included not only a side of potatoes, but also a sizeable side salad with choice of dressing on the side. Normally I'm never one to not finish a whole sandwich, but my tasty, big baguette sandwich had me happily stuffed and wrapping up the other half. Free refills too (though not on the beer). As much as I enjoyed my choice, I had a little entree envy eying the warm chicken salad another person in our group ordered. Next time, I told myself, for indeed, this visit was sweet enough to merit many return trips. Honey Honey proved every bit as sweet as its name.
author: Megan K.

description:
This place makes excellent dessert crepes, which is the primary thing I've eaten here.  However, their savory crepes are also good, particularly the breakfast ones.  It beats hotel food both in quality and price, and is convenient for anyone staying in the Union Square area.  The staff are fairly friendly and helpful as well.

The next time I am in San Francisco, I will try to go here again.
author: Shawn P.

description:
I frickken love this place....

I discovered honey honey back in the day when i had no wireless... I went on a find free wifi hunt. 

There was honey honey..

All i can say is that I have never looked back.
Lovely Lovely Staff
Great (and Healthy) food
Reasonable Price
Free Soda Refills

I really recommend this place to anyone, I have taken my friends there and all of them loved it.

I think the longest I sat in there was 4 hours...

Good Job Honey Honey
(ps love the new entrance)
author: Dave L.

description:
I was in the neighborhood for that Dottie's Breakfast place, but we couldn't find it. So we went with the next best choice near by-- Honey Honey, and we never went back to look for Dottie's again.

The place is neat, staff is friendly, and food is awesome. I love the crepes. The free water is even infused with ur choice of cucumber or orange/strawberry. 

Really cool!!
author: Ari W.

description:
The place reminds me of Crepevine.  

PARKING - Street. It's press your luck but luckily we found parking on the street and it was free parking b/c it was a Sunday

FOOD - You order and they bring the food to your table.  I got the Savory Crepe with Chicken, salsa, and sun tried tomato.  I thought the crepe was not well made because it was "flat" and too "doughy" and not crispy at the edges. There was only "one piece" of sun dried tomato.  ($8.65). The fresh squeezed OJ was $3.50. 

My gf's got the salmon crepe and the angel hair pasta. It looked okay. The noodles did not look al dente.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Crab cake florentine---pretty much all I have to say but I won't since it only costs like 13 bucks...all day long i'd get this thing!. It came out hot, with just enough sauce, pleasing to my stomach and to my eyes... the nutella banana crepe was pretty awesome too my GF was kind enough to share... next time I'm in SF i'd stop by here again fo sho!
author: Ivan L.

description:
Walking through the crappiest part of san fran, just to come here and POOF! I'm drowning in hipsters. 

This order at the counter take your table number to where you want to sit thing is confusing. the infused water is deeeelish and the sunrise burrito i had was yummy, albeit monstrously large 

Thanks for good food and hipsters.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I love this place! Their crepes are super delicious and come with a side of salad (with a really good dressing!) or potatoes (they are really good too, but I'm a healthy-eater-(sorta!)-freak and always get the salad instead). My favorite ones are New Orleans crepe and Pesto Chicken crepe. Yummm!! 

The place itself is quite spacious for SF Union Square standards, so I like that fact too (I'm not a huge fan of eating my lunch butt to butt with some stranger!).

The service is very friendly too. I also like the fact that they have pitchers of complimentary water with different types of fruit in them. I remember seeing water with strawberries, lemons, and oranges. They also have a pitcher with cucumber slices. I feel quite rejuvenated after drinking that one :)

The portions are very big... Each time I order food from there, I promise myself I would only eat half and save the rest for later... So far I have broken every single one of them... it's just too damn delicious for me to be able to just throw the rest in the fridge and focus on something else knowing that only a few feet away there is a tasty delight impatiently waiting to be devoured by me... Ahh... That's why I'm still stuck in the "healthy-eater-(sorta!)-freak" stage... OY is all I have to say to this!
author: Suzanna G.

description: Wonderful fresh crabcake florentine on an English muffin and "Post Street" scrambled eggs and veggies!  Good prices too!  Go early as the line is often out the door.
author: Ellen V.

description: Came here for my friends bachelorette party and decided to have breakfast here. Line was really packed and there were hardly any seats. Ordered the crab cake sandwich and eggs benedict. Pretty tasty and tried the crepes with ice cream which was goooood! Ice cream was very delicious and I believe they said it was fresh??? I dont even know what that means but it was a nice experience.
author: Khanh D.

description: This is a great little [place to grab a relatively inexpensive bite in the Union Square area. They also have great happy hour specials on draft beers, $9 pitchers!  I work nearby and usually visit often, staff is always nice. The crabcake crepe is a favorite.
author: K J.

description: A little over crowded and a long line but the line moved fast and tables cleared fast as well. Fresh Squeezed OJ best thing on the menu
author: Matthew A.

description:
I have been eating with these folks for the last 13 years and it just keeps getting better. The couple owner used to work on another crepe restaurant, which I was a regular - my favorite place, and this is their first own store. 
Needless to say, I  decided to follow them due to their amazing job. Applying all their years of experience from the previous location, they are always improving their menu, adding new items while keeping the winner items to satisfy their loyal customers! 
My favorite salad there is the Greek salad with chicken, my favorite crepe...so many...but the chicken pesto might be the one to top my list. 
Everything is worth to try but...the dessert crepes...I cannot name one as the best...they are all super delicious!!!!
I have just tried a new option: glazed pecans with Nutella and ice cream.... TO DIE FOR!!!!
author: Marcia V.

description: Great food at Honey Honey. The Mexican salad was awesome! The best salad I've tried in USA. The place looked coo and was a bit noisy.
author: Kristoffer F.

description: Amazing, delicious, authentic, fresh, whole foods! Menu items for those in party who don't like creeps too! Mimosas made with fresh squeezed OJ! Lattes to die for! Worth the long line to get a table!
author: Carlotta G.

description:
Great little breakfast nook tucked away in the Tenderloin.  I split a pesto, provolone, and sundried tomato bagel with my girlfriend.  They served it "open faced" so that both bagel halves were generously covered with  toppings.  It was enough food for both of us, for a total of $3.95.  

If you're going to the Glide service down the street, like we did, this is a great place to stop for a bite beforehand!
author: Dave C.

description: Great food, great portions, great prices.  One of the best breakfast spots in the union square area.
author: Stephanie S.

description: This place is pretty good. The service is nice. We went on a Tuesday Morning. The pricing is pretty fair. We had the Breakfast Crepe and a bagel with onion, avocado, cream cheese and tomato. Pretty great breakfast!
author: J B.

description:
I had a really great experience at this delicious crepery in Union Square.  The place has a cheery feel with its giant colorful chalkboard menus on the wall and open, airy ambiance.  Slight downside:  you have to wait in line and order at the counter, and it can feel a bit like a cafeteria.  But, really, I felt the atmosphere was pretty inviting overall.  Plus, the staff was super friendly.  I appreciated the thoughtful, free water pitchers by the register, one lightly flavored with orange slices and the other with lemon and lime slices.

I had the Pesto crepe (cheddar and feta, pesto, pine nuts, tomatoes, spinach and avocado).  Delicious, with flavors that balanced together perfectly.  Be sure to order the potatoes (rather than the fruit or salad) on the side.  They are quite amazing, and given in more then ample portion (can be split easily between 2 hungry people).  My friends ordered a crepe with salmon, avocado, capers and a few other ingredients...in my opinion, way too salty...but they seemed to love it.  The cheese blintzes are nothing to write home about, but are safely satisfactory.  

If I lived in San Francisco and near this part of town, I'd likely frequent this crepery once a month.  It's a great place for a little hangover pick-me-up breakfast or a casual breakfast date.  Suggestion:  sit close to the window...it's more pleasant.
author: Julie P.

description: I have come here twice while in San Francisco. Both times the line was the slowest line on earth because they have only one cashier who also makes all the coffee drinks. The first day I had the crab cake florentine. The crab cake was greasy and covered in breading. I would expect better from San Francisco. The next dayI had the Santa Fe special. It was ok. I asked a busser  if I could get some more coffee. She asked me to go up to the counter but there was absolutely no one but the single cashier with a line from hell to ask. I was not going to cut in front of that crazy line to ask for a refill. After standing there forever and no one giving two hoots, I hunted down the same busser to ask who exactly would refill my coffee. She grabbed my mug with a look of total exasperation and went up to the poor cashier and insisted she stop serving the endless line and refill my cup. Worst service ever. Horrible place to go if you actually want to relax.
author: Deb D.

description: So in the 3 weeks snide moving to SF I've been to honey honeys three times. It has been completely packed and comfortably full. They always deliver great food especially for the price. The service isn't amazing but it's more than good. It is definitely a place to make your "usual."
author: Julie P.

description:
Pluses:

Good/great food (right portions, prices, and flavors) in a casual setting.

Minuses:

Not the cleanest restaurant.

This is a worthwhile restaurant if you're in the area (especially for breakfast), but its not worth going out of your way for in San Francisco.
author: R.G. A.

description: Ordered a Salmon Benedict which I paired with a glass of fresh squeezed OJ for breakfast on a Tuesday morning. The restaurant was pretty full, but there were always people coming and going so getting a table was not that big of an issue; so it works out alright since you order your food from the counter and seat yourself.
author: Cherylle Q.

description:
Service has gone down the drain.  Major turn off.

I was second in line, and in no hurry.  The young lady working behind the counter spent just over five minutes talking to her friend, who was first in line.  I didn't care, even though I wasn't aknowledged at all.

Then a group of young gents, also friends of hers, walks in and stand in line behind me.  She looks past me, and strikes up a conversation with them for another 5 minutes. No "just a moment", no glance, no attention paid to me what-so-ever.

WTF?!
author: Shea G.

description: On my most recent city adventure I brought a girl friend here, and she was as enamored with the place as I was.  We ended up arriving in the middle of the breakfast rush, and the place was packed.  We had to wait probably 10 minutes just to order, but realistically it gave us time to peruse the large menu without worrying that we were holding anyone up.  The food was delicious and arrived no more than 5-10 minutes after we ordered it and sat down.  Another lovely breakfast; I'll definitely return again!
author: Jennifer K.

description: This place was a great find!  We wanted crepes and that is what we got here with some sides of breakfast meat and all was delicious.  We got there at 10 am and the line was out the door.  Heard someone in line say there is hardly any line at 9 am.  The line moved fast though, it was to place your order, they give you a number and you go find a table and wait for them to bring the food out.
author: Karen D.

description:
Pretty good for the purpose they're serving. Accessible location, universal food at affordable prices. The omelet and the crepes were pretty good to tell the truth. The cappuccino was foamy and strong and the fresh squeezed OJ is always a plus.

Even though there is usually a line for ordering over the weekends, it's nothing compared to the one in front of Dottie's, so we used this place as an alternative to Dottie's. 

I can't compare the food though since we didn't have the patience and the hunger tolerance to be able to wait like an hour to eat at Dottie's True Blue Cafe. Hold on tight, Dottie, we'll get'ya next time!
author: Volkan S.

description: Surprising little joint. Has the appearance of a late night diner, but food of an upscale, casual joint.
author: Christopher T.

description:
I went to Honey Honey for breakfast and internet.  The photos of the French Toast on yelp hit a soft spot so I tried it out.  It wasn't bad, but I'll try something else the next time I come.  This is kind of picky, but the strawberries that came with it were not at all ripe, which would be acceptable if we were in New England and it were winter, but neither are true.  The internet is fine, a bit slow, but they have kind of loud music and small tables, so I don't think this will be my new internet place.  However, they have so many good sounding food choices.

One thing I wanted to mention that made this a place I will definitely come back to, the staff was just plain nice.  Small things really made this place for me.  Offering to refill my coffee, the little bit of chit chat at the counter waiting to pay.  The flavored waters is a nice touch, and they are free!
author: Lizzy G.

description: Got all excited about the menu, but then disappointed with the food.  I know it's trouble when I feel I can do better.  It wasn't terrible, just not that special.  They do have a nice orange juice machine (it's the little things that I appreciate).  Won't be back though.
author: Pankaj B.

description:
On the morning before the occasion of my brother's wedding we were hungry and this place fed us. Such a simple concept but imagine how satisfied we were that the food was good and not entirely expensive. We needed coffee and hearty foods to chase away the memories of hangovers. I can't help but be biased because this place met the challenges that we gave it. 

Everything delivered on sating hunger and also lifting spirits. God bless us one and all.
author: Don L.

description: Came for desert, crepes were fresh with a good texture. Better than some more highly rated crepes in town. Nice dining room with ..... Interesting music. -1 for music!
author: Jorge R.

description: This place had a really big menu of crepes.  I stuck with something simple: a banana and nutella crepe.  It was delicious.  My only complaint was that he bananas tasted a tiny bit over cooked.  I liked that they give you the option of whipped cream or ice cream with the crepe.
author: Cookie N.

description: Found this place in a food app and when I was here eating brunch with a friend, it was a pretty great place! I liked how it was homely and warm. Crepes were good, I both tried a savory and a dessert crepe. Will come here with boyfriend and see if it's still as good as the first visit.
author: Maisy C.

description: Superb for what it's worth. It's cheap with ample servings. The food is great too and fast and hot. Did I mention hot? It's like an oven and lots of people waiting for u to finish eating.
author: Sen M.

description: I ate a little sandwich here about two years ago and thought the food was good and the service good, so I brought my daughter back with me when we came back to the City. We had yummy soup, a fabulous crepe, an omelet, a sandwich...oh yea, we ate there two meals because we couldn't try everything we wanted to on the first trip! Great service, food is fresh, when there was a line the server remembered me from the day before and sat us at a table, asked what we wanted, didn't write it down and came back in nearly 7 minutes with steaming food!!! I will go again when I am in the city!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Nice little cafe with free wifi and tasty food. We only ate breakfast here, but the lunch food looked really good too. Savory and sweet crepes were both good and filled to the brim. The hollandaise sauce was awesome and the fruit is all fresh and very tasty.

My only complaint would be that the tables are small and weren't big enough for 2 breakfasts and 2 laptops.
author: Andrea F.

description: Great food, great value. Portions are huge, easy to share if you can agree on something off the large menu.  Centrally located, very clean place to start ur day.
author: Oscar B.

description:
I came here as a back up plan after realizing waiting at Dottie's would turn my breakfast into a lunch with that ridiculous line going to the corner! 

At HHCC, you look at the gigantic menu on the wall and order and pay at the register, then find your own seat. When we went, it was packed, so we were lucky to be able to find a decent spot for 2. I think we took the last seats, so I felt bad for everyone behind us. It meant they had to scrounge around for a place to sit.

I ordered a pesto omelet which was pretty frickin' delish. And honestly, I forgot what the boy ordered. Hah. We also ordered a strawberry and nutella crepe. Sadly, this crepe was a big fail. The biggest fail part was the fact that the crepe was still super hot when they slabbed on the nutella and strawberries, so by the time we ate it, it was one big mess of melted chocolate and soggy warm strawberries which in turn, made the crepe soggy as well.

Sigh. And I was so excited about it too.
author: Peggy T.

description:
Great location near Union Square (but far enough away to not be inundated by tourists), fresh-squeezed orange juice, lemons in the water, affordable prices, and most important, very good crepes.  

The only thing keeping it from getting more stars in my book is the fact that they undercooked the breakfast potatoes (never a good thing).  Other than that, a solid breakfast eatery.
author: Bryan S.

description: Creative, inexpensive food. Lines and tables moved fast and it was a fun, fast breakfast spot.
author: Julia L.

description: This restaurant is so cute and delicious! They make great coffee & tea, have freshly squeezed orange juice, and serve yummy breakfast!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
So, I lied in my Cup-A-Joe's review because I said was going to keep going back there for my last few days in town. Instead, today I came to Honey Honey in search of a crepe. And then I ordered a lox bagel. Obviously it isn't their specialty, but it was really good. My complaint would be that it was basically the same price as a crepe, but about 1/2 the size. They def could have put more smoked salmon on it for the $7.61 it cost me.

But back to the point, the ingredients were all really fresh and yummy and everything that I saw go by to other tables made me want to order a second meal. But since I'm a poor soon-to-be student, I held back.

The place has nice atmosphere and the staff were very nice. And the free water has cucumbers in it, which I love...or there's one with fruit too if that's your thing. All in all, a good experience. Maybe I'll come back here tomorrow...
author: Lesley G.

description: This place is so great; I eat here every time I'm in the city.  Their crepes are amazing and they have a really good eggs benedict as well.
author: M K.

description: Amazing breakfast! Shared the croissant sandwich, crab cakes Florentine and crepe suzzette. Wondering what to have when we come back.
author: Ana F.

description: They literally asked us to give our table for other customers. BAD CUSTOMERS SERVICE AND FOOD.
author: T W.

description:
Three of us walked in and started looking at the menu. One of us was holding a very large book and set it down on a table while we were deciding what to get. Some Asian lady in a Honey Honey uniform came running up and rudely said "you go order, then you can sit!"

I understand her point, but that was incredibly rude and obnoxious. It's not like any of us sat down. If all of us at sat down and ordered nothing it would be time for that kind of treatment. That lady managed to set a world record for turning me off to a business. Congratulations.
author: Yod S.

description:
Came here for brunch the other day with a friend. Service is somewhat DIY: order at the register and they bring your food to you when it's done. 

The Eden crêpe I had was pretty great -- Fontina cheese, smoked salmon, capers, red onions. Their crêpes are a bit doughy, could maybe use a bit lighter batter. The potatoes that came with it were good, if a little heavy on the rosemary. For $8.95 it was perfectly acceptable but nothing special considering you can get more food of the same quality for less at a place like Crêpes A Go-go in Berkeley. 

I'd go back if I was in the area again, probably to try one of their other breakfast plates.
author: Sam K.

description: meh was my thoughts exactly. It wasn't that good. I've had better at little old rinky dink diners. I say go to another cafe....there are plenty around to try.
author: Emily K.

description:
The food is good but the service is lacking. 

We arrived during the Sat am rush and there was a decent line when we got there.  The line did not move for a good 5 minutes.  There was only one person taking orders and she interrupted herself to make coffee drinks before even completing the order taking.  There were at least 5 empty tables but they were all dirty with dishes.  I witnessed an employee emerge into the seating area only to BS with a customer while many tables needed tending to.  He finally cleared one table and then returned behind the counter looking baffled as to what he should be doing.  He wasn't the only employee looking for something to do and failing miserably.  

That said, once the order process was complete, I was surprised how soon it was that we received our food.  Of course, the order taking was so painfully slow, I doubt the kitchen had any difficulty keeping up.  The food was quite good and they did get our orders right in spite of our substitutions.  

I would try this restaurant again with low expectations as to service.  I'm hoping it was the exception and not the norm.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Great breakfast spot.     Enjoyed the salmon Benedict and the huevos rancheros.    Great freshly squeezed oj.
author: Nick H.

description:
YUM. Seriously, yum.

My sister had eaten here on a previous trip with her husband and when we realized we were staying in the same general vicinity she got way excited that we'd get another meal here. We came for a cheap quick dinner the night before I ran the SF half marathon because a. we were still slightly hungover from the previous night and b. it was close to our hotel (I like to be as slothly as possible the night before a run).

We were being indecisive so we shared a big salad, I got the chicken pesto crepe with potatoes, she got a crepe with cheese & chicken & salsa (also with potatoes) and we shared the SBK crepe for dessert. All that plus 2 drinks was $38. It was a TON of food and we were happy to be picking at the leftovers in the hotel room all night.

The girl working was super friendly and went out of her way to keep coming by to make sure we had everything we needed. We ran out of time the next morning which I was kinda bummed about because the breakfast choices looked amazing. I'll definitely be coming back next time I'm in the area!
author: Jessica R.

description: We were in town for a Giants game & needed some sustenance after a night of partying. I hate eating at those touristy Union Square joints where the food is mediocre at best. After Yelping breakfast options within walking distance, the Honey Honey was the clear winner. The line was fairly long but went quickly. The bus boy found us a table before our order was up so we sat down and waited. My hubby ordered a round of fresh OJ mimosas which were awesome. I love a little "hair of the dog" on a Sunday morning! My girlfriend & I ordered Eggs Benedict because we LOVE it. Hollandaise on the side. My hubby ordered the chicken pesto crepe. The potatoes were great. Very flavorful with fresh parsley. Our Benny's were perfectly cooked and the Hubby's crepe was delicious. Exactly what we needed. The menu is written in colored chalk & very festive. Made me want to order one of everything. The service was just fine, everyone seemed pretty friendly & didn't rush us through our first time. Overall a great breakfast in SF. Sure beats eating at Lori's Diner.
author: Katie R.

description: Salmon Benedict is simply awesome!!!
author: Zarko P.

description:
Service was good, fast and efficient.  I went here twice in my 4 day stay for breakfast/brunch since it was within a nice walking distance from my hotel.  Everything off the menu looked good, I wanted to try it all!  

Good stuff:
- Free water, infused in your choice of cucumber/lemon, orange or strawberry/kiwi.
- They use cute random coffee mugs (like from your parents house) when you order coffee
- Good crepes (I've tried the half moon and new orleans one)
- Yummy french toast
- If you feel like fruit, get them as a side with your crepe, it's actually a nice assortment and arranged in a nice small saucer.  All the fruits were really good and fresh too!
- free wifi

Not-so-good stuff:
- Their potatoes aren't cooked to the point of crispyness, they're just kinda cooked.  Maybe I'll ask them to keep them on the stove longer next time?

Overall, I'd totally go again if I was in the area.  If you're not, then I'm sure you can find another cute brunch place in SF.  But now I know, if I'm craving some yummy crepes for breakfast, I will head to the corner of post and taylor...  honey honey, yummy yummy.  :)
author: Lisa D.

description: Their crepes, omelets, and sandwiches make it a solid lunch spot.  Very similar to any of the Crepe Houses or Squat and Gobbles in the city.  It's close by so I love this place.
author: Cullen R.

description:
This place was down the block from my hotel, the Kensington Park hotel, right near Union Square, so we stopped in for our first breakfast in San Francisco. 
The food was solidly good and a great way to start out a long day of trekking around town. Definitely enjoyed the infused waters, mimosas heavy on the champagne, and yummy food.
author: Kim N.

description:
What a find! 
We were in the city for 3 days and everyday had breakfast here. Loved their selection. We had Belgian Waffle, Athen's, Milano,  MEDITERRANEAN crepe, hot chocolate and latte. Everything was good. Would go there again whenever next am staying in the city:)
author: Madhur M.

description: The business is busy but they pay attention to those in line and reserve a table for you.  The food was very tasty, the crab cakes good.  I had the crab cake crepe - I have never had crepes like this before. One of our party who had the crab cake omelet got food poisoning. Only thing she ate before it happened.  The other two in our party was iffy but it could have been suggestion.  Food was tasty but I don't know if I would go back.
author: Blythe P.

description: Great place for a quick, quality breakfast. One of our favorites when we stay near Union Square.
author: Todd B.

description: This was a great way to start our day.  We got the eggs benedict and florentine and it was absolutely perfect.  The orange juice is fresh squeezed in front of you and they have a good cup of coffee.  We were on our honeymoon, stopping through SF on our way up the coast and this was one of the more memorable breakfasts we had on our trip.  If we lived in SF we would consider moving to a close proximity to Honey Honey's.  Next time, BLINTZES!!!
author: Kristen F.

description: Love this place! On my trip to San Francisco, I wanted to go here for breakfast and lunch. I think a restaurant like this would do well in Austin.
author: Mark W.

description: Slow moving line but once you order they are quick to bring your food to you. Found this place on yelp while staying down the street at the Hilton Union Square. I'll be in the area again in about a week and plan on making a stop here again. Food is awesome, but that 1 star is missing due to how long it took to get to the front to order.
author: Ed S.

description: They have a fairly wide range of selection in the menu as compared to other cafe in the area. I had savory crepe with mushroom and feta which was pretty good. Though I wish there was sauce that came with it.
author: Nikita J.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and come here once and a while for a hangover breakfast/lunch. The highlights: The curly fries, the chicken pesto crepe, the asian chicken salad, and the water pitchers with fruit and ice in them.
What I'm not crazy about are the breakfasts, basically just stan

Good place if you live in the hood, but I wouldn't make a special trip out.
author: Danny S.

description: Yummy breakfast food - but the filing in the crepes is too sweet.  We went after church at Glide, so tehre was a long, long line - but that's not Honey Honey's fault.  Good coffe and reasonable priced.  I split the breakfast burrito and shared a crepe, it was plenty of food.  I'll go back.
author: Sara K.

description: Pretty cute place, got to try it thanks to the Post  Hotel they give a voucher for breakfast here...it was a good breakfast place... I want to try the crepes next.
author: Clara H.

description: Great food and great prices. I didn't see one entre over $9.95. I got the waffles and they were awesome. The chickeh-apple sausage was good too. Also gf had the 2+2 & 2. 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 sausage, the pancakes were just ok. not great, not bad. that's why i have 4 of 5. First time here, but I def want to come back and try more things. Ambiance is nice and they have free wifi. Oh you also get free water that nicely added with orange/banana and one with lime. If you're in the area you have to try it.
author: Brian H.

description: After attempting to wait it out for Dotti's True Blue Cafe, I ended up here and I must say that I wasn't impressed.  My fresh squeezed orange juice was as warm as the weather and it was a low-70 degree day.  When my food arrived, I noticed that 1/3 of my country potatoes were burnt to a crisp and another 1/3 of them appeared to be missing.  I left here full, but unsatisfied so I doubt I'll be returning anytime in the near future.
author: Michael G.

description: Honey Honey Cafe is in a great location! I love their huge menu and the fact that its more casual and you can just order and sit down. I think their restaurant needs a little uplift or some organization some things seem to be all over the place. The plates/cups seems pretty old as well.  We ordered the New Orleans omelet but instead we were brought out Miami Heat... Miami Heat was delicious pretty spicy but very good, so we didn't ask for it to be exchanged. We also ordered the waffle, which I had high hopes for...unfortunately it came out raw. I noticed the smell of dough but thought maybe I was imagining it but nope after tasting it, it was pretty undercooked...they did substitute the fruits with nutella strawberries and bananas for us, which was the only good part. We were in a rush so couldn't send it back. Giving this place 4 stars because I feel like it has a lot of potential and good customer service, but hoping they will look over my review and take some tips!
author: Milana K.

description: This is our favorite place to go to for crepes! My fiance and I go here pretty much every weekend for brunch. Their crepes are great and so are most of the other items on their menu. We now personally know the owner Abed and his son Met, very cordial people. On my birthday they gave us two glasses of champagne to celebrate. We always bring our friends and family here because we know we can't go wrong, everyone has something to order and they all love it!
author: Mandy K.

description: Really good for breakfast!!! The crab cake Benedict are sooooo good. So happy we came here on my vacation, totally worth it
author: Kyrene G.

description: Honey Honey Cafe and Crepery is near Union Square, but you're going to walk a little to get there. This place serves great food. I was happy I ordered from here, because it reminded me a little of some of things I like to eat. Everything from breakfast to lunch and thensome. I ordered their strawberry nutella crepe, and a chicken parmesan and took it with me and ate it at Union Square. It was like during the Christmas season, so it was delicious and wholesome. I would definitely go back and revisit their friendly service, and awesome tastes in brunch-like foods. :) The area inside is bigger than it looks from outside, so don't worry if you can't find a table. Either that or eat nearby at Union Square, Westfield Shopping Center, etc. Wooohooo.... I'm a fan of Honey Honey Cafe and Crepery @ Post St. 4 stars.
author: John P.

description: Yummo! French toast was delicious with the fresh whipped cream and strawberries, our omelet had a Mexican twist on it having black beans, avocado, salsa, sour cream, sausage and cheese! Only complaint was the orange juice although being fresh squeezed it was not cold at all. Worth going again next time we are in San Fran!
author: Ella J.

description:
Crepes are amazing and sandwiches are just as great. Can be very busy in the morning, but there are always people coming and going so seating is not a problem. A must go for any meal if you're downtown!

i recommend any of the dessert or savory crepes!
author: Cassandra H.

description: My wife and I are big breakfast people so we like to try and find new places. Honey cafe was good but have had better. The potatoes are different as they add basil and the savory crepes are average at best. The rest of the menu does look and good and would try again
author: Louie S.

description:
Walked into this place before renting our car from AVIS (one block away) and we were thrilled at what we found! There were so many delicious choices that we decided to return two mornings later to have a sit down feast. 

First time: split the tomato/avocado/onion/sun-dried tomato bagel on sesame (YUM) and the mozz/pesto on whole wheat (yum)

2nd time: split the eggplant crepe (fantastic) and the nutella/banana/walnut crepe with ice cream. Need i say more? 

Treated ourselves to a mimosa, hell it was only 4.50!
author: Emaan M.

description: The Huevos Rancheros rule, coffee is not bad either. Service is very good.
author: Ryan D.

description:
They make fresh squeezed OJ everyday... SO, I had to try the mimosa- which was delicious! Get anything with the potatoes.... which are seasoned with herbs and tasted delicious. 
Wasn't hungry enough to try the Savory Crepes, but a tried a few bites of the Greek omelet an it was delicious!
Would definitely come back over and over to try out the rest of the menu- breakfast or lunch!
author: Wendi W.

description: For breakfast/brunch, I want to be able to choose from a lot of options - Sweet, savory, caffeinated, fruity, cheesy, boozy.  Honey Honey fits the bill.  With more tasty choices than you can shake a stick at, you will definitely be able to find something that fits your mood.  The portions are large and service is quick - you pay at the counter, seat yourself, and wait for your food to come to you.  On my last visit, I had a mimosa and huevos rancheros.  Both were solid though not exceptional.  Next time I might opt for one of the savory crepes.
author: Jackie G.

description:
The picture of the french toast on this site sold me!  I ordered it and loved it.

Also the breakfast burrito!! oh nomnomnomnom.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Im so sad I only discovered this place now, its great!!!!!
Crepes are savory yum yum, menu is super cheap.

Highly recommended!
author: Flor D.

description:
Honey honey, how you thrill me, a-ha, honey honey
Honey honey, nearly kill me, a-ha, honey honey
I've heard about you before
I wanted to know some more
And now I know what they mean...
You have great cuisine!

Okay, so my mom has been listening to Mamma Mia! nonstop and the overflow of excessive ABBA beats has gotten to me... but how appropriate, I must say!

This place rocks. So many amazing breakfast and lunch offerings, I will definitely be coming back for more. My Savannah salad was HUGE and delicious, with nice large chunks of bleu cheese and no skimping on the other condiments. My mom's Half Moon Bay crepe was amazing and made me wish I had gone the crepe direction, while my brother's Croissant Sandwich and Potatoes made me wish I had gone the breakfast direction in general. I also ordered a good Vegetarian Black Bean Chili, and the Huevos Rancheros looked awesome (my dad's meal, which I eyed appreciatively as he savored it all).

Cannot wait to come back and try more from the menu, if not the entire menu.
author: Anna S.

description:
I like this place. It's almost the same menu as many as the blackboard "crepe" places around town -- Crepevine, Squat 'N Gobble, etc...but they redecorated a bit and have added their own flair: Sweet Things baked goods, free fruit-infused water (strawberry - yum!) and flowers painted on the walls and ceilings.

Everything I've ordered here has been pretty good -- salads, crepes -- and it's comfortable enough. I wouldn't lounge here forever all afternoon, but for a large salad in the area, it's worth a stop.
author: Melissa G.

description:
This place is much more fun on the inside than on the outside. It's got the multi-color chalk wall menu behind the counter, a sunny-feeling decor, and hip staff. Reminds me a lot of the Haight. The food ranges from burgers to crepes to American breakfast, and it's definitely satisfying and delicious. The small coffee mugs I find especially cute. 

It loses a star from 5 because it doesn't have as much of the big-window, sit-outside-if-you-want feel. It's a bit tucked away. The food is great and the portions of course large, but they're not some kind of super-chef invention. I need to go back a few more times to find my favorite dish. The prices are very favorable and it's a short wait.
author: Matt T.

description: We tried to go to Dottie's True Blue Cafe but the line was ridiculous and after a quick Yelp! search we ended up here. Quick serve type restaurant. We ordered eggs benedict, a pesto/feta/tomato crepe and two cups of coffee ($23) and grabbed a seat outside. The food was great and the seating was sufficiently comfortable. We did have to go to the counter for a coffee refill - not sure if that is the standard or not. Try this place out if you are in the mood for an easy, affordable, and tasty morning meal.
author: Ryan D.

description: Was staying nearby for a conference and was pulled into this place by the cool looking atmosphere and the "FREE WIFI" sign. I paid $2.00 (I'd already had a huge breakfast) for a cup of really good coffee, and I've been sitting here for two hours working on very fast free wifi. The waitress has refilled my coffee four times with a smile on her face. I am definitely stopping back later this week for breakfast.
author: Devon A.

description: The service was friendly and quick, and the food was amazing! It's also not really expensive at all. I had a crêpe and espresso and it was about $10. I am definitely coming back! :)
author: Christina L.

description: Pretty decent but I've had better.  Their crepes were a bit burnt and the salmon scramble wasn't as flavourful as I had wanted.
author: AJ D.

description: Food is great but seating limited. Extremely busy on Sunday morning. Line goes out of the door and people pretty much wait right next to your table while you are trying to eat.
author: Anya P.

description: We come here every Saturday and Sunday repetitively for good reason. One, their food is amazing. Two, the service is amazing, three, enough said. Although the menu is similar to all your creperies it truly is amazingly different. P.s. ask for a double Mimosa ;)
author: Sarah R.

description: The salads are pretty good -- they are HUGE and but it was the first time I've had bad tomatoes in SF.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Wait - A little long 3/5

Service - pretty fast, kinda small portions, good price 4/5

Food - salad sucked, pancakes were pretty good, potatoes tasted a little off, 2/5

Overall - Not a bad place but definitely nothing special. Food isn't the greatest quality but the pancakes are pretty good. If you go stick with the crepes and pancakes and you'll have a better experience overall.
author: Eric B.

description:
I been here 2 time and breakfast is great with the fresh squeezed OJ and I love the times 2 combo 2 pancakes 2 eggs and two meat items. 

I also like the veggie burger but they need to add a turkey burger to the menu to be complete. I just don't eat beef unless it KOBEbut thats even once in a blue moon,.  

Oh yeah they will make you a veggie scramble on comand and I love my veggie scramble.  Oh Honey is great with a lot of potential.
author: Karim R.

description: Mediocre service. Wait staff glanced in my direction when I entered. Then continued on without acknowledgement until I approached the counter, where I stood and waited a minute. Utensils handed to me were oily. New Orleans savory crepe was just okay. Chicken filling was a little on the dry side, despite the cheese and cream.
author: Eric M.

description: Unfriendly staff. Their ventilation is opening the door... Nice in a cold rainy day..  Food is good. Don't recommend with kids.
author: Julien B.

description:
OMG
SO GOOD
I ate here on my first night in San Francisco and I wish I had eaten here EVERY night. I had a crepe with eggplant and sundried tomatoes, a risky move for me who likes to eat within my comfort zone... and it was SO GOOD. I never knew an awkwardly shaped purple vegetable could be so... yummy! The rosemary potatoes that came with the order were perfect as well. And instead of some crappy plastic cup three times too small for an order of "just water" they had lemon and cucumber water available. Wonderful! 
So, my meal was huge and when I got it I thought I would never finish it--but it was so amazing I powered through it an never looked back. If I lived on this street, you can bet I would come here weekly.
author: Staci J.

description: Crepes were delicious, staff were excellent despite the large crowd.  Only thing from keeping it from five stars is how crowded it was!  Getting a table to eat took some skills on a Saturday at 11:30 am
author: Sean W.

description: Locals eat yes, visitors eat yes, everyone under the sun yes! First of all if you are staying at one of of the hotels near Union Square this is a good few blocks walk but definitely worth it. You can see outside this place is busy and I mean people line before sitting down. Luckily I just asked one of the bus boys to clear a dirty table and promised him a good tip which he did. Now to the food they really focus on cali/Mexi/fresh food with fresh squeeze OJ. I ordered their special burrito sunrise, kiwi banana strawberry crepé, and a croissant sandwich. All were great, portions were very giving and the flavors were spot on. They are more known for their crepés the rest of their delicious plates are worth tryin. Reason for the 4.5 was due to the staff not knowing the password for their free wi-fi
author: Cuth G.

description: Delighful find!  It was a crowded Sunday morning but the service was quick and the food was good.  From chocolate waffles, chorizo scramble, eggs benedict to mediterranean crepes everyone was pleased with their breakfast.  Coffee was ok - drinkable but tasted like mass produced restaurant blend coffee.  But the service was quick and cheerful.  Definately will be back next time we visit the city.
author: Susan R.

description: Good crepes at a reasonable price. When I come back to SF I'll make sure honey honey is on my list to visit again.
author: Marvin K.

description: In the city for the week, and this was one of the higher rated places for breakfast in union square.  The food was good, but the staff weren't that friendly.  The crepes were fantastic though!
author: Jacob J.

description: Amazing breakfast! I had the blitz and my husband had the crab cake Florentine. The presentation was beautiful. I highly recommend!
author: Carin W.

description: Very nice breakfast place in downtown. But the lines get crazy long.
author: Santiago S.

description: Meh...2nd time here....1st time was better...but now....meh.  Had the eggs benedict, which as ok...not very flavorful or memorable.  It came with potatoes, which was kinda un cooked still and was a disappointment.  The potatoes did have a great flavor/spice to  them...but too bad they were uncooked....uncooked potatoes...burrrrrrpppeeesss :P  Its always buzy here which is great..but I just wish the food wouldn't be so expensive for meh...breakfast...
author: Jeremy K.

description:
Wow, I must say that of all the breakfast places I've been to over the years this ranks as one of the finest I've ever been to. Simply great in every measure. Other breakfast places ought to be forced to spend a day here to learn how to do things correctly.  

Some of the things I love about this places:

-The food is excellent and consistent.
-They have the best tasting homefries I've ever tried with great seasoning.
-The Crepes always look beautiful and are well decorated no matter how busy they are.
-The staff is friendly.
-The decor is very nice airy and cozy at the same time.
-Prices are reasonable given the quality.
-Fresh fruit.
-Free chilled water filled/flavored with lemons and fruit.
-Excellent French Toast.

I found this place through Yelp and wound up eating breakfast here everyday during my trip from Boston and couldn't have been more impressed. I hope they don't change a thing they're doing because this was my favorite food stop during my stay in San Fran. It baffles me that anyone would award this place less than 4 stars.
author: David G.

description: It is what it is. Huevos Rancheros, Crab Cake Benedict, French Toast, Sunrise Burrito. Chorizo was bland, crab cake was goopy and breaded, very surprising. Go hunt for Don Pistos if you're in San Fran, you'll be a lot happier.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Ok, so, New Years day, my friend and I sleep in from partying till 5 am, and we're like, "Let's do breakfast and let's do it big."
So, we hop on over to Honey, Honey (it's two blocks away) and the line is out the door, but the staff (very few of them) hustle like no other and get through everyone. 

It was just us two sophisticated females, who enjoy food and conversation and the socially analyzing everyone while waiting in line and this is what we ordered:

She:  Eggs Benedict with canadian bacon. The english muffin was perfectly soft and buttered yet stable enough to hold the egg/bacon duo and topped with hollandaise sauce.  It came with roasted potatoes on the side.

Me: Acapulco omlet. This amazing omlet had a burried treasure inside: avocado, an appropiate amount of melted cheddar and soft, oozing with flavor black bean chili.  It was topped with a subtle amount of salsa and a drizzle of sour cream.  It came with roasted potatoes on the side and a choice of bread. I chose an english muffin. 

Okay, that's not it! We ordered more. We wanted a big meal to start the year off with, right?

We also shared an order of french toast with a slight sprinkle of powered sugar and fresh strawberries. We buttered them up and drenched them in maple syrup.

And...
We ordered a side of bacon (I know, right??) and a side of fruit (we needed something full of nutrient and water content).

With two glasses of freshly squeezed orange juice, we had topped our ultimate breakfast feast.

I enjoyed every bite. We finished everything!!

Service: they were super kind and efficient even with the high volume of business in their store.
Food: made love to my taste buds, satisfied my idealization of what breakfast should be.
and..
my dearest friend who accompanied me: was the best person to share the amount of food and the first day of the year with.

It was the happiest New Year.
author: Nahren K.

description: My new Go-To Sandwich place after a recommendation from a friend who lives nearby. Like many others, he loves the Crepes, but I have had several sandwiches, scrambles & beers here, all delicious. I have been fortunate enough to miss the crowds, there is always a place to sit & the outdoor tables are nice to chill at on the weekends.
author: Lily R.

description: Yummy yummy. Much too yummy for children! Crepes and pancake! Fresh orange juice ohh my! This place is usually busy in the morning but it goes by fast and is worth the wait!
author: Sammy H.

description: Cute Place with a friendly and casual setting.  The wait was long, but then again many smaller, good food breakfast places are like that so can't fault anyone! The menu has a lot of choices and the food is very good.  I would definitely go here again next time I am in the city.  I had the Sunrise Chorizo Breakfast Burrito...UBER GOOD!  I haven't tried the crepes which I hear are very good and want to go back so I can try them!
author: Jon T.

description: We had breakfast here during our visit in San Francisco and it was a great experience. The breakfast was delicious! I ordered the acapulco omelette and my fiance ordered the tofu scamble. The menu is really unique with some creative and interesting dishes.
author: Priscilla R.

description: Nice ambiance. Got myself an Original Crepes with a cup of Hot Cidar. Yummy. Though I wished crepes would be served warmer so the cheese could be a bit more melted.
author: Michelle N.

description: Our food was good, but the atmosphere didn't appeal to us. It looks like it has been through several generations of tenants without anyone ever overhauling the interior design - it looks like a Chinese restaurant, a diner, and an Italian cafe all at the same time. We tried 2 coffee drinks, a savory eggplant crepe, and a breakfast platter with pancakes, bacon, and eggs. Everything was good - the crepe came with really good potatoes roasted in herbs, and the pancakes were topped with nice, fresh strawberries - I could see the pile of fresh fruit back in the kitchen when I ordered. We left full and happy, but it's not a place we'd want to linger.
author: Erin A.

description:
this was a cute little place to come to on the weekend. the line was almost out the door and it took us about 20 mins of waiting to order.

i had the salsa crepe which was good and packed with cheese and well, salsa. bf had the 2 2 and 2 but he said it was pretty meh.

i really do like the atmosphere of the place - perhaps we just came on the wrong sunday.
author: laura f.

description: This place had the BEST eggs Benedict I have ever had. The eggs were perfectly cooked and not over done. The hollandaise sauce was freshly made and the English muffin wasn't over toasted. I can die happy now.
author: Alex D.

description: This was just the right place near my hotel for an early lunch/late breakfast.  Unpretentious, nice atmosphere.  I really enjoyed the New Orleans (a savory crepe with chicken).  Based on other reviews, I gather it can be too crowded at peak times so my timing no doubt helped in giving me a favorable reaction.
author: Patrick K.

description:
I love HONEY HONEY.  Every friend and family member I have taken there ends up loving it too.

Food: Breakfast/Brunch is definitely the thing to go for.  If you are like me and love breakfast food for any meal, then this place is great for you since they serve breakfast ALL DAY!  You never have to worry about getting up early after a long night out.  The french toast is amazing.  The potatoes are amazing as well.  

Service - It can get busy on the weekends and you seat yourself so keep that mind, but the staff is amazing.  Just yesterday I was in there and forgot to order bacon with my breakfast, so i asked the wonderful gentleman who brought out our food if he could but in the order  while I waited in line so that I could eat it with my meal. He told me not to worry and brought my a plate of bacon on the house.  They also offer free refills on coffee and teas.

ETC: They have free wi-fi, but there is only one table near an outlet, so charge your battery before you go.  It is a great place for large groups since you can each pay separately when you order your food and never have to worry about the one slacker friend who underpays!
author: Olivera J.

description: My fiancé and I were walking around our hotel, Nob Hill Hotel, to find a place for breakfast this morning and I saw the reviews on Yelp so we decided to go in, plus it was super cold outside and it was the closest place we could get to in a hurry...man were we glad that we did!!!  The line was all the way to the door, but we got up to the counter in less than 15 minutes.  You wait in line, order your food, then sit down at a table, and then your food is delivered.  It was for sure worth it!!!  I ordered the breakfast croissant sandwich and they scramble eggs with cheese and ham inside of a flaky, buttery croissant, and it was delicious.  My fiancé ordered the Sunrise Burrito and it was HUGE!  It came with black beans and sour cream, and the pork chorizo was so spicy and good.  We ordered a side of the breakfast potatoes and there were a couple hundred pieces of potatoes (definitely can share an order for two people).  They were yummy too.  We enjoyed every single bite of both of our meals.  They have fresh squeezed orange juice that is worth the $2.75 per glass, it is really good but they don't serve it with ice.  Ask for a cup of ice separate.  They have lemon and lime water up by the counter for you to get yourself because the staff is so busy moving food and getting people in and out.  It is not a place to sit and eat for hours, but if you want a really good breakfast quickly to get in and out, this is the place!  We will come back here for sure!  Great food!!!
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Amazing, Amazing, Amazing. 

Their savory crepes are incredible and their Nutella crepe (with vanilla ice cream) is to die for.  The potatoes that come with are also yummy.  Their Greek salad is another favorite.  Pretty much everything is good.  But, if its your first time you have to order a crepe w potatoes (try pesto)!  The atmosphere is soft and light.  Its the perfect place to go with a group for lunch if you want to talk/hear each other.  

I also LOVE that there is fruit in the water.
author: Taylor S.

description:
after a night of drinking, did someone say crepes for lunch and less than a minute walk from the JW? we are there! 

this place is so cute. the menu is written on huge boards on the wall and you order at the front and your food is brought to you. they also have regular breakfast items for those who dont want a crepe but also breakfast crepes for those wanting a little bit of both. 

we ordered 
- breakfast crepe and added mushrooms 
- eggs benedict 
- strawberry nutella crepe for dessert
- orange juice 
DELICIOUS evertyhingggg love it here! and its reasonably priced even though you're in the middle of union square! love it!
author: Jen S.

description: If you like Crepevine, this place is pretty similar. Good local food.
author: Cindy S.

description: How can you not appreciate this place? It's cozy for a crepery and they have a large menu of both savory and sweet crepes as well as traditional breakfast items and salads. However, the savory crepes our wonderful! I had the chicken pesto which was really too much for me to eat! My friend was also highly impressed with the eggplant crepe. The prices are affordable and they service is great. I can't wait to go back and try one of the sweet crepes!
author: Marissa P.

description: We did not eat here but passed by it. It's rather small. We decided to continue to sticking to our plans at eating breakfast at Sears Fine Food off Powell, which we continued to eat at every am while in SFO.
author: Kim V.

description:
Honey Honey is a solid breakfast joint.  Not the most amazing food out there, but it's still pretty good.  Out of all the things I've tried here, I think their crepes are definitely their best menu items.  Here are some things I've tried so far:

-Belgium waffle: Good!
-Strawberry and nutella crepe:  Very good!
-Basic cheddar omelette with side of potatoes: Average.  It's kind of hard to mess up an omelette and I've had better potatoes.   

I like that it has a huge menu selection and seating is easy to find even when it gets a bit more crowded.   On weekend mornings when it gets a little crowded, the line to order food can get very long and my only complaint would be that I noticed the the cashier is really slow (and there's only one) and not the friendliest.  However, once you get your order in, they're very quick about bringing your food and clearing other tables and the servers are much friendlier.
author: Michelle N.

description: I love coming here because the food is great, the portions are huge, and the prices are good!  I don't have any one favorite dish because they have so many good ones!!  I've always wanted to try their breakfast items, but always end up with getting crepes.  It's just a great neighborhood eatery, low-key, and delicious.
author: Vero K.

description:
This is my second time here (I had breakfast here before on my otherwise uneventful trip to SF in 2008).  The place was called the Crepe House, and can still be found on their website, but it's still the same inside -- cute as ever!!  

I had the cheddar omelette with wheat bread & potatoes.  The potatoes aren't really my fave (some pieces have some tough undersides), but the toast & omelette were great!  The waitstaff was really nice too -- both the counter clerk and the bus boy came around to offer me a (free) refill on my diet coke.  =)   The decor is super-cute -- last time I noticed the painted tables, and this time I noticed the Tiffany-esque (stained glass) chandeliers and sconces -- very pretty!!

It was obviously one of the very few GOOD things from my trip in 2008, and I've made it a point to return this time.  I will probably do the same in the future, so I think that says a lot.  =)
author: Karen B.

description: Best Avoided! I stopped by this place for lunch today and after a long wait a very small sad crepe with little filling, and a cup of fruit, some ripe, some not, showed up on a gray very chipped grubby plate.  Very disappointing! There are some great food pictures in the yelp reviews of this place, but mine looked nothing like them:(
author: Allyson B.

description: The banana crepe was not very good.  The Mediterranean crepe was a little better. The crepe itself was not inspiring and a little bland and heavy. Crepes are not pancakes.
author: George E.

description: This place is delicious. Exactly the kind of place you want to find when traveling out of town. Something for everyone. Very good!
author: Greg R.

description:
Great spot, good selection, good food and a good price. Also, free wifi and it's a cozy place to go! 

please check out my food blog for a full review with photos!
author: Lily K.

description: Had the crab cake florentine.  The flavors were great but it would've been nicer to have more crab.  There was a bit too much bread.
author: Kacie C.

description:
I was in the area for a surprise engagement cocktail party and since the hubs and I arrived early, we went looking for a place to eat. We stumbled upon this place not having any expectations and we were pleasantly surprised.

Atmosphere - good, clean, comfortable.
Customer Service - eh, should have been better. Lady working the counter acted like I was interrupting her napkin folding time. Seriously? WTF?
FOOD - excellent for $8.95 a plate! I've been to other creperies and paid more than that for less food. We both ordered savory crepes: 
CHICKEN PESTO - Swiss, tomato, garlic, pesto, fresh basil, chicken breast
NORTH BEACH - Swiss cheese, onion, spinach, chicken breast, mushroom, hollandaise sauce
Hubs had a side salad, I had potatoes (to soak up the booze later) and I have mixed feelings about the potatoes, they were fresh (I saw the line prep chopping them) but they were a little dry and could have used more seasoning. 

But other than dry potatoes and grumpy counter lady, I liked it and will be back. I'll just order the side salad...
author: Hotdogger G.

description: I've been here couple of times and always get the crepes.most of the time it's fine. Last time I went here it was dinner so I felt like trying the pasta. I ordered capelline di anjelo. it was such a huge mistake. It came in a bigass plate filled with mushy overcooked angel hair pasta with really thick sauce of white wine and tomato sauce. Its overflowing the plate. Its jusst gross I literary lost my apetite on the spot. I didn't finish it (obviously) and didn't even bother to have it to go. Ugggh give me back my precious 11 dollar..
author: Gina L.

description:
Solid place, a bit on the pricey side though.

Highly recommend the oriental chicken salad. It is huge and quite tasty.

I always get the nutella and strawberry crepe which is also delicious.

The service is a bit slow though, so be prepared.
author: Henriette P.

description: I can be quite the orange juice snob because I'm extremely particular about my oj and all I have to say is the orange juice here is out of this world...... and their potatoes are delicious.
author: Jessica L.

description: Waited an hour for our food. And it was cold. And not very good. Won't be going back.
author: Alana G.

description:
Too much cheese on crepes. (I love cheese)
Cappuccino, bloody merry and flavored water were superb.
author: Smigor r.

description: I am not sure who did the menu in this place, but it sure is intimidating when you are an 11-inch high, 9-lb. dog! My parents and I have eaten there three times. Most of their fare revolves around Crepes (of course) and is of average quality. Do not order their ice tea, unless you like the mango-fruity variety. Maybe it is because I am from the South, where you do not never, ever mess with the tea, but YUCK!!!  Outside seating and pet friendly. Come on, add some good ole ice tea and I will become a regular!
author: Finnegan M.

description:
Honey Honey has become my go to place for breakfast / brunch / an any-time-of-day crepe fix. 

Here's what I've had thus far:

Strawberry + Nutella Crepe : DELICIOUS! Tons of nutella and strawberries. How can you go wrong?

Strawberry Crepe : really good but a little too light for my taste. I was still hungry afterwards and craving my good ol' strawberry + nutella!

New Orleans Crepe: tasty but could use some sort of sauce. felt like it was missing something. The rosemary potatoes on the side were the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had. A little crunchy and oh so yummy.  

Eggs Benedict: good but I'm used to my mom's hollandaise sauce so I guess I'm a little spoiled! It comes with the rosemary potatoes though, so bonus points for that.

Overall, the place is very cute and clean and the menu has a good mixture of crepes (both sweet and savory), breakfast items, sandwiches and pastas. I haven't tried the pastas or sandwiches but I've heard good things about them. The fresh fruit in the water is a nice surprise but the service could be a little friendlier. C'mon, it's not that hard to smile!
author: Amanda R.

description: BEST-COBB-SALAD I have ever seen or tasted, you gotta try it if you're in a big salad mood.
author: Slim P.

description: i love that this place is pay first so that way i can get up and leave soon as im done. the food was pretty good to no problems
author: Donnae K.

description: Sandwiches are about what you would expect from a sandwich. Tasty, but didn't blow my mind. The side potatoes were tasty, but that's probably because they were coated in salt. The savory crepes looked really interesting, but in the end mine was a little on the dry side.
author: Nicole A.

description:
I had no honey, I had no crepes but what I did have kept me full and happy till dinner. 

After perusing the lengthy menu I choose the crab cake Florentine. Now I love me a crab cake, anything seafood has my heart but crab cakes for breakfast? I ordered my Florentine w/ eggs medium, grabbed my number and got my self serve water (it's flavored water, yummy and free).
