A short wait later I was served two golden crab cakes each sitting on a bed of sauteed spinach and English muffin topped off w/ eggs and hollandaise sauce. A side of seasoned potatoes was the dam that kept the lake of hollandaise sauce from spilling over my plate. The combination of the flavors made my mouth so happy. I am now convinced that crab cakes are A-OK for breakfast. I went back a few days later and had the eggs benedict.  This time the potatoes tasted a bit off, cooked a few mins longer than needed.  The food overall left me satisfied once again. Good location, nice mix of tourist and locals, free WiFi and lots of choices. One day I'll be back to actually try the crepes.
author: Jamie A.

description: Decently priced breakfast/brunch place.  Of the items I've ordered off their extensive menu, none have disappointed.  There can be a bit of a line, but they are organized.  This is San Francisco, so of course, there are better options, but in that neighborhood, it's a solid, if not exciting choice.
author: Aly V.

description:
If I could, I would rate if 4 stars 1/2.
The only additional .5 star it would take to go up to 5 would if it were a bit less noisy.
Except for that, the food is great, prices not too expensive, and layout and decor are cool. We had a great time, and the service was top notch.
author: Max V.

description: So good.........from the omelette's to Mimosa's fresh and tasty.... really kept us full all day. We ate here the first morning of our trip.  Found it on our yelp. We were staying at the Kensington park hotel...and it was a quick walk. No wait, fast service.
author: Sharon C.

description:
We happened by this place on Christmas Eve in the afternoon.  The crepes sounded good.  You could eat them like a taco almost and they were warm and crispy and filled with lots of good stuff.

 Coffee is pretty good and flavorful and my favorite part about the restaurant is the cute decor.  Nice lights and wall art and everyone is very friendly there and helpful as well.  Three choices of chilled water on hand too: lemon, orange and cucumber.  A nice little bonus.
author: Slim S.

description: Ordering took roughly as long as Israel and Palestine reaching a peace accord, though eating said food went by significantly quicker. Fresh ingredients and a low-key atmosphere made for a great Sunday brunch. Not the quietest breakfast I've ever had, but entertaining conversations managed to flutter around more frequently than otherwise less interesting or rude ones.
author: Phil R.

description: I absolutely love this place! I've come here for both breakfast and lunch, and they were both fantastic meals. I recommend the waffles for breakfast/brunch here. They put a ton of fresh fruit and whipped cream on top which is exactly how I like my waffles. Another nice touch is the infused waters they offer for free (I believe one is orange infused, and the other is cucumber and lemon). For lunch I had a soup and salad combination which was also delicious. I like the fact that they have free wifi, however, I wasn't able to find any outlets around the tables so it's not a place you can stay at to "work from home" which is what I was wanting to do (yes, I usually stake out at Starbucks for at least 5 hours at a time). Prices are decent, food is delicious, staff is friendly, atmosphere is quaint and pleasant, what more could you really want?
author: Ashley D.

description: Food was uninspired, dried out flat grill. Horrible music, atmosphere and bathrooms. Full of tourists who were tricked by the stacked yelp rating.
author: Brian M.

description: We found this place on a Tuesday morning. Why the relevance of the day...Dottie's was closed.  Now I know this is a write-up for Honey Honey, but I need to reference Dottie's only to tell you how much we enjoyed Honey Honey.  In a panic knowing we could not eat at Dottie's we looked for a place to fill in...along comes a recommendation for Honey Honey.  Stacy, who worked behind the desk of our hotel said we would not be disappointed...and I was not.  There was so much great stuff on the menu, two of us ordered 3 breakfast.  The crepes were yummy.  The omelets were fluffy and filled with great stuff and my eggs benedict was fresh and better than I have had in years.  It did not have the unusual items like Dotties, but what they did have was very good.
author: Scott T.

description: Not a big sweets guy but MAN was that good.  Beats the crap outta that pricey LA crApery I went to last time.  Had the nutella and banana with whip cream...  ditch the icecream, get the whip... just sayin.
author: Justin B.

description: Non-English speaking guy at the register was not fun to deal with. EVERY table that was not occupied, was filthy and there were staff standing around not doing anything. When the dish that had no dairy listed in the ingredients came out, it was in a cream sauce with copious amounts of cheese everywhere. The food I got was edible but, I then got up from the table for a moment only to have the busser come over and take ALL of my belongings, including some purchases I had made, and place them IN HIS WET BUS TUB! Except for my jacket which he threw over his arm, I assume in order to take them home for himself later. Needless to say, I had a bad experience.
author: Robert M.

description:
This place is right by my digs and I find myself in here when I'm in a rush.  

Most the food is rather gross, it is the same food as before just a new owner and name.

I do like the side salads the have.
Burger =rubbery and chewy in a non-good way.
Fruit= soggy and very mushy.
I've gotten bad milk a handful of times.

The atmosphere is just so awkward and weird, very run down vibe.

Tourist trap, good for large groups and children and have a variety of food on the menu so you can attempt to please everyone's tastes.


I will come back again and give it a 20th chance once the owners have really settled in and straightened things out.
author: Diana D.

description:
I really wanted this to be my neighborhood cafe - I gave it a good college effort, to no avail.  It's such a cute place with decently priced items, friendly service and good hours as far as I've found, but my rating is based on the two experiences I've had there recently.

The first bad experience was when I ordered a dry latte, which was depressingly cool - I watched the woman make it, so how could it already be lukewarm?  Then the internet was unfortunately slow, which gave me time to down the bad coffee, and I ended up leaving after waiting 10 min for a page to load.  

I thought these things weren't enough to turn me off completely, so I took a friend another time, and as we walked in it smelled intensely of bathroom as if a pipe had burst right in the kitchen.  I just couldn't stomach another bad coffee in these conditions.

The place has a lot of potential, but I won't be patronizing again anytime soon.
author: Amber M.

description:
Summary:  Eclectic array of delicious foods. Great Service. Free Wi-Fi.  

The Food:  Honey Honey Cafe features one of the most eclectic menus we experienced while in San Francisco: Crepes, Spaghetti, Burgers, Salads, Home-baked goods... the list goes on, and everything we tried was excellent.  

The Staff: Overly friendly and welcoming family staff. 

The Service:  Honey Honey does not provide the quickest meals, being that there is one cook and one to three people working the register and seating area, however the quality of the food, the friendliness of the staff, and the great atmosphere more than make up for this fact.  

The Atmosphere:  Classic Cafe styling.  Order at the counter. Seat yourself.  Free Wi-Fi.  During the breakfast rush there is a line out the door, and for good reason. The crepes are out of this world delicious.   Any other time of day you will have no problem getting a table.  

Bottom line: This place is great.  We dined here three times during our stay, and left wishing they would open a branch in So-Cal so we could continue to experience their greatness.  Do yourself a favor and don't miss this fantastic cafe!
author: Joshua M.

description:
Good crepes but probably not worth the super long lines for brunch.

Is this place owned by the same people that own Crepevine? Then menu seems to be in the same even though the dishes have different names.
author: Sydney L.

description: Fantastic food for a great price. The new Orleans crepe is excellent!
author: Jack M.

description:
great place to get breakfast!

most memorable, fresh squeezed orange juice!  the machine is hypnotizing!
author: Liezl S.

description:
The boys and I were starving and looking for something good. As I was reading yelp reviews on the iphone while we were walking, I mentioned creps, and the little guy HAD TO HAVE THEM. So we found Honey Honey. 

Who are we: Mom, dad & 2 boys, 9 & 13.

What did we get & How did we like it?

Mom, french toast - mmmmmm, super yummy!
Dad, eggs benedict - good but not great
DS #1 - Pancakes, eggs & bacon  - AWESOME - he was very happy, loved the cakes and bacon - could have passed on the eggs.
DS#2 Banana Strawberry Crep with whipped cream - he couldn't have been happier!

mom & Dad were happy with the coffee (although the refil process is a bit odd as the server takes your cup to refil, rather than bringing the pot. DS#2 got fresh squeezed OJ - and it was truley fresh squeezed - it was perfect.

We were all happy to be web browsing on our various handhelds on the free wifi.
author: Colleen R.

description: Walking around looking for a breakfast place and randomly found Honey Honey.  No line when we walked in but was soon out the door within five minutes.  Had the eggs florentine it was very good. A bit cramped and noisy in the restaurant but food was deliciousand the espresso bevy's were good too. Portions are pretty big.
author: Mandy R.

description:
Went here for a late (12:30pm) Sunday brunch with some visiting friends due to recommendations from a friend and yelp.

I went here for one thing and one thing only...crepes.
I ordered the New Orleans savory crepe (with chicken, swiss cheese, bell peppers, sun dried tomatoes, and topped with salsa), and the gf ordered the Miami heat savory crepe which had similar ingredients but with a spicier salsa on top.
Both crepes were pretty darn good, but I'd give the edge to the New Orleans crepe. The Miami heat's salsa was not as fresh/refreshing as the New Orleans, and seemed to be spicy for the sake of being spicy (even though it wasn't really that spicy). The New Orleans crepe was excellent with a balanced slightly sweet and salty tate.

The savory crepe dishes are big portions (1 is plenty per person) and are also served with a side choice (I got rosemary garlic potatoes which were a bit too dry and heavy on the rosemary/garlic).

There is quite a bit of seating area (maybe 1.5-2 starbucks in size) and you order you items at the front cash register and then choose your own seating.

Oh did I mention that you get free refills on your drinks (or at least we did when we went!).
author: Varun ..

description: Great little find located close to the Union Square area. The place is popular with locals and tourists alike and once you read the menu you can understand why as you certainly get a lot of bang for your buck. The list of option is varied and extensive with pancakes, omelettes and other egg-based treats making up the majority. Free Wi-Fi is a bonus too.
author: Joe M.

description: We had breakfast yesterday and dinner last night.  Everything was fantastic, the service, the efficiency and most of all the food.  Last night I had a veggie burger that was huge.  it was dressed with tomato, avocado, lettuce and I asked for cheese as well.  My husband had a cheeseburger which looked like enough for 2 meals.  We got ours to go and ate in our hotel.  Our food was still plenty hot and delicious.  If you want a light bite, better try something else our food was hearty!
author: K B.

description:
I used to frequent this place when it was The Crepe House. This morning was my first stop at the restaurant with the new name Honey Honey. The menu and decor seems like it hasn't really changed. The former restaurant, "The Crepe House", was worthy of 4 stars because of the good food and awesome staff. The food is almost as good as I remember but the staff (or at least the girl I dealt with) has taken a fall. When I called to place my take out order I had to deal with a girl who spoke very poor English and got frustrated on the phone when she couldn't figure out what I was trying to order.

*note to management* 
Make sure your staff taking phone orders can speak and understand English clearly and doesn't get frustrated at the customer when they don't understand.

This will be my last time eating here.
author: g m.

description: Fresh, tasty ingredients.  The salsa in the black bean soup was especially delightful.
author: Jackie F.

description: Delicious food, friendly service, and lots of variety! The best Blintz I've ever had! SOO GOOOD!
author: Liquidfairy L.

description: Stumbled into this warmly lit haven after a day of dodging chilly weather and raindrops in the city.  EXTENSIVE menu (honestly...amazed at how many lovely options there were to choose from).  We split a chicken, swiss, and hollandaise crepe and followed it up with plain crepes with sugar.  Both delicious.  Really warm inside (lighting and temp)...great music playing (jazz-ish) and friendly service.  Can't wait to go back and try a few more things!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Tasty food, extensive menu, and delicious fresh-squeezed OJ,  although I got a bit impatient waiting 10-15 minutes in line and another 10-15 for our food. Also a little bummed about the weak coffee and frigid temperature, but the yummy french toast made up for it. Bonus points for the convenient location and ample seating.
author: Lauren S.

description:
this place is really underrated.  ive wokred in the area for a long time, but for some reason, havent gone here much.  But when I do the food is generally above average and fresh.
The service is also generally good.
Their Veggie burger (comes with a great bun) is good and comes with fruit, salad or potatoes.
author: Sumit K.

description: Definitely one of the best cafes in the area!!! Delicious crepes, coffee, hamburgers, pastas, soups and salads, this cafe has it all. Stayed with my gf two blocks from here and it was our daily breakfast stop before embarking on our daily vacation activities. One might easily mistake service for being slow, but the fact of the matter is, that new customers have a large menu to choose from, therefore taking their time. Service, on the other hand, is great. The food comes out quick and customer service is as good as it gets. Very friendly staff and the cooks seems to know what they're doing. The majority of the crepes (if not all) come with very delicious rosemary potatoes, which are awesome. The dessert crepes are great and come with a side of either ice cream or whip cream. Can't miss the Moussaka they serve here, simply an amazing dish.
author: Ray B.

description:
I went here twice while staying a few blocks away. All in all the food was tasty and the drinks were just ok.

I appreciated the free WiFi though, and there prices were good.
author: Jon T.

description:
3.5 Stars rounded up = 4 stars

I started my beautiful Saturday morning with the sis by fueling up here at Honey Honey. It used to be called Crepe House but I think it changed names (and owner?) but I'm not sure why or when. The menu looks the same.

Why I like this place:
1. Free Wi-Fi
2. Casual cafe atmosphere and super friendly staff
3. Good selection of savory & sweet crepes along with a menu of other cafe (sandwiches, soups, salads) items
4. Beer on tap & mimosas

I've tried a few different savory crepes here which are all tasty. But if you're not sure what to try - you can never go wrong with the Nutella & Bananas with ice cream on the side! This was a way to start my long, long day shopping at Union Square... (Oh.... the damage was bad! Shopping that is!)
author: Mai N.

description: One of the few places I could find with good belgian waffles and fruit. The fresh squeezed orange juice is worth it at twice the price.
author: Matt K.

description: Attempted to eat at Honey Honey in October but the line was literally out the door. Came here this past Saturday for breakfast and while we had to wait in a long line, it was definitely worth it. The decor is super charming, seating a little tight but the food is absolutely delish. Coffee a little strong for my taste. Had to have a Nutella crepe, because when else would you order it...and they were to die for!
author: Cara P.

description: Good selection. Food was fresh. They were accommodating when I wanted French toast instead of pancakes with the combo. Free wifi too
author: Rainbow M.

description: YUM! If you aren't at Honey Honey Cafe for Breakfast then you're definitely missing out. Came here twice while I was in San Francisco. The first time was so good, I had to come again for seconds. The place is always packed, whether it's a Monday morning or a Saturday brunch. They have amazing food specials and their crepes are to die for. The portion sizes are large, enough to satisfy even the most hungry hungry hippo. I had the breakfast sandwich that was delicious and I also tried the "cable car" dish, which was very tasty as well. If you're in San Francisco I would recommend coming here for a great start to your day.
author: Janine R.

description: Crowded and busy on a Monday morning. Long lines to order, but totally worth it. Large menu variety & great food in a nicely decorated cafe. Big portions at reasonable prices & the pasta was better than we had at a 4 star restaurant the day before. Highly recommended.
author: Suzanne A.

description:
This is a nice cafe, and they have tasty (if a bit pricey -- not super-pricey, but a bit expensive) food.  The veggies in my crepe were a bit bitey which I like, but some might prefer better well done.

I would have rated it 4 stars, but when I got an iced tea refill, I was asked "did you get food", which feels very unfriendly to me, less than welcoming.  The cafe is not crowded nor has it been since I got here.
author: Blackfeather T.

description: FANTASTIC FOOD!!!!   I had the Crap Cake Florentine and it hit the spot.  The presentation of the food was neat and clean, the taste was fantastic and was a great start to our day.    FYI, You WILL wait in line for about 10-15 minutes.  We walked by Sunday around 9am and just passed up because it was about a 30 minute wait to order your food.  On Monday morning we waited about 15 minutes.
author: Scott O.

description: I've eaten breakfast at Honey Honey Cafe twice due to the convenient location (a short walk from Union Square hotels) and extensive menu. Both times it was crowded and took a few minutes to get to the counter to order, but there was no wait to find a table after ordering. The breakfast burrito was somewhat plain but the homemade salsa helped. The eggs Benedict were tasty and well made but not the best I've had. I definitely recommend the orange juice as it is fresh squeezed for each order! Overall, good food at a reasonable price and a great location. I'll definitely be back!
author: Lauren M.

description: Meh. Crepes are amazing. Coffee is good. Was not impressed with the rest of the meal. Had the sunrise burrito which was mostly tortilla. Also had the chocolate waffle which was rich and good but should be served with a glass of milk! The crepes are what you should go for though... Service was iffy and slow, and the place is loud. But if you're not in a rush and feel like people watching... Check it out.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Hopped in here for breakfast after wandering around for 10 minutes trying to find something. Happy we did.
I had lox benedict with sauce on the side. Really yummy, not a complaint to be had except the eggs were a tad on the too-runny side.
Wife had plain ol' benedict: Again, everything was good but her eggs were even more on the too-runny side. 
Coffee was excellent. 
Overall a good choice. No complaints. If you don't like your eggs super runny you might want to mention something.
author: Dave S.

description: This place was great. Sunday mornings make it a little difficult to get a table but I think it's pretty worth the wait. The place has a nice feel to it, really cute decor, and the food is yummy too! We had the french toast and acapulco omlette, then went back for the club. All of it was really tasty. Their curly fries are great too. Service was good, everyone was really kind.
author: Ann A.

description: I agree with the other reviewer.  Don't waste your time here.  The restaurant itself is grungy and the food is bland ... average at best.  We were only in SF for 1 night and I was looking forward to a great breakfast but was very disappointed with this place.  Also, they served use day old bacon - eewww!
author: Susan K.

description: I am a sucker for crepe, and they fulfill my every fantasy (my fantasy being crepe with Nutella and ice cream). Free wifi, which is always a plus, nice staff, good breakfast. I'm not so sure I like the cucumber water, nor the seating - the benching seems slightly too high, or the tables too low. Either way, I prefer sitting on the chairs, which seem to have the correct hight. The breakfast isn't breathtaking, I quite like the omelets though.
author: Tizia B.

description: This place sucks!! Confusing line and not sure whether to save yourself a table as everyone was doing without having a food ticket first and you have to ask other people what to do if your first time there. Supposedly they are to have a pretty good breakfast but it was not even close! Standing in a slow moving line just to order and you have to carry your own drinks and ticket number trying to find a table that was not hogged up by other people NOT eating. Chorizo and eggs scramble looked like a childs plate portion and not even chorizo..,potatoes were burnt and hard and sour dough bread hard, dry and cold not buttered as you have to be lucky to find butter sticks that are cold and overall not appetizing. Never ate much of dish as whole dish tasted like crap. The creeps looked good but hard and cold no matter what u ordered. Eggs Benedict tasteful but tiny!! That is why i give only 1 Star as there is no half stars. Overall this place is not worth price and food is not all that. Will never recommend this place to anyone unless u don't know what's good breakfast and never return.,....I make better breakfasts at home by my 12 year old...left to go eat a real breakfast!
author: Dana D.

description: YUMMY!!!!!  This is one of the best brunch places i have ever been to!  My boyfriend and i had such a hard time deciding what to order based on their unique, extensive menu so we decided to split 2 breakfast entrees.  We ordered the tofu scramble and the crab cake benedict, both were absolutely amazing!!  The tofu scramble had smoked tofu, green peppers, onions and eggs, it was awesome!  The crab cake benedict was fabulous, however, our eggs were a little over poached.  Regardless it was delicious and the hollandaise sauce was not too overpowering.  The best part though was the OJ!!!!  By far, the best orange juice i've had in my life.  They fresh squeeze it when you order it, with this unusual looking machine. It is so good!!  I loved this place and can't wait to go back and order a crepe!!
author: Steph H.

description: Very long wait.  Food was good but not so sure it is worth the 1hr+ wait.
author: Ibrahim M.

description:
The way they decorated the place is almost like they're trying to convince you that you're eating outside in a garden.... 

As food goes... GREAT. The Crepes are SOOO delicious!! It comes with either salad or potatoes and i ALWAYS get the potatoes. SO SO good! I like how they have actual fruit in the complimentary water. Creative and snazzy to say the least. I have yet to try the other food on the menu and i dont think i will for awhile, their crepes are just THAT good! 

I leave full and satisfied every time! 



GO HERE!
author: Tedi O.

description: The free wifi is unbearable slow,the oatmeal was delicious. A great place for breakfast.
author: Scott M.

description: I ordered the breakfast burrito.  Usually one ingredient (like the eggs) overwhelms the taste but all the ingredients blended together well to make an excellent breakfast.  I can also recommend the fresh squeezed orange juice.
author: Paul R.

description: My bestie took me here one weekend morning and it was packed with people. As we waited in line I practically drooled all over everyones meals. The menu is so big it was hard to choose, so I made her pick! We shared the sunrise chorizo burrito with a side of their amazing potatoes. UGH! it was so good! It's making me hungry RIGHT NOW! I'm so jealous she lives so close to this great spot. I can't wait to come back for lunch or dinner sometime!
author: Casi C.

description:
My girlfriend and I traveled to San Francisco in November of 2010.  I found Honey Honey a couple blocks away from our hotel and we ate there twice for breakfast during our stay in the City by the Bay (...hey, that rhymes!).  

Honey Honey has great selection and the prices are very reasonable.  I fully expected all of my meals in California to be twice what I paid elsewhere - for the budget savvy traveler this is a must visit.  

We both had the french toast, which was awesome, and their omelettes are creative and tasty too!  I'd suggest their hashbrowns too.  

Make sure you get a mug of their hot cocoa!
author: Shaun A.

description: Very casual cafe with lots to offer: burgers, sandwiches, crepes, eggs, etc. You order/pay at the counter, pick up your own utensils and choice of cucumber-lemon water or berry-infused water for the table. The lady at the counter and wait-staff were friendly, but the food was just OK. Normally, I'd say that the food is the most important factor when evaluating a restaurant, but in this case I will say location is important too. Honey is a block from Union Square, without the high price for simple breakfast/ lunch items. Thats A-OK in my book!
author: Lisa C.

description: I love this place! The best blintz I've had in years.
author: Glenda W.

description: Milano eggs & omlette for breakfast, along with potatoes and wheat bread. This is very filling especially with the potatoes. I first saw this place and wanted to get some crepes, but was very hungry and decided to get the omlette instead and good thing I did, filled me up for a good while and gave me food coma! The hubbie got the Salmon Scramble, which wasn't too bad. Only thing about this place is it is small and you have to come at a good time to get seats. We had to take ours to go and go back to our hotel to eat. I will be back to try the crepes when I'm in town again, and other things since they all sound and look so delish!
author: Lili Phuong C.

description: We are from Colorado, but were staying in San Francisco recently at the Kensington Park Hotel.  The Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery was just a couple blocks away (walking distance) which was perfect and I was excited to try it as a breakfast spot.  In the 5 days that we were in San Francisco, we came here twice for breakfast and once for lunch.  Everything that we ate was delicious and everything that we drank (fresh squeezed oj and yummy chai) was divine.  I love this cozy little cafe with a huge selection suited for every appetite!  It's probably good this cafe isn't in Denver, since I would be at it EVERY day!  :)
author: World T.

description: I got the crab cake florentine benedict and I pretty much threw everything away except for the poached egg. The crab cakes were such a sad excuse of what its supposed to be. Absolutely no crab, just over fried greasy bread crumb patty. The blanched tasteless spinach soaked the english muffin. The homefries were pitch black and almost looked like burnt potato chips. Will I be coming back? Absolutely not.
author: sunny c.

description: Stopped in here twice while in SF and I wasn't impressed either time. Both dessert crepes I ordered (can't even remember which) were somewhat flavorless. There's too much offered here to be all bad...my family did enjoy their French Toast and Eggs Benedict, however. I'll just need to stay away from those crepes again. I'd recommend not going during peak AM breakfast hours. The wait could be long plus you have a lot of web-surfing customers which can tie up seats longer.
author: Rick T.

description: This is the place you go to get American style crepes. What French crepery serves cheddar cheese filled crepes? I felt like this place should have been a Mexican restaurant with the decor and music being played. It felt very strange and not very inviting. The crepes were fine, especially the nutella strawberry. But how can you go wrong with nutella? Definitely don't get the side salad with your crepe, you'll be getting some iceberg lettuce, shreds of a carrot and some large slices of a tomato with a bland dressing. This place is fine in a pinch but don't go here if you want authentic crepes.
author: A. M.

description: Great little breakfast spot.  I've been here a couple of times and it's always been good.  It's hard to tell what kind of wait you'll have.  I've waited 15 min, but then again, walked right in another time (BTW, the wait is not because of the service, but the line).  Anyway, I've had their omlettes and their crepes and both are awesome.
author: Khim Y.

description: just got back from a trip and I ate at this place twice. tried the strawberry nuttela crepe and the eggs Benedict. they both were amazing! if i had to pick i would go with the crepe if you like sweets.
author: Hailey M.

description: the reason i give honey honey 3 stars is because of the scenery and because of the free wifi. The only food I can say is really really good are the burgers and the coffee. Other than that you can find better food around that area for a better price.
author: Victoria G.

description: A quaint corner stop for a Sumday breakfast on a rainy day... Big portions and a big menu to choose from. Lots of locals! But get in early...
author: Jeff B.

description: I have found that most of the creperies here in san fran have the same menu, just different names.  That said, I have eaten at Honey Honey three times in three days (my hotel is across the street) and I've enjoyed all of my breakfast choices.  Even when the line is almost out the door the service is speedy and friendly.
author: Meg D.

description: I do love a good crepe. I had my first savory crepe here and it was good. I think everyone else at my table ordered better crepes than the chicken pesto I ordered. But it was still delicious. The service isn't that great and for some reason the restaurant was ridiculously hot inside so we had to sit outside but lucky for us, it was a pretty nice day. Good food, really good fresh squeezed orange juice. I'd come back and order a different crepe.
author: June P.

description: Thank you Honey Honey, if it werent for you I dont know what I would have done for breakfast, during my short stay in San Fransisco! Not gonna lie when I first entered and saw the line I thought I was never gonna eat (and I was starving). Needless to say I was impressed talk about getting your food in a timely manner. The food was delicious I had  the 2, 2 and 2. Pancakes were great and my eggs too. I must say my favvorite was the "cable car" what a great blend of salmon, eggs, cream cheese, I asked for tomatoes too and it was utter perfection. One thing that I love about San Fran, is small little spots like this. Miami take notes!
author: luis s.

description: Had the breakfast crepe and BKS crepe (banana, kiwi, strawberry) - both were excellent. Crepes were nice and thick, perfectly prepared and service was pretty fast. First time trying orange water and it was really refreshing.
author: Chris C.

description: Good people here at HH, but all in all, rather mediocre. Guess tourists make it to HH more than the locals...but wait do tourists use Yelp?
author: Vivek N.

description: I was so excited for this place, and I'm bummed to be giving it 3 stars. The best part of my meal was the fresh fruit cup. My soy latte wasn't hot enough (it was like kids beverage temperature), and my half moon bay crêpe -crab cake with tomato, mushroom and cheddar- was a real failure. This thing was overstuffed, and barely resembled any true crêpe I've seen. I probably wouldn't have minded its size had it tasted good. I shouldn't say that. My crêpe tasted good, but not remotely like crab cake. Maybe falafel or fried breadcrumb ball. There was no crab flavor to this over-fried ball, which fell apart due to dryness. My BF had the eggplant crêpe which I tried a bite of and it was delicious, so I'm sure I just chose poorly. His crêpe was also enormous. He also had a bloody Mary, which was made from store bought mix and Tabasco sauce and black pepper. Meh. If we lived in SF and weren't just visiting, I might give them another chance with a sweet crêpe or another savory crêpe, but I can't recommend the half moon bay or their bloody Mary's. Do bring an appetite. These aren't petite French style crêpes.
author: Laura N.

description: Honey Honey is delicious. I go there almost every weekend (it's located near my house). I actually crave their potatoes - the ones that come with breakfast dishes. Their crepes are awesome and their breakfast burrito is incredible. They also have a pretty tasty Cobb Salad. Awesome food and convenient for me!
author: Lauren F.

description: Enjoyed chicken pesto crepe with fresh fruit side.  Wife's crab cake crepes were disappointing -- heavy on breading and light on crab.  Line was out the door on a Saturday morning but huge menu board along side line and efficient ordering and seating helped.   Popular but busy and noisy.
author: Kenneth H.

description: It was so good we went there for breakfast two days in a row! Get anything with the crab cakes, they are filled with crabby goodness and not a bunch of bread crumbs. My husband had their chorizo scramble he said it was "the best he's ever had", he loved the spice. They fresh squeeze their o.j. and have yummy mimosas. Highly recommend!  Worth the small wait.
author: Lanessa P.

description: We ate here after running Bay to Breakers - we were starving it could barely finish our meals you get so much food!  The line was out the door but it goes fast and is worth the short wait - plus once you're in the door it'll take you that long to decide what to order off their extensive menu.  I had the tofu scramble - I never had smoked tofu before and it was amazing!!  My husband had the Miami Heat Crepe.  His was delicious too.  Both of us had potatoes which were seasoned and cooked to perfection.
author: Megan M.

description: We went on a sunday morning and the place was pretty packed! We spent about a half hour in line, but the food came out very quickly. I think we all were satisfied. None of us was blown away by the food. It was good, but not great. We had breakfast, but no crepes. It looks like a nice little cafe, especially when it maybe isn't so crowded! The coffee was great, as well. Nice and strong. Even though it was packed, they were great about coming around and filling coffees, which I really appreciated!
author: Summer H.

description: First time. Great! Had the Miami Heat and it was really flavorful. The atmosphere is good for breakfast.
author: Jonathan A.

description: Food was great, except for my boyfriend's WAAAAY over-seasoned potatoes. Cute place, long line but I would go again. :)
author: Nina B.

description: Sooo yummy! Great food, nice atmosphere, reasonable prices, perfect portion size, etc. All you need to know is that Honey Honey is SOOO YUMMY!!!
author: Max M.

description: Eggs Benedict was runny, pancakes were good, potatoes were good and crepe was decent but the oj was freakin awesome.
author: Jonathan O.

description: One of my favorite casual restaurants in the neighborhood. This is a great place to come if you love omelets or crepes!
author: Josiah M.

description: We have had the pleasure of dining here a few times now and enjoyed it. They have quite a variety of breakfast items including sweet and savory crepes, pancakes and omelettes. I also noted they did have a selection of sandwiches and other lunch items but I have never tried them. Service is generally quick. I would
author: Melanie I.

description: Wife and I liked this place a lot while on vacation in San Fran. I had a crepe with chicken, cheese, pesto and basil, among other things, and it was delicious. Wife had scrambled eggs, potatoes and an english muffin. Really liked the three varieties of jams served with the muffin. Fresh-squeezed OJ is always a hit and if not for a diet I would have gone to town on some of the cookies and sweets there. If you're looking for an excellent breakfast or brunch (or lunch) spot, this is it.
author: Dave R.

description: For a breakfast spot in the Tenderloin, this place was much larger than most. Great for families (seating for 6-8, very uncommon here), with plenty of selection, and a very nice atmosphere. Food was reasonable in price, teas and coffee's were great. No table service, but grab a table while someone waits in line!
author: Chris C.

description: We went here on a Thursday for brunch and there was hardly a line and plenty of seating.  I had the Pesto Crepe, my husband had the North Beach Crepe, and our friend had the Mexican Salad.  Portions were very generous!  The crepes were large and stuffed with goodness, and the salad was less than $10 and big enough to feed a family of four.  All three of us truly enjoyed our meals.  Personally, I don't know if I will be able to steer away from the Pesto crepe next time!
author: Crystal K.

description: Interesting little corner cafe, I love how the menu is easily displayed in large letters not behind the counter, but on a side wall. Ordered a Mocha and the Eggs Benedict. The mocha was perfectly made, just the right amount of caffeine. The Eggs Benedict was good, nothing to spectacular about, found that the potatoes had too much rosemary, but it was still good. Will return if in the area.
author: Jenny D.

description: The omelets and crepes are fantastic. Great for breakfast, or dessert. Also good for kids.
author: Mike S.

description: This place has very good savory crepes and excellent service. The staff is very friendly. I ate there every day when I was in San Francisco. Definitely the best place to eat breakfast in San Francisco. Don't forget to ask for latte. They serve it in a glass :)
author: Prodigy G.

description: Had lunch here while on vacation in SF. Very cute place with extensive menu with nothing over $10. My friend ordered the chicken pesto crepe and was very happy. I ordered a toasted bagel with butter and jam (i really wanted the orange marmalade). The bagel was store bought, nothing special but jam on the other hand was delicious.
author: Marlen M.

description: Why is the line so long?! It seems to take everyone 10 minutes to order. They need to add another cashier. The food is beyond amazing though.
author: Lauren T.

description: Thank you to the owner, Abed, for contacting me about my experience. The concern in customers' opinions is respectable, appreciated, and telling of the management's approach towards service.
author: G. J.

description: Solid menu with great brunch staples. They also pay close attention to custom orders and give you exactly what you ask for.
author: E A.

description:
Decided to come here as recommended from the reviews for my hotel.  This is the type of place I would eat at every weekend if SF were my home. 
Came here 3 out of the 4 nights I was visiting SF.  This place is great, order at the counter, have your food delivered to your table.  I got the eggs/toast/homefries most days, oatmeal once, my boyfriend got the pancakes once (banana and candied walnuts) and then got 2 different omlettes (both mexican style-beans-torilla-chilies-cheese etc).  This place is amazing, decent price around $8-$9 for the food, another $1.50 I think for coffee (you can get a refill in a to go cup) and the food is great.  Waited less than 10 min. to get food and it was always hot.  The standout here is the homefries.  I would come here just for them alone.  They are crunchy and have a ton of seasoning in them (most notable is the rosemary).  I also liked that they have 3 types of preserves to go with your toast.
Do yourself a favor and check this place out.
author: robyn b.

description: My boyfriend and I came here looking for crepes with strawberry and nutella (successfully), and we ended up falling in love with the place.  We came back two more times throughout our 6 days in San Francisco =) They are a friendly, quick, and make delicious food - and such a selection. They also have cucumber lemon water, which is particularly refreshing after a night out and slight hangover ;)
author: Rebeca P.

description:
This fantastic little place was a Godsend on several occasions! Between the cute tiled tables and the delicious food, I was very pleased I spotted this rather discreet building. Then there is the free wifi and the fast service.

Order at the counter and take a number to your table. It is a seat yourself cafe and your food is brought out hot and fresh (and quick!). I would personally recommend any of their signature crepes (with quite a wide variety of fillings!) or their shrimp alfredo dish.
author: Millicent C.

description: Really tasty crepes, friendly service and super fast wifi.
author: Mack D.

description: I really enjoyed my Eggplant Crepe but my husband's Eggs Benedict looked really mushy and he didn't like it at all. Plus was funny that that potatoes were kind of sloppily made. Some were giant chunks and some were small. Some were burned and others not that cooked. Good rosemary flavor though.
author: erica u.

description:
I'm not sure how this place has any good reviews...there's nothing at all good about it.

I ordered sausage with my crepe and got something that had clearly been taken out of the freezer, because it was burned to a crisp on the outside and still cool & raw in the center. When I complained, they acknowledged the mistake and replaced it with a doughy and flavorless pancake.

It didn't look too busy, but people make mistakes. I'd never give a 1 star just for that...to get 1 star from me, the ~best~ part of the experience has to be terrible.

Enter the crepe. For a place that specializes in these, it was awful. Thick and chewy...not at all what a crepe should be. For a real crepe, try Ti Couz on 16th.

This place is a big fail for me. I won't be back.
author: Steven R.

description: More like a 4.5  Absolutely amazing eggs Benedict, good (but not earth-shattering) crepes and coffee. The atmosphere was lively and the service was pretty fast, but I probably wouldn't come here if I were in a rush. It can be tough to find a table after ordering at the counter, but tables turn over pretty quickly. Great experience overall--I strongly recommend Honey Honey for brunch/breakfast/afternoon crepe.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Nothing special about the pancakes or omelettes. Felt like I was eating in a cafeteria.
author: Luke C.

description: A must eat breakfast place for anybody new to San Fran.  Wonderful crepes!  This place is always busy, but it is worth the 20 person line, as this is the way that I start every day when I am in San Francisco.  Yum!
author: Chris S.

description: Very good breakfast! Light yet tasty. The crepes are amazing and not overwhelming as some tend to make them (how American-haha).
author: victoria r.

description: I can't really think of anything in this restaurant worth raving about. The food was as my rating says: A-OK. I might come back if I don't care to hunt for something better.
author: Michael P.

description: I came here last August and I've been wanting to go back!  It's a cute restaurant.  The food is absolutely fantasticcc.  I wanted a crepe but I was craving for something sweet.  I ordered chocolate chip waffles.  Yeah, soo original.  haha.  But can I just say it's the best chocolate waffles I've ever had?!  It was so appetizing especially with their fresh strawberries.  It doesn't come with it but you can get a side-order.  My cousin had waffles with fresh strawberries, kiwi and bananas on top.  And my friend ordered french toast with fresh fruits on the side.  I know, I know...we ordered the typical American breakfast but it was so good!!  They're cooked to perfection.  I love love LOVE this place.  It's clean with a wonderful ambiance.  Oh and I forgot to mention, you can order mimosa's!  Awesome, right?
author: Kanani N.

description:
Before our way back home from SF to LA, we decided to get some breakfast at Honey and Honey. They have about 6-10 selections of crepes and other things like French toasts, waffles, and etc. the menu selection isn't that big. I was looking for something with sundried tomatoes and goat cheese..( most basic French crepe flavor) but they did not have such thing. I was bit disappointed so I ordered a smoked salmon+ capers+ red onion crepe. 

1. Customer service kinda sucks. There were several costumers complaining while I was dining here. One of the costumer was complaining that she waited 30 minutes for her food and her order ended up going to a diff person. And when I ordered my food, the cashier girl was not attentive to what the I was saying. She asked what kinda bread I want for my order... ( crepes are not made from bread..) and then she poured a cup of juice which we didn't order. ....  When we found a table and sat down, we had to try hard to get any of the worker's attention...and when we asked for extra napkins.. they totally forgot about it and never returned to us. On top of all these....all the workers seemed pretty unhappy.
2. Food was good. But nothing AMAZING. The portions were pretty small.... 
3. There were flies around our table. It was pretty ugly.
4. They provide free-wifi. But no outlets
author: Rosalyn P.

description: Just not very good. Tourists will like it because they don't know any better.
author: Brittany L.

description: I was in San Francisco 1 week.  Ate here 3 times. Yep.  When I'm back in San Francisco it is the first place I will go for breakfast.
author: D'jango J.

description: Went to Honey Honey on a Friday morning for breakfast, which was excellent. Had the Torino crepe which was filled with Feta cheese, basil, tomato, mushroom...very tasty! The breakfast potatoes were wonderful and plentiful. Very satisfying experience.
author: Eric T.

description: Love this place - great stop for brunch or lunch. Try the chicken pesto. Deelish.
author: Matt M.

description: Very upset and dissapointing experience. Was actually heading to another crepe place on O'Farell but the place was closed so ended up coming to Honey Honey instead. The interior of the restaurant was "okay", they had the door open for ventilation. We ordered the blintz and the breakfast crepe. The breakfast crepe was nothing special and the blintz was just so sweet. It smelled really good but the taste was just like sugar preservatives. Will not come back again. :(
author: Kay K.

description: This place is one of my favorite breakfast places in the Union Sq. area! Food is always great there, and the menu has great variety and isn't like any other menu elsewhere. They're making you try something new and try to keep you out of your comfort zone with breakfast dishes you've never heard of. It all tastes great every single time though, and at a reasonable price. Great environment too! Definitely try it out!
author: Serge U.

description: I was instantly charmed by the brightly colored tiles and the funky seating. They have this little island in the middle, which reminds me of a carousel. I was mesmerized by the giant chalkboards, not really knowing what I wanted because everything seemed so good. I ordered the New Orleans crepe: Swiss cheese, chicken breast, mushroom, sundried tomatoes, salsa. It also came with a side of salad and potatoes. What I found quite endearing was the little water station they had with orange and lemon options.
author: Alex Y.

description: My husband and I stopped in on a Saturday while visiting SF recently. It was a nice solid breakfast (I had the blintzes and my husband had the chorizo scramble), with no wait and lovely fresh squeezed orange juice. The vibe inside was a bit dull but the food was perfectly satisfactory. While I am a fan of the crepe, I was glad to see a wide variety of savory dishes to suit my husband's tastes. If I were to go back, however, I would order their breakfast crepe (ham, eggs, cheese, etc.) which was sort of buried in their list of what looked like lunch/dinner dishes. It might have been a heartier and more satisfactory meal than the sweet, dessert-like blintzes.
author: Briana M.

description: Living half a block away, I tend to frequent this place.  They have an array of inexpensive entrées, sides, and plenty of crepes!  (yum!!)  I've sampled many of their dishes and my favorites include the Mexican chicken salad ($8.95), rigatoni san luca chicken pasta ($8.95), and Miami heat crepe ($8.95).  I hate to review their dessert crepes because I'll love anything with nutella, so I'm incredibly biased.  (But yes, they are yummy!)They also serve beer and wine and have free wi-fi with a purchase (the password is their phone number).  It tends to get pretty busy during standard brunch times, but other than that, there tends to be plenty of space.
author: Cersei T.

description: We come here just about every trip to SF since it's so close to my son's place. And it's really good. The egg dishes are great, as well as the pancakes, French toast and crepes. I highly recommend the drag squeezed orange juice too. All in all, a reliably good place.
author: M T.

description:
It is often hard to write a less than sparkling review of a local establishment, but this place was a 2.5 star experience.

Ambiance: nothing special
Staff: passably friendly
Food: not worth it.  French toast was dense and flavorless; huevos rancheros were nothing special, and the rest of our table (omlettes, eggs and pancakes) all reported "eh".

This place seems like it is owned by the Squat and Gobble folks because it has a similar (if not same) menu; S & G I have found the food better and the location on Chestnut the staff is amazingly warm and helpful, making up for the decent but not amazing food.

For Honey honey, I would say "honey, don't bother."
author: michael d.

description: I used to come here all the time when I was living at the Academy of Art dorms on Sutter. They have the best in all categories! I especially dig the salads.
author: Laura R.

description: Me and my sistah ate here twice on our visit to San Fran! LOVED IT! We were both a lil' homesick for tofu scram from the Pick-Me-UP and HOneY HonEy definitely could hold their own. I ordered it w/o eggs and added tomatoes and mushrooms w/2 sides of salsa! Delicious! The soy latte was drool worthy! We also tried the begian waffles minus the creme, which was heavenly with the fresh fruit. The atmosphere was cozy with many tables to spread out. Free WIFI too, which is a bargain in a town with $12.95 hotel charges. Great breakfast spot!
author: Michelle S.

description: Ive been here a few times, and never really impressed. They have the same menu as the crepe house off polk street, but the crepe house is WAY better.
author: Amanda C.

description: My family and I stayed at the Warwick hotel a block away from Honey Honey and we made it a point to eat there every day of our trip because it was THAT delicious.  The service is super friendly and the menu is huge with something for everyone.  My favorites are the angel hair shrimp pasta, bagel with avocado and cream cheese and banana nutella crepe.  Try the cookies at the front - they're homemade and delicious!
author: Melissa H.

description: my GF and I just got back from visiting SF, we were in SF for 4 days and went to Honey Honey 3 days out of 4.  I love all the food in this restaurant, in particular their Salmon Benedict is to die for.  I would go there every time when i visit SF, the owner and the staff were so friendly and helpful, its hard to find a place that is inexpensive, friendly, and tasty at the same time.  I am sold!! oh yeah their Bagel with cream cheese, onion, and avocado they are amazing. love it!
author: Jimmy L.

description: Great breakfast for Valentine's Day.  They cleared tables quickly and got our food out quick.  My chocolate waffle could have only been better if I got ice cream instead of whipped cream.  But that's on me.  Walked around the block and saw the line for Dottie's True Blue Cafe, Oi!  Glad we went with this alternative.
author: Shannon B.

description: Just went for the third time and the food was good, again. Has a small town, homie feel to it. Not one of the places in that area with the line out the door but its a good spot. I'll go back.
author: Donovan B.

description: Okay, I might not be an expert on creperies, but this place seems pretty great to me. I've had several of their different crepes, along with their burgers and other food, and it's all been good. Their fresh squeezed orange juice is really good, but I may just be saying that because it's fun to watch the machine behind the counter make it....
author: Carl R.

description: This is my favorite breakfast place in the neighborhood. It's a clean, bright, well-run establishment with an amazing breadth of menu. I haven't yet tried everything on the menu, but the Acapulco is a great Sunday morning awakener. The blintzes, with a special dash of orange marmalade, are delicious. The coffee, the fresh-squeezed oj. It's just all really good.
author: Les C.

description: Had one of the savory pesto crepes.  It was the best savory crepe I have ever had.  The fresh orange juice is awesome.  Will be back for a sweet crepe tomorrow.
author: Eric S.

description: There really aren't a lot of options of downtown eateries that aren't overpriced, crappy, or really touristy. Honey Honey is a delicious cafe very similar to Squat & Gobble in terms of the atmosphere and menu, and the best part about it is that it is so close to Union Square. It's annoying to have to trek a ways when downtown for a meal, I usually resort to foodcourt cuisine to sustain myself when shopping and running errands. But now that I have discovered Honey Honey, I won't be going anywhere else!
author: Sophie D.

description: This place makes me happy every single time I eat here.  The menu is amazing, they have free WIFI, and coffee refills.  I end up spending long afternoons dining on the incredible crepes or salads and enjoying the great, friendly staff.  I love this place!!
author: Megna M.

description: This was one of my first stops when I got into San Francisco for brunch. It was amazing. Unfortunately I did not have any Crepes, but the breakfast menu is killer. The potatoes are the best, believe me. Great location and atmosphere - Think the only think I do not like is the music.. always playing some sort of Cuban rap or some crap...takes away from the ambiance of the french style cafe. Oh well the food is great, and I would suggest going for Breakfast/Brunch
author: Jake S.

description: Superb! Eggs Benedict with awesome thick-cut rosemary potatoes and a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice. Great service. Wonderful breakfast spot.
author: Kyle M.

description: Found this place on yelp while staying in the area and thought it was a great find. Lots of creative omelettes and other breakfast foods.
author: Lloyd B.

description:
i have a newfound appreciation for this place.  since the change in ownership, they have made gradual changes to the restaurant and service and i love it.  

the staff and owners are really personable. and even when they're super busy, they always have time to exchange pleasantries with me, or share a laugh.  they even dressed up as honeybees for halloween

i absolutely LOVE that they make specially requested items that aren't on the menu.  i have a wheat allergy and they have been real nice about making my "crepes" with omlette instead.  also, just today, i was in a mood for a veggie scramble.  while it isn't on the menu, they asked what i wanted in it and made it for me anyway.  i'm eating it now and it is AWESOME.

this place just gets better and better.  now if only they started serving turkey burgers...
author: Lex E.

description: Loved this place! Ate here once for brunch while we were on holiday...Wish we had eaten there more, but we will definitely go back on our next visit. It's not a big place and we had to wait in line a minute but nothing like the line at Dottie's. Anyway, it was worth the short wait. I had the chicken pesto crepe and my husband had the northshore! Both were excellent! very filling! Service was great! I think i will try a sweet crepe next time...they looked so good! They had a great selection of both sweet and savory crepes...but also have a big sandwich menu and other brunch/lunch items. Really good!
author: Danielle H.

description: I wish i lived in SF so i could eat here more often. Staff is happy. Must drink the orange juice. Crepes are delicous! Waffles yummy! Fruit bowl a little dry. It was so good we went twice during our 5 day trip!
author: Soyoun K.

description:
Nice Environment, really diverse menu. They have daily specials and they all looked good. I had the milano omelette with rosemary potatoes, they were amazing. My friend got the huevos rancheros which had crazy amounts of food. I also had part of an apple crepe afterwards, I'd say for the price it's the best breakfast I've had in SF.

Also the OJ was so fresh it was like I was just biting an orange. If you're around Nob, you should stop by.
author: Eric T.

description: Went there twice on my week long vacation to san fran. Huge menu with lots to choose from.  Had the chorizo scramble, which was tasty and had a great ratio of chorizo to eggs.  Also had the mediterranean crepe, which was delicious.  The potatoes that you get on the side of the scrabble are worth ordering the scramble over the crepe.
author: Jeanne T.

description:
I work and live near here so I eat here frequently and I have not yet had a bad experience.

The staff is always pleasant and accommodating and the food is solid and consistant.  As well, the prices are decent.  

Some of my favs are the Cancun Burger (bacon, salsa and avocado on a burger- to DIE for!), Chicken Pesto Crepe, Grilled Chicken Sandwich and the French Toast.  The potatoes and curly fries are delish as well.
author: Rachel S.

description: We had brunch here while on vacation and it was super tasty. I'd definitely go here again the next time we're in SF!
author: Sarah D.

description:
I wish I would have discovered this place sooner! There was plenty of variety on the menu, something for everyone.

I had the feature Chicken Burrito, and that was pretty tasty.  The person I was w/had the Vegetarian Sandwich on Sourdough and loved it. We also got a side of fruit, which was fresh and delicious, also had kiwi in it! 

If I were in San Francisco every again I would definitely go back!  Probably try one of the many savory crepes.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Thus the Food is Excellent, the atmosphere is awesome, topped with a personalized service ...EVERY TIME without a fail. 
This is the place were you make friends, you meet friends, and you keep friends. 
From the owner on down, they will always treat you with a warm welcome and a genuine smile....
YOU HAVE TO EAT THERE....

Keep it up guys and thanks...
author: Imad N.

description: Cool, casual place & good food. Great menu for breakfast or lunch.
author: Dana P.

description: I had the pesto crepe and the fruit blintzes and they were yummy!  I wish parking was a little easier in the area, but what can you do.  I would definitely try this place again!
author: siutou s.

description: This place has many options; breakfast, lunch and dinner. I got the veggie burger, it was super good. Orange-flavored water was delicious. I'd definitely come back to try something else.
author: Melissa S.

description: This is probably one of my favorite breakfast places in San Francisco.  The owner is nice and loves to chat with his customers.  I told him how much I love his potatoes and he brought me and my friend a free plate of them (since my dish didn't come with them).  Delicious food with great size portions and pretty much everything is under $10.  I haven't tried the crepes because I usually stick to the traditional breakfast foods (eggs, pancakes, etc).  It's delicious!
author: Jacob M.

description: Ok, so the best place in town (allegedly), "Dottie's True Blue Café," had a line out the door and we were in no mood to wait, so we headed up to this joint in the same neighborhood. Its décor is cool and the staff was super nice, but the food, I would say is no better than decent. I did like that there were so many choices and that some exhibited creativity. Everything was fresh and fairly priced, just not anything to write home about.
author: Janelle M.

description: Great little find for a couple of out of towners. Just up the street from the Clift Hotel. We ended up eating breakfast there 3 times. Will go there again on out next trip to SF.
author: Mike D.

description: We went here for breakfast when another place we wanted to go to had a long wait. It was very hard to pick what I wanted because they have so many menu items that sounded amazing. The food is delicious! Both my boyfriend and I got the breakfast crepes and they were so good! He got breakfast potatoes with his and I got fruit. the fruit was very fresh and the potatoes were very flavorful. I can't wait to go and get a dessert crepe next time. I also think I need to try their mimosas. The guys in front of us got some and they looked so good.
author: Ashley B.

description: I used to go to this place when it was The Crepe House. It was OK. I just went to today for desert. I ordered Apple crepes and I smell detergent from somewhere. When I ate it I tasted detergent from Apple. Eek!!! This place must be mixed with food and detergent. I never go back to this place again.
author: Kitty C.

description: I really liked the food!  Prices were good, too.  The waitress wasn't the friendliest, but she was probably just having a bad day.
author: Sam F.

description:
when you are running around civic center looking for breakfast and you are hungry and you just want to eat, this place will work quite nicely.  

mind you, we thought our food was just o-kay but it was everything else about this place that bumps this place up to a four star, including great service, a clean place, and it's big enough so that you can actually sit down and eat as opposed to all of the hole-in-the wall bfast places in SF. honey honey also boasts quite a varied menu. 
if you have a family, they have stuff for kids to do so this place is a bit more kid-friendly than other places in this area

regarding service...it's the type of diner where you order your food at the counter, you are handed a number to place on your table, you find a place to sit, and  then your food is brought to you. we found everyone cheerful and conscientious
author: s l.

description:
I go here practically every time that I have to be downtown. They are friendly, cheap, quick, and the food is  decent. I almost always get the Greek Salad with the dressing on the side. They kind of pile on the feta cheese, but you can always take some off. I usually end up eating it cause I just can't resist feta. 

The thing I think I like most about the place (in addition to thefriendly owner) is that it is spacious and fairly comfortable. If it isn't too busy you can definitely bring a book or computer and hang out for a while.
author: Avril S.

description: Crepes in a beautiful presentation. I had the Nutella and Strawberry first time and it was a chocolate lovers dream. Ordered the Banana Strawberry Kiwi Crepe with Nutella the second time -- it was good but not enough chocolate for me. My husband ordered the cable car and blintz crepe and loved them both!
author: Iszy Z.

description: Tasty coffee, solid omelets, above average croissant breakfast sandwich.
author: Max W.

description: I have gone to a lot of these crepe cafe's in san Francisco, and most of them have the same menu and the same boring decor, but Honey Honey....has exceeded all of my expectations, they always change the specials in an attempt to keep their customers coming back to enjoy new additions to their menu, ( which are delicious),  The decor is very pleasant,  The two sisters, ( HINDA and SUHAR) are the nicest and sweetest owners I have ever met, They alway's smile when you come in and are very eager to please you.  I have never been treated like that in any other crepe cafe.  I love their fresh salads, and they have an Angelhair Pasta dish with shrimp that is out of this world.
author: tony n.

description:
to start off with ..... this little be of useless info .... my job  required me to "float"  to 6 different offices in the S.F. so i am always looking to find someplace different for my lunch ... i eat out for lunch 5 days a week ... so  to the review .... i was craving a Crepe for about a week ... my co-worker told me about honey honey (she just knew about it,hasn't eaten their) ... anyway ... i got a crepe and the crepe was stuffed with some goodness ... OMG it was fantastic ... the ice-tea,i got was a free refill ... this always adds to the stars ... so i got there at 1245 right before the mad rush of A.I. students ... the clientele is "funky" BUT interesting to watch while you enjoy a great crepe ... the only issue is 1 cashier ... so the line was a bit long ... it moves quickly but not fast ... that is it ... once you order the food comes quick too... and i got the ice-tea for a free refill ... 

BTW i was sitting there reading the reviews for this place on my iphone and thought this  ... this is my new years resolution to do more rating and see if i can do it and not get sued :)
author: Sean B.

description: mos def a fan of this sopt. food is pretty dope
author: Jen G.

description: Great food. OK coffee. The line was rather long (we waiting ~15 min to order), but it was so worth it!.  The cooks are a tad heavy on the butter/oil, but other than that the food was awesome.  I'd definitely go again. :)
author: Summer S.

description: Price to value is very high.  Food is simple, interesting and well prepared.  Good seating, spacing and view of outside street activity.
author: Ron M.

description: Great value, great location, good portions and a nice friendly staff. Plus a menu that has something for everyone.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Had breakfast at Honey Honey Cafe & Crepery. The setup is somewhat "self service" -- you wait in line, order your food, and find a table. On weekends, the place is pretty busy. Prices are very reasonable (under $10 for omelets or savory crepes) -- and even less for French toast or some desert-type crepes. They also make fresh orange juice "on the spot" with one of those orange crusher machines similar to what you'd see at Jamba Juice. Our food was good and abundant. It wasn't a good place to linger due to the lines -- you feel a little pressure to leave as soon as you're done so others can find a table. I rate it three stars because when it's busy, it can be a problem to find a table. Your food could be ready before there's any place to sit, especially if you're in a larger group (in our case, we needed a table for 5). Then again, it wouldn't be crowded if the food were bad or it was a poor value. For the area around Union Square, this is one of the better breakfast joints around. I would go back again and try some of the crepes next time. Overall a good find in the area and would go back again.

Summary:

The Good: 
Priced right
Good quantity
Good variety
Fresh juices and fruit salad options

Considerations:
Can feel rushed
Limited seated on busy mornings
Self-service
May need to stand in line to order and wait for a table
author: Greg L.

description: Ran into this place randomly while looking for breakfast!  The salmon scramble with chives was really tasty, and so was the eggs benedict.  Such a cute cafe, complete with lattes that come in big cups, and a varied menu to fit any palette.  I really enjoyed it!
author: Tare P.

description:
So my husband and I came up to SF to see Spring Awakening (great show, by the way!).  Since the show was at 1:00 we decided to come up early for brunch.  We did a bit of yelp research and was also recommended this one cafe but the wait is normally an hour on the weekends.  Husband didn't want to deal with the wait so we kept researching and came across Honey Honey.  At first I was apprehensive because I'm very picky about the reviews.  First, the more reviews the better.  Second, the reviews need to be detailed.  Husband really pushed for HH and he pointed out that maybe it was new and that's why it didn't receive that many reviews yet.  So, I relented.

I'm glad I did!  First of all it was a mere couple blocks from the Curran Theater, which was a huge plus.  Second, the atmosphere was so homey and what I like to think an urban cafe is like or if I was in Berkeley.  They had a wide range of sandwiches, crepes, other breakfast-type items, etc.  Husband got the chicken pesto crepe and I got a salmon version of Eggs Benedict.  We grabbed a table next to the window and although the view wasn't that great what with the beams crisscrossing across the windows it was still nice with the light coming in.  Our food came pretty quick and we immediately dove in.  The salmon was yummy and although one of the egg's yolk was fully cooked the other one was nice and runny!  Hollandaise sauce wasn't too overpowering, which I like.  Husband was digging his crepe until a couple minutes later the server returned telling us he gave us the wrong crepe.  It's interesting how Husband didn't notice there wasn't any chicken OR pesto in his crepe but maybe that's a true testament to the goodness of it.  The server was so kind and apologetic and immediately brought us the chicken pesto.  So we got 3 dishes for the price of 2.  The chicken pesto was very good as well as the supposed "chicken pesto."  The rosemary potatoes were good and we enjoyed the different flavored water.

And the best part?  FREE WIFI!
author: T N.

description:
Previous Review: Great priced, efficient and kind service, and the best Eggs Benedict around.  The ambiance is nice and the restaurant is always clean.  I like the cold water with lemons and sometimes strawberries.  Free WiFi, too!

New Review:  Same as above, but would like to change my comment on the service.  Wow, it has declined a lot over the last few months.  My last three experiences were awful.  Oh well, food is still DELICIOUS!
author: David L.

description:
This place was smashingly perfect after a long night of partying for a bachalorette party! Not being from the area, my friend allowed me and two other friends to stay at her place while she was gone for the week which is located two blocks from this charming little cafe. When we dragged ourselves to set out to search what was in near by walking distance, one of the locals told us to try this place out and now I am forever indebted to him. This homey little neighborhood cafe had such an inviting and cozy atmosphere with yellow tables and fixtures that gave it a cute character ,somehow made me feel as though this was my community too even though I was from out of state.
The menu was very extensive, especially in the crepes department which was fabulous except for the fact that I knew I wouldn't be able to order 3 out of the ten crapes that I wanted. Geesh, talk about decision making when hung over! Our server, Abdi, was very attentive and friendly and was concerned when one of my friends wasn't really eating her soup. He thought she didn't like it and quickly wanted to replace it with something else to satisfy her. We had to explain  that the soup was great, but she just was not feeling too well so she had to take it slow. My chicken pesto crepe was absolutely fantastic with large chunks of quality white meat and chunky veggies accompanied by a side cup of holindaze sauce and a glorious assorted fresh fruit cup. All for $9.73 when ordering water for a drink. If I lived in the neighborhood, I would frequently dine here, but I guess that it'll be in spirit when my friend chooses to do so.
author: Yolanda G.

description: Love this place! Crab cake florentine is awesome.
author: Jackie P.

description: Excellent Salsa Crepe. Good coffee. Their pancakes and eggs looked tempting... Staff was friendly, and prices are reasonable. I've eaten here twice, and I would go here again.
author: Daniel L.

description: Absolutely nothing bad to say about this place.  It was the best breakfast we had while in SF.  I LOVED the potatoes!  And they give you large portions for a great price.  The place is decorated really cute and the menu selection is the perfect combination of unique creations and traditional food.  Definitely recommend if you're ever in the city!  :)
author: Rebekah C.

description:
this place has me hooked, only thing is, i need to figure out when they're slow times are. tried to go last Monday morning at 10:30 and the line was to the door.  it was full of tourists gaping at the wall menu with no idea what to order. 
*hint* order breakfast. the great thing is they serve it all day (except for the waffle. it's only served in the morning)
i ate there around 5pm on Friday evening because i was hungry for breakfast. perfect. I had salmon benedict. yummy. made with real lox. and the potatoes had a wonderful blend of spices on them making them a little more special than typical home fries.  

9.95 great price. 

I will return.
author: Jenn C.

description: Great breakfast choice and chilled place to hang out.
author: Dave B.

description: Great to meet friends, to do some work on your computer or anything! Get the strawberry and nutella crepe! It's the best!
author: Jessie B.

description: Visiting up here from SD found this place through yelp and thought it was fantastic so I had to take my hubby.  He only said it would be unjust to eat anything but the crepes while there :)
author: Leigh C.

description: I have always be consistently pleased with the service and food at Honey Honey but had not visited in a few months. How surprised was I to see the updated look inside! The service was still superior and they are always able to accommodate my group regardless of the size. Thanks for being consistent in all aspects!
author: Ron H.

description: Solid four star place.  I've had a crepe here before, and it was pretty tasty.  What I like though, aside from good crepes/breakfasts, is the burgers.  Granted, they don't have as big a selection as a place like Pearl's down the street, but in my opinion the quality is on par with it, and it's cheaper.  At Honey Honey you can get a good sized burger and fries (regular or curly) for about the same price as just a burger at Pearl's.  Now that's what I call value.
author: Matt N.

description: Came here on a quiet weekday two months or so ago. Food was good, but not memorable--I can't remember what we ordered? The ladies at the counter were nice and the menu was pretty large, so I may come back to try some of their other items. Their crepes looked pretty good!
author: J. L.

description: This was pretty good grub for breakfast. I ordered the Acapulco omelet which has salsa,avocado,chili and sour creme. The house coffee was pretty decent as well. Its pretty hard to screw up breakfast food and I could eat it any time of day. This is above average and worth a trip if you are in the area.
author: Steve M.

description:
My absolute favorite place to eat.  Ever.  Huge plates for cheap.  Fresh squeezed orange juice.  A wide variety of delicious options: sandwiches, crepes, burgers, pastas, desserts, all-day breakfast, so if you come with a crowd, everyone will be happy!  No one I've brought here has been disappointed.  I must have eaten here over 30 times, so I know what I'm talking about!
Not only is the food amazing, but the atmosphere is super friendly: good music, clean tables, and the owners are very kind and generous people!
author: Nat G.

description: Really love this place. Busy on Sundays but a great casual place especially nice to fix a hangover!
author: Eric O.

description: I was really disappointed. We live around the corner, saw the reviews and came down. The lady at the counter wasn't very friendly, they were slow to clear tables. The food was bland. I got the chorizo scramble which should have a lot of flavor but had none, same goes for the potatoes, which pretty much just tasted like the cilantro they put over the top. My husband had the 2 2 2 breakfast, the pancakes were rubbery and the eggs were pretty much swimming in grease. Maybe the sign up looking for a chef should have been a sign? Won't be going there again.
author: L K.

description: I love this place! Crepe is very yummy! And here is very comfortable. I love hot cider with crepe and girls talk!
author: B B.

description: The crab cake sandwich was cold greasy and totally flavorless. The potatoes were the same, but at least the apple cider was good. I will not go back.
author: Pete A.

description: Great place to have breakfast upon arriving to San Francisco.
author: Jose S.

description: OK, I feel somewhat bad typing this on their free wifi.  The food is mediocre at best.  It's quick, bland diner food disguised as something more.  Brilliant concept, poor product.  We ordered the Mediterranean and Eden crepes.  Both were so-so.
author: Devon A.

description: Overall, a decent breakfast place. Big portions and tasty food. I had the french toast, which was okay. The fruit that came with my toast was so-so.  Quick but not so friendly service.
author: Brandon U.

description: I wish I lived closer to downtown cause I would be there everyday! I love this place so much. I've been all around the states and have never had such YUMMY MACAROONS IN MY LIFE! I cannot emphasize how finger-licking their macaroons are.Their food is mostly home made and fresh. The employees are very friendly and funny too, and they're quick to serve. I'm not a big fan of crepes in general but I've had some of their breakfast crepes and they were very healthy and tasty.
author: Sarah A.

description: Super triple dawg yummy!  I'm a crepe fan - so to have a restaurant that serves crepes accross the street from where we were staying... AWESOME!  I had the Breakfast Crepe (It was breakfast time) and was delish.  Filled with lots of breakfast treats like eggs, ham, cheese, and onions.  The side potatos were very tasty, with a special seasoning... I think it had some rosemary mix in.  WARNING: The crepes are HUGE!  Next time I'll spilt one with my boyfriend.
author: Holly W.

description: Eh...this place was fine. I ordered Eggs Benedict and the Canadian bacon was so tough I had a hard time cutting it with my knife. The eggs were well poached and the sauce was tasty though. I skipped the potatoes based on their poor reviews amd went with the fruit cup, which was a cut-up banana and a couple of strawberries and apple slices. I had plain coffee and my bill was $11.76.
