Not worth it! I can believe people wait in line for this place--I waltzed right in on a Tuesday morning. Underwhelming and overpriced--that's all I can say about Honey Honey.
author: Jillian H.

description:
I got the the savory Miami Heat crepe served with a side salad. the crepe's overall flavor wasn't very spicy, but flavorful, light n crispy crepe shell and moist bite-size chicken breasts, avocado n swiss. 

The garden salad was crisp and the dressing was served on the side without my request. I thought that was great since i forgot to ask for that. The salad dressing was a creamy balsamic dressing and the portion size of both crepe and salad was perfect - didn't need to stop half way or leave the cafe craving for more.

good casual plce to meet friends for breakfast anytime of day at a reasonable price
author: Mei L.

description:
nice location 
and decent food.

but i dont like that asian lady on the front 
but the other girl is good.
author: Bunty P.

description: Have breakfast there every Sunday.  Its inexpensive, the food is good    and the fruit flavored water in the glass dispensers is tasty.  They get pretty slammed on weekends before 1pm, but the service is quick.   I like going after work for salads.   Its kind of like California's version of diner food, but healthier.
author: purple z.

description: I would come back but I'm not amazed. The food is far better than others that I have had but at the same time, I've had better. I ordered eggs benedict and it was like any kind of eggs benedict I can get anywhere else. No 'wow' factor'. The service was very nice, they were happy to replace the bananas in my fruit salad for apples when I told them I was allergic. I'd recommend it if you're in the area because of it's nice and home-y feeling in the middle of the tenderloin. There's free wi-fi so you can just come in here and do work with a nice cup of coffee and a scone. The last time I came in here a group of obnoxious, loud-mouthed, teenage girls stormed in and completely killed the ambiance. They came in for a good 10 minutes asking for  free water and when they were told they had to pay, they made a huge scene. I'm not holding the restaurant to this, it's absolutely not their fault. It's just a heads up that these things happen when you go to any place in this area.
author: Trisha L.

description: I came back for the Chicken Pesto Crepe with a friend. The potatoes were fine and the crepe was yummy. Even my friend liked his New Orleans Crepe, and he's a picky eater!
author: Nicole P.

description: Good ass crepes, sweet or savory! My girlfriend is in love w/ the hot cider & I like the vanilla latte's. Good, burgers, bagels & breakfast. Sometimes the home fries are awesome and sometimes not. I recommend coming here.
author: Fresh B.

description: This is a great place to fly solo if you want  "me time" via a wknd brunch or relaxed mini mid-day retreat. It's great for taking a book, getting a chocolate nutella crepe (chocolate lovers, take note!) and escaping the world for a solid 45-90 minutes. Thank you Honey Honey, you help me gather my thoughts with your hot chocolate and crepe escapery.
author: S B.

description: I went there tonight and I loved it. I got eggs and the fruit pancakes. I tasted some of the crepe my friend got and it was so delicious that I kinda regretted my order. The girl behind the counter was really nice and she actually tried to help me as much as she possibly could. I had a really bad day and this was the sort of place you could get a meal and chat with a friend. I love you honey.
author: Ja J.

description:
This place is excellent if you want to come and chat with a friend or business associate... or better yet, you need to get some work done! This place is great if you need to do a little typing and get away from the hectic crowds of Starbux during your lunch break. 
     Honey Honey is NOT the best  cafe in SOMA... but for the price and great space it's quite a find. I usually order my favorite dish of all time; eggs Benedict. I give it a 82% on taste, but 100% on service. There's an amazing woman who works here who spends every nano-second making sure your taken care of. I'm talking she'll even come and count the sugars on your table to make sure you have enough to enjoy that second cup of coffee! She f**king rocks! 
      I love coming here to enjoy an afternoon working on a story, or answering e-mails. It's a great place to spend little (my eggs b + coffee is $11) and to enjoy the annoying crowds of normal coffee chains. 

CHECK IT OUT, You may enjoy, and if not... well, that's why God invented Yelp!
author: Joshua L.

description: The food is delicious, but the price is so so. I ordered 2 egg scrambles and 2 freshly squeezed OJ for about $30 for 2 people. The atmosphere and decoration is nice too. I'm not that into crepes, but they have a variety of dishes. I would recommend the salmon scramble if you're in to fish.
author: John F.

description: the food was alright. i got a strawberry & nutella crepe. but my strawberries were hot and it was kinda gross and hard to eat. my boyfriend got a plain burger and curly fries. i thought the fries were tasty but i didn't try the burger.
author: Xochi S.

description:
With the economy being like it is, and SF tending to be on the expensive side, this place offers great value.  First of all, the food is consistently tasty.  The portions are generous, so you could share if you're not a big eater.  

We've had quiche, crepes, sandwiches, salads, soup, and omelets.

You order at the counter, get a number, and the server brings your food to the table.  You don't have to ask for water.  There's a water container and cups for you to help yourself.

Employees are friendly and accomodating.  I think it's family owned (?)

The decor is pleasant with the way the walls are painted.  Big windows to people-watch.

A very enjoyable experience in the City.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
She Said (M), He Said (S): We found this place through the help of fellow Yelpers on a morning when M's stomach was craving for something more filling than just a bowl of cereal.

First Impression:  From the outside this place doesn't look like much, but as you peer in and see almost all the tables full at 9 A.M. it's a sign you made a good choice for breakfast.  As you walk in you are kindly greeted to delicious breakfast smells.  Their menus are placed on chalkboards high above the cash register.  With so many different crepe selections and breakfast choices it's hard to pick... but you won't be disappointed!

Décor:   The interconnecting tables are like little puzzle pieces that just invite you to scoot them close together; really helpful if you have a large party. Each little table seats 2, 3, or 4 people.  It was clean and cozy :)

Ambiance:  Depending on how crowded the place is, it can be a bit noisy but hey it's your first meal of the day... a good wake-up call!   Can be a very chill place to hang out... the free Wi-Fi helps.

Food:  2 different trips... M: Breakfast crepe and Eggs benedicts, both w/ potatoes - delish! S: French toast w/ fresh strawberries and Eggs benedicts w/ potatoes. M loves the [complimentary] water infused water with strawberry & orange, but even the cucumber water is refreshing.  S digs the freshly squeezed OJ.

Price: Very reasonable for the amount of food they give you. No complaints here!

Service: The staff is friendly and promptly brings your food only moments after you've sat down (even when they're busy).  They come around asking if you'd like refills on coffee and take your plates as soon as you've finished your filling and delicious breakfast.

Conclusion: A great breakfast/brunch spot hidden away in Nob Hill.  A definite place to return again.  Bon Appetite!
author: M and S.

description: Ooh, honey!  Cute place.  The barista made a smiley face on my latte.
author: Amy M.

description:
best eggs Benedict's EVER.

im kinda of sad i moved so far from this place
author: Jen M.

description: For me, a big part of dining out is ambiance and ease. I'm not really a "grab a bite" kind of girl...I'd rather be hungry and wait for a meal that sings. Unfortunately, waiting until dinner to get down and dirty with a fork and plate is not always an option when you're traveling with multiple personalities (not me--my friends, silly!). I usually don't like order at the counter places unless there is a lot of outdoor seating and time to spare. Sitting outside here didn't appeal to me , but I am happy to say the inside is roomy and even has a bit of decoration.  Honey Honey is clean, and the service was neither overly friendly or impatient. Great quick stop without feeling you want to get up as soon as you take the last bite.  Tons of veggie choices, free and fresh cucumber water, and ample seating. I could see how it might not be great for a date or when very crowded for brunch, but it was excellent for lunch:speedy, yummy, filling, and affordable.  I had the pesto avocado spinach crepe--it was yummy--maybe a bit too much cheese for some? The veggies in the salad that came with the crepe were super crispy-fresh. Ding!Ding!
author: kmama m.

description: Large portions, relatively healthy food, free wifi, and centrally located in downtown. A good place to know about if you are attending conferences at the Hilton and need to "escape."
author: Kerim F.

description: Counter service with delivery to your table.  Great selection of items for breakfast.  I had my eggs poached and they were poached perfectly.  My entire table enjoyed their meals.  Service was quick.  Would definitely go back!
author: MARIA T.

description: Great place.  Interesting, fun menu - although I can't stop eating the HALF MOON BAY - crab cake crepe.  Also - you can order 1/2 salad & 1/2 fruit for sides.  Yum!
author: Drew I.

description:
This is one of the best breakfast places in the city.  The interior atmosphere is very "sunday brunch", the breakfast menu is fabulous, and the staff very helpful.  

The service is very fast, and the food is very good.  If you're into crepes, there's just about every kind you can imagine.  

The only downside is some of the dinner items (but only some of them like the pasta).  While they're good, they're not quite 5 star worthy (but if you ate dinner here you'd still enjoy it!!).
author: Jason O.

description: I ordered the tofu scramble and was surprised to find on my plate seasoned tofu cubes covered with with scrambled egg. Honey Honey, I'm afraid, misses the point.
author: Casey L.

description: It was awful. You had to order at the counter. And get a number. The blintz was mediocre at best. The cheese and jam was so so and the cheese ran everywhere. I don't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Madeline K.

description: The menu was very large, and we only got two things, but neither of them was very good...at all.  In fact, we couldn't even finish them.  My wife got the florentina crepe and i got the half moon bay crepe.  the crepe itselft was so-so, but both of them were packed with melted, fakey, kraft cheese single type cheese, which made them unedible.  My salad was sub-par, and my wife's potatoes were dry and tasteless.  I won't be going back.
author: Brian S.

description: this place is around the corner from our hotel stay.  food is reasonable, service has a very new york feel in contrast to other san francisco places - fast-paced environment. the chick who took our order was extremely rude and didn't know how to treat her customers properly.
author: Kevin C.

description: Honey Honey Cafe is one of my favorite places to eat, but my favorite crepe house in the city!  It has just gotten better since they changed to honey honey from crepehouse.  When I have friends or family from out of town I always choose this cafe because of there amazing selection of food, and everything I have had has been awesome.  This place seems like a good mix for meat eaters and vegetarians alike.  My favorites are the pesto crepe, and the tofu sandwich.  There breakfast is also very good.  Basically I could keep going on, everything is perfect.  Always busy, but really good service.  All the girls that work in there are really hard working.  Great centrally located spot and good sized not so cramped eating atmosphere.
author: Meg M.

description:
Great food and I love the choice of fruits. It's a healthy start for any day.

I highly recommend the New Orleans Crepe. It's very good. My husband and I go often so I can't wait to savour the rest of the menu.
author: Joanne C.

description: AMAZING!!!! had the 2+2&2 (two of the moistest hotcakes ever, 2 eggs, and 2 chk apple sausage) It was so delicious. Also tried the milano omelette (mozzarella, basil, and tomatoes)... very tasty! Everything on the menu was so appealing. I had to get an apple crepe w/ ice cream to go. Cant go to a crepe spot and not get a crepe right??? The water was also very interesting... I chose to have the water with lemon and strawberries... Very good. Subtle hint of strawberry was nice. Price was very reasonable for the quality. Will definitely have to make more stops here in the future. Must go place if in nob hill!!
author: Jameson B.

description:
ray and i ate breakfast here last saturday morning. we woke up early and got here a little after 8, and there were only 2 other parties there, so it was nice and quiet. i ordered french toast with a side of chicken apple sausage and ray got.....oh the 2, 2 and 2 (2 pancakes, 2 eggs and 2 pieces of sausage). i love that they office pork and chicken sausage! 

the food was good, not too expensive, and we also loved the different choices of flavored water. 

havent been there for lunch, but the breakfast was good and i would certainly go back. nothing too special, but good nonetheless.
author: jenny s.

description: Definately a wake-me-up atomsphere being there is a lot of yellow color in the dining area.  Lots to choose from on the menu if you're a crepe fan.  I had the Torino.  I found the tomato to be rather soggy, lacking basil with plenty of feta.  I'm giving four stars b/c I liked the location, the atmosphere & the potential of a return visit if I'm in the area.  Plus the staff let me fill my water bottle with their complimentary jugged water.
author: sara l.

description: one of my favorite local cafe's, honey honey has great food.  i bring my family here for brunch whenever they come to visit me from out of town.  i particularly enjoy the athens omelet and the iced water with cucumber.
author: claudette b.

description: great place for brunch... omelets, crepes, and pancakes
author: Cass M.

description: I have been walking by this place for a long time, never was drawn in.  But I finally tried it and loved what I ate.  Had a burger and desert, great flavors and very well prepared.  Nice staff and a great place to work on the laptop!
author: Aaron S.

description: The fare is simple and the prices are friendly. The banana nutella crepe and the belgian waffles were good but nothing out of the ordinary. The house coffee is relatively dark and bold.
author: John Paul H.

description: This is basically the same as Crepevine or Squat & Gobble. Same kinds of items on a chalkboard menu, and sides of potatoes served with everything. I got a tasty sandwich with turkey, bacon, avocado, and Fuji apple. No complaints so far. Really nice Russian cashier, mellow atmosphere, and free Wi-Fi.
author: Jemima P.

description: I would have given this place a three for the dinner we had here but then we had dessert. The dessert crepes are wounderful and filled with flavor. Dont leave without having dessert!
author: Jeff L.

description: We had stumbled on this place looking for a decent quick place to eat. The menu was full of options and variety. This time I didn't have crepes but I will come back to try their crepes. I had the UNION SQUARE Burger, which was done just right. It was accompanied by delicious crunchy curly fries. My friend had their salad, and it was of very generous size. All around a good experience. I will visit again! :)
author: Adiv S.

description: We went here with a huge group of folks for brunch today and they were so accommodating.  Food was great, service was great, can't ask for more!  It's a nice, clean place in the midst of the tenderloin.  I'll definitely go back to try out some other items from their long menu!
author: goph s.

description: Great food across the board - and wide variety of choices from great sandwiches to breakfast..
author: Hal B.

description: I'm in shock that this place has a 4 star average on Yelp. We ate breakfast at Honey Honey this morning and it was super disappointing. The Eden crepe (fontina, capers, smoked salmon, red onions) tasted nothing like a real crepe - I think they used a flour tortilla. It was 80% cheese and 20% salmon. Overall it was gross. My boyfriend had the chorizo scamble - it's not hard to mess up eggs but the scramble was a disaster. The homefries/potatoes were half mush and half burnt crust that looked like it was scraped off the grill. The only decent part of my breakfast was a tiny fruit cup and a glass of fresh squeezed OJ (although the OJ was totally warm). We'll never eat here again! It's a shame since this location used to have a different owner and the food used to be great. I can only speculate that the good reviews are coming from tourists because there are MUCH better breakfast places here in the city.
author: Kelli H.

description: i haven't tried the crepes at honey honey, but i can tell you that this is one of the nicest places to catch brunch in the union square area. as a former brooklynite, i am a fan of the full sit-down brunch and was initially disappointed by the lack of intimacy in this cafe, which is located on the ground floor of one of the buildings downtown. however, i was pleased to discover that the quality of the food more than makes up for the decor. try the salmon eggs benedict with a mimosa. pour yourself a glass of water and notice the strawberry and citrus slices floating in the water pitches, a nice touch. order a tall glass of orange juice -- it's fresh-squeezed and exceedingly flavorful.
author: annie l.

description: This was the much needed after a long night of too much partying and drinking brunch spot! Good prices, decent food. I couldn't decide what I wanted to eat (sweet or salty) so I said eff it and got the egg-n-ham croissant sandwich AND a side of pancakes. The sandwich came with potatoes, that was prob the highlight of the meal. Everything else wasn't anything to run home about, but decent. My friend got the eggs-n-chorizo...gonna get that next time. Overall good experience.
author: vanessa m.

description: loved my salmon scramble even though it was a bit skimpy on the eggs.  orange juice (freshly squeezed is to die for). potatoes are cooked with rosemary...yum. overall, my favorite breakfast place in SF. Go there every time we're in town. Yum delish.  4 stars b/c should have more eggs in the scramble.
author: Roy H.

description: the food is okay but come in tiny serving don't justify the price
author: Audrey L.

description: Excellent place for an amazing breakfast. Order the Miami Heat and you will be so happy you did. Nice atmosphere, open and airy. Great staff.  Loved the fruit infused water. I'd kill for a breakfast place like this in San Jose~Lisa CW
author: Lisa C.

description: I LOVE the mediterranean and north beach crepes!!!  However, the hollandaise sauce is bland for eggs benedict.
author: L M.

description: I was working across the street from honey honey, at the JW Marriott and decided to try it out. Once I saw that sign for crepes I was a fan, then I tried them....yum...crepes were very good, sandwiches etc all is good! And reasonably priced too, another perk! Give it a try for a late breakfast or lunch, you'll probably love it too!
author: Kristin L.

description: Good crepes and amazing fresh OJ. One of the best breakfast options in the area.
author: Mollie P.

description: One of my favorite places to get breakfast and brunch.  Excellent savory and sweet crepes.
author: Tuesday J.

description: I love this place.  If your on a tight budget it's a great place to go that's inexpensive.  My husband and I can each get a crepe and drink for under $25.00 which I think is a bargain.  I recommend the Miami Heat crepe or the pesto crepe.  They are both great.  I have never had breakfast here but I'm sure I eventually will.  I've been going to this place for 2 years and I will continue to.
author: GINA M.
